reviews.review:
Cape Town must see. The aquarium is a must see for young families. Must son asks to go back all the time, we had to upgrade to annual tickets.
Surprisingly we don't get bored overtime we go back!
Highly recommended!

Small but quite amusing. There are some very interesting species in this easily accessible aquarium. Even though it's not very big you can still see fish and penguins that you don't see in bigger aquariums.

World class. Truly world class and a must for young and old! Well priced, fantastic variety, well maintained, informative and especially the microscope exhibit was amazing! Well done, but book in advance to avoid disappointment

Two Oceans Aquarium - New Section Opened. The Aquarium’s newest exhibit features a full 10-metre long tunnel and a 9 metre-wide, 4 metres high window onto a variety of subtropical species.Vibrant tropical beauties from the warm Indian Ocean, including the popular clownfish, honeycomb eels and more. This gallery also features a 3 metre-wide cylindrical exhibit showcasing the dazzling colours of Indian Ocean fishThe Ocean Basket Kelp Forest Exhibit is an underwater forest where kelp plants grow like tall trees, fish swim through the fronds like birds and abalone, sea urchins and rock lobsters feed and take cover among the root-like holdfasts

Under the ocean . This aquarium is a great place to spend some time relaxing looking at sharks and various sea animals ! With some small corners where to really feel like you under the ocean Super nice time

MY LIL ONE LOVED THIS...PLACE. If u have a child and DO NOT GIVE IT A MISS....the tickets are cheap..and yes u can book it online...which to me was very convenient...It has all fished...gr8 turtles...U can even SCUBA DIVE in one of the Fish Tanks....touch few fishes ...it was gr8 FUN....And the BEST FOR THE LAST...U CAN PLAY WITH PENGUINS....they were lovely ..and my daughter went bonkers....it was worth it...U would require one to 2 hours to enjoy this place

Great Aquarium. There are displays of marine life from the Indian and Atlantic Oceans.We were lucky with our timing as feeding times was about to start.Sharks are huge and the different fish species are amazing.

Really good. I like it very much. Yet, as I went with a group trip, there best part was a private class that we have in a classroom in the aquarius, where we had the opportunity to touch and learn about sharks and other animals.

Two Oceans Aquarium. I visited the Two Oceans Aquarium in early September (2016) and I was so impressed by the various marine animals. You can "meet" the marine wildlife from both Atlantic and Indian oceans. Loved the show and actually learnt a lot! I was not visiting with my kids but I did saw lots of children who definitely were enjoying themselves a lot. I also like the fact that the aquarium is located at the Victoria and Alfred Waterfront!I will enjoy another visit at the aquarium for sure!

Sharks so close you can touch em!!. Has lots to see, though get your timing right to catch feeding the penguins and other sea life. Sharks are huge and you can swim with them for a fee and climb into their tank..beautiful creatures!

What an amazing place to visit : just great. This is a superb aquarium,it is full of interesting fish,plant life and all sorts of unusual creators from the sea. All the water is from the sea and freshly changed every time the tide rises and falls.Just love walking through the tunnel and around the large tank with turtles,rays,sharks,all swimming around together and then watching the divers go into the tank to feed the fish,etc.
not worth the money. Didn't think this was in any way extraordinary and definetly not worth ZAR135. It might be an option for a rainy afternoon.
Good fun with kids. The Aquarium is not very big, but the displays are really nice, and the place is a very good option to keep your kids busy for a couple of hours.

Loved the Nemos . Never seem so many nemos in one tank. The jellyfish section was unbelievable and great signs for education that kids and adults can understand regarding our oceans and the heinous destruction that man is causing in our sea world. Nice way to spend 2 hours. It closes at 5pm so we had to rush.

A great aquarium to see. I've visited every aquarium of every city I have been too. This one is great, there are some fantastic exhibits, it's well thought out and the planning and design is such that you get to see everything. Only need two hours and you'll see everything. A good thing to do in Cape Town, especially when it's raining.

Excellent afternoon in the Aquarium. Excellent displays of many underwater animals. All sizes of fish were beautifully displayed. The live penguine areas were great fun to watch these funny little birds. It was feediing time and they are so noisy. There were good areas for children to explore as well.

Overrated and overpriced. This is one of the smallest aquariums I've seen so far, with basically nothing special. The only interesting thing is the jelly fish collection.It takes about an hour maximum to visit, but I guess is good to come to if you have kids.Otherwise it's way too expensive for what it offers.

Centrally located, fun for kids . Two Oceans Aquarium is a parents saving grace. Whether hot or cold, it's a place every young child would enjoy and have fun. We are members and often go there on a weekly basis. It's well planned with ample space for kids and adults to enjoy themselves. Great family friendly facilities that is clean and well serviced. The service is truly on point, professional and very friendly. They have age- appropriate activities and projects according to the seasons. It's located at the V&A Waterfront so it's an ideal family place to hang-out. If you are finished at the Aquarium, you just walk out into the Waterfront which boasts hundreds of fun-filled activities and restaurants. I have a 3 years old so , who loves this place. We often enjoy the basement section for the small children. They have puppet shows, and a little play section for the little ones. They can easily play in this area for over an hour before continuing onto the different levels. Ideal place to meet up for a play date or host a private party. There are also adventures for older kids, like shark diving in their tank for kids 12 and over. They host sleep overs and penguin encounters but call to find out what would be the best activity for your child. It gets very very busy during peak holiday seasons and on weekends. So it's best to time your visit. If you enjoy large crowds, this is the place to go on a busy weekend or opt for a weekday for a quiet visit. It's big but not that big. After an hour or so it's time to move on. Pram friendly, baby changing facilities are great. So bring the whole family and don't forget the nanny so you can enjoy a cup of coffee while they run around or a shopping spree at the Waterfront
Great for children. After a long day of walking at V&A Waterfront it's nice to relax and enjoy while staring at the animals inside the aquarium. It’s very educational especially for the kids.

Fun way to spend a couple of hours. . We visited the aquarium whilst on holiday in Cape Town and spent a good couple of hours exploring all it had too offer. There are many different sea creatures here to discover and it's nice and spacious. Fun, informative and interesting. Worth the money.
Enjoyable, worth visit but currently under some renovation. Probably best pick if you have children, lots of interactive activities. We really enjoyed it despite parts being closed due to renovation.

Good spot to wind down a little during a hectic visit, and a MUST SEE if you have small kids. You may have visited Cape Town, South Africa, and Africa to see nature (of all kinds) but you really are not going to see marine life up close unless you visit an aquarium, of which Cape Town has one. I havent been to Durban's one recently, and I am not sure if Port Elizabeth still has one, but I am confident in touting Cape Town's as probably the best in the country, by far.There are large tanks with viewing windows, containing many species including large sharks, as well as smaller tanks with other smaller species. Of particular interest is the penguin pool and the "petting pond" where even small children can touch rays. There is much more than this to see and I could go on for pages but go and see for yourself.Tip - Cape Town weather is notoriously fickle. At some time during your visit it might rain or be excessively windy. Pencil in a visit to the Aquarium, and keep it until you get one of those Cape Town days that makes normal outdoor activities impossible. Visit the Aquaruim on that day, enjoy the indoor activity, while you wait for the weather to improve, which it WILL.

One of our favorite family outings. We are regulars to the aquarium. My daughter (5) loves looking at the small stuff under a microscope, and dabbling in the touch pool, but her best is the kids area, where she gets to make a simple craft project and take it home, and to watch a puppet show. She also loves to see the jelly fish, spectacularly illuminated with UV light. From my perspective, the big tanks are great (predators in particular), but the penguins are also entertaining although very smelly.Unlike other top aquariums, there is no fancy moving walkway (underwater), but you can walk through a short tunnel in the predator tank, with sharks and rays and maybe a turtle swimming above you. The whole aquarium is well maintained and the staff are helpful but not overbearing.The emphasis is probably more on education than on entertainment - but we need to educate people so our oceans don't become barren!
Great entertainment. We took our nieces to the aquarium and it was an amazing visit. Not the cheapest spot if you're a large group of peeps spending in ZAR, but totally worth the experience :-)

Bit disappointed. We were very excited to visit the two oceans aquarium after not being for 3 yrs. we were excited for the new additions. But after paying full price we were very disappointed to see that once inside, some areas was still under construction.. Will wait another 3 yrs befor returning, to ensure value for money.

Not much to see. This was the only tour place i visited which i regretted in cape town, i think it is quite expensive and there is not much to see, the sharks have been released. but, it is a very nice place to visit if you are traveling with children, they have a nice play area. the penguins are also nice to watch, especially during feeding time.

They really care. It is not a zoo or a "normal" aquarium. It is the place where they really care. I had opportunity to visit some of their lectures (during my stay at Dyer Island Conservation Trust) and I must say that this is the place for real conservationists. Thank you guys for awesome work you do.

A good family morning. Visited during the school holidays so it was packed. Lots of information as you wonder around and lots of tanks to view. I was just a little disappointed as we had been told it was wonderful but I felt it did not exceed our trip to UShaka in Durban. I know you cannot compare apples and pears but I couldn't help it. It is still a great family trip while in Cape Town and if in the area I would recommend that you go.

Disappointing return. I had very fond memories of visiting the 2 Oceans Aquarium a number of years ago so was excited by having the opportunity to visit again. What a disappointment, the aquarium seems to have gone backwards from my visit 15 years ago. It now seems as though it is a lot of separate exhibits rather than one whole experience. There were certainly some highlights, but on the whole it is a bit disjointed, and now in my opinion nowhere near as good as uShaka in Durban which is a difficult thing for a Capetonian to admit!
Tow ocean aquarium. Beautiful and fun place for children to learn about the marine environment and taking a pictures, the crew was very nice and friendly with the visitors ..

Another magical sleepover for the little ones. Aquarium members and their kids are often treated with the opportunity to have a sleepover in front of the main tank, and last night they had a special Halloween offering. It was hugely satisfying with Halloween decorations, even with luminous skeletons in the jellyfish hall. The little ones enjoyed themselves enormously and we cannot thank the lovely lady behind it all. If I remember correctly Amina Hoosain has been organising these sleepovers for about 20 years now and we cannot thank her enough.

Great visit. On one day in Cape Town we had a couple of hours to kill. We visited the aquarium. As a couple this was a quick visit, no kids to stop and ask questions.The shark tank was being upgraded so we didn't see any sharks. The aquarium is good and offers looks of info about the fish on show. The penguins are lovely. A great way to spend a few hours whilst it rains!

Quality Aquarium. This is a qood aquarium with a nice range of animals and sea life. The penguins were particularly cool. It is on par with Sydney and Vancouver Aquariums if you have been there. Good to take the kids. Not essential if you have seen other similar Aquariums around the world.

Interesting and fun visit to the Aquarium. My wife and I visited the Aquarium on a day that was rainy. It turned out to be very interesting and contained species of fish we hadn't seen before. Would highly recommend this Aquarium to Cape Town visitors.

A really nice treat. A really nice treat to see this wonderful aquarium. The staff and the fish of all kind were terrific. I loved the jelly fish exhibit along w/the tube walk to see all kinds of fish and turtles.

A perfect place for an aquarium. Being located at a major city attraction (V&A Waterfront) and right on the ocean, makes this a perfect sightseeing spot. It is also the terminus for the HOHO (hop on, hop off) bus, so you are realy getting three for one here!
Mr. Good experience. Interesting and open. Learned a lot and nice to visit. Good experience for kids and adukts tonlearn about the sea.

This review pertains to the scuba diving at the aquarium. So, I wanted to go diving with the seals outside of cape town, but was there at the wrong time of year for this. However, I came across advertising for diving at the aquarium, and gave it a try. It was more fun than I thought it would be - a different experience, for sure, than diving out in the ocean, but much more interesting than just being in a pool. The tank we were in had two sea turtles, both of which you could interact with, and one of which (bob) took quite an interest in the divers, and was rather fun to swim with. It was also pretty cool to make faces and wave at the aquarium visitors, especially the kids. If you are a licensed diver and have a few hours to spare in cape town, I'd recommend checking this out. One improvement that could be made is to the change room / showers - they are pretty small, and need more hooks!
Good one. Although not so great it is worth seeing especially the little Penguins. The ultra violet lit jelly fish section in the Aquarium was different

The best aquarium in the world.. This is the largest and most technically advanced aquarium in Africa. Amongst its many exciting features are a number of unique exhibits, including a live kelp forest, an open ocean and shark tank, and the only snoek in an aquarium anywhere in the world.
Very nice aquarium. Enjoyed very much the visit, was a wide diversity of species and aquariums and with good interactions too for kids.

Penguin Encounter makes it worth it. The aquarium itself is smaller than I envisaged, but there was still plenty to see. I would say it is more aimed at kids, with lots of activities and interaction, so good for family visits – especially on a rainy day. We did have fun with the Rockhopper penguin encounter, a face to face meeting and a detailed explanation/Q&A with one of the keepers – this costs extra but worth it.

Fantastic experience . This is a must do in Cape Town.The facilities are very good and neat, and the collection of sea animals is very impressive.It is great for kids and little ones, with a lot of activities and feeding sessions.
My favourite entertainment in Cape Town. I love going here as often as I can. It is one of the best aquariums I have been to (and I have been to quite a few). I love it when the sharks get fed.

No need to visit . Being from Sydney maybe I'm spoiled by aquariums. This places feels small with a lack of things to actually do...Appreciate they are moving the shark tank and having a refurbished section put in, but it's very "meh" to others. You'd think in a place like SA there would be more the show case

Fun outing. We did expect a bigger aquarium and we were slightly dissapointed.It is small and well kept. We did enjoy seeing the Penguins. It was a quick walk through. I think a maximum of 1 hour to see everything. However I do think it will be more fun for kids.

Nice to see while you are in Waterfront. Its nice to see the variety of different types of fish there including a jelly fish section , there is also a huge view for aquarium where you can see a nice view Sector for penguins was nice as well

Sharks are on vacation!. Well worth a visit, nice looking fish. Check when feeding times are and visit then. Friendly staff. Was a shame that the sharks are currently on vacation and will be back in a few months.

Very pleasent experience. The aquaruim has a vast array of species on display and the young ones loved it. We found some renovations and this meant some species were not on display but what was available did the trick.

Educational Fun. It was a little disappointing as the large predator tank was closed for refurbishment. However the large kelp forest tank had sufficient species to make it worth the visit. All exhibits are well labelled. The microscope section was especially interesting.
Always fun. Really well looked after aquarium with lots of conservation efforts happening. Great family fun seeing a shark up close.

Great Attraction. Not normally my thing, but as it was raining made a visit and I must say it proved to be very pleasurable, if only to see the Penguins.The Divers feeding the fish in the massive tank takes place at 12.00 hours so get there at 11.45 hours to get a seat.Very pleasant and informative morning.
World Class!. We have visited many aquariums around the world and this is one of the best. You will not be disappointed.
Not worth it.. When we went, all of the largest exhibits were closed. The rest available was not worth the price. A bit disappointed.

Grand . It's grand. Good for a few hours to kill and great if you have kids. Price is fair and the aquariums tanks have all the facts and plenty of staff on hand to answer queries. Splash tank is a bit soft.

Jelly Fish section is amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!. The Aquaruim was clean, staff were friendly. I was a little disappointed, with the kelp area, i was there about 15 odd years ago. I remember loads of kelp, and just sitting there on the seats listening to the tranquil music and watching the kelp wave in the ocean. Now there is hardly any kelp there and there are so many fish in that tank. The glass passage under the ocean was closed - so no sharks. The Penguins were cute and was interesting to watch them feed. The Jelly fish area is OUTSTANDING! absolutely loved that. Its all dark and then the tank have these blue neon lights showing the jelly fish up in amazing light. Unfortunately - i personally thought that for the same price or really close to Ushaka has much more to offer. They have the seals, dolphins, sharks etc. However, my parent thought it was better then Ushaka. IF its a rainy day, then head to the aquarium.....
Amazing Experience!. World class displays and very engaging for families! Come and see how it is done and we can show in South Africa we can have displays as good as London!

Nice Aquarium. Nice Aquarium, especially if you haven't been to an aquarium before. The Durban uShaka aquarium is much a much better experience if you in the area with lots of activities like seal interactions, dolphin shows, etc...

Worth a visit. Entertaining, informative and definitively a Cape Town must see for all ages. Spend some time with the seals if only to enjoy the squeals of delight that remind one how to view the world through a child's eyes.

Nice place. The place is nice but not outside of box or something exciting. You may see much nicer and bigger aquariums. This one is kind of avarage on size and quality of species. Good as rainy day activity.
Great outing to see what's hidden in our oceans. A gem of a place to experience the wonders of the ocean. Well run and maintained. Great outing when the weather is the not good.

Small but good design. Well thought out design with nice viewing of a variety of fish. Jelly fish exhibit was very good. A touch pool also available. Good walk though with sting rays sharks turtles and many fish at close range. Inexpensive and only takes about half hour worth the time. Enjoy. Nice to see fish from Indian and Atlantic oceans. Walking distance from waterfront and also on the hop on hop off stop
Disappointed. I expected much more than i have found in aquarium. The city surrounded with two oceans should have a bigger and more diverse aquarium. It is nice but I expected much more.
Excellent. The Aquarium is located at the V&A Waterfront. It is amazing worth a visit when in Cape Town and kids will enjoy it
Great!. Nice aquarium. The main tank is huge with some really big fish and a huge school of sardines - something i have never seen before in an aquarium.
Worth it, perfect outing for a rainy day.. The aquarium is well organized and the staff is very helpful and friendly. It is perfect if u want something to do on a rainy day in Cape Town!

NEW I & J PREDATOR EXHIBIT NOT THE SAME. It was a rainy day in Cape Town and we decided an indoors excursion would be good, so off we went to the Aquarium. Viewing the fish is always a delight and there were quite a lot of people for a Friday afternoon. Since our last visit the new tunnel has been completed. The I & J Predator tanks are much smaller and lots of the big fish and sharks are gone. I like the rock formations especially the one that looks like a hole in the wall.The Kelp forest are still there for now but work on that and the original Predator tanks should hopefully be something to look forward to. There are (in my opinion) more and different fish. I love taking photos and maybe I have taken duplicates. My grandson would only touched the little orange starfish but not the Anemones - he said "they moving". He loves the turtle in the Predator tank - he says "she can see me". She is beautiful . We didn't view but the Microscope exhibit should be interesting.
Not worth your time. If you have visited an aquarium before, don't go! This is a very small and not well organized aquarium. You can go if you or your children haven't seen anything alike.

short but so sweet. The aquarium was fantastic, it had lots of quirks like the shark tank with flags around which had been designed by the public. The shark display was good and made even more fun by the hungry turtle, and if you are padi qualified you can dive in the tank too. Can't help but feel it was over fairly quickly but it is well worth a visit, the penguin part was especially lovely as it felt so open, not looking at them from behind glass. There is a pool of anenomes you can play with too!

Very nice aquarium in the safe area of Cape Town. The aquarium is very well organized, there's a good variety of species. The staff are informative and helpful. The place sends a good message to kids about sustainability and environmental protection.

Excellent aquarium . On the hottest day of our trip we took advantage of the air conditioning in the aquarium, which had been on our list to visit anyway. It was a great aquarium, with lots of interesting things to see, and some good photo opportunities; a very nice place to spend an afternoon!
Family outing. We went to the aquarium today. As usual the aquarium is full with both local and international visitors. I am looking forward to seeing the new shark exhibition in 2017.

Well worth a visit. This aquarium rates amongst the world's best niche aquariums. Whilst not the size of others, the exhibits are very professionally done, making great use of lighting and the glass. The Oceans exhibit is fantastic to sit and watch. Only complaint is a suggested guide route to ensure that one sees everything.

Small but nice. It was very small with few exhibits. Great penguin exhibit. The place was clean and well maintained. The animals had the space, attention, food, and stimulation they needed. Something to do if it's raining.

Great Afternoon. Had a great time at the aquarium, even got to see the penguins and main tank fish being fed. The staff were all very knowledgable and the exhibits well labelled. Even though it's not the biggest of aquariums it's a good afternoon visit.
Great Aquarium. Very good laid out and good exhibits, just a pity the shark enclosure is being done up but apart from that a good place to visit.
Dont be deceved, very large inside with great displays. Filled in a bit of time here waiting for the weather to improve, didnt think it would be much but the displays were great. Well worth a visit
Amazing fishes. My kids have fun there so much.We will go again next time.We saw memos,dory,shark,turtle,penguins.jelly fish,giant crab.

Great for kids but we went because a special jelly fish exhibit we wanted to see. because we are interested in learning more about these stinging nuisances for our own recreation. The exhibit is beautiful but not terribly informative and finding somebody to ask was a small challenge. But everybody was very friendly and anxious to please.
great thing to do in Cape Town. i did not expect this aquarium to be so nice but it was really worth visiting it.especially with the pinguins there!!
A great day out. A great activity for a family, or anyone looking for an entertaining day out. Some really epic exhibits and activities such as watching feedings and the "touch station".

Ok OK . Visit only if you have nothing else left. The Aquarium has an ok ok collection and the entrance fees is relatively high. The only things I found interesting was their jelly fish, sharks and turtle. Visit only if you are having enough time and money
Great for family. This is the 2nd time i have visited and still it needs to be a bit bigger. Very very nice set up. Cannot wait to see the new tank exhibition.

So many kids!!. This is a very biased review as my experience was not deterred by the aquarium itself, but by the magnitude of kids around! It seems like it was some kind of school trip day, or maybe this is normal on weekdays, but the whole place seemed even more disordered with all the kids running around out of control. The visit itself was quite anticlimactic, as we expected more and received a lot less... The displays and info boards were adequate, but most of the staff seemed just as bored as we were to be there...
Beautiful. If you like me and want to see all the sea animals that you see on National Geographic's, please go to the aquarium...its real value for money and an awesome experience. I loved it

Excellent facility with great penguins and staff. Attended a week long international penguin congress which allowed free access to the aquarium. The jelly fish display is surreal and very relaxing but the highlights are the Gentoo penguins and the sea tank. The staff are extremely knowledgeable and passionate about their work, being happy to spend time taking about their animals.
Really good. Best part of our trip to the aquarium was the 14:00 drop feed -the guide was very informative and very professional.

Best Day Out. The aquarium was amazing. We absolutely loved it. The children would have gone back every day if they could. The displays are terrific and a few of them are interactive, which really got the childrens interest. This is a must do attraction in Cape Town. World class

Find Nemo here. Great spot with my small nephew. We found hundreds of Nemos (and even one Dory). The black light room for the jelly fish display was my favorite. Plus we saw african penguins with one breeding pair taking turns sitting on the egg. Plenty of places for the kid to climb in and out of special viewing areas. A great place to spend about 90 minutes.

Amazing Kelp Forest. They advertised themselves as the biggest aquarium in Africa, but do not get impressed by this, it is small compared to most aquariums in Europe and the US.It is still well worth the visit, they have a wonderful jellyfish exhibition and the Kelp forest made worth the visit as apparently there are only 2 other aquariums in the world that have reproduced a kelp forest and they are in the US.At 12pm they have a mouth feeding show, with live explanations and at 2pm they do drop feeding, both of them were really nice to see.It is ideal to visit on a rainy day and children will love it.
Great variety and entertaining. They have a large variety of species including penguins. Very informative and entertaining. Spent about 2 and a half hours in there.

Amazing Aquarium. This aquarium had many amazing marine animals in it. My favorites were the penguins upstairs and the giant water tank that you walk under and can see the undersides of fish. Having just seen Finding Dory, I couldn't help but laugh at the kids' touching pool and the giant fish tank as you walk in (plus a special "Nemo" tank). A great rainy day activity.One piece of advice... try and go at a time that too many kids won't be there.

Nice aquarium. This was a nice, rather small aquarium with some amazing creatures. There were African penguins here. They had a lot of jellyfish. A highlight was the Nemo fish display where you could climb into the middle of the aquarium and see all the Nemo fish resting on the top. Good photo op!! It was a pleasant way to spend an hour.

New extensions make this even more spectaculor. Two Oceans Aquarium is undergoing changes. New extensions and tanks have been opened which gives us a far better view of the oceans. Kids have plenty of activities to encourage their curiosity and plenty for the older persons like myself. The site is wheelchair friendly which allows one access to all of the viewing rooms. I do have one concern, which I imagine will be fixed when the next few exhibits are finished. If you are not careful, poor signposting will mean you miss some exhibits. In the old days you had a starting point, and everyone moved in the same direction. Now you could miss some passages and not see everything.
Fantastic visit. I just love this place. Everything about this aquarium is great. Fantastic selection of fish to see and interact with. Great learning opportunity for the kids. Just love it

amazing fish world. This is a fantastic place to take you kids, but adults will also love it. not only beautiful to look at but it is also interactive, we had a great family time and will be back there soon.

"NICE CHANGE". We were visiting the waterfront so we called in here for a change of sceneryLots of exotic fish with good tanks,the penguins were funny.Well maintained Aquarium with friendly and helpful staffWell worth a visit

This is way better than I thought it would be. This is a world class aquarium. My favourite part was the kelp forest. Watching massive schools of huge fish swim around and above you. I could spend a half a day watching them. Worth revisiting.

Quite small but with a lot inside. Yes, as I say, it's small in comparison to others I've been to (in the UK) but there is plenty to do. You can touch the anemones and starfish in one zone, there is the obligatory massive ocean tank (though strangely missing the billed turtles) and there are masses of smaller displays. I particularly liked the bioluminescent zone. It was a great way to spend a couple of hours and all the family enjoyed it.
wonderful, new adventure!. I have been here before; it always amazes!! so well organised, clean, neat. really good explanatory exhibitions with so much enjoyment!!
Perfect!. Perfect for a morning with children, all kinds of fish, sharks etc.Easy access in V&A Waterfront, not expensive.

Average. It was good but having been to ushaka in durban the week before it seemed very small, the sharks are also no longer there. Didn't take us that long to go round. There were excellent talks/shows in the big tank tho which was worth going for
Brilliant. This Aquarium really gets the point across about protecting and respecting marine life. A great family trip, you will not be disappointed.

Interesting for the whole family!. As a local I have been visiting the aquarium for years now with my young daughter and lately with my teenage daughter. she still loves the place as much as I do. It doesn't get boring. Best to go early as it does get busy! Also take your time, don't rush from tank to tank as you may miss some magic! We especially loved the new underwater tunnel. And the new refreshment stop!
A nice morning out. The aquarium is a great option for children. Interactive and fun. My daughter loved the puppet show.

The shark and the turtle. My daughter loved this place. She still talks about it. Kids get to touch some of the sea life as well e.g. starfish, aquatic plants, etc. Great collection of fish and related.Demonstration was great too - you can see all the fish in one big tank - shark and a turtle were the pick.Reasonable parking space. Visited in July 2013.

Relaxing day under the sea!. Although the aquarium can get very very busy, its really nice to walk around there. Try to go on a weekday morning. That way you can stand and watch the wonderful life under the sea on your own time. Very relaxing!! There are really nice sealife with good descriptions written next to the tanks. Good stuff to do for young children as well! Good lunch spot as well outside! But pricey!
Stunning aquarium. Truly amazing aquarium.packed morning noon night well organised.effucuent.clean.world class..every species can be seen close up.
Great fun. It never gets old. The jelly fish exhibit is amazing and so worth it. It is nice that there is always something new to see.

Small, but nicely arranged. Our family visited earlier this month. Very clean. Multiple educational areas for learning about the animals/fish. Nice penguin exhibit. Could easily see whole thing in 1-2 hours.

Near a Mall...not IN a Mall...comprehensive education and fun. Unlike the Dubai Mall Aquarium, this is just outside the Mall..more spacious and therefore more comprehensive. excellent focus on education and content. Top class attraction. Glad it is on the Red Bus route.

Beautiful. my husband and I went here on a windy and rainy day. They had all kinds of fish here. I liked the information they gave on the Penguins while they was feeding them. My only complaint was that the day we went there was a lot of school kids there on a field trip, they just took over the place running around pushing their way in front of you. But I guess kids will be kids. It was very clean and pretty
Fascinating indeed. A variety of marine life of all sizes and colours. It's a must-do and suitable for grown ups and kids too. The outstanding feature for me was the Penguins of course.
Fabulous for the family. We took one of our grandchildren who is under 2 years of age and he absolutely loved it! Watched the feeding time which was great.

Not much to see.. When we hear Two Ocean Aquarium we get excited because of name and because of we are in somewhere very colorfull underwater activities but aquaruim was dissapoint for us except feeding time. Not too much diffrent species and small is we didnt wait for feeding time it would complete like 30min i did go and see Aquarium in Istanbul(Florya) and it was much bigger and more species and activities.

World Class Aquarium. This is a MUST on your bucket list and especially for the children. there are activities for the children that teach them about the ocean and how to respect what God has given us to take care of. Plenty to see and do. My grandchildren loved the huge tank with the sharks and turtles and enjoyed getting up and close to the penguins.

Be more educated in Marine, Ocean Life. That's the medium size, well organised aquarium to be more familiar with marine life. When I was there they moved some specific ones such as seals into another place due to some problems. Still it is a good place to learn, highly recommended for children. Even you can experience some marine life there even diving and feeding sharks. of course you need diving course as well.
Probably the best aquarium I have seen. This is really an outstanding aquarium. I have been to the one in London and it is no match to this one.

Excellent Aquarium. The Two Oceans Aquarium in the V&A Waterfront in Cape Town is one of,if not the best, aquarium in the world. The exhibits are fantastic and very informative. The variety of animals and the information on each is excellent. Although quite pricey for locals it is worth every cent to visit this amazing place. My grandson loves it !!

Great place to spend a couple of hours. We had to change our itinerary while in Cape Town due to a pre-booked trip being cancelled the day before. As a result we were looking for things to do and chose Two Oceans in the afternoon as it was walking distance from our apartment. We were not disappointed with this place - an excellent opportunity to view so many of the creatures that inhabit the waters up close. With helpful and informative staff to explain things, and a touch pool for the younger ones, this was a very positive experience all round.
Wonderful collection. Very vast collection of marine life from both the Oceans - Indian Ocean and Atlantic Ocean. Added attraction was the interaction with the penguins at the Aquarium

Beautiful, interesting attractions. We had a wonderful time at the aquarium, and it was very quiet when we went (Wednesday at 4:15pm). Although much smaller than I expected, there were some amazing exhibits and the staff were knowledgeable and passionate. The location was very clean and we had the impossible privilege of sitting in front of a huge tank all alone for about 30mins. If you are not into crowds, perhaps try close to end-of-day admission as I reckon you only need about 1.5hrs (2 adults, no kids)

okey but not world class. i thought the aquarium was okey but not the best in the world. it is very overpriced for what you get. they dont even have their signature sharks anymore.they should give South African citizens discount, it is also our country but too expensive to go there for the locals which is really sad.

Fun and educational. The children really enjoyed the experience. It was great that they could be inside the tanks among several hundred Nemos and touch some exhibits in the touch tank. I don,t think I have touched a starfish before. It is conveniently located on the waterfront near the open top bus stop.

Well organized medium sized aquarium. Been to a few aquariums around the world: ranging from big and chaotic to small and claustrophobic. This one is about small-mid sized and well laid out. What I liked about this aquarium is that they have done a great job with signage at each tank or enclosure to help you identify the species within. They have a great jellyfish section (lit up with eerie purple lighting to simulate underwater conditions). A section with penguins and a kelp forest tank. They have two daily feedings at the giant central fish tank: noon and 1400. The noon feeding is a diver feeding (as opposed to drop feeding at 1400). Their loggerhead turtle "Yoshi" is a hoot to watch and acts like she wants to play and interact with the dive staff - never thought turtles could connect this much with humans. The cool thing is that the diver feeding the fish is wired up to a microphone and you can hear his commentary live over the PA while he works with the fish. There is a staff member that facilitates things on the "land animal" side of the glass (actually it's acrylic but who's checking). And, yes, you can ask questions! The dive feeding demonstration was certainly the highlight of our visit and I highly recommend you time your visit to attend (take your positions about 15mins ahead of start time).
If you have time in cape, it's a must. I went their with my wife,, we are a young couple. We enjoyed it a lot.. The people with children will enjoy it even more

Educational and Beautiful Exhibits. We have visited the aquarium on a number of occasions and it is always a winner for my son, as well as for us. It is wheelchair accessible throughout, which makes it a fantastic outing for wheelchair-bound children and adults alike. The new ocean exhibit and jellyfish exhibits are beautiful, and together with the new coffee bar located at the ocean exhibit, provides a tranquil space to be mesmerised by the fish and turtle. I found the new environmental education section to be a drawing card, providing valuable information and an awareness of our effect on the oceans and marine life. Always a lovely touch is the tanks near the entrance where young children can identify some of their favourite characters from Finding Nemo.

Still a great aquarium . We last visited the 2 Oceans aquarium 18 years ago and it is still a superb place to spend some time. The displays are brilliant and the jellyfish exhibition was stunning. Even though the predator display is closed the large displays are stunning. There are some wild caught ragged tooth sharks in a small display which will be released into the wild again. The microscope display was very interesting and we had a great time speaking with Jenny and looking at all the tiny sea life under the microscope.

Awestruck, Awestruck. A visit to the Two Oceans Aquarium many moons ago, did not prepare me for my second visit this month....A 51 year old little girl i became. So many fish, so much sealife in an array of tanks....Three highlights were: Seeing sea horses, my favourite... to the embaresment of my boyfriend, when i approached one of the ladies at a counter with a microscope, who was showing interested bystandersSlides of sea life. My question to her was. Do seahorses whinny like horses? Sad to say apparently they do not. The only noise is the movement from their fins. My other highlight. The auditorium with I&J,s massive tank, a tvmonitor educating you of every fish and turtle in the tank. We bought coffee and sat on comfortable chairs watching shoals of fish. Turtles swimming past us. One of the best feelings in the world. A feeling of balance and peace washed over me.My other highlight. When we walked past the lady with the microscope, she called me back, showed us a baby octopus.... i was in awe. Awestruck. The staff interacted with us and the show; touch and tell staff were excellent teachers...

Nothing extraordinary compared to its other global peers. Located at the Victoria Alfred waterfront, this deep sea aquarium exhibits numbet of underwatet species. Large viewing windows makes ypu feel as if you csn touch the species. However, having an opportunity of seeing number of such aquariums around the world I would rate this as pretty ordinary. However, if you are not so lucky of seeing othets you can enjoy the tour for sure.

Family visit with grandparents and kids. We have been there a few times and it is always nice to visit an aquarium with kids. We spent just over an hour in there. The aquarium is accessible all day so you can go in and out during the day.

Beautiful. I loved the aquarium. I arrived just before penguin feeding time, which was a great introduction to the penguins. Learning about them before seeing them at Boulder's Beach made the other experience more meaningful. The kelp garden was a nice place to relax. The aquarium is nicely laid out.

Great experience - excellent exhibits. This must rate as one of the better aquariums. The exhibits are well kept and the interaction with the staff are great - very friendly and helpful. We could see the feeding of the fish in the newly opened large tank with it's amasing 10m clear tunnel through the tank. We could also see the feeding of the penguins. Great to see such caring staff - the keeper knows all his individual penguins by name. Ensure you have sufficient time for the visit. We spent 3 hours there and we did not see all the exhibitions.

Fun activity for the whole family. A world class aquarium. Our entire family "oohed" and "aahed" as we meandered through the aquarium. Surprisingly, we did everything there in just under an hour and a half, so not even a half day activity, but we'll with the visit!

See the jelly fish. Excellend jelly fish exhibition. Good variety of fish and sea life. Unfortunately the sharks were released back into the ocean which was a let down. Compared to other aquariums in the world it is good value for money

Very educational and an ideal visit for young and old. Fun place for young and old. Lots of places for children to creep through tunnels and come up in the centre of tanks. You can see the turtles and sting rays being fed by divers and noon and the rest of the fish fed and 2pm while a volunteer tells you interesting facts.

Good way to spend a couple of hours. Visited as it was a rainy day, great aquarium and couple of live demonstrations - penguin feeding at 11.30 & tank feed at 12. Enjoyed the visit, quite busy & lots of school trips.Good value

Nice place. The Cape Town aquarium is a good place to take your family. There is plenty so see. But it does not match some of the world's truly great aquariums (Valencia, Lisbon, Okinawa, Vancouver, Sydney ...) in my opinion.

A must for kids. Very well done, in that there are exhibits that kids love - the penguins and the touch experience, the latter being very unusual in an aquarium. The shark exhibit is also pretty amazing, and the sharks obligingly do a non-stop tour of their tank, meaning everyone gets a good look. For those with a good attention span many of the exhibits are also highly educational, but the main attraction is that the whole thing is very entertaining. The kids probably won't want to leave!

Beautiful!. The aquarium is really beautiful and very educational. There is a vast variety of fish and it's a great pass time activity.I would not saw its super wow and something you cannot miss but if you have two hours to kill, this is a great activity with children.
choose your fish for dinner. Nice collection of species and specimens well presented. Not crowded, but well signed. Penquins are fun. It should be better - but it is what it is.
Fishyyyyy!!. Finding Nemo, Dory and all their friends has never been so much fun!! Keep them safe, and us smiling!! :) Always so much!

Family bonding. I recently visited The Aquarium with my varsity son. We hadn't been since he was at school. From purchasing the tickets, enjoying all the exhibits, having a coffee and stopping off to purchase a souvenir in the shop a top experience was had. Thank you to all involved.
A must with children. We have visited the aquarium numerous times with other children and they love it every time! the aquarium has a large variety of animals.

A little disappointing. We were a little disappointed with the aquarium. We enjoyed the penguins but were a little underwhelmed by the rest, although as a pair of grown ups with no kids we admittedly may be a little older than its target audience.It was smaller than we expected and we covered everything in about an hour - although I suspect you could spent significantly more time here if you have little ones to occupyIf you need to kill an hour or so on a soggy afternoon this does just fine, but I wouldn't make a special effort to visit

old time aquarium with too little space for most animals. the aquarium is small, and the space for the animals is ultrasmall, no place for the penguins, no place for most fishes, no adequate explanations in front of the expositions. After the visit there is a desire to free all animals in this institution.

Go on an adventure at the Aquarium. I love the Aquarium, it is interesting and fun. The staff are a world of knowledge and it is a great place to go to see things that are not seen everyday.Get close to the sharks, clown fish (a personal favorite is to stand inside the tank as you can walk into the hollow middle)I always walk out having enjoyed myself
Aqua visit. Our first aquarium visit.. amazing,lots of species.. the tunnel is so fabulous..really magical,unfortunately didnt see the ragged tooth shark..

Family . Good experience for family fun day kids absolutely loved it Lots of information on marine life and surely a visit if like aquarium.They have made it very interesting for kids and have enough information in environment conservation .

Somewhat disappointing, was expecting more. We had read some great reviews on this aquarium, so we set aside 3 hours of our stay in Cape Town to visit the aquarium with the family. One hour is largely sufficient. There are some interesting fish to see here and there, and the penguin exhibit was interesting, but all in all, the place is much smaller than I had imagined from what I had read, and in some places, it even appeared a little run-down, not well maintained... A minor point perhaps, albeit annoying: at one of the exhibits, they had set up a camera which advertised on a big sign above it that you could get a free picture. You stand in front of the camera and await the countdown for the picture to be taken, and it appears on the screen with others' photos. But instead of printing the photo for you, they refer you to their website and tell you to "follow the link" -- only there is no link there to follow, at least not that I was able to find (which disappointed my children, who wanted to see the photos we had taken). All in all, it's a place you CAN visit, especially if you have children who like fish, but there's no need to set aside more than an hour for this activity.

Family Fun Edu Centre. We decided to see what's going on at the Two Oceans Aquarium and were pleasantly surprised with the high standard's the staff run the place. If you're looking for peace and quiet this not the idea venue as there are more excited children than adults. We loved the main tank with all the pelagic fish and mussel crackers. The food in-house was great with a quality cup of coffee all round.

I'm disappointed. Having been to the aquarium twice before, I was shocked to see how the aquarium has changed. Although I feel that conservation is crucial and the transfer of conservation knowledge vital to the survival of our aquatic species, I came to the aquarium to see fish, not conservation display upon conservation display. the predator tank was empty, which is why most people visit this place, but they don't tell you. they let you pay and when you get to the tank with expectation, you are faced with a note that says; "sorry for the inconvenience". not appreciated.
A 'fishy' treat. I went while in cape town as I like fish (I keep them) It was a very good example with very large tanks of all sorts of sea creatures. Well worth a visit

One of the best aquariums I've ever visited. Lots to see so give yourself a lot of time. Definitely try to watch the early feeding the main tank when the divers go in. Watching the turtle follow the paddle around to eat is something else. Its possible to do a dive into the tank as well which is something I'm really considering after watching.They have a massive school of smaller fish over in the tank too and one of the divers managed to bring them to the main viewing window during the feeding. I've never seen such a large group before in an aquarium, its very relaxing watching them move around the tank.The main shark tank is undergoing reconstruction at the moment so you do miss that but everything is well maintained. They even had someone come out and clean down the viewing windows before the feeding. May seem like a small thing, but it makes a huge difference when watching the show.
two oceans aquarium. kids love them, adults love them, all the creatures of the sea in their own environment. nice place to chill out with friends and family
fun and interesting. Great place to go to see penguins, sharks and other fish and sea creatures.the aquarium is easy to find as close to the waterfront shopping centre

Great staff, lovely day out. The aquarium is currently renovating their shark tank, but there was more than enough to keep us occupied! Our two children of 8 and 9 years loved the jellyfish exhibition, the dive feeding in the main aquarium, the clownfish aquarium and the Penguins. We had pre-booked a penguin encounter for our two girls, and we were amazed by the standard of this encounter. Only two kids a day gets to sit in with the Penguins for half an hour with a member of staff, being educated about these wonderful animals whilst having them sit on your lap- magic! Recommended if you have kids around that age. At 385 ZAR a child for the encounter (also includes entry to the aquarium) it is great value.We will return on our next visit to Cape Town!
great time. they have a huge selection of fishes, small and large. Mostly for families with kids. There are options to eat.

Short visit but well worth it. A relatively small aquarium but very good interactive displays especially liked the jellyfish display. Unfortunately the predator display was closed for renovations when I visited. The staff was great, had a baby and had not brought up the stroller, they where quick to offer one
Miss. The staff is just so amazing. Kind and ready to help the customers. Always smiling. The aquarium is very clean and organized.

Still feel like a Child. I hadn't been to the aquarium for a few years, so was really excited to go back yesterday and see what changes were made.They have really improved a lot of the exhibits, and it was great to feel like a child again! Really loved the new jellyfish exhibit, it's beautiful. And the new predator tank is stunning as well.Just know that when you go you will have to deal with selfish parents (and adults themselves), taking up all the space at many of the windows so that no one else can see.Otherwise I'm excited to see the old predator tank when it has finished reconstruction! The aquarium still remains a great place for children and adults alike! Educational and beautiful.

Fun learning!. Visited the aquarium as a family, and it was fun for us all. My 5 year old Daughter in particular was super excited to see so many sea animals she had only seen in books and on TV, in real life.The variety is lovely and the facility well taken care of. My Children loved the Clown Fish and Jelly babies best, but we loved everything about the aquarium.My Daughter can't wait for us to go back again soon.

Great fun for young and old. I always try to visit the Two Oceans Aquarium as it is great fun for young and old alike interactive and has some of the best marine life I have seen, if you have children its a must, hugely enjoyable.
Brilliant afternoon . Such a brilliant afternoon here at the aquarium.The staff were knowledgeable and the fish beautifully kept. A must see!

SARDINE BALL AT V&A WATERFRONT. The Aquarium is undergoing some structural changes but a recent addition is a Huge Ball of Sardines that swim with all types of Larger fish but seeing them move in mass is splendid.

Been twice and will keep going back. We love this place, it keeps our 5 year old very entertained, teaches he about all the different sea creatures and also a strong message on conservation and preservation. A great range of animals plus hand on experiences and loads of information. There is a car park straight opposite and a walk around the sea front afterwards is definitely recommended. We will return again.

Very informative place unline other Aquariums. Located at the V & A Waterfront... the place is easily accessible. Keep a good 2 hours to explore all the exhibits they have there. Make sure you go before sunset as they close around 6pm...

Brilliant fun and full of variety . The aquarium was so much fun. The tanks are accessible and interactive, whilst the layout is suitable for families. It is also really informative and they have a number of exciting species. My personal favourite was the jelly fish area, full of uv lighting and mirrors! The penguins are also great fun.Slight complaint was it felt like the museum was in the middle of a big make over, but it didn't really bother me.

Fun time for the kids. The Two Oceans Aquarium is located at the V&A waterfront. It was a fun experience for the kids and they enjoyed the Nemo exhibit as well as the Penguin feed. They had an interactive puppet show for the kids which they thoroughly enjoyed. It's much smaller than other aquariums I've been to in Dubai and Atlanta but provides you with multiple ways to interact with the creatures.The staff were friendly and helpful. There are also areas where you can get light snacks. Overall it was nice. We went more for the kids than for our amusement.

Nice but expected mors. We've visited Durban Aquarium in the past and it has a lot more to offer... It is currently under construction, but even so there's really not that much to see. I did however love the penguins...tgey are super cute...

Fascinating . We haven't been to the Aquarium for years now, since our children are now in their 20's. My 1 son is a Volunteer on Sundays, so we decided to visit. Wow, so many families with children and all ages been fascinated by mother nature's gift to us. Still in awe every time. Thank you to the people who make our visit worthwhile and their love for what they're doing. Definetly worth the visit.
waw. Very cool place I loved itGalleries and beautiful can take the family and the kids will love the place
Nice getaway . Very nice exhibit. Unfortunately the shark tank was not in use. Very child friendly. The jelly fish are a must see !!!

Cold day with a 12 year old. We have been to some big aquariums in Singapore, San Francisco, Boston, etc. This one is on the small side and one of the two big tanks (the shark tank) was down. We had some time to kill and the price is very fair. We are glad we went.

ANOTHER visit to the aquarium. This is a regular outing for me and my grand children. We spend a lot of time marveling at all the wonderful, colourful and interesting sea creatures. The new tank is superb. Such a peaceful outing (actually, only if you go really early before the school children arrive). There is much excitement around the Nemo tank (clown fish) which is my granddaughters favourite ... but then again so is Yoshi the turtle her big delight ... and the interactive touch tanks. Everything is really wonderful - the penguins and even the frogs. Please read the stories around the frogs, especially the rescued one who lost his tongue in a car accident. So much to learn and take in so a number of visits is recommended if you are local.
Nice outing for young and old. This is a world class aquarium with lots to do and see for young and old. Less people during the week, can get very crowded over weekends.

Yes, it's worth a visit. Took my 9 year old to this aquarium located on the Cape Town waterfront. Plenty of fish and sea creature exhibits. A nice collection of penguins, sharks and jellyfish. The aquarium has the standard touchy feely display for the experience of touching squishy and spiny tide pool beings. A small but adequate gift shop. The aquarium is well worth spending a few hours in.

Nice to see.... They have a tunnel but short. Various type of fish. You can interact with the pinguin but you have to reserve ahead by 3 to 4 days. They close at 6 pm. It is good for kids. Compared to Dubai and KUALA LAMPUR it is a mall aquarium.
Vacation in South Africa. Beautifully made aquarium. Although there were some repairs going on but the overall look of the fish tanks were good. Quite a number of speices
Always well worth a visit. From the tank with "finding Nemo" fishes where one could crawl under and stand up to be 'in' the tank, up to the penguins, is a pleasing experience. Well worth a visit.

Great aquarium. Lost to see, you need af least 2 hours. Different from the Ushaka aquarium in Durban, not better or worse. Smaller tanks and quite some jellyfish. No sharks now due to maintenance. We saw them in Ushaka.
Renovations in progress . Renovations in progress the area that keeps sharks are closed. The rest is still worth seeing for the children. The restaurant is also closed had to go elsewhere for lunch.

Good way to spend a rainy day. Should start off by saying we've been to some really big aquariums around the world. In short, we enjoyed the Two Oceans aquarium. The displays are informative and well laid out, with careful thought given to visitors of different heights! i.e. the kids can see a lot of things at their height too! Sad that one of the mains exhibits was closed (so only 4 stars) but if that was open we might rate higher. Staff were great too, and happy to answer questions.

Great place to take the family when the weather is miserable. This is such a great place to take the family when the weather is miserable. So much to see and do to keep the kids entertained. It can get very busy, so come nice and early.

Great place to visit. In general I am not a big fan of aquariums but I was positively surprised. The visit takes 1-2 hour and the aquariums are really big. There is a great collection of fishes from South Africa. I was there on a Saturday afternoon and they hat staff who was feeding penguins and explaining everything.
Xmas 2015. Was super fun going thru this attraction and there was loads to see and enjoy, loved seeing the penguins being fed and then the sharks

Education meets fun and wonder. First, the bad news. It's not a cheap affair (but if you love it, get a year pass for a few bucks more than a standard ticket) but it does offer value even if it loses out to uShaka in Durban for the title of best aquarium in Africa. It's got a rainy morning figured out for the kids, with snacks, numerous windows into local sealife, a couple of step-inside exibits (clownfish being a huge draw thanks to Pixar's Nemo) and even a touchpool and penguin colony. That's just for starters. Conveniently located near the V&A Waterfront, you are literally near like 5 museums, which could easily occupy your weekend if you are so inclined. Loved the aquarium and a nice gift shop too. Must see.
Neat place . Nice restaurant and gift shop. Great exhibitions to witness. Variety of animals. Clean and neat. Staff knowledgeable and friendly.
Fun,fun, fun!. We so enjoyed the new changes to the aquarium, even though everything is not complete yet, there is a lot of new stuff that the kids will enjoy. Take the family and make a day of it.

Great outing for family in Cape Town. We used to visit the aquarium quite often when our kids were younger but have not been there for the last three years. So we decided to go and visit it again after the renovations were finished. What a treat. The new section is stunning, and especially the jellyfish section is amazing. The kids (and the adults) thoroughly enjoyed the visit. Sadly the large predator tank is currently beeing revamped, but I am sure that once this work is completed, it will be a center attraction again.

Not worth the money if you have been to the one in Durban. As all the other places we visited in Cape Town this was also under construction. The layout and things were very good but I personally think if you have been to the one in Durban, don't bother visiting the one in Cape Town

Wow ! Must see Aquarium. Interact with Penguins
A must see. The Two Osceans Aquarium is on par with the best. Much smaller than the Singapore Aquarium. The interaction with the Penguins , remains it's unique feature. Try and attend during feeding time.Great place to relax a bit and wonder at the beauty of the Oceans. Highly recommended

Fantastic Aquarium. I've been to many aquariums around the world, but this is by far the best. From swimming with the sharks in the giant shark tank, to touch and feel rocky pools with starfish and other small sea dwellers. Stunning variety of fish in beautifully laid out tanks. There is a seal pool where the seals arrive and depart freely from the bay, and show off their underwater manoeuvres for the public. Spend half a day there and then have lunch at one of the many V&A restaurants.

What a view!. We enjoyed the Aquarium as much if not more than our kids. It is a pricy excursion, but totally worth it. The information sessions are to the point and interesting. Really a "must have".

Good place to spend time with kids. Although a relatively small aquarium, it is a great place to spend time with kids.The reef tanks seemed small and over - crowded and the benthic fauna was not in the best condition.The predators tank was empty (mantainance), which was a bit disappointing.

Outing for the family. Ive always loved the marine life. I live for watching discovery channels.We decided to take our 4month old to the aquarium to explore moving fish and colours ( actually it was more for us ) It felt slightly cramped up and extemely dark and gloomyThe fish in the smaller tanks looked slightly lifeless. I kept asking my husband if he thought they had enough spaceI do understand the want to keep them in an enclosure for our entertainment and viewing but i would feel better if it was less species and more space. Im a little sad that there wasnt any sharks. But i do understand that they renovating the exibit and did a release not to long ago. The gift shop had no little tshirts or outdits for 6-12 months and i was very sad i couldnt get hin anythingIm not yet ready to get my membership till i see some positive changes

great family outing. Best place to take the whole family. My son and his friend certainly enjoyed the visit and looking at all the interesting water animals. They loved taking lots of pictures with fishes. its a half day event and they have information sessions. it does tend to get a bit busy during holidays but the buzz also adds to the vibe of the place.

Small, but well-designed. Although the aquarium was smaller than we expected, we saw lots of interesting things. We watched a penguin feeding and large fish feeding in the predator tank (shark feeding was on a different day). There were jellyfish, eels, a whole tank of "nemos," penguins, a giant kelp forest, an entire tank devoted to predatory fish, and an octopus. The layout lent itself to getting around and seeing everything easily. We saw everything and still had about an hour before the feedings, so we got our hands stamped, did some shopping in the V&A Waterfront, and returned at show time.

Definitely worth a visit. As the owner of an animal organisation myself, I can only imagine the work that goes into keeping this place running. It is a wonderful destination - beautifully kept and a fun educational visit for kids.
See the penguins up close. Great to spend a rainy winter day, watching fish and penguins up close. Great to keep the kids busy :)
Interested in marine biology?. A truly great acquarium. World class. Similar to the Singapore island Sentosa. This may be of special interest to people that have an interest in sharks. Enjoy.

Visit on a rainy day. If it's a rainy day, you have young children and you run out of options of what to do, then this is a place to visit. It has some interesting species and information. Most of the staff are volunteers and they are very happy to explain about particular underwater species. Don't miss the section where you can see fish eggs under the microscope and "allowed to touch" section with some exhibits of sea stars. Be warned - at the penguin section the smell is overwhelming (old fish?) and we had to rush through it, which is a shame. Overall the staff is lovely and helpful. There is a huge section at the end still under construction right now.

Very nice.. This a great place to go with your children during a rainy day! They manage to make this place very interesting by creating different activities like seeing the penguins bring fed. I am a young adult and still loved it! There is no age to go there!!
Not a lot to see. The main exhibit was closed for remodeling and we were not informed of that before we bought our tickets. We were a little disappointed. The jellyfish exhibit is amazing, though.

Fun Hangout for Family. I spent half a day taking my time exploring the wide range of ocean life captured at this aquarium. Great for young and old alike and relaxing way to spend the day. You will see almost every kind of ocean life including the largest and oldest crab I've ever seen in my life. He was thought to be 40 years old or older and stood as tall as a large dog. Incredible!

Fun day at the aquarium!. Would love to see more fish, and more jellies. They have lots of penquins, but it would be fun to see more varieties.I had a nice time but it was rather short. I would love it if they had a lot more fish, more colorful exhibits with rocks and all, and a lot more jellies. It was still fun to see what was there.

The new predator display is open!. If people only knew the enormous amount of work that goes on behind the scenes to set up and run a world-class aquarium, to say nothing of the stupendous costs involved, then they would appreciate this aquarium even more. Now that the new predator tank is at last open we can see several types of fish that has not been kept before, including both yellowfin and longfin tunas. Some 30-kilo specimens of the majestic poenskop, one of the most sought-after South African shore angling species and now severely endangered, can be seen swimming around right in front of the main window.
Wonderful. Wonderful experience especially for families. Enjoy a day out at Two Oceans. Must compliment the friendly staff and making the day more special. Highly recommended
Too little for too much money . The entrance fee is disproportionate to the experience. It is an okay time out but is simply too expensive

Excellent place. A must visit.. The aquarium is a great place to visit with kids. The penguin enclosure if simply superb. Catch the feed times if possible. The new Ocean exhibit was also good but a had a few teething problems given that it was the first day for public viewing.

Well worth it.. Great experience with the kids. They loved it. We were disappointed that the predator tank was empty due to maintenance but at least there is a sign about this at the entrance so you know before paying. There is enough without it.

An attraction for big and small.. Very few people get the opportunity to see underwater life first hand through diving, so the Two Oceans Aquarium is the ideal place to visit when at the Waterfront in Cape Town. Of special interest are the feeding times, so when you plan your visit make sure that you get to see either the feeding of the penquins or the fish in general. Another tip (especially in tourist season) is to book your tickets over the Internet at their website, saving you time as there can be a long line otherwise. Centrally located in the V&A Waterfront within walking distance of many other attractions, be sure to include a visit in your schedule when in Cape Town.

Always amazing!. I try to visit the aquarium every time I go to Cape Town. I always drag along anyone who is with me much to their initial consternation. As soon as we walk through the turnstiles and into the first display everyone I know, adult or child, is captivated. Who can fail to be fascinated, awed, and delighted? On this visit my companions (age ranges from 14 months to 73 years old!) and I were lucky enough to see the penguins and the rays and turtle being fed, to have a chance to try out microscopes (who knew what is in the water!!) and to learn lots of new things. The staff is always informative, helpful, kind and rewards interest with information. The displays are undergoing renovation in some parts and I can't wait to go back and see what has been done, I can't think of ways the aquarium could improve but I am sure the dedicated team there will make it even better. Plus - a big thank you to the lovely staff in the cafe who let us spread out all over the place, made endless concessions for the kids and did everything to help
Fun day for kids. We took our godchildren and they loved it. There is a few spots for nice photos and there is a "touch pad" where kids can touch sea plants etc.

Something Fishy. A great place to keep the young ones entertained as well as the adults. Watch the divers enter the many tanks to feed the fish and visit the live display where one can handle different objects. Once again pricey but not something you would do every day so nice for a special treat.

amazing. good for all ages,to see children's faces and enjoy it so much, grandparents if you want to do something with the children take them there. lot of sea life to see big and small and even creatures you wouldn't even have thought existed.

Great for children. We are annual members for a couple of years now. It remains a great occasion for the children. They love the exhibits and we enjoy all the entertainment that there is for the children. The exhibits are frequently updated making it a fresh experience frequently.

Better than expected with a good range of attractions. Easy to while away a couple of hours here, with good displays and information on what you're looking at. Though provoking at times. Great for kids.

An annual treat and family institution.. The stark, almost bland building exterior hides the explosion of natural wonders held inside. It is fun, educational, well run and good value. Every year we visit at my grandson's insistence. It has entranced 4 generations of our family. The exhibitions change focus from sea anemones one visit to penguins the next. The gift shop is a bit generic but it sells jaw dropping high quality posters of great whites which make stunning souvenirs. Don't miss.

Post Renovating Visit. The aquarium was looking good now that most of the big renovations are completed.We took my parents who are pensioners along for their first visit. Our tickets were booked online therefore affording us a small discount on the regular ticket office price.My folks loved the array of fish but both didn't enjoy the dark areas where exhibits had special glass and with the movement it caused them both to feel claustrophobic and almost motion sick. We moved to the AfriSam kids area, touching pools and penguin areas which were better for them. Loved the kids puzzles against the walls and new murals along with educational information. The new passage with overhead water was ok - it's brand new and I'd love to see more species of fish inside.The Shoreline Cafe outside but attached to the aquarium was lovely. We sat outside and watched all the activities in the Marian and the nearby seals. Had some great coffees and kids enjoyed their meals.

Penguin feeding was good. I love going to aquariums and have been to quite a few around the world. This one was ok but I have seen better.The penguin exhibit was excellent and I was lucky enough to be there during one of their feeding times. The staff member who spoke was very informative and knowledgeable making sure that people knew how penguins feed so that we didn't think they were being force fed.The lack of any sharks was disappointing as I had watched a film showing the work the aquarium has done in helping save them and was looking forward to viewing them.All in all, I was there for about 1.5hrs which I felt was ample time.

Great. I love going to the Two Oceans Aquarium - lovely place - great place for kids too - and they have a lot of interactive activities for the kids - This month they had an underwater photography exhibition on - was really nice to see
great for kids and adults. One of our favourites. The big aquarium is amazing. great to visit on a rainy day or at a hot day to escape the heath.

Good n informative. If you haven't been to an aquarium, suggest you ahead there. Suggest that you book tickets online to avoid standing in a queue. We did that and on reaching there, saw a big line for buying tickets. Inside, its really like wow. There are so many different varities of aquatic life. They have a touch and feel area which is interesting. There a few enclosures (like a shell) where one can stand and click photos which look like you are inside the water. For the predators, they have a huge huge tank with glass walls. This is spectacular. They also have a person go inside and give feeds to the predator species. We spent a nice time and our kids learnt quite a bit new about aquatic life.

Was good . I expected more, there was a lot to see and do but the main reason for a visit was to see the sharks which had been removed to allow building work. Still a very good aquarium. Loved the penguin feeding!!!

Nice experience.. A huge aquarium.. . It's amazingly built.. Variety of species.. And very close to the waterfront. You won't have to travel a lot to get there, just add it on with your waterfront visit..

always a winner. I love coming here! there is always something new going on. I feel inspired by the greatness and harmony of the sea life, and I also love the way they educate kids on the ocean and all its treasures. love the coffee shop where one can relax afterwards, and the gift shop has amazing things! Even a favorite among locals. if it rains in cpt, it is very full and busy and one can easily loose your child.

Kids paradise. Being a local resident, this is an annual outing for the family, with December 2015 being no exception. My children loves the aquarium and never seem to tire of it. We try and take new people with us every year to share the beautiful displays.

part of aquarium under construction. when buying ticket the cashier said that they did not have the large sharks. I did not know this meant that the entire tank was drained and that the whole highlight of this visit which was the tunnel under the shark tank, was empty!

Great outing for kids. I'm not crazy about seeing any animal, fish or bird in a cage, but this would be a great experience for any kid. The aquarium boasts a large variety of displays which includes a huge circular tank containing sharks. The shark tank is quite spectacular and viewable from all sides via a walkway that encircles the display

Amazing Experience. The aquarium itself is superb with incredible displays of aquatic creatures. However the highlight came when we decided to grab a bit of lunch in the Shoreline Cafe. The food was absolutely superb and amazing value for money! Staff were really friendly too - well done for serving such great food!

Fun for all ages. My family never seems to get tired of visiting Two Ocean Aquarium and its a nice outing when the weather isn't great. The displays are interesting so that you don't get bored easily.My girls loved the touch pond and the staff were really friendly and full of fun and interesting facts.The shark tank is totally amazing and there is a HUGE turtle that likes all the attention at the viewing window.We will definitely be back for another visit soon!

Brilliant as always. We always have a fantastic time at the aquarium. We became members and go once in a while to visit our favourite fishy friends. The aquarium recently opened two new exciting exhibits which are both amazing. They are currently renewing some of their larger tanks which means there are even better things to come!
