Well worth a day trip any day!Today we joined the crew on a behind the scenes tour. It was nice to see the 'nuts and bolts' of the place as it really drives home how much effort they put in to keeping the sea critters happy and healthy. Recommendable all round!

Great fun for little ones. Took the family to the Aquarium and had a nice time. Daugter (then 3 years old) had a particularly good time at the touch exhibit and the kids play area on the lower level. Good indoor / winter activity.Not a whole day affaire and would recommend allowing for 2 hours maximum.

Must see with children . This is probably one of the best places to take children of all ages 2 to 80).The displays are well done and maintained, the shows and displayd to edutain are excellent. Highly recommended!
Quick coffee. Popped in for a quick coffee while at the waterfront - a great place to relax while the kids run wild in the indoor play area. They do great fish and chips as well!
Beautiful. Was amazed with the different species of fish in there. A beautiful site for families & couples. It will be a wonderful experience for children.

Two Oceans Experience. This is a great experience for the whole family. We thoroughly enjoyed taking in all the sites and learning new things. The penguins are especially cute. I like the fact that you can have kiddies parties there.
An underwater wonderland.... The Two Oceans Aquarium is a really great place to take the whole family, experience the undersea environment the way it is. Has lots more to offer as well...

A good aquarium if you have small children. A decent aquarium which requires 2 hours of your time. If you have visited many aquariums then you might finish this even sooner. Though we have visited many aquariums across the world, our son was insistent on going and he loved it. The main attraction being the feeding of the African penguins. It was raining outside and it was time well spent inside the aquarium

The aquarium in Cape Town. The best place to teach your children and also you can learn a lot of stuff Aquarium is it nice place to relax and watch fishes and predators end lots lots more you love it A-1 day 2 you can also have coffee and cake when you're finished you're around there's a place for the kids downstairs that can play it X
V&A Two Oceans Aquarium. The best time was spend at the Two Oceans Aquarium. It has the most diversified sea life. It also showcase a few exhibitions.

Okay - a little small. We wanted to go for the shark feeding only to find out that the Sharks were released. Got to see the feeding of the Rays and a turtle named Yoshi. That was nice. Aquarium is well kept but a little in the small side. Felt it was pricey for the size.
Educational and amazing. Take your friend or kid to make them gain appreciation for our beautiful sea creatures and ocean sustainability

Must visit. This is a must visit.. Informative. .. Fun.. It's everything.. The place is meant for both kids and adults.. Do remember to carry a camera. .. Place is superbly maintained and the staff is well informed..
Must see. Well worth a visit. Lots to see, especially if you have children. The Aquarium is clean and very well set out.

Nice . Very nice. Nothing wow. I definitely think a ticket is over priced. We paid R150p/p. Took us about 1hour to walk through the aquarium twice. Other than that, friendly staff and aquarium is well looked after. Also, the sharks have been removed. No one informs you of this before you buy a ticket.

Nice smallish aquarium. We were lucky to arrive as they were transferring a 6 year old shark from the large main tank to a smaller tank before releasing back into the ocean. It took skillful manoevering as she didn't want to go, but it was successful after about 20 minutes.A good educational aquarium with areas for children to play and learn. Some interesting fish.

Amazing Africa Tours . It is more than recommend to visit the Aquarium. It's very interesting to see what the Atlantic coast around Southern Africa has to offer. Please take time for your vist. You need about 2 hours if not more. Very interesting.
Mrs. Beautiful setting. Expensive but you pay for the view. A pleasant place to spend an evening with friends.
Cute prnguind. Located at V & A waterfront, easily accessible. Although the display are not exactly impressive and plenty, still worth s visit with children.

The times they are achanging. The Two Oceans aquarium has been an excellent aquarium for the past 20 years. At present it is in a flux of change, having built a new exhibition which opens within the next few weeks. This has a complete walk through tunnel.The entry to this exhibit will also have a jellyfish display.The current predator tank and Kelp Forest exhibition will be closed for an overhaul and the ragged tooth sharks which were being exhibited there have been released into the ocean during this week.There are constantly changes at the aquarium, the current changes being the largest in it's existence. One can visit time and time again and never be bored. As a solemate (Member) one has the opportunity from time to time to go on a "behind the scenes" visit of the exhibitions. This is most informative and gives one a much better understanding of the work that goes into keeping people informed and the animals in a healthy condition.Having dinner at a function with the predator tank as background makes a memorable experience which will never be forgotten.

Excellent Aquarium - great rainy day option. The aquarium is on the waterfront, literally around the corner from the V&A Hotel where we were staying. We visited it on the only rainy afternoon we had during our 6 day visit. It was a most enjoyable several hours that we spent there, and as aquariums go (and I visit many) it's a solid B+, which is an excellent grade. Lots to see, and it wasn't crowded, despite the rain. I wouldn't call it a must-see (like Monterey or Baltmore) but it's well worth your time if the weather isn't cooperating. Interestingly, of all the sights we visited in Cape Town, the aquarium was the most expensive entrance fee.

Family entertainment at its best. Our whole family visited the aqaurium this sunday. Grand childrenespecially enjoyed the interactive displays and furthermore becomes really affordable if you can purchase the membership option

Excellent visit with your grandchildren. I often visited this aquarium since it opened and still enjoy going there. Did so yesterday, 28 May 2016 with my grandchildren of 4 and 14 years old. For the older girl it was a wonderful opportunity to take photo's and discover interesting sea life. For the little one it was the most exciting thing we could have done for her. She ran from one to the next exhibit. Personally I was a tad disappointed at the fact that there were noticeably less species in the main tank than before.
Go after four and you almost have the place for yourself. It's great!. I loved this experience! We were almost alone and there is so much to look at. The big tank, you could watch it for hours.

Excellent for kids. Second time I came here with my kids and they loved it even more, they are now 8 and 10 and a good age for being interested in learning more. There was a fantastic lady doing a demo in the main area who answered my son's questions so well. The penguins talk is wonderfully interesting for the kids, especially because we went to Boulders beach later in the holiday.

Great little aquarium on the V&A waterfront. This is a great little aquarium on the V&A waterfront. There are several fish tanks where the kids can go through a tunnel and come up in the middle of the tank.

Beautiful ocean life. Great place to see some of all the beautiful fish and animals living in the ocean around Cape Town. Daily you can see the penguins and the fish being fed. Can buy a combo ticket for a boat trip as well.

They lack structure. Far from to say the aquarium is not beautiful, but once my mother was not feeling well and they would find someone to measure her blood pressure.Bottomline...many aged people and children visit the place, but in case of any emergency, just pray to God, because from those people of the staff there is no help to get.

wonderful fish and wild life. We were impressed by the variety of ocean dwellers from both the Atlantic and the Indian ocean. And the Penguin display is not to be missed. If you can time your visit to when they are fed, it is added value.

Great selection of fish, kids love it. Tours available. My kids love the aquarium and we go often. We went on a specially arranged behind the scenes tour and it was very interesting to see how the aquarium works and to see the new exhibit with is under construction. The tour guide was well informed and the trip was fun and educational for the kids. If you are already familiar with the aquarium and are looking for something different, I can recommend the behind-the-scenes tour.

Great Aquarium. Great aquarium in a great location at the V&A Waterfront which makes it very easy to include in a day of shopping, eating and visiting Robben Island ( or other excursions). The aquarium is not huge so manageable in a few hours. The shark tank and underwater tunnel are wonderful and mesmerizing. The aquarium focuses on sea life of South Atlantic Africa and Indian Ocean so is different for visitors from Europe, Asia and the Americas. Be sure to see the giant " crabs/Crayfish" they are unbelievable!

You can swim with the sharks!. I didn't, but you can swim with the sharks at the Two Oceans Aquarium. I have visited aquaria all over the world, and Two Oceans is one of my favorites. They have areas you can walk through, so you don't feel so far removed from the beasties. One walk through area contains penguins and various other birds. It's fun to see the penguins and other birds interact. They're quite territorial. Two Oceans is also one of the few places where you can get within inches of the colorful and deadly mantis shrimp. Admittedly, it was very thick glass and a small, young mantis shrimp - but they are one of the world's most deadly animals. There are so many varied things to do at the aquarium that you can easily spend two or three hours and not be bored. Two Oceans is not an aquarium where you merely walk around and look at things in tanks. It is especially enjoyable on a hot day in Cape Town, as the aquarium is nice and cool inside. Don't miss the shark feeding times. And if you get tired, sit down and have an ice cream at the ice cream shop near the exit. Trip was actually in November 2013, not 2015. It was my second visit to the aquarium - the first being in 2006. It was an excellent experience both times.

it's ok. Traveling worldwide I've seen much better aquarium, from Genova to Singapore. This one is ok, I expected more since I heard it was recently renovated. The penguins feeding session is the most fun, and the clown's fish bubble is also cute. Apart from that the shark tank is very dated and with tired fishes. Don't expect to see the white sharks here, for those there's only the ocean with the cages tour.

Wonderful underwater experience. Wonderful aquarium with plenty to see and do. Located near waterfront shopping centre with plenty of parking close by. Restaurants and putt putt close by also. Helpful aquarium assistances and guides

Penguins Were Great. There are some pretty cool fish and other things to see but the penguins were the best part. They are interesting to watch and I managed to be there for their feeding. Take an hour or two and go visit the aquarium if you're not busy.

I visit twice a year. I sign up for annual membership and visit at least twice a year. The exhibits change constantly, it is a delightful venue and the kids that I drag along are enchanted. The harbour boats outside this venue are also much cheaper method of getting to view the working harbour. Departures every 20 minutes or so.

Really great aquarium. Although I am not a fan of captive animals, I really enjoyed the aquarium, large variety of animals with very well done acquariums. Most animals seem to be in good shape, except the rays who look like they are always genuinely trying to escape.

Enjoyable attraction for families in Cape Town. We have visited many aquariums and this was fun for the boys (age 9 and 12). It was as educational as much as it was fun. Our favorite exhibit was the tank with the clown fish that the kids can get in the middle of while the fish are swimming all around them. We walked there from our hotel (Table Bay) and enjoyed the street performers and the shops along the waterfront. Recommend visiting early before it gets crowded.

Lunch and aquarium visit. What a nice and romantic place!
It s so nice to walk and see all these beauties created by mother nature.
It s a unique feel to walk inside the tunnel and have all these fish, turtles and sharks around.
Lunch outside is very nice to finish the visit.
You must go!

Unusual experiences!. Booked a penguin experience and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. I fell in love with one disabled penguin (Teddy) whom very nearly got smuggled out of the Aquarium as he didnt seem to want to leave my lap! Very intereesting exhibits and can't wait to see the "new" feature after this winter ...

Underwhelming. When you've seen one aquarium, you've pretty much seen them all, and it takes something special to beat that. This wasn't one of them. It's very small and doesn't take long to get around at all, which is especially disappointing considering the high admission price.They have some endangered African penguins, but having been to Boulder's Beach the day before and seen hundreds of them living in the wild, I was less than impressed with seeing captive ones.

Really nice. This was a pleasure of note, beautiful selection of marine life, interesting bits of info to pick up along the way and all round a well run place. We were fortunate to be there during the sham feeding and this was truly a special.

more kids than fish. The aquarium itself was quite good; lots of interesting species and it's great at feeding time. However, the main auditorium where the feeding takes place is jam packed full of kids. Most of them run up to the glass and press their faces against it. Even though the staff tell them not to, they do it anyway, which of course ruins the view for everybody else. We got there well ahead of feeding time, chose a good viewing position and waited patiently for the feeding to start. Literally 30 seconds before the scheduled time (and in many cases after), people with no concern for others, thought that having kids entitled them to plonk themselves and their rabble on the floor right at the front, parking their buggies and pushchairs anywhere they felt like it. It was more like a playground with kids full of E numbers!I would go back, but it would be in the day during term time because unfortunately, uncontrolled children ruined it for me

Ocean Lover Must-Visit!. Although going to the aquarium was essentially to entertain a 3-year-old and 5-year-old, I would admit that I probably enjoyed the visit more than them!Well set out with a walk-way that visits each section of the aquarium, we were kept well busy and entertained for about 2 hours of our V&A Waterfront visit. Make sure to time your visit well so that you watch the penguin-feeding as well as the shark-feeding demonstrations!
Very nice Aquarium. The aquarium was very nice, interesting animals, huge bassins. The only negative point was the café where not interested waiters did a bad job.

Fantastic Displays. I was here for a private event in the evening but was able to get a good sense of the extent of sea life on display. The tanks are fascinating and there are fish from the local waters that are unusual and fascinating to watch for someone who has traveled to South Africa from a distance. I was there with some local people who seemed to enjoy it as much as we visitors did. A fine aquarium and well worth a visit.

nice. Nice small aquarium. They do a good job displaying the local marine species. Nice penguin area, and up close. We enjoyed the feeding in the tank. Give yourself an hour or two and then you will have seen everything.
Amazing. Had an amazing time at the aquarium - there is so much to see and do and I really learnt so much about sea life! The customer service was excellent!

Amazing Not to be missed . The aquarium is a must see for all young & old. It has up close experiences and for those that have the certification diving is also available. The feeding times are once a day on different days so try to plan your visit during those times. There is a kids play area with puppet shows for the very little ones. The Penguins are fantastic to watch and you can even feel or touch some sea creatures in a feel tank. Book online tickets for cheaper rates.

Well worth a visit, great for kids!. We took two of our grandchildren here whilst on a visit to Cape Town and had a very enjoyable morning. The place is very children friendly with lots for them to do and explore. It is also educational, with a heavy emphasis upon wildlife protection and conservation. The staff are very knowledgeable and passionate about their work. Well worth a visit..

worth a visit. While far from exceptional, this aquarium has some interesting exhibits and is a good place to spend half an hour, especially if you have children who have been bored with the shopping at V and A wharf area. They have 2 large tanks, one with large fish and the other with a kelp forest and penguins swimming around (which was an unexpected plus). Also a rather sad area on the top level with penguins. The smaller tanks downstairs and the touch pool area are more interesting You can re-enter during the same day so this allows you to come back for the feeding times later in the day of you so wish.

Awsome!. Love going to spend time at the aquarium. It is so interesting and the staff are so passionate about their work. Can happily spend hours there between the fish and penguins. Can't wait for the new section to open!

Educational Outing. We love visiting the Two Oceans Aquarium. The offer a family pass which enables one to visit throughout the year at a discounted rate. The children love the Nemo pictures as well as the puppet shows. The highlight is always the penguin feeding session, a bit rather "fishy" experience. I would recommend the aquarium for anyone with children.

Really neat place!. I was very pleasantly surprised by this aquarium. It is small but lovely. I did the rock hopper penguin encounter, which was absolutely fantastic, and enjoyed just sitting and watching the tanks. There were people every where to explain what you were seeing and many interactive exhibits. Very good value for the price as well, and lots of neat items in the gift shop. Also a great location because when you are finished there you are mere minutes from the V&A Waterfront and everything it has to offer.

MY ALTERNATIVE TO DEEP SEA DIVING. I haven't been for 5 years and the excuse to take my grandson worked. I was surprised at how busy it was. My grandson loves Pingu and I told him we going to see them at the 11h45 feeding time. His father(my son) though, said there's lots of time and of course we missed that. My grandson and his mum took their photo at the Nemo exhibit and he was enthralled. All the exhibits are beautiful and my grandson made his mum and dad crawl into little passageways behind some of them. He kept dragging us to go see other one fish (the penguins). No matter how many times you go it is so beautiful to see the different species.The Yellowtails and some other fish in the I & J Predator tank are quite huge. The turtle is a real show off and swims close to the front of the tank. We also wanted to see the shark feeding time at 15h00( on a Sunday) so we took a pass out and had lunch in the cafe on the premises. We watched the sharks (ragged tooth), turtle and mantaray being fed. There is a touch tank and it is good for the little (and not so little) ones to touch the anemones and star fish. There is also a kiddies play area. It is a good excursion for schools and they sometimes have sleepovers

Loved the Dolphins!. I'd recommend this activity for families with children and just adults too!I was so excited to see "Mon Capitan" from Madagscar (not really him, but who'll tell?)The store at the aquarium is good to purchase some souvenirs if you're so inclined.

Huge variety of sealife. We visited the aquarium to pass time before another activity planned and were pleasantly surprised at the variety of sealife on display. The entrance fee is R150. Good for budget travellers or those looking to fill their day.

Marine Life at its Best. An underwater wonderland that will transfix. Two Oceans Aquarium makes you believe in King Neptune again and leaves you with a newly found wonder and appreciation for the ocean and all the people who dedicate their lives to saving and preserving our marine life for us to marvel at its beauty.Have you ever dreamed of a wedding that will blow you away ..well here you can have that reception under the sea, and guests that will cherish your memories forever.Indeed a parents dream destination as kids are most welcome, and best of all entertained with puppet shows and experiments that will teach them facts they are not lightly to forget.
Beautiful!. I went there with son last March. We enjoyed it very much. It is very close to the V&A Center. The many fish species are beautiful.

Fascinating! Well laid out.. Interesting for all ages - we saw some one-year olds having a great time. Warning - the visit can bring out the child in all of us! Serious point: attractively presented exhibits, well lit, well cared for. We could have stayed all day and not seen it all. But would have been easier on the ear and the elbows if we had avoided the primary school parties!
Marine Life. The most beautiful Aquarium in the worldLots of marine lifeLast time we had a function at the Aquarium .Wery well organized!

In need of a facelift. . My first time to the Two Oceans Aquarium was a disappointment. The dirty tanks, stale smell and dim lighting created a dingy, claustrophobic atmosphere. Additionally, my friends and I were shocked at how small the tanks were. Definitely in need of a renovation.

Great rainy day outing. We enjoyed the whole outing. Its interesting and educational and world class The shark tank was definately a highlight. Also very child friendly. Will take about 3 hours to get through. Don't eat there, have something to eat at the food market just 200m from the entrance afterwards.

Delightful assortment of critters. A lovely day trip, albeit slightly expensive. The exhibits are well maintained and there is a great selection of aquatic creatures. Whether you're going for aesthetics or education the aquarium offers something for everyone. However if you are not attending with your own children I would recommend visiting outside of school holidays.

Fun 2hrs in Cape Town. Peaceful to wonder about each exhibit, the kelp forest is especially amazing, check out the website of the CT Aquarium for feeding times. Restaurant on site. Make sure you visit every corner of the aquarium as it is easy to mistakenly think that you have reached the end of the exhibits buy carry on and the next corner reveals yet another. Much fun for kids and adults.

a good place to bring children and to visit. Good exposure of the species, you can visit, and come back during the day for free (have your hand stamped). The kids have playgrounds, resting areas, there is a snack place for parents and children, a team to explain some particularities and enough space for everyone. Even wheelchairs could circulate I think all around.

love the penguins. i personally dont agree with aquariums, its a shame to keep sharks in a tank, but the children really enjoyed the experience, the penguin colony was enjoyable,(nasty little buggers in real life) all very pretty, ok on a rainy day

Kids love the aquarium!. We've been to the aquarium several times in the last few years. It is a consistently good experience and it is one place the kids will repeatedly visit without protest. The exhibits were wonderful, lots of interesting sea creatures in the touch pools. Staff were friendly. The kids puppet show a bit of a let down but the activity centre still offering a good few minutes entertaining for the kids while we enjoyed a quick cup of coffee. Penguins a hit and loved watching them dive into the sea forest tank.

Well it was an Aquarium . And it's good to visit, the sharks is amazing but I think this visit would have been better without all screaming children:) the oceans aquarium may benefit to have children free hours:)

Okay aquarium.. The aquarium is great for a rainy day, but I wouldn't recommend it otherwise. There are FAR superior aquariums that I have visited else where. The list of exhibits isn't massive, so only took 1.5/2hours to see everything. Needs more species, larger exhibits and more interactive areas.
A pleasant surprise. I have been to a few aquariums around the world but only recently to the one in Cape Town. What a lovely surprise. Found information clear and insightful. Loved the Kelp display.

A bid visit by smaller than expected. The Two Oceans is a good visit specially for the smaller ones. I was expecting a larger aquarium and in 2 hours we pretty much saw everything to see. It is well maintained and all the fish info is well presented and posted. It is a good visit, but not a whole day affair.

Absolutely Amazing!. This is an amazing experience! Walk through the glass tunnel and see sharks all around you, or visit the penguins! There is also a child-friendly touch-facility with guides that let you touch starfish and other marine life. This is highly educational and very beautiful! Fun for the whole family!
Just great!. I am a lover of aquariums and try to visit them everywhere I travel to. The Two Oceans Aquarium is one of the best! Fantastic place to visit (if you like fish! :) )
Kids Enjoyed. The kids enjoyed this one way more than I did. Was pretty average. Will be back though - kids have fun.

Informative entertainment. A treat for the whole family, especially if you need to be indoors with the kids on a rainy day. Clown fish tank is a hit everytime. Get there before 10am explore the diversity on display and appreciate the ragged tooth sharks, sea turtles and kelp forrests.

A tad tired. I am probably writing contrary to other reviewers but I was a bit unimpressed. Maybe because I have been a few times since it opened. And maybe because I am unfairly comparing to the stellar London aquarium. It might be due a refresh. On the plus side it's surprisingly compact and very baby buggy friendly. The kelp forest, pengiun display and predator tanks are all impressive in its own way and worth the admission. Word of warning the entrance is packed with people trying to get a photo with Nemo. Also has a nice restaurant at exit with play area or kids. Still a good morning/afternoon out.

World Class Aquarium. Being an avid follower of aquariums, i love going to Cape Towns aquariums VnA Waterfront Aquarium. From the very first 'Nemo' tank which one can stand inside to the myriad of smaller exhibits where one can see rare jelly fish and the endangered Sea Horse, i commend this aquarium on their lay out and a very enticing and exciting entrance. The guided touch pools are a feast of information for all ages. The penguine pool always makes me a little aad but a good reminder of the impact himans have on our oceans leaving little creatures in need of rehabilitation spaces like this. The fresh watee exhibit with different frogs is interesting. The best part is the impressive and enormous swaying sea weed tank where one is left mesmorised by a wonderful display of life underwater. Ofcourse the large shark tankis prett mind blowing too where brave divers can dive with the sharks too.

Amazing and humbling - great for all ages. Went to this with 3 kids and a 16year old, lots of different exhibits culminating in the predators which was a huge tank with sharks and other huge fish. All the kids enjoyed it and enjoyed the various different exhibits, there were ones where you could feel anemones and star fish! The obligatory penguin provided some hilarity too as did the display where the kids could insert their heads into a tank full of 'nemos'. Overall there was a lot of space and the layout enabled you to stay and look without feeling herded through.We didn't eat a meal but did have an ice cream which was lovely! If you want food there is a cafe but be aware there is a fantastic 'Food shed' between the aquarium and the waterfront mall which has a myriad of fantastic food! I had the vegetarian Indian platter which was amazing!

The Penguins. I like aquariums and every time I find something special in each and every aquarium. The Penguins are what Two Ocean Aquarium has as a plus, don't miss them , they are located at the top floor.
Aquiruim experience. A must for families with children. This is always a winner and the kids enjoy the fish very much. Stay for the feeding og the animals and a show for smaller children

Moray eel!!!. What a lovely place to spend some time... My favorite had to be then honeycomb moray eel but there is so much to enjoy. Be sure to give yourself lots of time. Some beautiful species to see!

A lovely afternoon out. We visited this place on a Sunday afternoon. There were still plenty of people inside. This aquarium has some really large tanks and you can spend all day looking at them. It's also very educational and interactive for kids. They have a touch and feel section, where kids can touch starfish and sea cucumbers and other animals. They also have a microscope area where they show you sea horses under a microscope. Upstairs is a cute penguin area where you can watch them playing. We had a very enjoyable afternoon here and I would definitely recommend a visit.

Great day out with the family. We had a free morning, so what better way to spend it than walking around the aquarium.Absolutely amazing marine life and everything was so clean.The walk was easy for my disabled father and there was plenty of resting areas.Had a really great day out.

Worth a visit. This was my first ever trip to an aquarium and i dont know if its me but i expected more.Nice cafe inside, reasonably priced.The admission price is reasonable. It doesnt take long to walk around the aquarium but it was very clean and lots of information about the different fish.As with any place you have to go through the gift shop to exit.

2 Oceans diversity. A visit to the Aquarium gives a good overview over the 2 different ecosystems found along the south african coast. The aquarium displays the plant and fish species of the cold Atlantic ocean and the warm Indian ocean. very neatly done and informative.

lots of fish. The "Two Oceans Aquarium" is an amazing experience. Explore the underwater world of both oceans in various aquariums. A great experience especially for children. Don't miss the shark feeding.
Close to nature . The best and must see in Cape Town, friendly staff excellent fish and marine species. Must do is the interaction with marine life.

Exploring the Two Oceans Aquarium. We spent a lovely afternoon exploring the Two Oceans Aquarium. There are many tanks with a large variety of fish to see as well as supervised hands on exhibits and also a children's area with informative puppet shows etc... For the most part it is wheelchair accessible which is great. This is a good place to visit especially if you have young children.
A must in Cape Town . As always a great place to visit especially for our children. The staff with "touch" exhibitions were great and as usual predators a must to see.
best aquarium I have ever seen. this place is massive and great to spend some time in bad weather. Tanks are so big divers are in them

Wonderful to go with children. I have visited several aquariums in different countries, and I must say that I really enjoyed this one. Beautiful displays and very respectful with the animals' needs. Loved the penguin area, and my son had a ball there.

tranquility. The 2 ocean name is not evident in the display of creatures once inside ! There are some interesting exhibits, with a few tanks containing large numbers of shoaling fish and also some different invertebrates. Labelling of fish in community tanks is always difficult when there are only a few individuals with a similar appearance.The staff are helpful, but when asked questions, largely 'had a script' about what they could say about individual displays.The place is wheelchair friendly and most tanks are set at a lower level that will enable small children to be able to see the exhibits.There are some very large tanks and it is possible on occasions for a scuba experience among sharks.

Great way to spend a rainy day in Cape Town. Two Oceans aquarium is a wonderful attraction for anyone who is interested in the ocean. There are interactive areas for kids and adults to learn about marine animals as well as the impact that humans have on the environment. All the areas housing the marine animals are very well maintained and aesthetically pleasing. This is an affordable activity (with discounts!) that is educational and can be enjoyed by many people. If the weather is not great, visit the aquarium and spend a few hours being amazed by everything they have on offer.
TSC Function. We really had a great evening at Two Oceans from the welcome reception from their staff to the ambiance of the venue was such a lovely experience!!

Closest I've been to a shark. Nice little place if you have an hour or two to kill in Cape Town. Learn about local sealife and sharks in particular - we were not dissapointed. Maybe a bit pricey - but we felt it was worth it.
A bit old. Expected more and bigger area, but it is still worth to see it. There is special area for the kids, where they can touch different sea animals.
Amazing two oceans. Marvellous what a tour with the Baz bus can see the both Oceans meeting together and what a beautiful scenery
Fun day out.. Fun day out. Friendly staff. Kept very clean. Very informative. Enjoyed the penguins they are very cute.Defnitief a great family outing.
great close up with sharks and variety of fish and penguins. Kids heaven! interesting for adults too! Lots of things to learn and also educative experience for children.

2 kids 4 adults all hungry . Very well looked after watched the 3o'clock Shark feed. Loved the different interactive parts, touching starfishes, watching the penguins being hand fed. My high light has to be the restaurant alongside, massive portions and very well cooked sea food (steak wasnt the best) well priced too. While watching the Fur Seals who sat alongside the restaurant

One of Cape Towns best spots. What a fun trip! Great for the entire family - don't forget to see the penguins getting fed - the highlight of the visit. All the tanks are clean and well maintained. Look forward to my next visit.

Fishes of my wrd. Wow the staff are amazing especially with the guided tours. The aquarium is not very big but good entertaiment for kds on a winter day. Thank you to all for assisting me with taking amazing photos of my experience
Great experience. We had an evening function at the aquarium which was a real treat. Even got to "find nemo"! The catering and staff are really great.

Worth a visit - you will spend longer there than you think. A wonderful aquarium with good information presented as well as the oddest looking sea life I have ever seen. Great for kids and families and great for more serious visit too. They have a great scheme where you can upgrade your day ticket to a years one that looks worth it if you are spending a reasonable time in Cape Town. Also impressed by the work they do in conservation, seal health etc. When the tunnel is built and doesnt leak, it will be spectacular. Very happy to give it 5 stars already, but stay away from the expensive ice cream at the entrance :)

Nice aquarium. Nice aquarium. Not huge aquarium but good exhibitions and a good activity with kids on a rainy/cloudy day. Try to catch the feeling time for the Penguins and large fish tank. Eat at the nearby food market at the V&A waterfront instead though.
Thoroughly Recommended. Been to a few around the world and this is the best. Very interesting for old and young alike. Lots of interactive and hands on. Good value for money.
Worth a Visit. A fun aquarium for any age. The place offers a great variety of exhibits and just to see how the two ocean merge...very cool.
Get up close and personal with some amazing sealife.. Spacious and well laid out - the large aquarium containing sharks, tuna and a giant turtle (amongst other things) was well worth seeing.

Allow plenty of time to explore. Great place to visit but beware that it's popular with children so it was very noisy when we went which took away a bit from the serenity of the tanks. However there is plenty to see. It's well laid out so that even when it's busy it doesn't take long to find a space to see the fish. There are penguins too which are a delight. The predator tank is a wonder to see the size of the fish and get a close up of the sharks teeth from the safely of the other side of thick glass is amazing.
Great visit. Revisiting with our young children. Enjoyed seeing the sharks, turtles and rays again and educational. Really enjoyable on a cooler day here in Cape Town.

Nearly a must-do, especially with kids 8+. Whatever you're expecting - I suppose, you're going to find it here. From sea horses to sharks, from kelb to corals... Just lovely and really special. Don't miss the seals in the harbour when you leave the aquarium.
Very good program for kids... and grown ups. Right next to V&A Waterfront you can find a very good aquarium, with most of the native species and with some nice activities for the kids

Great environmental info, Check out the "Nemos"!. Blink and you'l miss it - there's a very photo-friendly stop in the first room, where clownfish have adopted a clear acrylic platform as their anemone home. You can crawl under the tank and actually SEE the clownfish from the perspective of an anemone! Inspiring to look up and see dozens of clownfish staked atop each other - the artificial sunlight acts as an x-ray: you can see the blood pumping through the veins of these gorgeous creatures.

Nice visit on a rainy day. Two Oceans Aquarium is the perfect place to go in case you are visiting Cape Town and it happens to be a rainy day. The aquarium itself is very small when compared to similar ones in the rest of the world. However, exhibits are very nice and visits can be very informative if you simply spend some time reading about habitat and peculiarities of the species. If you are planning a visit, ensure you go during feeding time: watching the penguins is fun for the whole family.

Good for a rainy day. A fun and interesting aquarium which we visited on a rainy day in Cape Town. A good mixture of hands on activities and exhibits to keep kids entertained. Highlight was watching the divers in the main tank hand feeding the Rays and turtle.

New exhibits. Another great visit. . We haven't been here in a while but it was high time we returned!The new exhibits are lovely and the current ones are still good, with new signage. We spent quite some time looking at everything - it's clean and informative and fun.

Titanic Showing and Amazing Aquarium. A lovely day spent wandering around in the Aquarium. It's fun for the whole family and there was an informative exhibit on micro-organisms in the ocean. Great fun!
Interesting . Something completely different to look at. I found it intriguing as I discovered new species of fish and other sea creatures. Thank you.
Large variety of fish. Loved the Nemo fish, the penguins and all the othet fish. Took loads of pictures. It took me 2 hours or less to visit the whole aquarium. Worth a one time visit

not bad. i'd say it is a rather average aquarium. they have a big tank with sharks and a semitunnel to watch them and the rest of the fish. there's a possibility for shark diving too. they also have some nice educational panels where they teach about plastic waste and electricity. i think this is a great place for families with children. for adults it is ok, but not a must see.
worth every cent. One will never get boared when in the Two Oceans Aquarium. It may seem a little expensive but once inside you'll see that you're actually paying very little.
Exiting. Very exiting aquarium indeed. My grandschild would like to spend all day in this place. Even for me, who I am not very much interested into those kind of atractions, was interesting.

South African sea life. It's one of the best aquariums that I've visited. It's not huge but you will find a wide range of different species, with a focus of the South African wildlife. Kids friendly. They loved the clown fish (I guess more than a hundred of then) and penguins. There is also a small playground for a quick stop by. Nice cafe inside. You can leave the aquarium and come back later.

Well worth a visit. This is our 2nd time to the aquarium and it's a great place to see marine life up close, especially the large predators like sharks, rays, etc. We combined our visit with a boat trip in the bay, where we say dolphins and a humpback whale with calf up close. Absolutely thrilling.

Great. Scuba dived the first time in here . It was a great experience . And the diving master Iain was really experienced and kind .They had some new ideas designing their tanks . Also they had a section with a microscope that was amazing . ( learn about jelly fish life cycle etc. )

Sigh an awesome wxppeience. This is truly special and the fish on display are mind losing! It is well kept and every single display was in immaculate condition. There is a lot to see and the facility caters for young children as well as their parent! Awesome experience

Disappointing. I found the aquarium a little disappointing.Some of the exhibits of the plant life and corals had no fish in them, so they looked like they were unfinished. It's great that they are given their own 'stage' to shine on, but surely fish and corals go hand in hand.The kelp Forrest was probably he highlight for me.A nice touch is that once you have paid entrance, you can go back as many times during that day as you want.
Great. Good displays, sharks, penguins, snakes, stingrays, excellent tunnel with fish and sharks swimming very close to divers
World class aquarium. Fantastic aquarium with a great range of marine life on display. Nice location near the V&A Waterfront and tour buses.
Ok Aquarium. After having seen many other aquariums and seem two oceans a few times, i feel this could be made better. its getting a bit boring these days.

It's mostly for children. I was visiting Cape Town on my own and Two Oceans Aquarium sounded amazing but I was a bit disappointed. It was quite small and the exhibits although interesting , we're not that many.. Still, there was quite a lot to do for the children; interactive exhibits, play area etc. I think my expectations were too high and I thought I would see something similar to the Aquarium in San Francisco...
nice family outing. Very interesting place. Well maintained friendly people. Loved the penguins. Great outing for whole family.
Feels to be part of Sea world!. Amazing setup and multiple kind of sea creatures. You can also see penguins. Very large aquarium setup for great view and pictures.

Not amazing.... Not amongst the best aquariums in terms of size and variety, but it does have some interesting aquatic creatures. For families with young kids, the Two Oceans Aquarium is worth visiting.

A Fantastic Family Afternoon Out. We were at a loose end down at the V&A, and thought we'd give the aquarium a try, and it was lovely. Brilliantly laid out, and lots of amazing things to see - even our six month old was fascinated. A lovely way to while away a couple of hours.
Fun, not too large. They do a good job of labeling all the exhibits so that you can quickly learn a lot about what is in each exhibit. We came for the penguins and were not disappointed.

Amazing. Very well laid out with some great exhibits. Photo friendly. Many exhibits allow you to get your picture taken by popping up a tube within the exhibit so it looks like you are right inside. What a view. Family friendly, wheelchair and pram friendly. You can leave the aquarium and come back later. Buy a combo ticket and do their marine harbour nature tour. This is truly amazing.Great little cafe with friendly staff. Good coffee too.Reasonably priced. On the hop-on-hop-off bus route.
Stunning displays. This is worth a visit with young children. The displays are stunning and there are a few interactive displays too. It's not cheap but travelling on the pound helps.
Spectacular. One of the most spectacular Aquariums in the world, offering a variety of sea life and massive viewing pools, this is a must see when visiting Cape Town.

Good to watch - experience to scuba dive in!. The Two ocean aqarium is a very nice aquarium located in a posh (smile) surrounding in waterfront. Go from a nice snack in waterfront market to the aquarium. The big tanks are amazing and are the high lights of the visit. They are really big!Me and my wife went on scuba diving in the tanks! Yes - you read right. It is possible to scuba dive the big tanks and enjoy both the fish, sharks and turtles as well as the humans outside the tank. It was a great experience!

Great place!. Visited with my granddaughter and we both enjoyed the wonderful exhibits. We were there for penguin feeding and also saw the diver in the kelp forest take. The aquarium is very well done. A great educational experience.

Great aquarium. Lots of fun for both kids and adults. If u don't go on a cape point trip u can still see african aka jackass penguins. Well laid out with exhibits from both oceans. Craft shops next door have excellent things to purchase

Pleasant Surprise. First visit to the Two Oceans Aquarium, and we were pleasantly surprised with the overall standard. The passion of the staff make the visit more worthwhile, and the level and diversity of the displayed marine life is awesome. Worth a visit
Good stop for family . Always a winner with young and old, new exhibits coming end of 2016. really professionally run, a fun outing to be had.

Yossie the turtle is lovely. It is a great place, lots of different places within it including a predator which as you can imagine contains the predators like sharks, Eagle rays, and Yossie the turtle, along with Yellow fins.Penguins swim in the cold water with the predators, but they don't eat them. a must go to place.

Overpriced and unimpressive. Visited with family during March. After wandering around the entrance area and looking in the various tanks, we wondered where the rest of the attractions where, only to find out that what we had seen, plus the penguin area upstairs was pretty much it. I guess I got confused with the Ushaka Marine World in Durban and expected more. Won't bother visiting again.

Worth a look. We weren't originally planning to stop off at Two Oceans Aquarium but I'm glad we did. We only spent about an hour looking around but there's some very interesting sea life here. And sharks! In a massive "predator tank" near the end. Definitely worth a stop off even if like us you just want to get out of the scorching sun for a while. They stamp your hand so if you want to go back in and see the Sharks or penguins fed - later on in the day - you can.Iain, London

Fun at the Aquarium . My fiance and I went to the aquarium for a day of relaxation, and a break from all the wedding planning. And we definitely got that at the Aquarium. It was so much fun, even though it is really busy, there is always enough room to move around and see everything. Absolutely loved the penguins

Worth a visit.. The aquarium was amazing by South African standards. My son and myself really enjoyed the open area's and even though it was full, we had plenty of space and never felt cramped. The place was so clean.
Great Experience. This lovely aquarium in Cape Town has a huge diversity of species and a cool environment. Also not expensive.

Shark Diving and Kelp Forest Dive at the Two Oceans. I wanted to get a close up encounter with the sharks having dived quite a lot with them in the wild, decided whilst I was at it I would add on a Kelp dive as it is one of the few in the world.I was defiantly not disappointed the staff were amazing and so friendly they really made you feel welcome. The kit was in good condition and the overall experience ran very smoothly. Once in the tank we had a good time to swim around and admire the sharks. Although you have to watch out for the big boss which is the turtle she owns that tank! The kelp dive was surprisingly more fun though as we got to feed the fish under the water which was amazing as they come straight at you - obviously an experience you cannot have in the sea so left me feeling very happy swimming in the beautiful forest of kelp!Unfortunately I didn't get a chance to explore the whole aquarium but from what I did see was very well designed and kept. The environmentally friendly building was extremely interesting to read about.

An After-thought. It appears to be more of something they came up with to fill the building rather than a planned aquarium.They have fish and sea life, many in small tank in the walls. A couple of large tanks as well, but seems confused as they basically throw a bunch of ocean fish in with no real "draw" to the exhibit. It looks like they are renovating, so maybe this is the thrown-together, "got to open now" version 1.0.Has potential, but I'd like to see them pull it together so you feel like you swam around the ocean gaining knowledge about the indigenous sea life in a logical progression rather than a shot-gun of fish tanks and exhibits.

Great for the kids. Took my friends two boys to this as a diversion, they enjoyed it very much, they have a touch pool and a tank full of clown fish where the kids can pop their heads up in the middle so you can take their photo with the fish all around. Penguins were great but smelly as always, presentations were good and all exhibits were labelled and a short description of what was in the tank.

do the Penguin Encounter!. Really nice Aquarium that doesn't feel crowded. The animals seem happy and the people seem to care. We did the Penguin Encounter which was utterly brilliant! Please do it if you can as it was a great experience. Lovely shop and beautiful harbour-side cafe. A great day out!

Mr Mentor . I advise all patents to take there children to this wonderfull place.There is so much that anybody can learn.You never to old to learn what is going in the sea life.I find it very existing and fun then you learn a lot too.Take the family it's worthwhile for your money and for your family's.
Aquatic Adventure and Scuba Diving at Two Oceans. The aquarium was pretty nice, diverse specie of fishes by best part was scuba diving inside the I & J predator exhibit aquarium.
Spectacular!. While this aquarium seemed smaller than uShaka in Durban, the tanks were too beautiful for words. We all loved this and it was a highlight for our kids (4 and 7).
Best Aquarium I have ever seen. This aquarium has the most amazing variety of sea life as it covers the Indian Ocean and Atlantic Ocean.

Fun for kids. There are many fish, and other sea creatures to be seen there. Lovely one or two hours touring around, you can also see penguin feeding. Interesting for adults, fun for kids. Location is just near V&A Waterfront, so is in the center of town, easy access.

Wonderful world of the sea.. A great place to experience the life of the sea. Enjoyed watching people dive in predator tank. Loved Nemo. Staff all very friendly and child friendly. Touch pool really great to eerie de with the children. Can get crowded with school groups but go prepared to really just stop, stare and enjoy.
It will surpass your expectation. Never ending nooks and passages with more and more exhibits. Magnificent experience for youngsters and parents alike. Ideal for rainy days.
Aquarium. My granddaughter thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Will be taking her again during the next vacation

Going back, again, and again ........ Recently went there with friends, children from 5 years to 18 years old, and all of us totally enthralled with the displays. A must see for any visitor to Cape Town.
Not my kind of thind. While this place gives you a an opportunity to see some beautiful see creatures, I prefer to see animals in the wild.

Kids delight. The staff were so sweet. They spent time patiently overseeing the kids at the tactile pools and seeing sea life so close up is a must for animal lovers. I was delighted to be able to stock my hands in the water and touch the little anenomies and have the winner of a child list in my own world. I felt safe with the kids and they would disappear and return at random. Not something I am ordinarily comfortable with. Thank you. Lovely experience follows buy lunch at the Waterfront - Mugg and Bean. .. sitting outside with kids and sea gulls watching the ships and their crew. Followed by a trip to Exclusive Books as a perfect treat for auntie book lover

Great Experience. As a marine lover, I really enjoy going to the aquarium. It's great place to observe our marine life, something not accessible to many outside of the aquarium. Do yourself a favour, go on a quiet day, take some time to sit and enjoy the hypnotic effect of the kelp garden!

Really Nice Family Attraction. This was a very nice little aquarium that I would recommend for families with children. It didnt take long to go through at all and the exhibits were nice. Right on the waterfront so you can grab lunch before or after.

Interesting displays & very relaxing outside of school holidays. Try to visit outside of school holiday times if possible - we have visited at both times & during school holidays it is really busy & noisy. great displays & kids activities, staff helpful.

Great for the whole Family. A great way to spend rainy days. the exhibitions are great, informative for the entire family. have been there a few times. its my favourite place to go to in winter when you want to get "out".

amazing for kids. this is great aquarium with lots of sea spices and biggest tank with sharks which i had an opportunity to feed the shark at lunch time, this was the greatest opportunity and experience, my kids will go there again for this experience

Really like the improvements!. I visit for the first time in 2010, and 6 years later I had the opportunity to do it again; I was pleasantly surprised by the renovations, the new tanks with the two big sharks it's amazing!

An interesting way to pass the time at The V&A Waterfront. This is a great escape from the hustle and bustle from the popular V&A Waterfront. It is really well done and has a lot of interesting facts and sights. It takes a minimum of an hour to get through, but you can spend longer.

Spectacular exhibits. An aquarium that is committed to conservation as wellSpectacular exhibits allowing great views of the marine life. Entry valid for all day so could return later in the day to see the feeding of the predators Penguins a must

Lovely!!. A great place to visit....beautiful sea creatures and other marine life. The displays are well explained and executed. The flow of the exhibition is well defined and the structure is awesome.The staff is very pleasant and courteous.Nice place to visit with kids...

Absolutely a must-see. Even if you're not into things aquatic this is a great experience, and if you have children, well, you'll be hard put to drag them away. In fact I was really cheesed off not to be seven years old and small enough to get into the "Finding Nemo" tank.It's well laid out, with good signage a great predator tank, which will be even better when the new one is finished and you can walk through,plus if you can't get to Boulders Bay, then there are penguins to see here.The waterfront cafe is good and you can come and go as you please during the day, which again is good if you have little ones, or the weather changes and Table Mountain is clear.Wonderful sea creatures and educational without being stuffy. After Table Mountain itself probably the No 1 attraction in Cape Town.

ALWAYS A GREAT EXPERIENCE. Two Oceans Aquarium is my #1 place to treat my grandchildren. I renew my membership on a yearly basis. The aquarium is such fun and the whole family enjoy an outing to this wonderful sea world. Best in the west.

Great place to visit after lunch before your next adventure. We went there around 2-2:30 (on a Sunday) to kill time before we went off to Table Mountain. This turned out the be the best time to go as penguins and Sharks were fed at that time. It was great experience but would recommend it for people with kids more than couples.

Nice outing. Ticket queue took a little long, especially when you have a 4 year old with you who's super excited. After that it's heaven! Sadly no one was there to assist at the children's kiosk and after 15min a very unfriendly staff member rocked up.
Good experience. I expected it to be better than Ushaka in Durban.... Although, it was a nice experience. The people working there are very friendly

Wonderful . Lovely place for a family visit where all if you will have a great day .It's in waterfront area just a walking distance from the mall . They work until 5 pm . The prize around 140 ZAR per adult and young children enter free . They have variety of fish and sea habitats . The display is great and you will enjoy the Penguins and the shark tank where you just can set for hours and enjoy the scene . It's around two hours to finish the aquarium but you have all day access so you can go out and come back again to finish your round .At the lower level there is a lovely kids play ground and a small shop where you can get snacks , the main Resturant is by the main gate . In short find a couple of hours in the morning and go to enjoy the tranquil fish world .

Kids. We were immediately impressed with the layout of the aquarium and the detailed information labelled on each exhibit. Similarly the knowledgeable staff were keen to answer any questions one might put to them. The already excellent set up should become awesome once the planned renovations are completed.The only thing that spoilt our time there was the badly behaved children that ran riot with no apparent control from teachers or parents alike. This hopefully was not a regular occurrence but certainly stopped us from staying that little bit longer.

Fun and educational for all ages. Cape Town's Aquarium is located at the V&A Waterfront. Having read beforehand that this is the biggest aquarium in South Africa and that they have over 3000 marine creatures I was expecting something bigger but it didn't seem very big to me. We moved rather slowly because we were visiting with the kids but were done seeing all the exhibits in under two hours. I wouldn't say that the aquarium is a must-see when visiting Cape Town but if you find yourself at the V&A Waterfront with some extra time or if you're traveling with kids as I was, it is definitely worth a visit.Their focus is showcasing the marine life of the two oceans that border the Cape Peninsula, the Atlantic and Indian oceans. Among others they have penguins, turtles, sharks, rays and a kelp forest. Fun and educational for all ages. Some exhibits allow for the visitor to crawl inside - the clown fish aquarium for example - and they have a 'touch and feel' pool where kids can touch shells, sea stars, algae and the like.At the entrance they stamp your hand and that allows one to exit and enter as many times as they like during the day.

AN AMAZING AQAURIUM. I am a volunteer at uShaka Marine World in Durban and have always thought this to be the best aquarium in South Africa until I had visited the Two Oceans Aquarium, it is definitely worth the day.
Excellent aquarium. Great aquarium and particularly good for children with a variety of displays to look at and lots of information written sympathetically.
Interesting.. Much like any other aquarium but with sharks, penguins, turtles and myriad multi-coloured fish. Your ticket allows you to pop in and out as many times as you like during the day.
A world class aquarium.. A world class aquarium with a unique tank showcasing local local biodiversity. Put aside at least a couple of hours if not more.

Wonders of the Sea. The aquarium is nearby the V&A Waterfront shops and restaurants. The aquarium is well done with many exhibits that are fascinating to look at as well as educational. I particularly liked the shark tanks. You can get so close to see them looking at you with their sharp teeth! The penguins are also a treat. Expect to spend about 2 hours at the aquarium.

Amazing. . This is a must for anyone staying here. We have been to various Sea Life Centres in UK so we were not expecting much when we visited here as 'something to fill an hour'. How wrong we were. It is very large with breath taking collections of fish from tiny to enormous. We spent over 3 hours here.

Perfect afternoon. A perfect way to spend your afternoon. Experience up close all the wonders of the sea. Sit in the middle of all the "Nemos" and let yourself be hypnotized by kelpforests. Spend time following the great seaturtle and be amazed by the giant crabs.This is what my daughter and I did and we were very happy when we left and still talk about it.
Nice place to visit. This is one of the best place in Cape Town, specially if you are travelling with children they will enjoy this place. Lot of things at one place :)

Not impressed. This was our plan B for the afternoon and went to stop by based on the ratings. However, if you've been to any great aquarium in your life - you will be wildly disappointed. Would not recommend. Small and the penguin area smelt potent.

Finding Nemo Tank. Great for families or nannys, although you have to get there early to avoid the crowds. Members get free entry so we skip the queues and its nice to get a discount at the curio store and the restaurant. by the way the restaurant only serves sustainable seafood!

Under the Sea.... Enjoyed our outing to the Two Oceans Aquarium - all he animals and sea creatures are in a good condition, and the staff are well trained and informed. Over all a great experience and nice to see things that you are most likely to never see again. Enjoyed the penguins the most!

Go to the Aquarium before you head for shopping!. The aquarium is just in the shopping area and all the restaurants. We did not feel like shopping all day so we decided to go to the aquarium first, and we were glad we did! The aquarium ticket price is good for what it has. It was fun to see all the different, interesting fish. I would recommend people to go visit this aquarium.

Not bad - worth an hour or two. Aquarium was very good all round. Lots of interesting exhibits. Does seem a bit smaller than expected. Best bit of trip was actually outside aquarium on seal viewing platform, where you could see seals swimming about / honking at each other etc

Safe place to see sharks. Impressive aquarium. In spite of its rather small size from its outside everything looks natural, fresh and is very informative. If you have some time over in Cape Town, it is definitely worth a vist.

Expected more. Enjoyable? Yes, but I some how expected more.There were some excellent ideas, especially for family visitors. Some aquariums actually gave the visitor a space to crawl inside and there were touching exhibits, which excited the children..As an older, lone traveller, I was hoping to get some good photographs and see more large sharks. I did get some reasonable shots, but nothing too fantastic.I am no expert, but perhaps a guide to taking good shots and where to stand in such a dark environment, may have been idea. Some people were using direct flash photography, against the glass. They must have got some superb pictures of themselves.The larger tanks, had some amazing fish, possibly magnified by the glass. The combination of the tank glass and dark environment, made it difficult to get any astounding photographic results, even with a reasonable camera.The perspective was also impossible to gauge without involving some person in the picture. You can get some strange looks from people.
Very Nice. Go inside and be like the marine diver... live the life of the deep ocean...enjoy many strange kind of fishes

Fish and Things. A must see if you are in Cape Town. Do time it so you can go at feeding times of penguins etc. Fun to watch. They have educational show and feel talks for children which is great. Need to book and contact them beforehand. Childrens area for colouring in and lego - nice set up.Bit expensive. They also have yearly memberships, sleepovers etc.Great cafe which is reasonable.Well stocked shop.Conveniently locatec at the Waterfront

Excellent if smaller than expected aquarium. . We went to the aquarium last minute, late one afternoon. It is definitely worth an hour or so of your time.The aquarium is excellently laid out and is full of interactive and interesting exhibits at every turn. I imagine it would be great to do with kids. The large predator tank is excellent and well designed. The focus of the aquarium seems to be on conservation and how to protect the wild brethren of the species they have on show.The only very slight criticism is that it is an hour tops to do the whole place thoroughly it was so good that I wanted it to be bigger.

Great visit for the family. It's a lovely place to visit and is very well maintained.The only drawback is the high cost to enter but once you are inside the cost is justified.A world class aquarium filled with hours of fun for the entire family.Definitely worth a visit if you are in Cape Town and it's a stones throw away from the famous wsterfront (walking distance)
Great time. Had a lovely time here ...great for the children and adults alike..spectacular fish ..and sharks. Watched e penguin feeding which was lovely .Great for families
Fish galore. Fantastic displays of many different species. Penguin display was great. Would really recommend a visit whilst at the waterfront area.

Well laid out and interesting aquarium . This is a beautiful aquarium and it is great for kids. What I respect and enjoy most is that there are no live dolphin shows - well done to them for not subjecting these beautiful creatures to captivity.

A surprisingly wonderful aquarium in the heart of the waterfront. This is a beautiful, well laid-out aquarium. If you are planning to be in Cape Town very long buy a season pass and stop in frequently. There are lots of shops and restaurants close by too.

1001 reasons and more to visit. Fun and educational for all ages young & old. There are various activities for all.Open 7 days a week. For tourist this attraction is a steal of real beauty. Entry is affordably priced.Not to be missed attractions. View all the marine life from both Atlantic & Indian Oceans. The kids will enjoy the play area & puppet show . While adults can focus on many exibitions & view education videos . Also suitable for kids. Some exibits can also be touched. Not to be missed is the feeding of the sharks by divers & penguins. Staff are well educated,helpfull & friendly. Includes a restaurant and souvenir shop. Photographs are allowed . Restrooms are easily accessible & clean.

A lot to see and do. This place offers a lot especially if you have small kids who can enjoy the place even more than you. I would also recommend that you plan it in advance because not every activity is available every day or every hour.

Had a really good time here! Love it!!!. Had a really good day at the Aquarium and there is so much to see there! Loved seeing the penguins swimming in the kelp forest tank! And the sharks and fish in the predator tank were astonishing to watch! Very busy with school children during the week so for a leisurely walk around try the late afternoon. Are going to go back to scuba dive in the shark tank! Cannot wait!! :D

Land ahoy captain. spent a morning wandering through the Aquarium. Pity that the school groups are so unruly and misbehaved. No supervision at all.Spoilt it for me and will definitely not be going back. The attraction is starting to show signs of wear and tear too. Not enough maintenance being done. A pity as I have always loved going there.
very informative. Hundreds of sea species can viewed here. Very informative and educational. Great atmosphere for the kids and families.

Ambitious but not as spectacular as one expects. It´s a nice enough place but frankly not as grand as one thinks it is, from all the ads. We were through after about one hour. However, it can be a good shelter when it´s too hot outside for doing much else.

Found Nemo and took pictures with him!. Decided to check this out as we had run out of time on a previous visit. We were not disappointed. amazing selection of interesting creatures - also the usual sharks and manta rays as well. there is an enormous tank with full grown sharks. Penguins in their various habitats was also cool to see. my only disappointment was that there were no dolphins. seals are plenty in cape town and can be viewed via other activities - seal island, hout bay. there are also some great photo opportunities where you get to stick your head into the tank into a cavity which appears like you are in the tank. Awesome fun!!

Loved it.. It was raining that day on Cape Town and the Two Oceans Aquarium is a great activity for these particular days. The displays are amazing and suddenly you can see how diverse is life under the sea. You could not imagine how many creatures are living there, bizarre fishes, beautiful fishes. The predator aquarium is really impressive. Next time I will try to book a dive.

what a lovely visit!. I have visited the Aquarium a number of times in the past 3 years and once again this visit was lovely. The displays look beautiful, there is good information available and the variety of sea life is really impressive. It is a spacious clean environment where my children have fun!! It is expensive for locals and a fee that is more kind to SA citizens would be a great initiative. A lovely place like like this is out of reach for a family outing for many families because it becomes very expensive if you are even just 2 adults and two small children. A R 400 outing is expensive for the average house hold in SA.

Nice way to spend an afternoon. We came here for a few hours on a rainy afternoon. The Penguins were the highlight, but it was also impressive to see the sharks. We were only here for about an hour and a half but there was a wealth of information and the children visiting really seemed to be enjoying themselves.
Excellent aquarium. Aquariums can be very expensive: this one is surprisingly cheap but well worth a couple of hours visit for all ages
Penguins are the highlight. It's a pretty good aquarium, with a new home for their African Penguins. It's not in the same league as America's SeaWorld, but it's worth a visit if you're in Cape Town.
Good place to kill few hours. Its a nice place to spend few hours. Perhaps more for children but its fun to watch the fishes also.
Lovely outting for young and old alike. A beautiful aquarium with a variety of quality displays. Worth the visit. Booking online will save you a few Rands.

Book online and save. To save time and money, it's well worth buying your tickets online. Not only is it about 10 per cent cheaper, but you can jump the queue at the ticket office, which was quite long on the morning we visited.It doesn't matter if you don't have a printer. You go straight to the visitor info desk and quote your booking reference number. The staff stamp your wrist with invisible ink, which is then scanned at the entry turnstile under an ultra violet beam, and in you go. Quite the oddest admission procedure, but it works!As for the aquarium, it kept us interested for an hour and 15 minutes. Highlights are Africa's only kelp forest exhibit and the penguin beach. Most visitors are families with young children, so the whole place is a bit of a crazy zoo.Compared with other aquariums we have visited, it's quite small. Two major sections - the new predator hall and a jellyfish room are still under construction.

Aquarium Fun!. This was so much fun! While my husband golfed,I leisurely toured the aquarium. Watching all the creatures just reinforces what beauty the oceans hold. Seeing the excitement of the school children as they observed the marine life and the exhibit of the importance of keeping the waters unpolluted,made me hopeful that they will help protect this resource.
Needs more.... I expected more....its so small...We were done in 30 minutes or less..For the price I expected more...kiddies will enjoy...not so much adults visiting as couples

Anywhere with a Penguin Encounter is where I want to be. We did the penguin encounter - we paid a little extra to be able to hold rock hopper penguins. Yes, they may poop on you. Yes, they were molting and looked pretty haggard. Yes, it was totally worth it and I would do it again anytime.

Great fun for families. Not the biggest aquarium, though that could work in your favour if you're hoping to do other things that day. Creatures from both the Indian and Atlantic Oceans make for a fun and interesting visit.
Wierd collection of sealife. Great collection of fascinating sea life Highlights: Penguins (cute); Tuna (numerous); Shark (scary);Giant Turtle (majestic). Plus anything odd you couldn't think of

Worth the visit. The marine life off the southern Cape is not all that diverse but enough so to be seen. There are also exotic marine creatures and an explanatory exhibit of the ecosystem of the coastal plain. African or Jackass penguins are on display. Probably not as opulent some in other countries it is still worthwhile seeing. Add to that the fact it is situated in the V & A waterfront with it's many restaurants, shops and relaxed atmpsphere it is well worth it.

Beautiful aquarium, also for parents with young kids . Had a great time here; it is not too big, nicely set-up and beautiful fish to see. And dont forget about the giant turtle and the adorable penguins. You can easily see it all in 1h30 we experienced, but we only have a 1 year old with us ;).

A delightful visit. We spent an interesting morning, the aquarium is not just small tanks of fish, there are huge tanks, one with growing kelp it is amazing to look how kelp clings to the sea bed and just how it moves underwater. There are interactive areas for children of all ages, the staff are knowledgeable and helpful, we stopped and listened to a member of staff teaching a group of schoolchildren in front of the shark tank. ( it was fun talking to the children and listening to how much they were enjoying their visit). And then there's the Penguins enough said - definitely worth a visit.

Interesting visit for a couple of hours to get out of the sun or rain. Located at V&A waterfront so convenient for a fill in visit between shopping and eating. Had a leisurely stroll round and had seen all the exhibits in 2 hours. The major feature is the large shark tank which you can walk under. Lots of things to do for children which this is mainly aimed at. Shame we didn't get to see the sea otters.

Interesting . It's interesting enough especially when you've got nothing else to do. The aquarium is home to amazing species of fish and the Restuarant outside is very nice. Kids will love visiting here
Beautiful Interesting Experience. I have been to Aquariums in many cities it this is the best one I have seen.the exhibits were cleverly displayed and the content was varied and unusual
Piece of the deep. Beautifully maintained aquarium with massive tanks and great variety of sea life! Stunning sharks and mantas. Kids of all ages love this place!
Fun, unique and educational!. Lots of different species from Cape Town's oceans. It is perfect for families and nature lovers. Definitely worth visiting!

Great aquarium, worth visiting. It is a really nice aquarium, one of the best ones I've seen. Totally worth it !They have 30 minute interactions with emperor seals, but you have to book them ahead since it's only once a day. Book that online.

Loads of fun for all ages. Aquariums are always fun to do, and this one is no exception. Loads of different fish in large aquariums. Nice to spend an hour or two while at the waterfront. Only thing that could be better is that there isn't a whole lot of information about the different fish, just a small sign with the very basics. But its mostly meant for kids so I understand

Amazing and serene. Took my mom for a 4-hour outing at the Two Oceans Aquarium (buying online tickets is real value for money) and we had such an amazing time! There is a large variety in fish species, interesting information on top of or around the glass displays and we simply loved the touch pool. Feeding time at the Penguin Exhibit is a real treat - they are so funny and some have quite quirky characters. The atmosphere is serene and if possible we would have spent the whole day there. Best time is to go outside of the school holidays when there are less visitors and more space to move around and/or linger in front of the various displays. Really a must-see when in Cape Town!

ENJOYABLE . Went with friends very reasonable price to get in lovely fish all kinds watched them feed the penguins there's also a souvenir shop to get keepsakes I would definitely recommend it to others

Penguin Feeding is really interesting. Though this aquarium may not offer very large variety of marine life, it offers very unique experiences. One of them happens to be Penguin Feeding, it is treat to watch them being fed.

Awesome experience . The aquarium has many features but loved the feed watching the most. It is well thought out and great fun and learning for kids especially the touch pond.we loved the afternoon put. And would go there again because every visit is a new discovery.

Better to see these things in real life. If you can, go see the penguins in real life. Seeing them being handled at the aquarium is amusing but is not the same as the real thing. Overall, animals seem well cared for and it was a fun way to spend a rainy day - kids will enjoy it.
2016 visit. you must go and see this place, spent hours there as there are so many different species of fish to see. Try to get to see some exhibits at feeding times, adds to the visit.
wow!. one of the biggest surprises we had on our trip, that aquarium is just stunning. our little girl enjoyed it a lot, too.
A good visit for a hot day. Well presented and we left well informed - an hour out of the heat and an improved awareness of the need to be "green"

On the small side, work in progress . It killed an hour but it wasn't anything special. It was nicely set out and had good sized tanks. The only things we hadn't seen before were the spider crabs and penguins at an aquarium. The clown fish exhibit is good. The turtle appeared to be in the new area they are creating so couldn't see that. It might be better when the new area is open? Later in the year?

Shark tank the best!!!. All the exhibits with the fish were superb but the most interesting was the shark tank.
