The aquarium has skilled divers taking visitors into the shark tank and the children's expressions are classic. They warn the divers when the shark is near. There are a few bull sharks in the tank and turtles which swim in graceful circles. The shark tank can be viewed from three levels.

A fascinating and well arranged Aquarium. Visited here today with friends on our last day in Cape Town. It was buzzing with School trips it was obvious all the children were enjoying their visit as we were. One of the tanks was laid out as a kelp farm from the roots to the tops that you see along the coast.The Aquarium was well laid out with clear descriptions and well kept.It was interesting to see and read about the penguins some had been rescued and others bred in the Aquarium. We had seen them in the wild at Betty's Bay and some of these had ended up in the Aquarium for one reason or another.

If you love nature and sea, this is the place. This aquarium is everything, I loved absolutely everything in this place, the Sharks, the Penguins, nemo , I feel inside the sea world. I loved every bit of this place. Strongly recommend for kids especially

Beautiful . The aquarium has lots of aquatic animals, variety of fishes and sea plants. Definitely a place to visit if u are visiting with kids, ur family or just with ur friends.. They even provide aquarium diving with sharks (without the cage)

An educational aquarium...great for kids.... We found the fish exhibits interesting.. amazing variety of fish and plant life...the penguins were noisy and colorful.. the educational exhibits were good.. and a zillion little kids were having great time there!
Great experience for the whole family. Great experience, there is something for everyone. If planning on visiting aquarium on regular basis buy the annual pass.

Overrated. Been to the aquarium because everyone talks about it. However, it was a bit small, staff wasnt nice and there was a cute photobooth that took the money but didnt even work. It will be more fun for small children but you can't keep them entertained for the whole day though.

Two Oceans of Awesome!. we spent an hour or two with 3 kids 11, 9 and 6. A huge variety of fish, penguins and sharks. The kids loved it, and with so many other great spots nearby, the aquarium is a great detour.
Amazing variety of sea life. An absolute pleasure to take kids. Huge variety of fish/seal life! My nieces and nephews visit regularly (you can get a yearly membership)Definitely recommend

Well worth our time. . What a lovely couple of hours spend with our two small children! Great excitement all round, aquarium is beautifully maintained. Predator tank especially fun! Well worth a visit if in Cape Town.
Very good. Had a pleasant visit, suits family with kids. It was fun, well ventilated and good space even in peak times.i definitely loved it and would return again

Predator Tank Diving!. I've been very spoiled by some great aquariums around the world. This one is small but has a very diverse population of species that come from both the Indian and Atlantic Oceans. They had a great predator tank and we were able to take advantage of one of their programs that allowed us to learn how to scuba dive in the morning and then dive in the shark tank in the afternoon. For someone coming from the US (or for anyone coming from the Eurozone or UK)- this was a very cheap endeavor that we could have never done at home. We spent 30 minutes in the tank with two certified divers and got to experience the aquatic life close up. I would highly recommend, especially if you go shark cage diving and the water is too cloudy to make out the sharks.

Fabulous Aquarium . 18 Jan 2016, an afternoon visit was found to be family friendly for young and old. Interactive displays soothed our vacation hurriedness to enjoy our time here in wonder of the ocean world we rarely see!

Visit at Two Oceans Aquarium. Very nice place. Looked small from first impression but great place to be. it is the perfect place to visit after the waterfront as very relaxing atmosphere which allows you to recharge your batteries. kids can wonder around safely and fish are easy to see. well labelled. recommend it.
Nice but more for kids. The penguin exhibit is nice but aquarium is on small side. There were some interesting things to see so I would definitely recommend more for families
Really disappointed . This was surprisingly poor, the animals are kept in cramped conditions and there was often very little signage telling you what you were looking at.
Lovely couple of hours. Had a lovely birthday outing with the kids. Informative, fun, lots to see and manageable even during peak season. Lovely for all ages.

Good half day activity. We visited the aquarium on a Saturday. Half way through the exhibits we exited for some lunch and returned to view the second half. Entry tickets allows exit and entry for one full day making this an easy process. We had a good slow tour through the whole aquarium, enjoying everything they had to display.

Not too shabby.... It really not to bad. Nice little trip especially with kids. Informative. I loved the water conservation quotes on the glass windows. HOWEVER the giftshop staff really needs to work on their attitude and manners. There was a very nice little book that I wanted to buy 20 pieces of. I asked if they would consider giving me some discount for the large purchase... The lady didn't even make eye contact with me. Just said NO and walked off. I decided she clearly didn't need the sale, so I walked off too, leaving a heap of other things I wanted to buy. It's a shame that such people forge a wrong image of a place that needs visitors. Just to make it clear, it's not so much about the discount as it is about the attitude and how it was done.

Relaxing day out. I guess Two Oceans isn't the most impressive aquarium in the world, but it certainly has its charm. Although not large, it has several nice displays, with some interesting creatures which I did not know. We especially found it very relaxing to just sit and observe at the two large tanks. Worth a visit if you have plenty of time in Cape Town.

nice but nothing special. For the name "Two Oceans" i expected more. It is a nice, medium size aquarium, but nothing special. If you have seen such places, you do not need to add another one. If you have small children - it is always fun!

Autism delight. We took our autistic son here and he loved every minute of it! Such a calming place with a visual censorey overload. our 1 year old daighter also loved it as well as the play area attached to restaurant on the eay out. Restaurant was nice with great views. Didnt like the cakes though very stodgy! Overall extremely impressed

Two Ocean's Aquarium Cape Town. The Two Ocean’s Aquarium offers the following exhibits (Jan 2016). I&J Predator Exhibit Ocean Basket Kelp Forest Exhibit Penguin Exhibit Indian Ocean Gallery Atlantic Ocean Gallery Touch Pool & Microscope Smart Living Challenge ZoneThe museum looks larger from the outside than it is inside. It is costly to visit compared to other activities offered in and around Cape Town, however it is informative to visit. The museum is engaged in various great projects, reminding us to save water, looking after threatened species, reminding you about the damage plastic does in the oceans etc.The museum is rather dark, and the signs you need to read are in very small print, added to this, the signs are only available in English, not other major language. If you bring children keep at good eye on them, there are places where they can fall in or climb areas, they should not climb.
Under the Sea. We love going back to the Two Oceans Aquarium - with or without the kids. A beautiful experience - educational and interesting. Well worth a visit.

worth the visit for local education of sea life small needs some updating. we visited here to get a good feel and understanding of the sea life around the Cape. Good variety of species and friendly knowledgable staff. What is a disappointment is that the exhibits are getting "long in the tooth" and needs a comprehensive updating.But never the less do try it.
interesting. We had a few hours to kill so we went along to have a look it is interesting as they have both warm water and cold water fish. its also very cheap so great value for money

Great to visit. The aquarium is cheap to enter and open 7 days a week.It has a wide variety of sea creatures to see, including large sharks!There are lots of interactive activities for adults and children. It takes around an hour to see all of the aquarium properly, and at the end there is a shop and a cafe.
Under da Sea. Love this place for kids. Very educational and interesting as well. They get to learn about different characters of the deep ocean. Recommend it for kids

Disappointed. Having visited as a child and having such great memories of this place, I was somewhat disappointed with my return. So much smaller than I remember and quite pricey. Aimed at tourists no doubt. Glad I can say I've been, but I wouldn't need to go back.

BREATHTAKING. It was just entertaining for me just to see how my 15 months old daughter was reacting to the entire experience, that is all I needed to enjoy the experience. She had a good time judging by the way she wanted to come close to everything and smile at all these wonderful sea beings. Watching the feed in the shark tank was an amazing experience. I will take her again when she can tell the difference. Actually, I will take her until she says she's seen enough of this sharks. Unfortunately for her, she has a little sister coming, she has to keep going. :-)

Beautiful and educative. Very interesting and educative presentation of marine life related to South Africa. We enjoyed the sharks, penguins and the microscope presentations end explanations by two young biologists. You should not miss the place at the Waterfront when you visit Cape Town!
AMAZING!. Great experience, loved every bit of the aquarium. Staff were very friendly. Got to see such amazing creatures.

Dive with sharks...the 'sort of' conservationist way?!. I wanted to do cage diving in Cape Town, but after reading so much controversy over it I decided I need to find an alternative. I landed on the "Predator Exhibit" dive at Two Oceans.The whole experience moved like a well oiled machine and soon after arriving for my dive I was in the water swimming next to Ragged Toothed sharks, a turtle, yellow tail and others.Not scary at all, in fact it was quite relaxing to swim around with the sharks. Quite fun to also look back at tourists on the otherside of the aquarium glass and feel like a bit of an attraction yourself.For those skeptics about the conservation side of this, they catch and release these predators every 2-3 years (they can live for up to 30 years), so they don't spend their whole life in a cage. I'm sure there are arguments for keeping these predators in the wild, but this seems to present itself as a reasonably sustainable solution.

Let down- heard so much about this attraction.. Been in Cape Town for nine years and haven't been here due to visits to aquariums in Singapore and Chiang Mai,Thailand. What a disappointment ! I suppose if you haven't been to a world class aquarium then this one will be pleasant. If you've been to aquariums in another country don't venture here.I think it is time for a major overhaul of this attraction especially if Cape Town wants to be known as a city of international visitors !

Fun Stop. This was such a fun stop but I would really only do this if you want to kill a few hours right in the heart of Cape Town. There are so many beautiful fish and the feedings were very entertaining.
Fun with kids. Great selection of sea life and very educational. The kids had a great time. Worth buying an annual membership! Kids play area downstairs too!

One of the best aquariums ever. Apart from being a bit busy during the Christmas season as expected, this aquarium is one of the best we have ever visited. The tanks were clean, the information clear and easy to read and very imformative. The big tanks are spectacular! Worth another visit.

Feel like a child again. This is such fun to visit. Any time we have visitors in Cape Town I take them here, no matter how old they are. It is so great to feel the wonder of a child as you look at the wonderful selection of sea life. We are awaiting the new expansion with anticipation.
excellent value for money. excellent value for money as a family outing. the underwater flora is amazing! if you are in Cape town you must visit the aquarium

Beautiful, modern, fun day out for all the family.. Especially on a rainy day or when it's too hot we love to visit the aquarium. It's worth taking an annual membership if you intend on visiting more than twice in a year. The aquarium is very modern, clean and full of interactive fun for the children. Some days we can walk it all in under an hour however there are a few places to stop and have a snack and do arts and crafts with the children too which is fun. Lots of educational interactions.A firm favourite. Ideal from babies through to teenagers.

GREAT AQUARIUM. The Two Oceans aquarium is a brilliant way to see various maritime species of the southern Atlantic and Indian Ocean and to entertain young and old for a couple of hours – and an excellent backstop option if it is a rainy day in the Mother City.The whole design of the aquarium is fantastic and the displays are well thought out and excellently presented. All the staff are friendly and helpfull.

Always a good idea!. We have been to the Two Oceans Aquarium a number of times over the past few years and find something new to love each time! Interactive stations along the way are great for older kids with greater attention spans and there is plenty to entertain & inform younger ones. Visiting the aquarium is always a good idea & wonderful for a family outing coupled with a lunch at the aquarium restaurant on the way out.
Perfect place for children. Big areas for children to visit. Both penguins and enormous aquariums with really big fishes. The entrance fee is also very cheap

Wow first time seeing so many fish. Loved this experience. The displays are well lit and they have a good variety of fish.my best experience was the predator display and of course the cute pegiuns. And of course the little nemo fish. The kids went crazy at tht display
Aquarium. Because of our world changing, the aquariums will always be our guide to our living friends in the ocean. You can see most fish up close and personal, without worrying of "attacks". Lol
Always the Kid in you. One can never get enough of seeing just how majestic creatures of the sea are.Young or old it is a lovely outing and leaves you with a really feel good feeling

Penguins and Clownfish - oh, my!. My young daughter wants to be a marine biologist, and we have visited aquariums around the world. We all enjoyed visiting this aquarium. They have the largest number of clownfish in one tank that I have ever seen. Very cool that they don't have an anemone in the tank for them to live in, but they think the top of the glass dome you can crawl in is their anemone. Really enjoyed crawling in to see the clownfish. Their African penguin exhibit is also fantastic. So fun to watch the penguins hop, jump, and swim. The little kids were enjoying the touch tank and the play area too. Great way to spend an hour or so in Cape Town.

First visit at the Two oceans Aquarium. Went there with my 5 years old boy. Nice seating and different activities available like penguins or predators feeding ( different time and day). With explanations on the different species.
Awesome Family Activity. Entry price is moderate however you do see a lot once inside.Definitely find out when the penguins feeding time is - personal favourite of mine

A truly great aquarium. The Two Oceans Aquarium at the Waterfront is one of the better aquariums worldwide. They also have a 'touch and feel' section for the children and adults for that matter. Not only do they have a 'walk through' section where you can walk looking at the marine life on both sides but also see them above you. They have a section dedicated to ' underwater finds' and the information they provide South placards on the walls as you walk through the aquarium is fascinating. If you are at all interested in marine life it is a must visit. Thinking about it, even if you are not that interested it is worth a visit.

Good variety of animals, but nothing special. The aquarium was ok -- mostly geared towards young children. The penguins and the 'nemo' tank at the entrance were highlights. If you have an hour with nothing to do around the V&A, it's not a bad place to go.

Dedicated, cheerful staff. I joined as a member last year when I found a baby loggerhead on a beach after a storm. The staff are always helpful and really care about the animals. The aquarium is family-orientated but also perfect for solo visits. This place is a real asset to the Waterfront brand and showcases our warm African spirit perfectly!

Perhaps Best for Kids. They're in the midst of some new attractions which may help-I didn't think it was outstanding by any stretch-fine for an hour visit but you could skip also. Best was the penguins. I do wish there was a way people would understand that letting their kids run around screaming has an impact on other visitors. It wasn't just a bit-it was nonstop throughout the aquarium-screaming is not necessary.

Easy Way to Entertain Young Children. Very well done up place with great staff and brilliant well kept displays and informative boards. It was okay for adults but the kids love it. Very simple way to keep younger children entertained for over 3hrs.

A two and a half year old to amuse.... We took our 2 1/2 year old grandson to the aquarium the other afternoon and had a great time from the moment we arrived..... the nice man on the door was lovely towards this wide eyed little boy and spoke to him face to face and told him to 'have a good time'. I had not visited the aquarium for quite a few years and it has really developed. Our grandson loved the penguins, the neon jelly fish and was totally captivated by the kelp and fish in the tank - and fancy seeing divers in there too! He was also brave enough to venture into the display that makes you look like you are in the actual tank. Thank you to all the staff for making our trip most enjoyable.
Good for kids . Your kids will enjoy the learning. Great place. The turtle and sharks are quite impressive. Don't miss it if you travel with young children

Maybe for children. I didn't like at all. My husband enjoyed himself as he is very curious but I felt it "poor" and really, I feel very sorry indeed for the poor creatures living in those tiny space. Never went neither will go back at all.

Well presented and great for kids. Gonna keep this short.....visit, end of. Your kids will enjoy the well presented displays. Nice way to keep your little one's occupied whilst educating them at the same time. Bali for money. Enjoy.
Amazing place. Was a good experience seeing the variety of species the water bodies have to offer. The Penguins are really cute too. Must see place.
Great family day out. I would recommend this to people off all ages. Staff are very helpful. There is an interactive area that the kids loved and they also learnt a lot about our natural resources.
Lovely Aquarium but Ushaka is better. Decent aquarium not the best in Africa..but they have a variety of marine life to see. ...Shouldham ea dolphin show etc for kids
Awesome!. My children absolutely loved it here. They are still drawing fish and giant crabs lol! Well worth the visit

Fun for all ages. A great aquarium with a good range of sea creatures to admire. Reasonable entry fee and a great venue for younger children as there were interactive activities and demonstrations. Not the most incredible aquarium we have seen, and it could have been cleaner, however a nice outing all the same.

Dec 2015 holiday. Great experience. Children absolutely loved it. Main tank is absolutely stunning and you can just sit and enjoy the view for hours. Very educational and please take the time to get your kids to read the info cards at each exhibit. Lots of kids interaction as well which was great. The penguin exhibits are smelly but also an enjoyable visit. Highly recommended for everyone
Good Educational Fun. My kids LOVED it here!! They just want to go back!!! My little boy now also wants a penguin tank at home, with 2 pet penguins!! :-). We loved all the recycling tips too!!

U for underwater experience. If your not into endless shopping or eating in the V and A waterfront, then this is a must. Our friends had suggested this as a must in we were in the area, and we are not fans of endless shops. It not a very big Aquarium ( in comparison to Dubai and London ) but its has some amazing scene setting tanks and up personal areas ( that would be perfect if we had children ) The Kelp tank and penguins were our favourite. The staff were all very professional and the penguin feeding was very funny. The predators tank was very up close and personal and a little scary. A good two hours is needed to see everything

Not really worth it...... Have been here many years ago and decided to take my kids this time around. It was fairly expensive (R140 per adult and R67 for young kid). The number of displays were disappointing (far less and smaller than i remember) and although there was some interaction for the kids like the touch pool and "getting into" the clown fish tank there was not much else. Felt a bit cheated for the money that we paid. uShaka in Durban is far better.
its decent. good place, have seen better, not so much to see as the advertised, but still worth a visit. good for kids

A visit to 'Nemo land'. Children and adults alike enjoy the Two Oceans Aquarium, whether it is a once off visit or a regular affair. If you go regularly I would advise to get annual membership for you and the family. Kids enjoy not only the memorable experience of 'swimming' with Nemo, but also enjoy the fantastical world of sharks, giant crabs and 'surfs up' with the penguins. Loads of playtime in sand pits and a puppet show (occasional) for alternative entertainment is also available. To round it off, be sure to capture the moment with the Facebook camera....and then go for ice-cream and enjoy the harbour activities.

On the small side, but worth a visit.. My kids LOVE aquariums, and we go to them whenever we can. Two Oceans is a great place, even though it is a bit smaller than say, the Shedd in Chicago, or the Vancouver Aquarium. Go early in the morning, as the lines get long very quickly. There are some fun "experience" exhibits that kids can climb into, and when the aquarium is busy, your kiddo will be waiting for awhile to take their turn.
Insigtful and kids love it. We go there often with our boys as they really enjoy it. The staff is friendly, helpful and very professional.
A bit of everything!. Must see in Cape Town, especially if you have kids. Don't miss the predators tank, the kelp forest, and of course, the penguins!!!

Beautiful Aquarium. Spent a few hours here and enjoyed the experience, the raggedy tooth shark exhibit is great as are the Penguins, it's a great way to spend a few hours out of the sun or on a rainy day.
okay not exceptional. fun activity to do especially with the kids, i was expecting more but generally okay. sharks, penguins and different species of fish and a touch experience esp for the kids

Average. This was a bit dissapointing to me. It is a lovely place to take the kids with a puppet show and gave the kids a close up view of a lot of sea animals but that was about it. It was very crowded and busy so if you do decide to go, make sure it is early in the morning before the masses arrive.

"Where two oceans wild life meets". What really fascinated me the most was the fact that sharks were together in the same tank as other fishes but not attacking them. It is said that the sharks' metabolism is very slow so they can go on for about a week without food, something I never knew!! So when you see them not attacking others you must know that they are really full. Another fascinating thing was seeing penguins when they are fed. We also saw a huge sea tattle in the same tank as other fishes and sharks. It is said that the tattle is 20 years old. We really had an interesting experience.
Very nice. Very nice place to visit with small children. It is an activity for the whole family and can be done on a rainy day as well. Will definitely recommend this.
Expensive. For South Africans it's expensive for what it is. Good displays lots to see but due to price we expected more. Soveneir shop is pricey.
Very nice. I have visited a few aquariums and I must say that this is world class venue and the kids thoroughly enjoyed it

Perfect for a rainy day activity. Interesting, educational and engaging. Lovely aquarium without any of the moral dilemmas of having captive dolphins or whales. Great location and super activity for kids. On any day really. A couple of hours is plenty.

A Great Aquarium. The Two Oceans Aquarium is a great activity for anyone looking to find out more about the marine life inhabiting the southern oceans. It was very well laid out and had a few interactive activities to keep young ones interested. The penguin exhibit was very different to anything I'd seen. Highly recommend it for anyone visiting Cape Town.

Wow! . We did the penguin experience and dove with the sharks in the aquarium! I have done this in my hometown as well so it was fun to see the difference! I loved this! The exhibits were awesome as well!

Great exhibits . Having not been to the aquarium for a few years we returned this month. The exhibits are really well done and the information boards gives interesting facts. Well worth a visit, even a one year old had a great time enthralled by the various sea creatures!

A must-see for any family travellers. We (couple) and our kids had so much fun and were able to learn a lot by visiting the Two Oceans Aquarium. A visit that had been put on hold for some time, came in good time on boxing day. It is huge aquarium, well designed to give a real feeling of what goes on in the sea. Definitely a must-see if you are in Cape Town for holiday.
Huge aquarium. An exceptional aquarium, conveniently located near the Cape Town waterfront. A wide variety of marine life and well presented. A world class aquarium.

The Otter Exhibit Had a Skeleton of an Otter--Need I say more?. The aquarium is a gigantic disappointment. Perhaps on a hot day, parents think that an "inside" venue will be cool and interesting. Sadly, with masses of people and thousands of somewhat unhappy children, the air conditioning could not cope with the crowds. It was hot and stuffy. Moreover, there truly are not many fish tanks. Admittedly, the fish, sea horses and coral are beautiful. And, the aquarium tries to make the place more "child friendly" by allowing children to crawl through tunnels and pop up in the middle of a fish tank for a parent photo op. However, the aquarium is tiny and, as mentioned in my title, the otter exhibit featured a skeleton of an otter hanging over the pool of water.

Beautiful day. Very beautiful aquarium with some fishes I haven't seen before. Its not too large as a space,but have it all. We went there on the Xmas day and was not so crowded. Many activities for kids,but have to check the schedule. We watch the penguin feeding,but sharks feeding we missed as its only on Sundays. There is kids play area,good for birthday party. Perfect for visit with young kids and not so expensive. Restaurant with tables outside and see view available. Also the hop-on-and-off bus and boat tours starts from there. A must visit place,even without kids,for a good relaxing day.

The next best thing than swimming in the ocean.. What a wonderful place! Beautifully laid out, very informative, and thrilling to see all these creatures up close. Lots of squeals from young and old. Penguins too sweet and funny. The gifts shop is very nice. A must while in Cape Town.
Beautiful! . Beautiful Aquarium! They have pretty much everything. Very friendly for kids. We enjoyed it throughly. We had a toddler with us and he really had lots of fun. Everything is well run.

Always a winner. Great place to take the kids. There are various cold, warm and tropical water displays as well as interactive and educational programs. A highlight is the feeding of the sharks in the main tank.

Where the two oceans meet. Amazing sea word from two oceans: Atlantic and Indian Ocean. There are many activities which the kids love like the predator area, kids play area, puppet shows, Penguin feeding etc.

A must for young and old. We took our grandson (and his parents) to the aquarium. We were all mesmerized by different things, but one thing was for certain....we all felt it was an outing well worth the money. There is something for young and old, it is well looked after and visually pleasing. There is lots of opportunities for interaction and lots to be learned about the local marine life and conservation. Worth a visit....wait for a rainy day when you cannot go to the beach!
Exciting. We were greeted with a smile. Very friendly staff. The tanks were well kept and the fish were breath taking. Alot of interactive activities. Overall a must do when in cape town.

Miss Green. I really enjoyed myself with the kids, as I went on a sunday; which means I got to see them feeding the penguin's and sharks on the same day! Also while waiting for the penguins feeding time at 2 o'clock, there was a play area for the kids to mess around in. They also had a few activities for kids, and there was someone taking pictures charged R20 per photo which came with a Thank you card.
Small and smelly. Small little aquarium at the waterfront. Expensive and very smelly when you get to the Penguins . I prefer uShaka and this doesn't come close.
Pleasant and informative. An enjoyable outing with informative information on the local marine life and conservation. Well looked after and visually pleasing displays.
Interesting for young and old. We spent a lovely couple of hours at the Aquarium. The resources exhibit was informative n interactive.
Two Oceans Aquarium. Take the kids or grandparents there any day! A top class aquarium experience compared to none other in SA!
Shark feeding and touch pool very cool. My 5yr old and I loved the aquarium.The touch pool and microscopic display very informative. Shark feeding very busy. Try and get there 30 minutes before.

A tankful of amazement. A definite must for every visitor to the Cape educational and awesome great adventure, nice looking play area for the kids, The dedication to duty of the staff is to applauded, especially at feeding time

Fascinating and educational. This was our 3rd visit to the aquarium and we loved it as if it was our first!The displays and various aquariums are beautiful with information and facts of which fish species are which and a bit about each of them.The I&J tank is by far the best and the most popular with a group of people always sitting on the steps watching the ragged tooth sharks slowly swimming by.The queue to get into the aquarium was ridiculously long..the trick is to buy tickets online via webtickets..which get you to skip the entire queue and go right in.Our timing was perfect as we were in time to see the penguins and some of the fish tanks being fed.The shop at the exit had delicious ice cream...the turkish delight flavour is the best!!Tickets are not cheap. .but absolutely worth it!

Good family entertainment. I visited with my nephew (4), niece (5) an their granny (68), and I am aged somewhere in between... We all had fun! Lots to see with heaps of information for those of us who can read and those who (still only) see, listen and touch.I was impressed by the clean an well maintained facilities. The kids loved the play area downstairs and in the cafeteria - helped when things became a bit too much for their concentration span. And of course they loved the diving Santa!I have visited the aquarium before. It was interesting to note new displays and it was amazing to see how different the experience is through the eyes of a child.

Brilliant once again . Did a dive in the predator tank with my recently qualified girlfriend. Great service even though a lack of communication between reception and Dive Master as they said he was not in, and he was, I called his mobile! Dive staff were great. Only downside is the clambering required once kitted up in Scuba gear to get into the tank, it's a bit precarious. Dive master was great and looked after us very well. It's my second time diving there and enjoyed it just as much as I did 6 years ago.

The kids and the young at heart will love this. It was wonderful learning experience about various forms of sea life. The highlight was the feeding of the penguins as well as feeding the shark and giant turtle by Father Christmas

On par with aquariums in the USA. We have been to many aquariums in the USA and this can certainly compete with them. The tanks are well done and the information displayed very informative. Penguins are very entertaining and a number of frogs are in tanks as well. There is the usual gift shop as well as a small restaurant for a small breakfast or snack

Just as I remembered. Aquarium was lovely, clean and just as I remembered when visiting as a child. Interactive areas are great for all- especially children. We saw the penguins being fed, staff are a great help. Only downfall was we went just as schools were breaking up so lots of groups of school children running wild- if you don't like this I'd recommend coming during term time. Other than that, it was fab!
Penguins are a treat. Visited and enjoyed thoroughly. All biologists were very informative and friendly. Exhibitions are easy for young and old, tall and short, to view and enjoy. Highly recommended!

Great aquarium. Great aquarium to visit if your in cape town. Located in the V&A waterfront it is a must see we got to see the many exhibits and even watch the feeding for both the penguins and the sea turtle in the larger tanks. Would definitlry reccomend to anyone in cape town.

Fun family outing for. What a day at the two oceans aquarium.. There is so many fish species but the predator tank is at the top of the list.. Its amazing watching the raggies eat and ti thing its possible to dive into the tank with them.. I will definitely come back to swim with the ragged tooth sharks. I will strongly recommend that you pay a visit to the two oceans aquarium for it is so beautiful place Thank you ..

Great aquarium, worth a visit. We visited the aquarium on our first day in Cape Town and were really impressed. The diversity of fish on display is amazing and everything is explained in great detail, without ever being boring. Beside, how often do you get to see sharks from such a close distance?
Busy lunchtime. Food was good. Service was rather slow, admittedly they were quite busy. Thankfully were considerate of the kids and brought their meals asap.

Lots of big fish in the aquarium. A fun and interesting way to spend a couple of hours. The small displays are fascinating and the "big tank" is full of really interesting fish. The information boards give you all the interesting detail. Never touched a sea anemone until this visit!

Favourite family hangout. This is definitely out favourite family hangout. We have had annual membership for 6 yeara running and visit the aquarium on a monthly basis. Its exciting, exciting and we always come across something new. Its an amazing learning experince for the kids who never get bored of it. Aquarium caters for the entire family. There are allocated feeding times for the animals, story telling and arts & craft sessions for the kids. Theres also a restaurant which serves great quality food. The view from the deck is spectacular. A must visit indeed.
lots of kids. this want particularly my thing. lots of kids had taken over the aquarium.there were some really cool exhibits

Great visit. A really compact and interesting aquarium with sharks. Can get around in 30 mins - learn a lot and also allowed to re-enter all day. The rockhopper penguins are worth the entry fee alone!

Sad. We had some time to kill so we popped by the aquarium. Conditions for the fish seemed poor (particularly the penguins) and the aquarium really isn't very large. I was expecting to see better living conditions for the fish, however I felt saddened. One tank boasted hundreds of fish (including sharks and a turtle) that just seemed far too small for them.

Wonderful!. My husband and I truly enjoyed our visit to the aquarium. We stopped in for the afternoon after our morning trip to Robben Island and loved every second. The tanks are large and the staff is very knowledgeable. Special mention to the sweet penguins who loved to have their picture taken.

What lives in our Oceans. This is an incredible Aquarium, they do not have killer whales or dolphins, but they sure do have dazzling Star fish that you can touch, ragged tooth Sharks, thousands of Nemo's (clown fish) and my absolute best- penguins!This is a great day out for the whole family that will open your eyes to the beauty that surrounds our coastal regions.
Great attraction for the whole family. Very informative and interactive. Kids loved it and so did we. Well organised and well looked maintained. Informative and engaging.

A must do in Cape Town. Located at the water front, this aquarium is a must visit when in Cape Town. Interesting species of aqua life and the penguins are interesting to watch. The feeding of sharks is the highlight. You can truly spend the whole day here. Lots of entertainment for the whole family.
Wow!. Simply amazing. Went with elderly parents and young children - a treat for all. Fantastic value for many hours entertainment

Interesting sights and sounds for curious kids of all ages.. We took the family for an educational outing, to learn about the sea and the various fish and other water creatures. a fascinating experience in a well managed aquarium ; well worth a visit.

Nice, Well-Organised Aquarium. The Two Oceans Aquarium is a nice experience for families or school groups. It is quite a young aquarium and offers informative and engaging activities for the younger visitor. We were travelling as a couple, so it wasn't exactly an enthralling activity for us, but, nonetheless, we enjoyed the calm and casual walk through the the exhibits on show. The penguin feeding was great for children to watch, but we felt a little in the way, so stood back and took some photos. We would absolutely recommend this attraction for families or school groups.
Great Fun! Great for Families with Children. so much to do and see great learning experience lots of interactive displays - great fun for the kids small and big!
Fab for one and all. Go visit this attraction, great for all ages - quite large and very interesting. The kiddies will enjoy the nemo and feedng times are interesting and informative.

Not worthwhile. I was really disappointed. I know it is currently going through an upgrade which will hopefully make it bigger and better. But until that is done, I don't feel it is worth it if you have been to any other large town aquarium. It is very small, with not much to see.

Good for adults and children. Follow the signs from the main waterfront to discover marine life from the Atlantic and Indian oceans. The kelp forest is a unique feature. Well laid out an informative. There are penguins too.

Up close to marine life. This aquarium allows the visitor an up close view and experience with a diversity of marine life, including interactive exhibits. You could spend at least 4 to 5 hours at the aquarium. It is managed by a very knowledgeable and capable team. The tanks are huge and offer everything from sharks to squid. It is located in the heart of the well known V & A Waterfront.

Tranquility. The moment you step into the building all the noise from the Waterfront is left behind. The light dances magically off all the tanks and you are instantly taken into a new world. I can sit at the kelp forest for house and watch the large fish floating around all the kelp and rocks. There is now better way of recharging and relaxing. The predator tank is spectacular. The dagger tooth shark cruises by on the there side of the glass, Sting rays floating above you in the glass tunnel, a turtle foraging in the sand or watching you through the glass. Each visit is different. The bio diversity hall is also a great place to spend time. If you plan to visit, give yourself a whole morning at least. You don't want to rush through.

Great option. I got there after the weather spoiled a trip to dive with the white sharks.I was told that I could "practice" swimming with the sharks at the Aquarium, so I did, I got my gear and a guide took me inside a huge tank to swim with the sharks and other fish they have there. It was a great preparation for the adventure of diving close to the "whites" the following day.

Great way to spend a few hours!. We really enjoyed our visit to the aquarium! The staff were really friendly and we loved wandering around looking at all the sea creatures! Loved the predator exhibit with the ragged toothed sharks and really enjoyed the penguins, seemed like a real crowd pleaser! Entrance fee wasn't too expensive for the time we spent there!

Penguin encounter. We booked a Penguin Encounter with Two Oceans and were met promptly by Vernon. He took us through the aquarium up to the Rockhopper penguin area and we were introduced to the crew. We were given towels for our laps and the penguins immediately hopped onto our laps as soon as we sat down. They were very cute and it was a treat to spend some time with them. Vernon told us all about them for about 30 minutes, then it was time for their daily swim around the exhibit. Immediately after our penguin encounter was feeding time for the African penguins in their exhibit downstairs. We spent about another hour or so going around the rest of the aquarium. The aquarium itself has many impressive exhibits, but the penguin encounter was by far the highlight! The encounter price includes admission to the rest of the aquarium, so it's really a great deal.

Worth every cent!. Loved this beautiful aquarium with the feeding sessions. It was a sight to see the feeding sessions. We saw the penguins being fed, and learnt a little more about them. We also saw the shark feeding which was amazing. Ohw, how can I forget to mention, the gorgeous attention seeker of the aquarium, Yoshi!!!! Yoshi is a female turtle and she resides in the same tank as the 3 female sharks. The visit to the aquarium is really educative, with beautiful creatures. and also you get to have fun by taking goofy photos around the nemos!!!!! It is recommended to visit here on Sunday Afternoon, from 2pm onwards as thatz when you will see the penguins being fed, and also the sharks, and Yoshi too!!!!! :-)A must visit place!!!!!! It is worth every cent!!!
Ok ive seen better. Great for children Dont forget to go upstairs to the penguin ponds and freshwater pondsEasy to get around the place as not many people in there a fair price too

Fantastic visit for all. Really great visit. The whole family loved it (3 children aged 7,8,10). Very very enjoyable and informative. I did a shark dive in the tank with Iian - well worth the time and money.

Great day at two oceans aquarium. Received a warm and welcoming visit at the two oceans aquarium. Aquarium content is great and kept us busy for hours especially with the feeding times times. I highly recommend this attraction.

Another excursion covered by Go TouchDown Tours!!. This aquarium was amazing!! It truly was a sight to see everything that surrounds this amazing country! Plus it was nice to also nice to have an aquarium which provides education on conservation & not just photo opts...Thanks for including it on our itinerary Go TouchDown tours!!

Wonderful venue for a dinner party. We were invited to teh acquarium for drinks and snacks party. This acquarium was very well designed and teh variety fo Fish is mind boggling. ther are real hugs sharks and lot of yellow tail Tunas. It is a must see location if you are visiting Cape Town

Good trip -. We had a day to kill so went to the aquarium, our daughter enjoyed and good value for money, but not as extensive as others we have been to - great hands on area with informative staff. Allow 1.5 to 2 hours

Crowded, but with good reason. A popular attraction by the waterfront. Lots of variety. Well informed staff eager to share their knowledge. Beautiful displays of sea life. The South American penguins, the turtle, the sharks and the sting rays are some of our favourites. Watch the penguins or sharks being fed. It's not cheap and it gets very busy, but it's a good day out.
Smalls area for animals but excellent. It is very interesting and educational for childrens and adults too but fish and animals are in tiny area , also penguins area is too small

With two areas being renovated, still worth the visit.. We visited the aquarium in July. Tickets were purchased at the window without a line. The aquarium has many things to see and is great for little kids. My kids are teens and we have been to many outstanding aquariums, so they were not thrilled, but enjoyed it. I would say if you have a rainy day in CT, spend the afternoon here, but skip if you have older children that have been to many aquariums before.

Two Oceans Aquarium - Small But Excellent. This aquarium is, compared to others I've visited, on the smaller side. But don't let that stop you. The presentation and variety of aquatic creatures is impressive. We especially liked the kelp forest (a unique presentation) and the large tanks. Of course, everyone loved the penguin exhibition - the naturalist setting was a definite plus. The facilities are just excellent. I highly recommend Two Oceans for anyone visiting Cape Town.One suggestion: provide steps or something for the smaller children to see the displays that are above their eye level. Not ever visitor is an adult. I have the same suggestion for other aquariums I've visited, so this is not just Two Oceans.
Colorful and Informative. Interesting variety of indigenous fish species and information regarding same. Oddly shaped glass Aquariums while not unusual, certainly fit the atmosphere.
small but good for kids. A bit small, but you can see pinguins, a shark and lots of differents species for south.Good to go, but not the major thing in Cape Town

All the variety you require. Our seas are of the most rough in the world, so here you can venture all you like. Going twice a year for the past few years, it's a children's favourite activity. Variety is plenty, with everything for them to see. In the past my children have also had sleepovers with movies arranged, that they liked. It's a quality aquarium of world standard. Easy access in the hub of the waterfront.

Nice way to spend a chilled morning. the aquarium is very family friendly, if you have kids they will love it. Exciting range of marine life, and overall a nice alternative to spend a couple of hours in the morning

Visit with Grand children. An entertaining morning with our two young Grand children. The Aquarium was very interesting especially for the children, they were able to touch and feel in one section. Great children's entertainment area with puppet show. Lots of good exhibits. Good value too.
Loved The Penguins!. The Two Oceans Aquarium is a great place to go to view sharks, penguins, eels, and tropical fish native to the area.

Still good, but starting to show its age. Enjoyable and a good place to come face to face with many of the denizens of the deep that are found in south African waters. However, it's starting to look a little shabby and the offer hasn't changed much since the first time I went nearly 20 years ago. Good for a rainy day, but not sure I'd suggest going out of your way to see it unless you are particularly keen on marine life.

Strong environmental messages. This place is well worth an hour or two of anyone's time perhaps, as we did, coupled with a visit to the arts and crafts market nearby afterwards. The exhibits are clearly explained and the range of creatures on show wide. The highlight for us was the penguin feeding at 11.45am and the large fish feeding at noon about 20 yards away.. The whole thing great for kids judging by the reactions of the school groups there when we were. Conveniently located in the waterfront area.
Great visit. Great visit to rainy days. Interesting and beautiful fish. Nice experience, even for adults. Very recommended.

Sit and watch the Atlantic swim by. The aquarium offers the best of both our beutiful oceans bordering SA. Some interesting exhibits makes for a fun outing for any age. I can sit in front of the Atlantic exhibit with its kelp forests all day and just relax. It is not as big as uShaka in Durban or as flashy but still a great day out.

Great place for the afternoon. We went to the aquarium with our 7 year old. We thought it'd be a good idea to get there in the morning...bad idea. There were literally thousands of school kids. The staff told us to come back around 1pm. When we returned we practically had the place to ourselves. We watched several of the shows - which were great and really enjoyed our visit.

All things sea life wonderfull.. A worthy visit and a must do if never done before. I do it every time I come to cape town. Lovely exhibitions of the under sea world. Particularly love the logger head turtle in the large main display aquarium. Sharks are always a hit and somehow dont look so menacing through the glass.

Don't expect to much. I had high expectations before I went to this aquarium. Once you are inside everything is well taken care off. But in my opinion the aquariums were small and not so special. The big tank with sharks is cool!

Not just for children!. Nice aquarium, lots to see, saw of loads of fish I hadn't seen before! The clownfish tank was a lot of fun. Like many attractions in cape town was cheap to get into and worth the money.

Love & hate. Love & hate feeling !! Two Oceanos Aquarium is mesmerizing ... Beautiful creatures. My concern is the small aquariums, tanks they're in.I know this place is for educational purposes too but ... Make those tanks larger ... Penguins area included.Again ... Loved the place but cannot stop thinking about the exiguous space !!
Funtastic. It was a rainy afternoon in Cape Town when we decided to visit the aquarium. We were pleasantly surprised at all the exhibits. They were very interesting and some were unique.

Wonderworld. Took two sets of grandchildren through in October. They all enjoyed it thoroughly. The beauty and variety of the displays kept them enthralled and it was really educational for me as well. Keep this one for a rainy day. It really is worthwhile

Okay.. Its nice but it can sometimes get a bit boring although it is wonderful. It is quite expensive though. It is nice to look at the animals and take pictures of them, especially when the sharks swim towards you. There are lots of fun things to look at and do. There is also a 6 and younger arts and crafts section.
Worth a visit. Worth a visit , especially with kids. Well maintained and a lot of Cape animal and fish species. Located at V&A Waterfront can be a good entertainment.

What a treat!. The Two Oceans Aquarium is a must do for any visitor to Cape Town...and also for the locals:-) It's a wonderful way to spend the day...especially for children...very clean...helpful staff and so much to see..........

Small but interactive. Perfect for children!. It as a small acquarium with many attractions designed to children: they can go in special areas designed to take a pic or closer view, penguin area, have playgrounds, hallway designed to learn ecology... but best part is to see in the microscope small animals (touch the screen of a shark) and touch area where you can touch anemones, algae...
Brilliant, even for adults!. My husband and I had a great time here, probably the best aquarium we've been too! Well worth a visit, it's great!
Absolute Treat!. World class - award winning Aquarium...Perfect for families, couples and school excursions. The staff are amazing and passionate about ocean conservancy and there is so much to see!

Awesome. This is a great place for kids and adults. The displays are stunning and our kids love the craft activity that is different every time we visit. We do not regret buying the annual pass as our children love going back time and time again.
Fun day. I took my kids here and they LOVED it. A lot of interactive things to do and SO MUCH to learn. We spent nearly 3 hours browsing around and they didn't want to leave. So much fun was had;)
Funtastic!. well run establishment, very informative and a great morning to be spent here.We attended a penguin feeding session and got lots of info on this species.Put on our must do list!

smaller than the mega-aquariums but worth it. The staff is excited about their Aquarium and you will find out much more about the sea life from their inputs at the various exhibits. A young guide was also feeding the fish, turtles in the same tank as the sharks. It was pretty entertaining....very reasonable cost too

consistently good. This is our third visit (we try to visit every time we visit Cape Town, roughly every 2 years), and it's always a great experience. My daughter especially likes the touch pool, and also the science exhibit where small species (e.g.. plankton) are explained and shown by microscope etc. I also appreciate the bio-diversity exhibits, and the exhibition on the terrible pollution menace of plastic in the oceans.

Under the Sea. One Saturday we decided to go to the Aquarium. We got there at about ten in the morning and there was quite a few people but not to the point where it is unbearable. Inside there was a lively vibe and the animal-life was just amazing. I have not been to any other aquariums but I think it is safe to say that they have a rather big variety of animals. The reason why I say animals instead of sea-life is because they have special frog and penguin exhibits. They also had a lot of interactive facilities where you could for example hold a starfish or look at the development of octopus babies. My favourite part was the I&J Predator exhibit. It is a 2-million-litre exhibit which houses sharks, schools of fish, turtles and various other things. The best part about it is that you can completely walk around it and thus see everything from the fishes' point of view. For a day with friends or family I would definitely recommend it

Great way to spend a hot day. The whole place is airconditioned so when it's over 35 outside it's the perfect place to escape the heat. The aquarium is pushchair friendly and there are baby changing facilities. If going in term time beware the hordes of school trips.The tanks are clean and have lots of information about their contents. The explore ponds are great, where you can gently handle some inhabitants of rock pools. The Snack Shack is a great place for toddlers to run around but there are no healthy snacks to be had. The aquarium restaurant has a better selection. The kelp tank was fascinating and the shark tank has great visibility. The penguins are really cute and so close. Staff are really friendly and polite and the gift shop is great. You can easily spend most of a day inside.
Its just another aquarium. the highlight of this was seeing the divers feeding the sharks was very good but very packed and difficult to see
Great for Kids. I love going to the aquarium because it's so beautiful and serene. It's really lovely to go in and you can go diving with some ragged tooth sharks.

Lovely Outing. I visited the Two Oceans Aquarium with my husband and daughter and we all enjoyed it. There is a wide variety of fish species to see, there is a puppet show for the kids, and kids can even touch certain fish species under supervision of course. There is a tuckshop and play area for the little ones and a restaurant gift shop for the adults.Would visit again!
Must go.... Dispite already visit bigger aquarim´s, this one suprised me bacause of the variety os animals and fish, the warm sentation, the size of some fish and has a nice gift shop.

Average. I expected a lot more from the advertising. No need to spend more than 3!0mins to an hour, max! The Aquarium at uShaka Marine in Durban is an attraction you can go to time and time again. With Two Oceans, once is enough

Finding Nemo . Come find Nemo and all his friends from the undersea world. This modern aquarium is a delight for the young and young at heart. Optimal location, good layout, wide range of sealife and sharks are still scary. Good playroom for children by the restaurant.

Great for the kids!. I recently visited the aquarium with two of my neighbours children (aged 4 and 6) and what an experience it was. It is an awesome venue to take children to as it offers an insight into what one cannot imagine. The displays are truely magnificent and the kids were spellbound. So, if you have nothing to do on an otherwise boring day, take the little ones to the Waterfront. They will not be disappointed.
Beautiful place. My kids had a great time and enjoyed so much the morning we spent at the aquarium. Lots to learn and experience!

under the sea adventure. variety of sea life is awesome, the curio and café is a bit on the pricey side, but I guess they targeting tourists. there is no dolphins but the sharks and the turtle are worth a visit to see.
A 'Must See' in Cape Town. The Two Oceans Aquarium is educational and interesting. Beautifully laid out and very informative. A great experience that should not be missed.
Breathtaking experience. Informative, beautifu and well designed. A must do when in Cape Town. Educational and factually correct.
The penguins!!. Spend a lovely morning here looking at all the wonderful displays of fish and sea life.The penguins were the highlight.

Special entertainment. My wife and I visited with our Grand daughter and spent the afternoon being entertained by this special place below the waves. It is my first visit since the place was renovated and I found the Penguin display outstanding with a tidal pool and oyster catchers for reality effects.

Save it for a rainy day. The aquarium is a great place for a rainy day in Cape Town. They have wonderful exhibits and cater quite well to children. I absolutely loved the penguin exhibit. You can do a penguin experience everyday at 11 but booking is required. Not available on Mondays. I went there for penguin feed and that's at 11:45 and 14:30. Shark feed is at 15:00. That exhibit is also neat as it has the Sharks, stingrays, turtle and other endangered predator fish.

It's raining . If it's raining in Cape Town and you want to kill a couple of hours then this is the place to go .the aquarium is pretty standard . the penguin in closure is good and the staff are very informative there's a shop and a big restaurant .
Good place to visit with kids or without. If you have couple hours to spare do not hesitate and visit the aquarium. If you lucky and time it well you can see penguin and shark feeding.

An interesting aquarium where divers can enjoy a personal encounter with the sharks. A great rainy day activity for children and adults alike.Certified divers can book a dive in the shark tank. Iain, the dive master, was very knowledgeable and friendly and we enjoyed the dive and felt safe at all times. The gear was in great condition and we were treated to a nice hot shower after the dive. It is a strange sensation to see the other visitors on the other side of the glass !

Beautiful and environmental. This place is lovely to walk through. The sharks were my favorite next to the environmental reminder art and notices. Though it isn't very big, there is a lot to see and great for families. It is also close to several restaurants and other sites to see. It is absolutely worth visiting.

A Must do. What a great place to visit. Plenty variety water life. Interesting exhibition and penguin demonstration . Such a wonderful hands on and informative talk for children especially explaining about environmental impact on the cape penguin population. I especially enjoyed the clown fish tank. A great little exhibit where you can actually climb down underneath the glass dome and pop up inside it with literally hundreds of clownfish swimming all around above and around you. Makes for wonderful photo opportunities for kids and adults( if you are on the small side And can negotiate the tight fit). Relatively inexpensive.

Not soo bad. Really interesting, the staff know their stuff and its really clean. We went when there was a huge school gathering and it was hard to hear the lady guving a talk as they were making noise, which i could visually see the tension on her face.Id go again but only with someone that has never been before..its a been there done that kind of thing.

Wowwwww.... One of the most awesome aquariums that i have been to... Large number of spectacular fish species.. vibrant in colors...I would definitely suggest dive in with the sharks for those who want to experience the thrill ... this might be better than shark cage diving.. Another tip... try to be around the penguins during their feeding time... it is jus too adorable to watch .
Something fishy. A beautiful escape under the water with my daughter in December 2014, allowed us to truly appreciate the beauty of these majestic animals

Two Oceans one amazing place. Children & Adults this is amazing.The upkeep of this Aquarium is amazing.There is so much over and above to see and do.Feeding fishes and penguins.Seeing the most amazigg animals that live deep in the oceans

A great place to get up close and personal with turtles, sharks and fish!. 2-Oceans is a get morning/afternoon trip out, and a great place to get up close and personal with turtles, sharks and fish - without having to get cold and wet! The new area they are building looks stunning, and there is something for everyone. I was luck to get invited on a 'behind the scenes' tour, so saw a great deal more than your average visitor. I did find fish and chips for lunch in a different place harder to swallow - and seeing the size of these fish as they cruise past the glass windows gives you a whole new respect for the fishermen that bring you sushi and of course, fish n'chips!

Dive in predator tank. Our friend enjoyed the dice in the predator tank, while we enjoyed taking photos of it! The aquarium has such a fantastic variety of fish and other creatures!! Allow lots of time. Outing will be enjoyed by young & old. Expect school crowds in the mornings!
Interesting. Very good, really quite cheap too we thought. Lots of fish and animals. Not much by way of interactive stuff, but still a worthwhile visit if in the V&A area.

be "amazed very amazed". one of the attraction's the will spell bound you, the vast tanks the biggest i have ever seen,fresh water, tropical and salt watercrawl spaces ,touch areas for the little ones ,great restaurantbetter price's, very cheap entrance fee, well worth it.

Memorable Visit. On a recent visit to CapeTown the Aquarium was on the to do list. The first ocasion I went I was on my own but two days later was with friends. We throughly enjoyed the experience. So many tanks containing a vast collection of fish, crabs, plus penguins in the open. My favourite amongst many was a Moray Eel. It was busy but that all added to the excitement this place affords. Reasonable entrance fee plus you can come out and go back in again on the same day. Also the shop and cafe all adds to this amazing place. A must see if in Capetown and on the basis of this experience I recommend the Aquarium at the Waterfront.

I took my granddaughter for a fabulous visit with amazing sea life that boggles the mind.. We recently visited the aquarium to expose my 2 year old grand daughter to some sea life. Well she was blown away and so were we. There is so much to see, this is a must if you are in the area.

Interesting aquarium. Took us about an hour to go round this aquarium, some interesting tanks with ragged tooth sharks and a really nice penguin exhibition. The day we were in there was a lot of school children on a visit which made it probably a bit noisier than normal but we still thoroughly enjoyed it. Restaurant and shop also but we did not use them.

A selfie with a Shark:A "shelfie" :-). My daughter was so happy it was worth it.I was super excited as well as i got to see the sharks up close and personal and the walkaway underneath allowed me to time it perfectly so i could take a selfie with the shark.A lot of diversity and information.The overall experience is one of fun and learning.I recommend it.

Lovely experience. What a way to spend a morning with the family. I came here last 9 years ago and it still surprises me as to the quality of the place. The displays are well placed and show off some incredible sea life that you would normally not see.A highlight is the ghost crab tank which is a sight to behold. The staff are very knowledgeable and very eager to help and discuss with the children

Eyes therapy.... I find watching animals like fish and cats are like a therapy... And this aquarium is giving me therapy and excitement... Located in the heart of Cape Town Waterfront, this aquarium offers you an overview to Hindi and Pacific ocean sea creatures...

Swimming with the fishes.... Beautiful exhibits of some amazing marine species. Two Oceans has some fantastic examples of the good, the bad and the ugly in the sea Kingdom. Wonderful chance to view lion fish, seahorses, sharks, a turtle (can there be more please - my daughter asks EVERY time!!). penguins, 'Nemo' fish (Clown fish) and many more. Well worth a trip and we bought a year membershp card. Nice lay out; good loos; shop - if you like that kind of thing, plus food and ice cream available either in the restaurant or, if the weather is kind, outside with a harbour/mountain view. Winner.

Lovely experience for the family. Fascinating experience... My kids (6 and 11) were enthralled. The walkway underneath the one tank was especially soothing, and we all had a wonderful time. Good time well spent
Quick visit but well worth it. Well presented aquarium. - entertained two teenagers and two adults for an hour! Super convenient and nice set up - recommended.
Informative and enjoyable. There are fun activities for the whole family, and loads of fish from the two oceans. My 3 year old enjoyed identifying the fish and the general wonder of the place.
Fantastic underworld. Superb exhibition of animals living under water. Very educating, but at the same time relaxing for grandparents supervising their grandchildren.

Great place to take the kids for a couple of hours. I've been a few times and visited recently after 5 years. Not much has changed and it is quite small compared to other aquarium attractions in the world. However the kids enjoyed it- many interactive elements and I think just the right size for them not to get bored or tired. Affordable as well. Would recommend for families with small kids.

Tranquil experience in Cape Town. A very nice experience with many, for me, new fishes and other water animals. One can sit down and listen to the music and see the fish slowly passes bay. Very relaxing

Small but lots of cool fish. Although we felt the aquarium was rather small, we saw a beautiful variety of tropical fish we've never seen before anywhere else. The decor was nice and the staff was friendly. The lines were long, but the entry moved quickly. There were interactive displays that even the adults enjoyed. Must visit site,,,

Wonderful Experience. We were highly impressed by the amazing enormity & beauty of display of ocean wildlife. Everything was perfectly laid out & explained. In addition, there included a hands-on site mainly for the children, although many adults were evidently having a great time as well !!The entrance fee was very reasonable allowing for multi entry & exit during the day.A highly recommended site to visit.

Good to visit - Penguins are the best. We came to the Aquarium on honeymoon. I think this would be great for kids as there are quite a few interactive elements for them. The Penguins were definitely the best part for us. This aquarium has a fair amount of attractions, but not as much as I would have expected (maybe we are spoilt in Australia).

Great way to spend a couple of hours. This was a very well laid out, informative place. The tanks were well set up with a wide variety of species. Frankly, the biggest letdown was the penguin display, though the display with the ones they had rescued was interesting. Daughter loved it.

Informed and informative staff!. Wasn't too sure about bringing our two pre-teens to an aquarium since so many of them are pretty basic. This one was a step above most of them, almost entirely due to their amazing staff. Lots of hands on stuff and displays kept us busy for several hours because there was always a volunteer there who was enthusiastic and knowledgable about their subject and made things interesting. We got to watch anemone eat through a microscope, saw penguins and rays fed, and explored the touch tank with the guidance of a young teen volunteer. Very cool encounters! Reasonably priced food on site, but we walked over to the waterfront for lunch and then back to see a feeding after the school groups had left.

Dove right into the Predator Tank and Loved it!. I was volunteering at Marine Dynamics and on the last day they left early so we could go see the Two Oceans Aquarium and go diving in the tanks. We had a Great time. Everything ran smoothly, the Dive Masters were wonderful and took time to make sure you were fitted out correctly. We spent an hour diving in the Predator tank and I gotta tell ya, it was Great! They even had showers to use before changing once you were out of the water. The Penguin area is great but always crowded when they are feeding them. All in all a great experience and you should not miss this while you are in Cape Town!
nice but just an aquarium. nice to visit but not very special, the location and the interior of the building makes it interesting.

great idea for spending rainy day. The two oceans aquarium is a great idea for spending rainy day with family. For sure all you children, even adult will like it! Aquarium is really big, you can see there many kinds of fishes and pinguines as well.

Good for kids but although adults. If it's a rainy or windy day in Cape Town and you want to be inside for a few hours it's a good thing to do. They have a high variety of animals and do some feeding of the penguins and sharks. Interesting!
Educational for Family. Easy going place, welcoming atmosphere for kids. Well laid out and easy to follow through. Staff very helpful and pleasant. Nice coffee relaxing place after the tour.

Two Oceans Aquarium. Last month (September 2015) my wife and 5 year old daughter when twice in one week to the aquarium. We went twice as my daughter loved the first trip. The aquarium is a wonderful outing for the whole family and caters for all ages.
Fabulous family outing. What a pleasure it is to visit this amazing aquarium and to witness the wonders of the ocean - really well run with lots to of help available and people to answer queries.

Fun day out for the family. Bit expensive to enter but all the nice fish and attractions makes up for that you cannot believe that all this fish are swimming in our oceans, a fun day out for the family go and enjoy.

A fun place for the family. A great place for the kids.There are quite some magnificent sea animals you hardly find in some places.You can tell how excited kids are when you visit there by their curiosity,though most are scare of getting close to them.
A great day out. Such a beautiful and comprehensive aquarium. Make sure you go check the website beforehand so as to time your visit with the feeding of the penguins and the larger fish.
Outstanding. Simply stunning, great variety of sea life, lots of opportunity for hands on experiences, even opportunity to dive free with sharks. Our children were absolutely gobsmacked.
Excellent. First experience of seeing Dolphins being fed. The visit was informative to my 11yrs daughter. Sharks!!!!

Great place to entertain kids. Two Oceans Aquarium has to be one of the best aquarium in the world, it is now much cleaner than it use to be when last visited about 5 years ago.A diversity of marine life to be discovered, with a wealth of information.There is a kiddies play area at the bottom, also great ice cream, try the green pistacchio.It is advisable to get an annual membership cards, as kids always get entertained, with the nemo section a firm favorite.Only suggestions is perhaps the step walkway be illuminated with LED lights as kids often struggle to climb, stand or get down.Otherwise a great way to spend the morning or early afternoon, highly educational.
Nice place. Many kinds of fish to see and the sting ray almost jumped out of the tank! Was awesome I will go again! Just missing some great white sharks *hint hint* ;)

Great place for families. We were staying across the road from the Aquarium and decided to visit it. As we have seen many aquariums in Australia, we were a bit disappointed with the displays and found the water in the large overhead aquarium, rather cloudy. The most informative display for us was the lady who was showing the small sea creatures under a microscope. The penguins displays were enjoyable.
Great Exhibits. A really nice few hours can be spent here, good exhibits and lots of information. A must do for a rainy day, but don't rule it out if weather is good, as within the V&A Waterfront.

Aquarium with Penguins . It's a nice Aquarium for the kids, my son really enjoyed himself. There is a Nemo glass fish tank and kids can take a picture with the Nemo fishes. My son loved the Penguins too but we didn't make it for feeding times. If you want to feed the Penguins check the timetable

Rainy day activity. Aquarium isn't large. Everything is South African. Some aquariums try to do the Seven Seas. I don't care for that. Feedings at certain days/times. We saw the penguin feeding as well as the kelp forest feeding. Penguin feeding was interesting/informative. Kelp feeding was basically just a diver feeding the fish with limited narration. Our favorite part were the ragged tooth shark. Exhibit on them as well as saving/rehabilitating/tagging and turning a couple of them in to essentially ambassadors. They also have mermaid purses, which are pouches containing the developing shark embryos. No Great Whites here but some information given on them as well as multiple whale/dolphin species.
Relaxed family day at the Two Oceans.. Great day spend with the family at one of our best destinations in Cape Town. Very informative and the kids loved feeding time of the penguins at 11:45.

Interesting Visit. It is interesting to watch sea life so close. This is a wonderful excursion for especially children. There is a variety of sea animals. The place is quite spacious and it is relaxing to walk around.
only if you have time. Nothing really much but a few sharks here. I am kinda oppose to having animals in captivity.... so i guess it wasnt my cup of tea. When there as we had free tickets.

Fantastic!. We visited as a family with two small children (4 & 7 years old) and it was great. We were fortunate enough to have been there on a Sunday to see the divers feed the sharks. Kids loved the puppet show in the "kiddies entertainment area" and also enjoyed the magnetic puzzles on the walls.Worth a visit.

A few fish in big tanks, right? Wrong!. I've driven past it hundreds of times and I've never thought it would be interesting. Then visitors asked to be taken to the Two Oceans Aquarium and that's how I discovered one of Cape Town's best attractions for a rainy day. You might as well know that I've never visited an aquarium before so I may not be the best person to rate this place, but we all absolutely loved it. We were 3 adults and a baby of 10-months, and she was as mesmerised as we were by all the colour and movement. So many different species, heart-stoppingly close encounters with huge predators, little pop-up spaces in the middle of some tanks that you can crawl into and then stand up and feel as if you're in the water with the fish, a fabulous tank of Nemos, an interactive anenome display, lots of penguins, lots of happy visitors, plus its clean and well kept and has a good kids play area... it was a great way to spend a chilly afternoon.

Small but well done. Good place to go with children or grandchildren .large play area and interactive exhibits. For adults 3 massive razor tooth sharks in a large tank with large school of yellow fin tuna.
Ok but not fantastic. An absolute ok experience, however there are better things to use your time on in Cape Town. Ok for a rainy day.

Kids love. Take your little ones here. I've been to many aquariums around the world and although smaller than its overseas counterparts it's well run. Well setup.A definite for your family or a stroll...
Beautiful. We were told not to miss this attraction, and it was very good and kids love it. We compared it to our Aquarium in Toronto Canada, and it is way better, but do go it's worth it

Nice way to kill a few hours on a rainy day . We popped into the aquarium to kill a few hours on a rainy day. Lots of fish to see and the Penguins were really cute. Feeding time was interesting but unfortunately the Sharks were not hungry so no pictures of them eating. The turtle was by far the best attraction. Really jealous of the divers getting to touch and play with the turtle. Would recommend a visit if in Cape Town

Really cool sea creatures. Husband and I visited during our honeymoon.The aquarium has beautiful creatures and is really nicely laid out. We stayed for the penguin feeding which was fun to watch and saw the shark feeding as well. I will say that watching the shark feeding was incredibly annoying since kids were running around screaming and we couldn't hear anything the presenter was saying. It has nothing to do with the aquarium and more to do with lack of parenting but it made our time there really annoying so we left mid show. Also, the "Nemo" tank was really fun to go into and take photos in.
Nicely done. Nicely done and simple exhibits! Not as large as other aquariums, but will give you something to do for a couple of hours.
Wow. Amazing time spent with the kids, we learnt alot from the tour and saw amazing species of fish, mezmerising!!
Perfect for Families. It is not a very big attraction as they promote, but it is a nice experience for kids. They will enjoy the huge aquarium and the pinguins!

Fantastic place for families!. Wonderful aquarium, so many different animals presented really well-thought-out, especially the immense aquarium with the sharks and the one with the sea forest are fantastic, you can spend the whole day there and the location directly at the waterfront is perfect.

Lovely morning outing.. When my grandson visits us in Cape Town as has over the past few years, nothing provides more exciting pleasure than a visit to the V&A aquarium.
