The wondrous creatures housed there never ceases to amaze us. After the visit we usually have a very decent lunch at their restaurant. Highly recommended especially on a weekday.
Average. Not expensive, but not a lot to see compared to others in major cities everywhere. No real "wow" moments but fillled an hour on a rainy day.
Amazing. My little grandson had a great time. There were so many activities to do and penguin interaction too. We had a great day taking in the variety of marine life
awesome!. Very nice aquarium with creatures from all around the cape. Great for kids and adults. The feeding times made public are a great crowd pleaser
brilliant. Brilliant aquarium and very informative staff. well worth a visit. Once you pay in you can visit as many times as you want that day !

Recommended. I would recommend going to the Two Oceans Aquarium. The rating would probably be higher if it was my first time at an Aquarium but because I have been to others before there wasn't anything exceptional about it for me.

Nice water life display. Although not very big the aquarium has a varierty of sealife creatures from shrimps to sharks. I especially adored the pinguins. There are some birds and frogs too. The place is worth the visit.

Fascinating. The aquarium is a good visit but I'd recommend going when no school children are on excursion there since it becomes unruly and cluttered. The gentleman that showed us various species under the microscope did well and had a good knowledge of aquatic creatures. There is a play area for kids and an area where one is allowed to interact/touch some of the aquatic plants. There are various locations where one can sit and watch the fish. My favourite part of the aquarium was the penguins and close vicinity to them. If you are a student, take along your student card for a discount.
Brilliant, just brilliant. Best aquarium in the world hands down. great cheap fun day out! Take your time and enjoy, spent hours in the sea floor room.

Fun. It's a fun experience getting to see all the creatures there. Well laid out and exhibits look cool. It's pretty small though, so plan just over an hour to visit - it's definitely not a full day experience. I recommend doing a harbour tour with citysightseeing right after it as it's right near the exit and only costs R40 (about $3.20) for half an hour. That gives you a more holistic experience with the aquarium.

Dont miss Two Oceans Aquarium. The Two Oceans Aquarium is located on Dock Road in the V&A Waterfront Cape Town. The displays offer an informative look into many different ecosystems. Fresh, sea and estuary species are on display, many uniquely South African. Highlights include the Penguin feedings, shark tanks and kelp forest. During peak periods the que may be long, but the Two Oceans Aquarium is well worth a visit.
Kids. Kids will love it. Different species of fish can be seen. There are also penguins that can be viewed. The curio shop has a good selection of souvenirs.
A abit over priced. The turtle tank was an amazing view but for the price, I expected a bit more. I figured that this place is more aimed at tourists than locals.
Water water water. Fun for the whole family, this Aquarium is amazing. Spend hours here. Go for the day. They have sharks, fish, starfish, turtles, sting rays, hmm lots to see

One of the top Aquarium, do not miss it. Yes it is one of the best aquarium i have seen, it's content several types of fishes, there i saw the biggest crab my life and you can enjoy the social of penguin and how they feed them, in addition there is a live show of fish and sharks feeding by divers, in the end of your tour go enjoy the lovely cheese cake in there coffee shop, by the way from the coffee shop view you can rent the red colour flat boat to have a journey around the cape town harbor..thx to them

Fabulous Day out for the family.. My husband and I as well as our teenage boys and young daughter all immensely enjoyed this outing. The shark feeding was interesting but quite crowded. The kids area in the basement was also well supervised and a wonderful experience for our little girl.

Best aquarium I have visited. The Two Oceans Aquarium is the best aquarium I have visited. it is located at the V&A Waterfront and comparably small, but all the displays are well layed-out and the information given is helpful. I didn't really want to visit the aquarium, because usually I have concerns about the animal wellfare in aquariums and zoos, this must be an exception, the animals all seemed well looked after and are either only temporarrily diplayed nd the rereleaesed to the wild (young ragged tooth shark) or animals that have been found nd can not be rereleased for various reasons (penguins).The most imprssing display must be the kelp forest, which is something I have never aeen in an aqurium before.Definately worse a visit and best of all, not at all crowded.

Good for a couple of hours fun with kids. The aquarium has a wide variety of ocean life to show. There is a lot to do for the kids as well. A small playground with all sorts of activities. The tunnel and the nemos are the absolute highlights.

One of the better aquariums around. I've been to aquariums all over the world with my kids -SYdney definitely still the best. But this charming aquarium in Cape Town is well worth taking your kids to. Well designed, excellently stocked and a great location for lunch afterwards in the Waterfront.
Magical sea life. Best aquarium I've ever visited. Packed with creatures of all shapes, sizes and colors. Could have spent a whole day there but our schedule allowed only 3 hours.
Be sure to see the Penquins!. A great Aquarium with many interesting exhibits of Sealife. Don't miss if you are in town!I love the Penguins!

Top class aquarium - rates among the best in the world. A top class aquarium, The Two Oceans Aquarium in Cape Town, rates among some of the best in the world, and I am not just saying that because my late husband, Omar Cassim (who worked for Aquatek) installed the life support systems in the tanks. The most fascinating "room" for me in the aquarium in the giant kelp. Fish weave in out out among the tall swaying sea plants. Children especially love this room and I think it is the enormity of the tank rising more than 12 feet high. Another high light are the penguins. As everyone knows penguins are only found in the southern hemisphere and mostly at the south pole - Antarctica but in South Africa we are lucky to have them at Boulders Beach, another great tourist attraction. At this beach the inquisitive penguins will come up to you without fear of humans. Everyone loves penguins. Many people rave about the sharks but I am not a big fan. The aquarium is a must see and since it is right at the Cape Town Sight-seeing open air tour bus, multiple joys on your holiday can be combined: the aquarium, plus shopping in the Waterfront, plus dining in the Waterfront, plus a trip around the city on the tour bus to as far as Camps Bay on one route and Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens on a second route. For the children, you can also have them join the regular sleep-overs inside the aquarium. Kids bring along their sleeping bags and teddy bear / soft toy and voila! Camp out in the aquarium!

Nice activity for a rainy day - better to see penguins in the wild down the coast though. Great for a wet day in Cape Town - the events in the aquarium are engaging and informative for all the family - especially interesting in terms of endangered species etc - my kids came away with lots of good insights and it has changed their behaviour in terms of what they choose to eat. The events are pretty diverse and aimed at a varied age group which is really nice to see (story telling through to feeding).Never a big fan of captive wildlife - even fish - but the enclosures and tanks seemed a good size and staff obviously care a lot about them all. My main issue was the penguin area - I guess it is for their rehabilitation but given you can pop down the coast and see them in the wild it seemed odd to house them here.Cafe is also pretty good and the route round the aquarium makes for a logical narrative and a fun visit.
Nice. We popped in here since it was a rainy day on the waterfront. The aquarium is very well done and very educational.

Simply Awesome. Have been to quite a few aquariums by now, but will rate this high simply because of the information it shares!! It might have lesser exhibits, but definitely has the best ones of both the oceans and southern african waters. Each presenter was just willing to share as much information with each one of us, making the trip an amazing learning experience. We were also amazed by the conservation work the aquarium does. Will definitely be there again when we are in Cape town again!!

Amazing Experience, Diving with the sharks!. I went to the aquarium with a very specific goal : dive in the Shark tank.That was an amazing experience, together with another customer and our divemaster Ian, we spent some 35 minutes among 3 Ragged-Tooth Sharks, other predatory fish and a huge turtle.Overall the aquarium has a lot of beautiful and interesting fish and other marine species, pengiuns.They work reintroducing animals to the wild and also help grow interest on marine life, which is so highly threatened.

Amazing experience. I was blown away! What an amazing experience! I was surprised at how clean and neat every single enclosure was. I learn so much about marine life and conservation. I would strongly recommend this attraction to anyone visiting or living in Cape Town.

Must be visited. Its an amazing attractions in Cape Town. It has a variety of sea world animals, and has an interaction place. My kids enjoyed a lot the scientific area where they learned about sea animals. Always book online and enjoy the discounted rate. They offer an amazing dive experience, and don't miss to book the penguins in counter. You will need a least 2 hours to finish the experience. You can have a light meal in the aquarium, or enjoy a cup of coffee. Their gift shop is great and full of unique items. Its a wheelchair friendly place, and good for all ages. Don't worry if you have small children, they have a play area to keep your child busy.
Very interesting. Truly an educational and fun trip to the Two Oceans Aquarium. A must see for visitors and Capetonians. A must see for kids and adults :).
The ocean on your door step. My kids loved this trip ..... price was a bit higher than expected , but otherwise , very educational.

Small but enjoyable just the same. This was smaller than i expected but still an enjoyable way to pass a couple of hours. Does get crowded (especially during school holidays with school camp, vac care type groups. Worth a visit, especially if you have children or want to fill a couple of hours at the Waterfront.
Simply the best. This has to be one of the best Aquariums in the world. a wide and varied range of exhibits easy to access and photograph. Take your time here and enjoy the experience

Fascinating. Living in a land locked country I found this place pretty awesome. So many times of water life to see. All very colourful. The design is unique and fascinating. Lots of fascinating info especially on the penguins. It is a great place to go and very fun filled, kids love it. Some real edutainment.
Good for a younger age group. This is probably more suited to a family with young children that it was to just an adult pair but it was interesting all the same.

A great visit!. A little smaller than I expected but still a very nice place to visit while in Cape Town. My husband and I stopped here during our hop on/hop off bus tour and it took about an hour to get through. The penguins were my favorite part!
Don't waste your money or time. Sooooo disappointed. Yes there are tanks of some beautiful fish and sea horses, eels etc. but that's it. I was expecting some larger species too. Very small aquarium

Best day out!. The Aquarium is beautiful, educational and fun for both adults and children!The aquarium is divided into many different sections and the sea life that you are able to see is beyond what you can imagine. I thought that I would be too old to enjoy looking at fish but I went there last year and have been back three times since!The aquarium is very well maintained, the staff are incredibly helpful and you can tell that the fish are well looked after.If you're in the area, be sure to take a look!

The fish bowl at the tip of Africa. This is an ideal place to take your young children and show them the various species of fish. They also organise birthday parties for yourn children which are so exciting for your kids. They have sleepovers for youngsters. A hub of activity.

Secrets of the ocean. A must visit to see all the amazing creatures of our beautiful oceans. The aquariums are very well placed and is also a fun and friendly place to take kids to. Felt like a kid when we visited

Never gets old.. Let me just start by saying that if you live in Cape Town and have little kids, do yourself a favour and buy the yearly pass. It'll serve u well in the Winter months when it storms and kids need to let out some of that pent up energy. My kids have been coming to Aquarium for some years now and it never seems to get old. They enjoy running through the Aquarium and see all the marine life up close. They especially love the penguin and shark feedings, so try to get there in time for these. And Sam's play place downstairs keeps them entertained for quite awhile, with the daily puppet shows and arts and crafts and playgym and sandbox.

Interesting but not world class. We visited the Two Oceans Aquarium on Monday 1 September. We had been to the aquarium about 20 years ago and since have visited a few international aquariums. The Durban Ushska Marine is much bigger and yes, better. The aquarium is realatively small and nothing stood out as a wow. It did not take long to see all the exhibits. It's Clean and in good condition, which is great. A shop with unacceptably high pricing.

Fun and Kid-Friendly. It was just the right size with enough variety of displays to keep kids interested. They had a great play room and wonderful steps for shorter kids to get a good view of the tanks. The sharks and penguins were very cool as well as the touch tanks and microscope station.
Modern and fun. Really clean, modern aquarium. Plenty to see and read and lots of quirky little things for kids. A bit expensive maybe but still enjoyable.
Liked it. I enjoyed going to the aquarium just a small problem its smaller than I thought and wish to have seen but more of the species but that is fine felt sorry for the penguins
Nice place ,kids will love it !. It was a very nice , our kids loved it here you can also see the penguins .must go here if visiting cape-town .kids will love this place for sure !

Maritime Palace. Although I've been spoiled by visiting aquariums in New York, Boston, Monterey (CA), and San Diego, I was impressed by how the operators of Two Oceans Aquarium have packed so much into the waterfront space they have and how they make it so appealing and accommodating for children.
Fantastic experience. We visited the aquarium with our three year old. Great experience! The clown fish and shark expo were really awesome. Very child friendly place and a lot of fun!

Aquarium living. The experience was amazing. I fell inlove with the ocean and the myriad forms of life. It was colorful, beautiful and serene at the same time. I could easily spend hours at the Aquarium. The staff were amazing,

Another must see. Honestly, not as awesome as I had hoped. Probably because we've seen a few aquariums before but I was hoping this would be really sensational being Africa. Good display though and the penguin room was something we haven't experienced elsewhere. Unfortunately, because of the strong smell, we literally ran through this exhibit. Haha! The Predator exhibit was the highlight but because it wasn't feeding time, it was a little anticlimactic. Maybe I expected too much, but to be fair, in so far as animals not in their natural environment go, I would still rate it excellent.

Finding Nemo. This Aquarium isn't as big as I thought it might be but is very well laid out and provides lots of activities for kids. It would be hard to spend more than 2 hours here but it's worth a visit.

Fun day at the Aqarium. The experience was amazing, I learned a lot. I never knew that the Ocean had so many organisms living in it, it's almost like another world under the sea.Was simply amazing.Our Oceans are beautiful, Look after it :-)
Aquarium of note. Really quite a site! so many strange, varied and beautiful creatures!perfect for a family day out!!! :) near to other tourist attractions so do plan ahead.
Killing time.. A little small and more ideally suited to guests of a young age. It's a reasonable to kill a couple of hours.

Still enjoyable ...even for adults. Visited the aquarium over the weekend. It's quite similar to the PTA Zoo (Aquarium), however has the penguin feeding , predator feeding. Was still enjoyable and informative. A must if you have kids

Nice place to see. We have been to some aquariums before, but this one is really amazing. All the animal's are spotted in a good light, many informations are given and it's all combined in a lovely atmosphere. You should definitely go there when you're in cape town - it's not expensive and absolutely worth it!

Best place to take kids on a rainy day. There are so many wonderful activities that the children just love and that is apart from the fantastic array of different species that are housed at the Aquarium and which makes for a most enjoyable day out for all ages really
Very educational. We found the aquarium interesting, interactive and educational. We didn't have our grandchildren with us but are sure that they would have loved it too.
Excellent - my child didn't want to leave. Great activity for a rainy day. Highly engaging aquarium with some fun opportunities for kids to interact with the sea life...
Nice place for Kids. We have enjoyed by seening different types of ocean species. Penguin park was really nice. Kids will enjoy very well. It's not must watc place.

Great experience. I have visited many aquariums before but I felt this particular one has added a lot of knowledge , fun and experience. Booking online attracts some discount. Alternatively, you can get 10 Rands off by showing your Hop on Hop off bus ticket. Display of different fish species in a clearly visible clean tanks with script explaining the salient features of the content of every tank. Observe for the feeding time. You can always go out and come back the same day to see that activity (They will put an invisible stamp on the hand that is only seen by special ultraviolet light). I thought one is enough but really you can keep watching the penguins for an hour. As expected, there would be crowds of children and school pupils with some but tolerable noise. I did not regret spending the money or time.

Every visit, worth it. . Visit whenever we come to Cape Town and it never disappoints. My favorite part is the light microscope which always gives fresh appreciation for detail in nature. Then the enormous tanks that let you feel as if you are standing in the ocean. Don't miss the craft market in the shed outside.

Average Aquarium. Right at the entrance of V & A Waterfront, cant miss. Good for kids under 8 to see those sea creatures. Would recommend only for someone who have never been to an aquarium before. worth an hour or so. small kids may still enjoy. If you have been to Hong Kong, Singapore etc..skip this easily
Awesome activity. I reckon this is a great place, specially if you have children. Make an effort to go to the talks, they are worth it.

Totally worth it!!. You could easily spend two days here!! I was able to see a penguin feeding, a shark feeding, and a turtle feeding which was amazing. They also have this kelp display which is just relaxing to sit there and watch it sway beautifully and the fish swimming, very soothing. This is such a great aquarium and to be able to see life and environments in two different oceans is great and the price is very affordable. If I lived in Cape Town, I would totally buy the yearly pass haha. As you can tell, I loved this place and would highly recommend it!!
Good on a wet day. A very pleasant few hours spent in the aquarium on a wet afternoon. Some interesting displays and the main tanks are superb.

Beautiful Aquarium. The Aquarium is situated conveniently next to the V and A waterfront.There is so much of Marine life to see.The most Beautiful fish and other creatures of nature.There is also a shop that stocks all types of souvenirs to buy as gifts.I reall enjoyed the visit.was well worth it.A must see for all visitors.

Outing to get indoors. It was raining and I need a place to pass the time. I've been to a few aquaria through the years Monterey, San Francisco, Lisbon and a few more. This one had a few species that are local and that med the place interesting. Especially the little penguin colony. A little run down but fun for kids!

Penguins in Two Oceans Aquarium. Although I was a bit in a hurry I thoroughly enjoyed visiting the Aquarium.A very interesting exhibitions which you could not miss walking upstairs was about the plastic we have left in the ocean. Great to be made aware of it again! High point was the feeding of the penguins: we had seen them already in Boulders Beach in freedom. One penguin dropped his meal in front of our eyes - I hope he got another fish?

Aquarium visit. We went on a public holiday and it was very busy with children however the kids watching the various displays was also fun. Very well laid out and the fish varieties were many. Some displays were interactive and overall the facility is well worth a visit in central waterfront.

Excellent day out, worth the visit. My children thoroughly enjoyed the aquarium, seeing different variety of fish and enjoying the shows , it turned out to be a great family day out . A definite visit for those parents who want to entertain their kids.
Good on a wintery or rainy day. Who doesn't love a visit to an aquarium? This one is fabulous and worthwhile for the whole family. Fun and educational.

A fishy kind of tale. The Two Oceans Aquarium offers a number of exhibits for both young and old. There are a number of interactive exhibits, including the touch tank. There is a children’s play area downstairs with timed puppet shows and a small snack bar. This area also offers a lovely view of the penguins playing and diving in the water. Time your visit to coincide with the penguin or shark feeding times for an extra special experience. For a little relaxation, the kelp forest exhibit is the place to be. The Aquarium is generally a busy hive of activity though with lots of children enjoying the exhibits, including school outings in the mornings. The Aquarium is expanding and we are looking forward to enjoying the new exhibits later this year.

Nice but very basic. I enjoy it here but honestly it's not very special. The glass of the tanks is all misty and grim. Could do with replacing the tanks as obviously cleaning isn't helping. The staff are okay but mostly absent or having conversation amongst themselves.The penguin enclosure is an overpowering smell which is revolting. I understand penguins are the kind of animals that no matter how much upkeep they are given are bound to smell but this takes it to a whole new level. The place is worn unfortunately and looks tired. You can do the whole place in under an hour which isn't right. It's not a day trip. Screaming children and kids running around are constant. It's not outrageous to put up signs asking children to remain attended to at all times. The shark show is nice but the sharks unfortunately aren't very impressive and they are supposed to be the main attraction, and to have fish on display that are bleeding and shredded is not pleasant. The turtle is gorgeous but I believe they should have a separate section of more than one turtle and give them a beach area. The turtle has no choice to enjoy sand and air, she/he must swim around in circles all day with the fish. Very sad
Don't miss the penguins!. Not the world's best aquarium in my opinion, but a very fine one. I especially enjoyed the penguin exhibits and the predator feeding.

Thoroughly enjoyed our trip. Although my 3 year old toddler was not all that intrigued, but for a good hour managed to get excited about the animals she recognised, her favourites were of course the clown fish(Finding Nemo influence of course), the starfish and turtles.I think perhaps there should be more entertaining buts for the younger children definitely luring us for more frequent visits!

Lovely aquarium - loads of cool things to see. Good sharks, a load of lovely penguins and brilliant exhibits with loads of different types of fish. A good place to spend a couple of hours at the waterfront - especially if you are into marine biology.

Concert in the Shark Tank. What a gorgeous venue for a Music concert!!!The Shark Tank at the Aquarium is set in a round auditorium & the musicians set up in front of the tank with a gorgeous backdropSnacks & drinks can be organised independantly & brought in for the functionWould love to do a black tie event in this venue with a long dinner table in front of the tank gorgeous food & great music !!!Have still to walk through the rest of the Aquarium but have heard it is fantastic !
Family Fun!. If you have kids then this is one attraction worth taking them to! Lovely interactive Aquarium. Fun for the whole family!

The kids loved it!!. Great adventure for children of all ages. So much to learn and see. I was amazed at all the species to see. Awesome memories. Brilliant interactive stuff and great feeding of the fish shows.

Funny looking penguins. When arriving to this aquarium you might think it's one of those touristy attractions where you pay a lot of money and won't get anything back. But when you get in and go through the first floor it's just great, amazing and WOW! The first floor is mostly about smaller fishes (Nemo, squid, ...) and then you get to the second floor with funny looking penguins. Those guys do not realize that, but they're better than those ones on Boulders beach.
Great collection of aquatic life. Interesting displays and fantastic collection of various marine life. Info boards describing the creatures were lacking in useful or interesting facts.

A lovely family outing. It is doubtful that you will be disappointed with this family outing, which will easily keep you and the kids busy for 'at least' half the day. So plan your time carefully.Enjoy seeing the most fascinating and interesting of sea creatures that you would not ordinarily be able to see. You will be amazed and will also learn so much. There is much to see and enjoy.Your will walk away having taken 100's of photos.

Enjoyable experience. I was a bit skeptical about visiting a place where fish are in captivity, but I was glad to see only 3 large fish, two of them ragged tooth sharks, of which they follow a release program. Wonderful for kids, not cheap for adults at r130. Lots of memorable photo opportunities, especially amongst the Nemo clownfish
worth a look. I went with some people I met in SA its pretty big and there's plenty to see I'm a big shark fan and I love aquariums this one is in my top 10.

My Day at the two Oceans Aquarium.. WOW, what a lot to see and do. Curio shops and eateries to all kinds of water animals (fish) from Microscopic organisms to big fish. Feeding of the sharks a must see. And the penguin feeding well even in the bird kingdom do you get your different characters, that are all to willing to put on a show.
The life from the two oceans. The life from the two oceans (Atlantic and Indian) are very well presented here. Even seals and penguins can be watched at close distance. And the sharks!!!

Worth a visit. Well, I was very happy that I went to Betty's Bay to see the real penguin. After seeing them here I was not really interested in going to see themBut the pinguins at Betty's Bay was worth it, don't miss to see themThe aquarium, yes, why not if you have some time to kill

Not Monterrey Bay. After several trips to Monterrey Bay aquarium, this was a big disappointment. It's likely fine for aquarium newbies and is very inexpensive, but the venue is small and uninspiring. Imagine it is great for families with kids.

Great place for all kids (plus adults!). The aquarium is a must visit if one has children. Great exhibits although they are constantly improving so some areas were closed. Currently the frogs!It is always busy so get there early.It is one of the best aquariums in the world and especially great for kids with a touch pool where they can touch and things are explained. The wave pool is always a favourite as are the places were kids can crawl into the exhibits! Great fun for the entire family!

Amazing aquarium. This aquarium is superb.The variety of species and layout is great.We were absolutely amazed by all the sea life on show...especially the predator tank.The informative guide with his demonstration was lovely to listen to and very knowledgeable.Great place to take the kids ....and us adults too.

Worth a visit.. We were looking for somewhere to fill in a few hours and with the weather being so beautiful decided to stroll through the V & A Waterfront to the Aquarium. Lots of interesting displays & facts. Popular with kids & adults alike.
Great aquarium to visit. Great displays of the sea creatures and the opportunity to touch sea urchins was good. Fantastic large pool with sharks and turtles worth a visit for all the family.

Childrens delight. A great place to spend an informative morning with eager youngsters when the weather is bad. Unfortunately as with public attractions that are high use areas, this one has become a little worn and in need of a bit of tlc. Don' t let this put you off though as it is still a highlight of the Waterfront. Would not however recommend the restaurant for more than a colddrink or coffee.

What a great aquarium!. One of the best aquariums I have ever been too! loved it! the sharks were awesome and the giant turtle! And also, I have never seen so many Nemo's in my life! we watched the penguins being fed, so so cute!

Best time ever. Had the best time with with my family. They are super child friendly and have really friendly and helpful staff. You can have a snack and drink halfway through your vissit at the kiosk. And there are couple of restaurant options availible outside and nearby.

A must for anyone visiting Cape Town. We had been here many times when we lived in Cape Town - this place was amazing then and is now even better (12 years after our last visit). Many superb smaller displays, with an excellent touchy-feely display. Superb display of a number of a number of water environments (i.e. rock pool, riverine, etc). The piece de resistance is obviously the 2 massive tanks (sharks and Cape marine environment) - the latter remains my favourite, despite having dived in the shark tank all those years ago. Magnificent - and what a location!! Don't miss this one!!

Worldclass display. It is a good half day experience and well worthwhile spending time at the aquarium. It is not only informative but entertaining and very well displayed. I have seen others, but this one is one of the very best in the world.
World class. This aquarium is world class. The displays are magnificent and unusual. A perfect way to spend a day in Cape Town.Ideal for adults and children alike.
My beautiful Cape Town. Situated on the Waterfront. Very interesting. Put it on your list to visit especially if you have young children.

Average aquarium. It has been a while since they updated this aquarium. We spent half a day at this attraction (mainly due to bad weather outside) and for the most part were not impressed by it. We think it lacks a main attraction - most aquariums or zoos around the world has that..

Great way to spend a couple of hours!. We were meant to be heading to Robben Island but the weather meant all trips to the Island were cancelled, so we spent the morning at the Two Oceans Aquarium.We really enjoyed our visit although it's not a huge aquarium. All the tanks were clean and crystal clear with good information boards next to the tank. We loved the Nemo tank (who wouldn't!) and pleased to see that the aquarium pretty much focussed around the oceans around Southern Africa. The tank with the sea kelp was fab and helped you understand what was living in the sea around you. Our son loved the predator tank with the ragged tooth shark and was very impressed with the fish that was still alive having had two chunks taken out of him!!We had completed a circuit of the aquarium and decided to head back to watch the penguin feeding. There were also school visits taking place and if you sit quietly at the back, you get to learn more about the sealife than just reading the info - great questions from the school kids! One huge plus point to the aquarium was the "photo booth" camera before doing into the penguins ... all photos taken are uploaded to a website accessible FREE via facebook (you can download or have an email copy sent to you) - our son loved it as did everyone else. I wish the tourist places in the UK whould follow your lead rather than use photos as a pure money making exercise as only a small minority of people buy. This way I am sure everyone will download and share their "Two Oceans Aquarium" photos.

Very nice, especially for kids. The Two Oceans Aquarium is located in the Waterfront area. It is very kid-friendly. It is a relatively small aquarium with a lot of different fish, but also penguins. The entrance fee is not high and worth the experience of the aquarium,

Disappointing, avoid. Unless you have never been to an aquarium, I would not waste time going here. It is small and frankly not many great exhibits/species to see. The best was the penguin enclosure but anyone with a few days in Cape Town can see them and more at Boulder's beach! So, don't waste yor time and money on this.

A good exhibit for families. This is a great exhibit for catching a glimpse of the ocean life in the southern hemisphere. The numbers of fish and sea mammals was impressive. The facility is well suited to children and wheel chair requirement.
Worth a visit!. I have been to Atlantis Dubai aquarium and the Two Oceans Aquarium is at par with Atlantis Dubai, if not better!worth a visit!
Good day out,Must visit location in Cape Town. Great,informative content with so much to see.Lots of fun for the entire family and it happens to be a great experience

two oseans aquarium. I must say I were a bit disappointed with the aquarium. I must say I really have expected more . They were busy with some sort of renovations. The fish in the tanks were quite an attraction. Some tanks were empty. The seahorses were fantastic to look at

Worth it!. What a wonderful place to visit. Worth. Every. Cent. We took our 9 month old and he slept for 2 hours afterwards! We enjoyed the beautiful displays and the animals are awesome!Such a treat every time we're in Cape Town.
What a place to visit for young and old. What a fantastic place if you like fish!!!! and more, must be the best Aquarium in Africa to visit you will not be disappointed.

Ideal pass time. Not only is it educational and fun but it's also a perfect way to see aquatic life you don't get to see everyday. The aquarium also has a tank where you can touch some of the anemones. Guaranteed, kids will enjoy it!

Kid friendly destination for rainy days. Kids of all ages love this Aquarium. It is well layed out and the staff are very well informed. My kids love doing crafts near the fish tanks at the end of the ramp and the frog and penguin area is a treat.
Gorgeous. One of the best aquariums you'll ever see. Myriads of fish kinds and huge displays. You can also touch some species, and have photos with nemo fish all around you

Great aquarium. A must see when in cape town, we all enkoyed it young and old one of the most beautiful aquariums. highly recommended. Close to V and A waterfront, nice to walk around there and enjoy a sundowner cruise

A very nice aquarium, but not up to the Baltimore, USA aquarium standards but it is reasonably priced.. My wife really enjoyed this place. The highlight was being able to get "inside" several aquariums for unique photo. Kids throng this place.

Great experience for all ages.. Great aquarium with friendly knowledgeable employees. They also offer diving experiences in the shark tank, aswell as in the Kelp forest tank. Our instructor Robert was very freindly and kept the sharks at a safe distance, while risking his own life. Well, sort off!

Great Winter escape. Amazing viewing and education for the kids from the pop your head up Nemo display to the GIANT aquarium (not sure the Ragged tooth sharks agree with me there0 but the Penguin display is perfect to show your young ones how they waddle swim and get fed.
Great idea for all the family. Very interesting and informative. Well worth a visit. If you go on Sundays you will se shark feeding - can exit and return if you wish - great idea )
Great way to spend a rainy day. Visited here on a cold, wet afternoon in Cape Town, it was a great way to spend a couple of hours. Some lovely displays and the very informative.

A great place to spend time. What a fascinating place.The tanks are well laid out to view all the fish and sea dwellers including corals.The tanks vary in size with everything leading to the massive predator tanks with sharks, turtles, tuna etc.Enjoyable for all ages

My son loved the sharks. The 2 Oceans Aquarium is a wonderful attraction for a family with children. They have a restaurant with a play area and the aquarium is a huge hit with inquisitive kids. My 4 year old son love sharks and I could hardly tear him away the display glass. Great place to visit during your stay a the V&A.

Fantastic Aquarium. I have been to the aquarium a few times and it never gets boring! There is always something interesting and the staff really do a fantastic job of doing the best presentations. It's informative, interesting and magical, one of my favourite places in Cape Town.

Second visit. I visited this aquarium in 2000 and it came across as being new and improved. In January 2014, it has the feel of being a little dated and could do with some refurbishment. Having said that, the displays are all still interesting and fun.

Wonderful attraction for young and old. Couldn't recommend the aquarium enough. It is entertaining, educational and wonderous to see and spend time with creates of the ocean in such close proximity. I have been to a number of aquariums across the world and this one ranks high as one of the best. You will not be disappointed.
Great. We had a great time, saw a lot of different aquatic creatures and got a photo with a ragged-tooth shark! Perfect for a family outing or just for discovering and learning about nature.

Good, not great. We visited Cape Town in their winter season, and were looking for something to do on one of the colder, rainier days, when we decided to stop in here. If we had come with very little kids I think we could have easily spent hours here, but the aquarium wasn't large enough to fill too much time for anyone a bit older. It's a good stop to escape from the bad weather, but a little on the expensive side for a short stop.
Great educational experience. Interesting, entertaining and educational attraction. Our family spent 2 hours inside and able to thoroughly cover all exhibits.
Great for a rainy day. This must be one of the best aquariums I have seen in AfricaAlso lots of playgrounds for Kiddies, really family friendly

Good for a rainy day. It is not a big aquarium, but it has a little bit of everything. There are many taks with different species. There is also a place with African penguins and one other where some penguins are treated and medicated. I took my kids there because it was raining too much for outside activities and because the aquarium was close to our hotel, but I don't recomend it unless you find yourself without better options.

Beautiful setting and very nice aquariums with lots of varieties of sea creatures.. If you visit the CT waterfront and have 2 hours to spare go visit this aquarium. It's not big and lacks the open pools with big sea animals but the displays of aquarium is very good and interesting. Definitely a good place to introduce kids to the sea creatures and the risks of pollution, destruction of inhabitat.
Its Alright. Its good but Ushaka in Durban is better I think for an overall experience especially if you have a family...

Good Aquarium for Cape Town. Good but not perfect. Could be more and better visualized information on the plates. At our vistit in June, there was a special exhibition about frogs. Nice for Kids. The Aquarium is not very big.

Fun for both kids and adults. This place is great to take the kids to during the school holidays. The aquarium is very well run and is quite mesmerizing seeing such an array of sea life right in front of you
I was expecting more. This is a good option to kill some time if the weather is bad but frankly I was a bit disappointed. It is quite small and very average as aquariums go.

Always a special outing!. This was our 3rd visit to the Aquarium. Previous times the children were younger, but now they are teenagers and enjoyed it in another way. My eldest is a keen photographer and the youngest is fond of penguins - needless to say they took a LOT of photos and spend most of their time with the penguins! My mom also joined us and enjoyed as much - the seats at the big tanks helps a lot to rest the legs for a while!

Best kids attraction. This has to be the best attraction for kids, especially when the weather is bad and you don't know what to do with them. They can spend hours looking at the fish and there are added puppet shows and kids activities to keep them busy. For locals, the annual membership is an absolute must and best value for money spent.

small but beautiful. I was surprised of how small the aquarium is, but it has some amazing animals that I had never seen. The big water tanks are worth the visit and for me, the penguins that I absolutely love.This is probably a 2-hour visit.Spend a few minutes to seat in front of the Kelp Tank and find out how relaxing it is to just watch it move form side to side.

under the sea in Cape Town. a wonderful child friendly outing for cold winter days. Situated in the V&A can be accessed by local mi city bus.there are interactive activities for the little ones and a very good selection of marine life to enthral the adults.

Great collection of fish and other water animals. They have a wide range of beatiful fish, pinquins, etc. The best thing was the sharks and the giant turtles. Especially our little daughter loved this place.

WORLD CLASS AQUARIUM. We have been to the Aquarium several time with my partner's grandson. He (3 years old) loves the place and knows where all the exhibits are. The tanks are always clean and well kept, fish seem well fed.Highly recommended for families, tourists and anyone with even a passing interest in teh sea

Enjoyed our visit. Great place to visit if you have a couple of days in Cape Town, especially with kids. We were reluctant in the beginning, but decided to go because of our teen age boy. We are glad we went. We got to see the fish we had never seen before. They have also maintained the displays well.

June 2014. Nice place to take the kids. As you enter there is a nimo cylinder that you can get into and take a pict with all the Mimi's around. They have kids play area food court and games for children vast variety of fishes.

Been many times and still love it. I always enjoy every minute here , even squeezing myself into the "nemo " tank meant for kids , but some areas fun , others quite dramatic and all in all every educational
Great winter activity. Stunning place to take kids , especially in winter holidays when it is cold out. They always enjoy to see the sealife

Fish escapes. One of the greatest aquariums visited. The size belies the scope and extent of the exhibits and creatures on show. The diversity of the two oceans of the Cape are wonderfully presented. The shark tank is amazing and also offers the opportunity to dive with the raggies (qualified divers only). A great experience. The new exhibits that are due to open shortly will enhance the experience.

Life under the two oceans. I remember visiting aquariums when I was a kid, and having to peer through tiny windows while hoping a fish swims past. Modern aquariums in general, and the Two Oceans Aquarium in particular, has HUGE windows, and it is easy to imagine you are right in there with the fish or sharks. With SCUBA diving so prohibitively expensive, visiting this aquarium is still the cheapest and most satisfying way to see the fish-life that is found in our local seas. The kelp forest is my favourite by far, and it is so relaxing to sit there and watch the kelp sway to and fro and to and fro and.....oops, I just fell asleep!

Good place to kill some time and worth the money.. Raves from the locals brought us here however we are fortunate enough to of visited a few of these venue and found this one nice but not great. Short easy visit so plan on maybe 90 minutes. A huge indoor mall nearby and a great market place as well will take you a couple of days to see. Saw some where online that we should visit Long Street which is about fifteen blocks away. Do not do this! It was pushy bums trying to panhandle and scanners ( People trying to copy your charge cards as you walk). Security was OK but not great in this area.
A very good family outing.. Ideal for children and adults alike. Make it part of a days visit to the V & A Waterfront . Enjoy 2 hours wandering around the various tanks especially the Shark Tank !

Great for kids!. Brought my 5 year old niece for an afternoon at the aquarium and she loved it! The interactive exhibit was her favorite and she absolutely loved the shark tank. Would definitely bring her back.

terrible drivers, must mean bad service. Im sure parents and teachers would love to know how recklessly your mini bus vehicle driver's, drive. Cutting me off and then because I hooted, dropping back a trailing me all the way to my office with brights on and right up the back of my car. Well your scare tactics don't work and I will let everyone I know about this incident, including my PR friends who have connections to the press. #notimpressed
Two Oceans Aquarium Visit. Very Interesting especially for children. Very varied from many different fish species , penguins and sharks. Well worth a visit

Average. The staff is friendly and helpfull. The displays of all the fish types are very interessting, but i do feel that that the entrance fees are a little bit to expensive for the amount of things to see.

Great rainy day activity . We spent one foggy rainy day in Cape Town and toured the aquarium. Lots to see. Cool aquarium and great location. Very clean and a friendly staff. We are used to the Georgia Aquarium and the Tennessee Aquarium, so it was very small in comparison to those. Close encounters with penguins and birds in one area. Some great displays and interactive areas.
its fishy..... A good place to visit with family. We enjoyed the shark feeding time and the session after that. We also got to hold star fish in our hand. Over all a good experience.
Lots for young kids. Fabulous setup with many interactive zones and great combination of information & things to see. Well maintained, with professional staff and great coffee at the restaurant
Great variety of marine life. Worth a visit if you are at V&A waterfront. The whole walk through can be done in 1.5 hours. There is a good variety of marine life to view.Innovative displays.
Kids holiday expereince. Lovely experience well set out with interactive opportunities for the children and loads of entertainment. I love seeing fish life so close up

Penguins are amazing!. Not a very large aqarium however there is a variety of fish on display. The dispaly's have good descriptions which enable one to identify the type of species and provides additional information about the species. The penguin area was definately the best....

Always fun. Always fun to spend 2 hours walking through the aquarium. Fun outing for kids. 'Interactive tide pools' and play area for kids. I have 2 kids (2 & 5 years old), we are regular visitors to the aquarium.

Nice for a 2 hour visit with the children. The aquarium is small but nice for a short visit. I must admit I am spoiled with the Steinhart's Aquarium in San Francisco and the Monterey Bay Aquarium in Monterey, California. If Cape Town's weather is challenging or if young children are restless this would be nice stop for a couple of hours in the afternoon. The fish are beautiful and the exhibits well maintained.

Amazing outing.. Always good fun taking a walk thru the Aquarium. Must say one of the best outings I have. They go out of there way to show you in detail all that is going on under the sea. Please spend some time at the Aquarium nest time you in Cape town. Well done to management for keeping the place up to date and clean.

Small aquarium, bad practice. Its a pretty small aquarium with not much to see. The reason for the low grading is also because of their practice of catching juvenile sharks and releasing them as adults. I can only compare them to one other aquarium I have been to but it was not the experience we were expecting. I did like the South African initiative of colour coding fish for the consumer to better work on preservation.

A world class commercial natural experience. I must admit, my soft spot is always for aquariums. There’s an inner desire of mine to always visit aquariums and see the underworld beasts. I’ve seen some shocking aquariums abroad. This one is top notch and definitely about preserving nature. The little creatures come first above everything else, as opposed to plonking fish into a display tank for entertainment purposes. There are environment protection initiatives and projects, so well worth supporting these guys. Whether you older or young, everything is geared for everyone. It can be a morning thing or an entire day thing, you set your own pace.

Dive delight. We needed a weather day option as we were visiting Cape Town in the winter so we booked a dive experience at the aquarium.The shark diving in the ocean is completely weather dependent and we wanted to have a guaranteed dive experience. We booked the dive experience with the aquarium and as some of us were not dive certified we did the Discover Scuba course with Iain who is associated with the aquarium.He gave a great and easy to do course. We traveled to a nearby military base to do the dive course and Iain guided us through the technicalities of diving. It was great to have all of the dive scenarios practiced in a pool first.We then returned for our dive at the aquarium. We first dived in the Predator tank. It was fantastic to be so close to Ragged Tooth sharks in complete safety. The dive was very easy and Iain was attentive and made sure we were all comfortable and safe at all times.The experienced divers then had the great opportunity to dive in the Kelp tank. This was really pretty and was like diving in the kelp in the ocean without the potential surprise of a predator. The fish were inquisitive and very pretty and the tank really pretty to dive in. One can see why only sufficiently qualified divers can dive there as it is moderately technical as well as the delicate kelp can't be damaged.The only way to experience sea life and what an honour to have done it.

Great kids attraction if you have spare time. Table mountain, safari, lion's head, 12 apostles, sun, beaches. Cape Town has so many other great attractions for adults. The aquarium is proper, entertaining and tidy, but personally I've seen much more splendid and better aquariums in the world beside this one. If you have kids, this aquarium might be a good cool area for them to spend 2-3 hours. But if you are adults, I think you might find yourself entertained outside this place

Great for kids, even if you've been to other aquariums. Our son really liked the little tank that you could sort of crawl up underneath and stand on a little stool in the middle of it, so that the fish were swimming all around you. It's not really big enough for parents to accompany :) We also liked the stadium seating around the huge aquarium, was a nice place to sit and rest and let our son climb up and down the steps. The penguins were great, more specious than you can see at Boulders, though obviously you go to boulders to see thousands of them in a natural habitat. It's very pricey, as these types of attractions seem to be. There's a little touch tank for kids to feel, and in general, we'd recommend it for families who have gone to aquariums before, it has enough nice things to offer. Of course, it can be very crowded and full of screaming kids. Duh. Still fun.

Lovely Aquarium, Great for Kids. The Two Oceans Aquarium is a fun and interactive aquarium. They have a large range of fish and water critters as well as sharks and cape penguins. The aquarium is also in a great location, nearby to a food market and many waterfront shops.

A Cape Town Gem. The aquarium will give everyone a peep in the living ocean. From coral reefs to the darkets depths to enjoy a spectacular view of hidden nature. The added scientific information and the sharing of science with tourists by trained staff of the aquarium is very valuable. The shop was excellent and grandfather bought his grandson a Nemo
Nice small aquarium. Small but nice aquarium in the centre of Cape Town. Nice to visit for an hour and a half. Good with children all ages!

breathtaking. excellent. atmosphere was great as it felt like you are under the sea. We enjoyed it but I time was too short as we went in by accident, when it was almost closing. However we had a good time.

Very enjoyable experience!. Definitely worth visiting! The predator exhibit is amazing - a massive viewing window kept us at this exhibit watching the sharks up close! In complete contrast we loved the penguins - so cute!

Great Outing for any age and little ones too.. The aquarium is a very interesting and fun place to visit for any age even more for little ones. I took my daughter there for the first time and she loved it, they have the tunnels where kids can play around. We spent most of our afternoon there and the little ones dint want to leave. Its just a great indoor activity that is perfect for everyone and I will go back.

Waterworlds. This is a lovely attraction for the family. There are special little tunnels for children to pop up for little photo opportunities. It's no Sea World however it's wonderful to see the beautiful and diverse colours of fish, crustaceans and penguins. There are interactive educational displays about conservation. There is also a gift shop for souvenirs and the onsite restaurant does children's parties too.
Very cool. Well laid out and very educational with great displays. We spent much more time there than initially intended (and very happily so). Looking forward to my next visit already!

A wonderful experience for young and old (and everyone inbetween).... We have visited the Two Oceans Aquarium 5 times in the past 6 years and we never tire of the remarkable underwater experiences it offers. My personal favourite is the kelp forest and our son loves the penguins.
Beautiful Fish. There is a huge array of fish to see and they are beautifully arranged for great viewing. Such a worthwhile experience.

Under the sea!. Two Oceans aquarium (and also the boat tours) offer the nature lover a glimpse of the flora and fauna of the deep seas. The aquarium is well kept and maintained and the attractions are amazingly captivating. It is educational for people of all ages and backgrounds. The boat tours are also enjoyable especially for learning more about the history of the Waterfront and the bay area.

Very impressive. It is a couple of years since i have been to this aquarium and I was stunned. The lay out was good, leading from one exhibit to another. There was plenty opportunity for learning. Well informed personnel and volunteers was around. It was a pleasurable morning for children, pensioners and everybody in between
3 floor aquarium!. I've been to the aquarium once and adored it! It has three floors with cool animals such as: penguins,clownfish(which were my favorite) and manta rays.
Good place for kids!. Smaller than I expected, kids might love the place. Croweded wjth many students. A little bit bored to old lady :)
Love the fish!. This was a fun place, especially for kids. Good shark exhibit. And it is right by the hop on/hop off bus and shopping. Good location.
Great day out for all ages. Absolutely brilliant!!! Especially the penguin section. Getting to watch them feed the penguins and learn more about them is so much fun!!!

Magnificent, always a treat, well managed, layed out and enterrtaining. I have visited the aquarium many times and each time is a treat, time just flys buy as one is absorbed into this new world, a really great experience, I seen many aquariums and this is certainly top 10 stuff

Educational and Entertaining!. The Two Oceans Aquarium, in the V&A Waterfront complex, is well worth a visit.I found it interesting since it compares and contrasts the differences between the fish and plants found in the Atlantic (a turbulent and colder ocean) with those filling the same ecological niche in the Indian Ocean (a warmer and more placid ocean and thus in major aspects a different environment). The similarities are striking, but the differences can be amazing.It's not that large as aquariums go, and you can see pretty much what you want to in a morning or afternoon; indeed, a couple hours would give you most of the high points. There's something for everyone, even the kids - especially if they like sharks. And don't forget to check out the penguins (yes, they have penguins in South Africa).

Beautiful Marine life in the Two Oceans Aquarium Cape Town!. The Two Oceans Aquarium is a must see in Cape Town! The variety of marine life is absolutely beautiful! It is a great family activity as well as a educational outing. I definitely recommend visiting them!
Good educational family fun. Interesting for the whole family. Highly educational. Great for kids. Great family activity. Recommend!

TWO OCEANS AQUARIUM AT THE V & A WATERFRONT. The aquarium can be rated as a 'must see' in Cape Town for an excellent outing lasting as long as you want. You can eat good food in the cafeteria or shop too. Their visual presentation of all the fish and all other creatures of the Atlantic ocean mainly in almost their natural habitat is a spectacular attack on your senses, as you experience it all close up with loads of information about each exhibition. Cameras are allowed and don't forget to visit the 360 degree shark tank which is under the water and of course the penguins!

Sea creatures all over you. Next to the V&A waterfront is the famous 2 oceans Aquarium that provides a good insight about the life of sea creatures found in the oceans nearby. Large enclosures of sea creatures provides a good view of these creatures. Video shows and well marked posters highlight the information quite well. Kids specially have a lot to learn and also have a good play areas for entertainment. The shop near the exit does sell all the familiar merchandise and keep the kids busy most of the time.

Small but interesting. Small aquarium, but ok to pass some time on a rainy day. The penguin bit upstairs was good, but the rest is fairly run of the mill aquarium stuff. Too many school children for me too!

Swim with sharks..for fun!. half day training session on how to scuba dive and a half day swim in the tank at the aquarium! one of the best experiences i've had in cape town. children look upon you and instructors as you float calmly through the shark tank surrounded by large fish and turtles. look for shark teeth on the bottom! there are tons!! great experience and EXCELLENT instructor!!!!!
Wonderful experience. This is a great way to find out about the sealife living between the Atlantic and Indian oceans. Very well looked after and presented.

Must for little ones !!. Have been coming here since hanaa was 1.5 years old.Enjoyed it so much that we have become members and visit every few weeks.Even to the extent she has named the turtle her own name Timmy..and she loves shark feeding time on Sundays even though it gets very busy so get there early for prime seat.Rest of the aquarium is enjoyable as is the play area for small kids to enjoy and for adults to relax.A must for tourists and locals alike

Wonderful Aquarium. Great for adults as well as children. It is walking distance from the V & A Waterfront. The exhibits are clearly labeled and are very interesting. There are large tanks containing full size sharks and so many types of fish. There are also many penguins in an open area. Make note of feeding times. Well worth spending at least 2 hours there.

"a revisit after many years". as a family we visited the Aquarium after many years previously Danielle was about 10 now 30 Byron 4 now 24, Kyle did not go as he has the shivers to see what is below the waterline, the outing was a real treat for the family as the focus was more on the science, what is their habitat and where do you find them. a tranquil 2,5 hours experience followed by a good lunch at Theo's in Green Point.
Good for kids. I was expecting more from this aquarium. But overall, this is a good one, especially for travelers with kids, but for adults it will be better to go to penguin beach.

Take the whole family--a fabulous outing.. We took our children to Cape Town as part of their Christmas gift, and Two Oceans Aquarium was absolutely the biggest highlight for them. The exhibits are beautifully done, and the layout is easy for all ages: steps up so little people can see into tanks, amazing "bubble" tanks children can climb into and watch fish up close, and great hands-on exhibits that allow kids to touch urchins and corals and more. There is also push-chair rental if you've got an infant or toddler who needs one, and the museum has ramps everywhere, making it friendly to wheelchairs as well.The aquarium's location on the Waterfront makes it a great day out, as you can get your hand stamped, go out for a stroll or to eat (if you don't plan to eat in the Two Oceans Cafe'), then return later to see more. Our only disappointment was that the old warship anchored in the harbor next to the aquarium isn't open for visitors. My little boys looked at it longingly as we walked past!

Small but worth it. This relatively small aquarium gives you the opportunity to see a lot of creatures that you may not see anywhere else. The fish tanks are fabulous and clear allowing you to take really close pictures of the fish, crabs, starfish, etc. You only need 2 to 3 hours at the most.

Small, but interesting aquarium, lots of school children . Listening to light classical music while watching the kelp forest was a highlight.I visited the aquarium in the week during the school term, to be met by three large groups of primary school children. They did not warn us when we brought our tickets and since the aquarium is small, this meant that we had to wait a while to see the displays and navigate the corridors.

Great Aquarium - Sunday is shark feeding day......... The Two Oceans is a great aquarium for all ages with lots to see and do. Obviously the centre piece is the huge circular centre piece aquarium - I want one! Then by chance we actually visited on a Sunday so it was 'Shark Feeding Day' wow how exciting! We sat with the grandkids for about 30 minutes (you need to get sat down early because seating is limited) before the scheduled feeding time. Then the excitement mounted as divers appeared and then the presenter. Here we go fish carnage - how wrong. The sharks just wandered around with the divers almost having to force feed them. There was a bit of excitement however feeding the turtle was far more interesting. Perhaps the sharks were just having a quiet day.So the aquarium is brilliant seeing all sorts fish, and some are really big, swimming in a great environment but feeding time on a Sunday was a disappointment. My guess would be that if a shark is hungry then it will eat whatever and whenever it wants and in the tank there is plenty of options to have a different fish every day if it feels like it. On other days different feeding strategies are used so perhaps when they surface feed would be more interesting.One surprise was that the onsite café was very good and so was the gift shop. Also if you take the open top bus ride (recommended by the way) like we did because it was too windy for the cable car to operate, then you do get a discount entering the aquarium.

Kids and adults love. I wasn't sure if I should give this a 5 star but I did. The aquarium in Cape Town offers spectacular experience of what life is like for those amazing and beautiful creatures the aquarium has to display. One of my favourites is the shark world,if really feels like you are under water when you there. There are also lots of other things you can see but make sure you don't miss the sharks.

Cutest Penguins. Really, this is not really large aquarium but it had a couple of good things. They had a tank of clown fish (like Nemo) and you could crawl up inside it and it gave a completely different view of things. You could get a picture of that too.The other was the penguin area. They had 3 different types of penguins but I was able to get a couple of great videos of them. They are so fun to watch. If you like to have hands on, you could feed the fish r pet a starfish but other than that its a fast trip through the different areas.
Small but educational. This Aquarium is very nice for Adult and children to visit. The place is small but very educational for my children.
Awesome aquarium. An awesome aquarium with a great setup. Two of my highlights were the clown fish and their class tank and the incredible ragged tooth sharks in the predator display.

Amazing. I visit aquarium in every place I visit, and don't ask me why. I just love it. Maybe because here was the first experience visiting one overseas and it was the best thing I did. Huge and impressive. Good location, easy and interesting. You can spend hours just looking at the fish, sharks..

Great place . Was there with my family this month.Well maintained and great place for education as well as recreation .They have wide variety of fish and other reptiles and penguins too.Worth a visit if you are with kids .

Birthday Surprise. Wow and what a surprise. I couldn't go when it first opened but it was worth the wait when I went eventually. I though it was such an under the sea feeling and loved all the sea life on show. Would def recommend a visit there.

better than I expected. I was a bit sceptic about visiting Aquarium. My previous experience in London Aquarium was not that exciting as I expected it to be, relying on advertisement. But actually after visiting Two Oceans Aquarium, I must say it was very good. I really liked the predator aquarium, it was large and we could walk around it on different levels. Whole attraction was nicely arranged and clean. I must mention that there was something unique about the whole attraction. Atmosphere was laid back and relaxed. In some areas there were some sofas placed to sit and enjoy aquarium. I was pleased with my visit. However I would suggest to improve penguin area. Now I am probably comparing to other places I been to, however I truly believe that some improvements can be done in this area.

A must visit for young kids . A great way to spend 3 hours. Great displays. Huge display arena for the Sharks and Rays. Helpful staff. Touch Pool with anemones, star fish and other plants. A huge open area with penguins A microscope section where you will be amazed how the teeny weeny creatures look so intricate and beautiful when under the lens...

good but room for improovment!. Being a trained Zookeeper and have worked overseas in Aquaria for many years, I thought it is time again to visit the Two Oceans Aquarium again. The last time was about 10 years ago and I thought it is time again.As I said in the heading the Aquarium is good, really good!!Having said so, I still think it could do with more and better visitor involving info and displays. Many of the tanks look sterile and bare to me and out of my own work experience, more could and should be done.Some exhibitions are awesome but considering the size, I was done in roughly an hour and that is to quick for a display of this nature.When reading this review please bare in mind I'm a professional in this field and might have completely different expectations and views than the average visitor.

Calm and soothing, ocean life with classical music in the background. Well, it's an aquarium, but much better than Sealife or the likes and very unique in my view. Nice layout and arrangements, loved the calmness pervading the whole establishment, particularly the crabs, the kelp forest, sharks tank and of course the penguins but everything is great really and underscored by soothing classical music or by the sound of frogs in the terrarium where you get a sort of pond life, frogs and a river/water fall arrangement. It could be therapeutical and will definitely relax if you work a stressful job the rest of the year.I got an annual membership and went every few days while there for two months. It's worth it if you go at least three times.

Great way to entertain the kids. We had our year end function at Two Oceans and I must say I was impressed. Food was great and kept flowing and the fact that we could access areas to see the sea creatures it was great. I think it's a great way to keep the kids entertained while moms and pops relax in the restaurant with a book and a cuppa
just okay. everything is really based around a big round glass fish tank, only in one area are you able to walk under the glass and feel like you are actually in the fish tank

Wonderful day out. I often visit the Aquarium on my birthday - it is always a treat. Highly recommended not only if you are in Cape Town on holiday but also if you're a local looking for a fun day out.
Beautifully done. A wide variety of sea life, lighting is good in the tanks. I enjoyed the visit to the penguins the most.

We thoroughly enjoyed. We visited the Two Oceans Aquarium during December 2014 break with our 5-year old daughter who loves marine animals - sharks in particular. We enjoyed it completely. They a number of marine creatures. The set up is amazing. My daughter loves watching penguins and their young ones. We will recommend it highly.
Interesting. Beautiful place, friendly and helpful staff as in everywhere else in SA! It is very nice and interesting. I most liked to see the sharks and penguins. I visited in March 2014.

Great for Kids. Don´t miss the seals show!Kids and adults enjoy it, but if you´ve seen too many aquariums in other places of the globe, you can skip this one. But turtles, seals and penguins are soooo cute!

Great for little kids and the Big ones too. Loved this aquarium, felt like a little kid again, especially when I saw the "Nemo" display. It isn't too big so it can get a bit crowded but definitely worth spending a few hours here on a rainy day.
Nice on a rainy day. A decent aquarium with a lot to see but not to big and can be crowded, but a nice place to spend a few houres on a rainy day, kids will love it..
I love it!. The aquarium is great for both adults and children! A lot you can learn and definitely some things you wont see everyday! Well worth it.

Behind the Scenes. Thoroughly enjoyed a "behind the scenes" tour with a work group. The guide was extremely friendly and knowledgeable and took a personal interest in the group and their needs. The real work of the aquarium is revealed and how much goes into making the public exhibition happen. Very inspiring and impressive. Can't wait to visit once the extension has been completed!

Great for children. My friend and I were volunteering in an orphanage and we took 11 kids (3-6 years old) out to visit the Two Oceans Aquarium. They were fascinated by all those different fishes and creatures they were seeing. You can take nice pictures when they get in the middle of the clown fish tank. As you go on, you can touch and take some animals in the touch pools. The forest exhibit and the predators exhibit are also very impressive with their large windows.Bathrooms are only at the entrance/exit so be prepared for that.

An ok Aquarium. Having visited a lot of Aquariums around the world, the Two Oceans Aquarium offers a relatively acceptable variety of species.You do get a good value for money with tickets at R125 for adults and R60 for kids.Good fun for an afternoon!
Nice diversion. We liked seeing the marine life for this part of the world, but felt the type on the placards was too small to see in the light available.

Great family fun. I love the aquarium, since I was a child, and I still love it. It is slightly on the expensive side now. But still wonderful to visit. It has a variety of fish and the tanks seem clean.

Unbelievable. You need at least four to five hours o enjoy the exhibitions. The kids will love the interactive exhibitions and the big tank, which is close to the end of the tour, remains one of my favorite parts of the aquarium. Well worth the effort for the whole family!

Real Value for Money. R 125 for Adults R 60 for KidsOpen 365 days a year from 09h30 until 18h00Shoreline Café is open from 09h00 to 18h00 (kitchen closes at 17h30) Feeding times:• I&J Predator Exhibit ‐ Daily at 15h00• Shark feeds - Sundays at 15h00• Ocean Basket Kelp Forest Exhibit ‐ Wednesdays and Saturdays at 12h00• River Meander Exhibit ‐ African penguins daily at 11h45 and 14h30• AfriSam Children’s Play Centre ‐ Rockhopper penguins daily at 11h30

Lots of Nemo. I expected a bit more from this aquarium. Information is quite poor and there is no explanation about the differences between the two oceans. We did like the microscope and the touching of the anemones and the tank with the clownfish. We also enjoyed watching the feeding of the penguins and the information given there was good.

Solo Traveller. I needed to use up a few hours before heading back to the airport, so i decided to pay the aquarium a visit. Its very well laid out, with lots of interactive things for the children. Lots of various fish and sea creatures.

A real treat. Loads to do for you and for children. A well run, well looked after aquarium- lots of educational information and so much to see- make sure you have a few hours to really take advantage.

Short visit but worthwhile. When wew were there, there were a lot of schoolkids but even this did not distract from the visit. They definately keep the best for last but the other tanks are also very nice to look at. You will definately see some interesting animals/fish...Good to do when you have an hour or so to spare.. Whether solo or accompanied it's worth the visit

A Must-See in Cape Town. We are a little jaded in regards to aquariums, but the Two Oceans Aquarium was frankly out of sight! Depending when you go, you really can have the place to yourself. The exhibits are informative and quite interesting, and for someone from the North-Western Hemisphere, the fauna is very interesting. We arrived just before the penguin feeding- it's a real treat you do NOT want to miss. The penguins are the stars of the show, and if you go during the week, there'll be hardly any crowds.The same can be said for the predator feeding- another do-not-miss opportunity. The Two Oceans Aquarium is perfect for kids of all ages- from 8 to 88 (and for Americans- a bargain to boot!).

Surpassed expectations. We went to the aquarium on our last day in Cape Town, after doing the bus tour. We had a few hours to use before our transfer. The aquarium was well laid out, and had lots of exhibits as well as specific displays etc at certain time of the day.We spent a good 90 mins or so here and enjoyed it. It provided some protection from the heat outside as well as being educational and reasonably priced. (There is a small saving if you've done the bus tour).

More than we expected. This actually was a last minute stop off but well worth it. Fantastic 'interactive' exhibit on the life cycle of shrimp and jellyfish given by an extrmely knowledgeable member of staff. Loads of other fish including a shark tank. Take your Red bus ticket for a discount on the admission price.

Perfect to kill an hour or two. The first day we were in Cape Town was quite cloudy so we decided to go to the waterfront and the aquarium. This entry price was pretty cheap and there were plenty to look at. There's a circular tank full of clown fish that you can climb under and watch them from the inside. They have an area with different types of penguins and you can even go diving in the shark tank.Its something different if have a few hours spare it's cheap enough. I'd recommend especially if you have children.
Nice with children. Nice place to spend 1-2 hours. Coolest thing for our children was a pool where we could touch some plants and starfish. Pinguin section is nice.
Two Oceans Aquarium at V&A. Excellent aquarium to visit, kids can also enjoy. It is colourful, clean, informative and with a variety.

An excellent aquarium. This was one the best aquariums I have visited. It is not overly huge but has many high quality tanks. It contains fish which illustrate the variety found in the two oceans around South Africa, the Atlantic and Indian. My personal favourites were the Kelp Forest Tank of which there are only three in the world and the gigantic spiders crabs. And of course there are sharks and a tank full of 'nemos'. It is located in the V & A Waterfront by the City Sightseeing bus stop - easy to get to.

Small and worth it. Such a good educative place for kids. Animals kept in excellent conditions, most of them were rescued on the coast. There is a dedicated place for children with puppets show and craft activities, You need 2 hours to visit and enjoy at its best

A must for every adult and child. The ocean is next to Cape Town. Every resident of this city should visit to see what is below the surface in their neighbouring area(s). It has a large variety of fishes in tanks to display their best features and keep them healthy. Very good value. I always leave there more determined to not pollute and to try to contribute to a green country.
Amazing. Great place for family outing especially kids , very educational. Had a good time . Enjoyed every moment...

Good but not the best. Staff generally are very quiet......the science lab was a very interesting stop and learnt a bit of new facts.......not too keen on the touch pool.......get there early as school group tours do start to arrive and get quite noisy and busy

Great day. The weather was bad so we decided to change our agenda and make our way to the Cape Town Aquarium. The Shark feeding and Penguin show is a must, but these happen on certain days and times, so make aure that you get there on time. This is truly a place for grown-ups and kids alike.
