The Aquarium really captured the mysteries of the sea, show casing not only the preditors but also the tiny entities which keep the ocean eco system going. Overall a great experience.

Average.... Spent an afternoon at the aquarium with my young daughter. We were slightly disappointed with the displays which looked tired and outdated. Routes through the aquarium are not clearly marked or obvious, which results in walking around in circles.

Got Penquins. The Penquins saved the day for me. Most aquariums have their niche to separate from average. The Penquins did it for me. Other than this, the attraction does offer a lot of species not typical. I was a little disappointed with smaller size or less than expected displays, but two additions are in their future.With the current size the aquarium was maxed out when I was here, so good for them!

Great place for families. Its conveniently located in the heart of the city. The ticket prices are reasonable . Friendly staff. Its a great place for families day out. They have several feeding sessions which are fun. They have huge variety of water creatures.
Would go back!. The aquarium is conveniently located in the heart of the V&A waterfront. So much to see and experience. The shark and penguin exhibit is a must see! Would definitely go back.

Another family friendly day out in Capetown. We spent most of the day at the aquarium which the children are still talking about. Facilities were nice and clean the puppet show was enjoyed by all. The show at the frog hall was a treat and lunch was good.The only negative, the lady at the microscopes was not patient with the children and spoke at such a high scientific level no child could follow what she was saying.

Blissful amazement. From the moment we are born, until the moment we give our last breath, humans have been able to admire mother nature. The Two Oceans Aquarium is a place where you can relax, take in all the beautiful colours and shapes (that we are usually not exposed to) with which the ocean floor is decorated.I am not an advocate of caged animals, but sadly we live in a time where this is one of the few places where they are still safe. This Aquarium is educational in environmental sustainability, preserving nature and marine life.My favourite part of the Two Oceans Aquarium is the jelly fish, illuminated in such a way that you are awestruck by their movement and colours.Take along your family, friends, lover, or go solo. This is a place of beauty and bliss.
Nice for everybody,. -whatever your age are, you will enjoy the Aquarium!The pinguins are the top experience to me, -so cute!
dont rush. take youre time and talke youre kids! don't rush because there is so much to see. you cant dothis in less then 2 hours, if you in a hurry, dont go

Delightful and very well managed.. This aquarium is a delight to families. It is well layed out, well kept and very well run. Children in particular are delighted by the many exhibits that cater specially for them. No visit to Cape Town is complete if missing a tour of the aquarium.

Excellent outing. This is a great place to spend a couple of hours whether on your own or with family. There are various displays ranging from tanks, to touch displays and penguin viewing areas. I will go again.

Lovely experience well worth a visit. Spent 3 hours walking around and also viewing the sharks being fed. Nice clean and very well organised visit. If its raining or windy, this is a very good spot to get out of the nasty weather and enjoy an afternoon next to the waterfront area .
PERFECT if you need to kill HALF DAY. very nice option to visit the place.i felt like a child again. amazed by the fishes and penguins. well located. big. a lot to visit.
What a great aquarium!. Excellent aquarium! Lots of specimens, great tanks and great info provided about each of the species. Highly recommend!

good attraction if you need to fill some time in your cape town visit. We enjoyed our time at the aquarium and it compared well with those we have in the UK. There are better things to do in Cape Town if you are only there for a few days.
Good family experience. Good for a bad weather day. Plenty to see and good location at the Waterfront. Penguins were good to see and the talk at feeding time was enjoyable.

It's ok.. If your into Aquariums you would probably like it. I'm 28 year old male and found it kinda boring. We went to the predator feeding and I thought it was a little in-exciting. Although I did think we were going to see sharks rip fish apart...that didn't happen.

World Class!. This is great for all. Loved the aquarium. Get a season ticket it is a little more than a once off entry and you can go back for free. There is just so much to see and do. Wheelchair friendly also. Allow time to sit in front of exhibits to watch feeding and just to watch the fish. Excellent!
great spot to visit. one of the touristy things we did on holiday in the cape - - very interesting, sharks and learning more about our seas was great

Enjoyable outing. Well layed out with good exibits. Students showing different forms of marine life within the aquarium were pleasant, informative and well received by the children in our party. Although the aquarium is small there is lots of different marine life on display. Affordable outing, worth doing particularly with children.

aquerium. situated in middle of water and 300 mts walking on bridge is neededwhales and big fishes with diffrent jewel fishes and reare sea horse fishes are worth of visitaqueriem is with all odren amenties

Really interesting. Our last morning before flight home and being a weekday we thought this would be a good place to fill a couple of hours or so between hotel check out and airport transfer.Good value entrance fee ( 131 rand each) and lots to see and experience, with excellent information provided on all the creatures on show. We could have easily stayed longer. Loved the marine forest and sharks of course but some of the other more quirky creatures just as good. We have told our cat that he is probably less intelligent than the octopus on show as he has not yet learned how to open his Whiskas himself. Lovely terrace to watch the seals at the rear and quality shop.
Family Holiday. Good break to keep children entertained. Personally felt it had a good variety of sea life and the children especially enjoyed the shark feeding

Two oceans Aquarium. Good viewing of all the fish, interesting talks. Loved the encouragement of water savings. Great touristy shop at the end of the tour, stocked full of a good variety of souvenirs.

Lovely displays. Very nice setup with the Indian & Atlantic displays set apart. A good amount of species on display. Found some of the areas cramped during the shows (penguin show) kids play area a very good touch. Overall a good spot to take kids .

Fun morning! . We both enjoyed the morning here together, much more than expected! Well presented and educational as well as fun and interesting. Good price for the visit especially as you can go in and out all day when you get your hand stamped. Worth a visit if you get the chance

Best indoor fun for tots. On a sunny day when the wind was too much for us, my four-year-old goddaughter and I ventured into the aquarium and had the best fun! She was completely engaged in the lavish exhibits and even I got caught up in the magic of underwater worlds. We sang soft lullabies to snoozing sea horses and laughed until our cheeks hurt as we stood inside the circular "Nemo" fish tank looking out at passing people through a dense shoal of lovely stripy fish. The interactive area was made more engaging by the staff who were sincerely interested in sharing the oceans with small children. The penguins were adorable too! The fact that here and there we came across a jungle gym or button to press or some other play activity made it easy to explore the entire aquarium over more than two hours. To complete the day, we had delicious milkshakes in the coffee shop and my goddaughter spent another happy hour playing with other children in a designated, equipped play area. The Two Oceans Aquarium was such a great place for quality bonding time that we now visit it regularly throughout the year - our first visit was in 2013.

Great Visit for all the family. Really enjoyed this trip, was quite busy with it being school holidays and we have been out of school holidays and it was certainly less busy, but that did not really detract from the visit. Parked in parkade opposite which is under cover and great for the whole waterfront. Took picnic lunch and ate it on the benches outside although was quite hot in the sun.

More than th ordinary aquarium!. This is facsinating and very well laid out. It is going to be even better when the new large walk through tank is completed. Beautiful, strange and sometimes scary fish - and a discount if you have sight seeing bus tickets.

Small but special. Small children love it here, they can interact with some sea creatures and they learn a lot! The give a puppet show that is quite good. Small cafe for a nice refueling break when we are done.
Take a pic with Nemo. Lovely morning outing with the kids to the aquarium! You can even have a picture taken with Nemo (clown fish)Well run and very educational with friendly staff
Top notch. We had a very good time at the aquarium. I actually prefer it to the Durban one - the educational aspect for the children is excellent.

good fun for kids. Great staff very friendly good price and great entertainment for young kids unfortunately they were upgrading displays when we were there so a little disappointed but was still good fun especially hands on with star fish etc
A must see for all. Exhibitions are breathtaking and the staff is friendly and professional. The perfect place for young and old to experience the wonders of the ocean world.

Excellent. What an absolutely beautiful experience! The penguins were my favourite part of the aquarium. I did the penguin encounter and got to hold rockhopper penguins- an experience everyone needs to have.Fantastic please support these amazing people helping marine life around Cape Town.
A must see. A good and impressive presentation of the sea creatures found around the western cape. Very informative tour.
Very nice.. Nice variety of marine life, great for families. Staff is very accommodating, wanted us to have a first class experience.
I've seen better aquariums. I've seen better aquariums. It's an old aquarium needing maintenance and update. The expectation was big but the visit was dissapointing.

Awesome marine life collection. I visited this place (R131 pp) with my family, last month, on a Sunday afternoon, and spent a wonderful three hours here. Even if you have seen fish/aquatic life before, you will still be awestruck by the vast and diverse collection exhibited here. My kid really the enjoyed standing in the specially created area, in between the Clown Fish tank; it creates a cute illusion of being in the water with the fishes, from the outside. This may be one of the best aquariums in the world and easily the most child-friendly too.It was nice to witness the penguin feeding (happens daily at 11h45 and 14h30) and we also got a chance to see the shark feeding (only at 1500 on Sundays) with some interesting commentary. The interaction with the Starfish and Anemones at the Touch Pool, with the help of some friendly volunteers, was also pleasant.Once we finished our aquarium tour, we had some delicious snacks (mainly seafood) at the adjoining Shoreline Café.Must-see in Cape Town!

Must see. Myself and my wife are from the UK and stayed in Cape Town and went to the aquarium at the water front.We were very much impressed with it as there was many species that we have never seen before!We would very much recommend visiting the aquarium!!!
Wonderful place. It is definitely a great place for a family trip and holds amazing tanks, filled with the most incredible animals.

Great place for the whole family.. It's a great place to take the whole family if you have a couple of hours in your schedule or if you want something to do inside. They have a good variety of animals and plant life, and it's always great to see penguins.

Best Aquarium we have ever seen. Another great experience an exceptional value for money place to visit in Cape Town. There where many tanks of fish as one would expect and everything well labelled, and as you progress round what at first looks like it is going to be just another aquarium things get bigger and bigger. Suddenly you realise you are being dwarfed by the size of an enormous tank with hundreds of fish from sharks and sting rays to small tropical fish and turtles. A crowd is gathering and suddenly you know why as four human legs appear in the water at the top of the tank, there follows a commentated feeding session by two divers one of who does most of the feeding while the other fends off the sharks with a long stick.You do not get a show like that at any aquarium we ever went to before.
Very nice. Cat fish here is one of the largest fish I have seen. Very good different sea mammals and a must visit for kids and children

Nice aquarium with an amazing collection of marine life. One of the few aquariums with such a wide variety of marine life and a key attractions of Cape Town. It is quite something to see a large whale in a glass aquarium. You can do this when you go to V&A waterfront, no need to plan to go separately. A couple hours should more than suffice unless you are an enthusiast in which case you can spend a fair bit of time here.
An awful lot of fish. The aquarium is at the V&A Waterfront and is well worth a visit. It houses an unbelievable range of marine life in excellent tanks. Everything from tiny seahorses to penguins.

You just can't get bored in this place. This aquarium has so many inhabitants and so much to see that you should aim to spend a few hours. Check shark feeding times so that you can be there for that, pretty impressive. But everything, from the little box fish to the unbelievably big west coast creatures, is beautifully accommodated and an absolute pleasure to watch. Stunning place.

We love going there!. This is one of my favorite places to go and 'get away' I love the way it is set up, and the helpful information next to each tank gives one a crash course in sea life education. There is always something on for the kids, and the coffee shop is ideal for a drink or a quick bite before you go. The prices are slightly high, so I don't go too often, but every visit was worth it.
Try the scuba diving. I did the scuba diving with sharks there. It was a great experience and a good price for it. Definitely worth it.

Family visit. What a fantastic visit, our kids enjoyed it so much that it made the teens act like toddlers running.from one exhibit to another. The facility is in great condition with very friendly and helpful staff. The volunteers at the various exhibits are very informative

It was well worth a visit. I have often wanted to go to the Aquarium but time was against us: on this occasion we were acting like tourists so we did a tourist visit. The fish displays were well presented and the ocean life many and varied. We took time, unlike many other visitors, to stop at the microscope exhibition where the less glamorous and excedingly small sea life was on display. The presenter was well informed and interested in her subject; we would recommend a stop at this display.We enjoyed the penguins on the top floor and felt it was a couple of hours well spent

If you plan to be in CapeTown again inside a Year. Buy the annual pass - which is like £3 more than the day pass. The shark tank for me was the standout. But the Finding Nemo tank that kids can stand inside, and the penguins enclosure are both good fun. Its no Seaworld. But then it only costs some £6 to go in. I had a nice time. I visited very early as it had just opened on a Sunday morning - and I almost had the place to myself.

An Average Aquarium. Having been to Cape Town before and heard about the Aquarium, I decided to visit it. The displays were nice but nothing special in comparison to other aquariums I have seen in other parts of the world.

A must see in the waterfront. There is a lot of effort in design of the tanks to allow for good views and clears explanations. This would suit families as evidenced by the school children queues and eager faces. The penguins are so cute and its as an experience to be less than a foot from the oystercatchers just before feeding time. The rock hoppers are looking quiet at the moment during a moult This was a good opportunity to speed visit from 2-3:15 the same day as arriving in Cape town when the kids were stills recovering from flight!

Penguins and sharks!. There was nothing to dislike about the exhibits - a touch pool, magnifying glass with a helpful volunteer and really good value! The souvenirs aren't anything to write home about, but take plenty of photos - there are heaps of opportunities.

Great way to spend a few hours.. It cost us R150 each (about £7) and crapped all over Deep Sea World which is the closest we have in Edinburgh. It was really good, very interactive. And we got to see penguins being fed. This happens twice a day and so worth it. The penguins were literally 2ft from us.

Well I thought it was marvellous. Wanted to visit the Two Oceans site on numerous occasions. The exhibits were informative,well presented and housed in a superb location. The place itself is spotless, and brimming with information.Well worth a visit to see what is in the ocean. The large displays were awe inspiring, and the variety of sea life was stunning.

Amazing outing for the kids. We took our nieces for a morning excursion to the Aquarium and they had the time of their lives. Both are under 4 years old and they were captivated by just about everything! The teared around the ground floor looking at the various glass pools of manta ray, butterfly fish, moray eel etc and couldn't stop asking questions and showing us their new discoveries.They loved the touch/learning pool where patient staff let them touch various seaweeds, sea urchins and a hermit crab. They were super excited to see the 'talking frogs' which was a puppet show about the importance of frogs in our ecology (the content was a little lost on them and the show was a little silly- but I guess I am not its target demographic).The shark tank was a major highlight too. It was a wonderful, super stimulating outing for small children. As an adult who is deeply interested in the preservation of our oceans I also loved it. I thought it was really well maintained and laid out. There is a wide variety of beautiful and interesting marine life. The information is well curated and easily accessible.All in all, it was a really good morning out, I would recommend it to any tourist or local looking for something to do in Cape Town on an overcast day.
Just okay. It was not quite as good as expected.The displays are just not up to par.Very glad I went but after uShaka Marine World in Durban this is a little dissapointing.

Fun Family Outing!. Perfect morning for our extended family! Our 3 year old grandson enjoyed walking around, playing with the experiential learning table and loved the fish! He and his uncle crawled up the middle of the fish tank and were surrounded by fishes - posed for pictures. He loved the penguins, the big tank with the diver inside. The Aquarium is decent, not very large, and provides a nice exhibit of oceanic life from the Atlantic and Indian oceans. It was just about right for our multi-generational group and young children.

"Fun for the afternoon". The aquarium is located a short 5 minute walk from one of the best malls in Cape Town, The Victoria Wharf Water Front. The Wharf warrants a visit on its own due to its multitude of activities including shopping, eating, and day tours. The Two Oceans Aquarium is a relatively small, but well done aquarium. You will see species from the two oceans (Atlantic and Indian) that South Africa's position offers. The exhibits are well done, clean, and well labeled with countless volunteers able to help you to both navigate and give you information on the animals (that range from Mantis Shrimp and Penguins, to small sharks and large predatory fish. There is a large tank near the center of the aquarium where you will find sharks, large fish, sting rays, and the like. Definitely worth the visit if you enjoy aquariums, and especially if you have children. If you want to get up close an personal, you can also dive with the sharks in the tank, however I would recommend you take the Great White tours that you can find on the Wharf. Entrance fee is relatively cheap and the gift store is well stocked.
Penguins!. Loved how close you can get to the penguins and the art exhibit in the hallways was pretty interesting. Great place.

Disappointing. Having seen various acquariums this was not as good as some. We were lucky to see the penguins being fed and an interesting talk by their keeper, also a diver going into a fish tank to feed fish swimming in the kelp (seaweed) also an interesting talk. Other than that as 3 adults we did not find much more of interest, however with young children there may have been more. A little expensive for what it was.

A good way to see the nature of the deep. It's not the biggest aquarium but space is well used and a visit should certainly be on the agenda of anyone wishing to understand the seas around Cape Town. I spent a couple of hours exploring all the tanks and enjoyed the exhibits imensley. The highlight of the visit has to be the main tank with sharks and what is also good is being able to view the fish from different depths as the tours winds its was around the aquarium. It would be a great place to take children's as they have lots of extra displays the with children in mind.
Very educational. A non expensive way to be educated and amazed at what lives in the two oceans located close by without a sea sickness pill.

Not a must have.... The aquarium is rather small, which surprised me since I expected it to be a lot bigger. It's certainly nice to visit if you have never been in an Aquarium before but it's definitely not a "must see". In my opinion you can skip the Two Oceans Aquarium without hesitation.
Small but nice. The aquarium was rather small, but it was nicely maintained and the sealife, including African penguins, were well represented.
ALWAYS ENJOYABLE WITH MY DAUGHTER. Brilliant place to be, especially with little ones, it will rock their world, amazing varieties of sea creatures, entrance fee quite reasonable,
Great for kids. Pity we didn't have any with us.. This is a delightful well set-out aquarium with interesting displays, especially the penguins. Thoroughly enjoyed our time here.

Why see this in aquarium?. It was a nice afternoon spend in The Two Oceans Aquarium. Very touristy, but nice - especially if you have kids, I pressume.I just could not shake the feeling, that I would be better off spending my time taking a diver course and going out to see the fish in their natural arena. I come from a country, where we haven't got these colorful and interesting fish swimming around by our beaches and in our lakes. South Africa is a great diving place - so if you have the time - spend your money doing that instead. That is worth it.

Family fun or romantic. Perfect for a day out with your other half, a day with the kids... its overwhelming walking around all these under water wonders... a little scary with some of the creatures though... its also educational...

Good but needs to be great!. I might be jaded, but I expected something much more at the joining of two great oceans. What's here is fine but I hope that it will expand over time to become a truly great attraction. I finished up in about 90 minutes and it was a good distraction on a rainy morning. Kids really seem to enjoy the attractions so if you need to entertain them, this is good choice.

Great spot for fish lovers.. Very interesting , they have very good facilities for all animals .Greatly located next to the Waterfront.Lots of fish on display with also possibility to dive and feed the sharks.A must do.

Great value. It's not the biggest aquarium, but I spent an hour exploring all the tanks and enjoyed it. The highlight is definitely the main tank with sharks as they are pretty huge by UK standards. It would be a great place to take kids as they have lots of extra displays with children in mind.

Great Aquarium. For the price of admission, this is a great aquarium to visit. It cost about $12 USD and the aquarium even has live feeds of their predator fish (i.e. sharks) 3x a day. The aquarium is well laid out and has many interactive exhibits as well. Great for the solo traveler and those with families with children.

Wonderful Attraction!. A great place to take kids.....well there is some in all of us!The Aquarium is well kept, its clean, clearly signposted and well laid out.We have visited the Aquarium in Dubai and this one is on par.There is nothing we didn't like.. The entrance fee is reasonable, there are no long queues and would definitely recommend a visit.

Worth a visit. This Aquarium is well kept, clean and clearly signposted. Having been to the Dubai aquarium our expectations were high but CT is comparable and great for the children.Reasonable entry fee and no long queues for admission.Would recommend a visit.
always good. Well laid out with lots of informationCheap admission. Great for childrenNice cafe and gift shop.Nothing we didn't like.

A wonderful place for people of all ages.. We enjoyed everything presented but our favorites were the divers in the huge shark aquarium feeding the large turtle and stingray, and the climb into the Nemo tank and the climb in behind tank for kids.

Nice to visit. Visit the Aquarium with my 3 years old son. He loved it! Nice aquarium to spend there 1-2 hours. Loved the kids corner too. Entrance is free till age 4, adult ticket is also cheap 140ZAR. Location is really good, just at the Waterfront at the heart of the city.
Wow!. Felt very majestic! Loved it! The variety of fish was really great. Built very nicely as well and perfect location!
A must see!. Wonderful experience. Could spend a whole day there. Too bad couldn't see the feeding of sharks. Check the days where this is carried out before booking your visit to the museum!

skip if you have other things to do. the aquarium is in need of a renovation (currently underway) and is very small. If you have been to aquariums in singapore, atlanta, barcelona etc than this will be a big disappointment. The only part i enjoyed was the predatory fish feeding where you can see the sharks etc swim by. but they need to upgrade their sound system as all is lost in translation. if you have nothing else to do , than its not a bad trip but if you have seen bigger and better, than skip

Best of 2 oceans. Every time when in the mother city on a rainy day we go down to the waterfront and have a stroll though the aquarium. It's world class, I have seen many aquariums in many countries but this one must rank as on of the most interesting ones.. 2 oceans!
Very good Aquarium at the waterfront. Very good well laid out with some shows and interactive areas great for learning or just browsing, Kids will love it

All the marine life in both oceans. Easy way to see the bright fish in the Indian Ocean where we later snorkeled. And also the Atlantic life. one of best aquariums I've seen. Loved the sharks, all silvery and evil looking.
Really average. Not mind blowing at all at R125 per person. Does not compare to Ushaka in Durban in anyway. Small overpriced fishpond

Beautiful!!!!. My husband and i were there for holiday and its an absolutely MUST SEE. Do target the feedings times for the penguins, shark and fish. We also got to touch some shell animals, took photos in the 'aquarium' photo booth and bought the most amazing fridge magnets for our memories. The location is great, as its right at the V&A waterfront. Your tickets allows you to visit the aquarium the whole day, its huge so you can see some parts and come back later after a meal and see the other sections

Fun and Leisurely Day Trip. The Two Oceans Aquarium was a great way to spend a few hours. It's not a huge place so I would recommend carefully selecting the day and time you go, to avoid big crowds. I went on a week day and closer to closing time (2 hours before) and it was great because the majority of people were gone and gave me the chance to really enjoy all of the exhibits. There are a few interactive type exhibits which were fun and a bit unique. They also offer some additional activities for extra fees, which looked fun but I didn't have the time to stick around. The main attraction that I really enjoyed was the shark conservation educational program, accompanied by a short film. Take the time to watch the film and read about the program, it really is informative and interesting.
A fun afternoon. Interesting diversity of marine life, we especially liked the final exibit with The kelp forest and next shark, and turtle exibit.

family visit. Having been to many aquariums before i can say that this is worth the visit.It is as good as anything back in the UK.also because of the exchange rate it is massively cheaper than anything back home.

Beautiful !. I have been there a couple of times. The location is great and allows for visiting Cape Town waterfront on the same occasion. It would be nice to have a plan of the aquarium so that first time visitors can know which direction to take to get to a particular place.

Nice. The place is nice and treatment is great as well. There is a big aquarium, were you can watch the fish feed and shark's too.There is a big turtle, the highest point, in my opinion. It worths the visit.

Still a great place!. I took my daughter to the aquarium for the first time but my wife and I have been a few times before. It was still amazing to see all the different types of fish and sea life. My daughter enjoyed the play area downstairs and they were kind enough to assist us with a stroller for her. Definitely a good visit.
Take the plunge.. This is a wonderful attraction. Go and enjoy yourself and learn about the ocean creatures. Well presented and loads of fun.

Nice place to visit with children (interesting for adults too!). This was my first time in aquarium and I liked it really much. 1 hour was a bit too short time since I enjoyed watching all the different kind on fishes and sharks so much :)

Nice Aquarium. Spent an hour at this aquarium. Not as big as others I have been to but still nice and worth a visit. It's located minuets from the waterfront mall by foot so very convenient. Enjoyed the penguin exhibits.
Average. It was an average aquarium, nothing so special. I saw better ones in Osaka and Barcelona. It may be good for families with kids.

Undersea views for non divers. Very well set up undersea experience. For you kids, a great way to compliment TV and book education with face to face experiences with all manner of amazing undersea floira and fauna plus exoitic fish and of course, sharks. Also, stars of happy feet arte present although one might consider mumbles feelings in the aquarium when looking at the (kind of motionless) penguins.

Two Oceans Aquarium. This is a truly wonderful experience from little "Nemo" fishes to very large sharks. Some of the aquatic displays of live plant life are really awesome with brilliant and vibrant colours. You are also able to touch and feel some of the displays. The penguins are lovely and often comical besides being only seen in this part of the world. Look out for the large crabs, crayfish and other rather exotic creatures.An added attraction to visiting the aquarium is that it forms part of the greater Waterfront with all its shops and food outlets.Well worth a visit if you come to Lovely Capetown also described as the Tavern of the Seas.

Awesome Two Oceans Aquarium. When visiting our beautiful city, please put this attraction on your to do list, you will not be disappointed. The displays are beautifully appointed and a joy to behold, so much to see.The staff are amazing and nothing is to much for them.They are also busy with renovations and I cannot wait to see what transpires. Please do yourself a favour and visit this amazing attraction.Kind regardsFerdie Liebenberg

Grandson's favourite haunt. My grandson and his parents have "Loyalty cards" and visit the Aquarium regularly. Daniel has never tired of looking at the exhibitions which he has been going to since he was 2 years old. When i visited with them, he gave me a guided tour, pointing out the huge crabs, the frogs, the sharks, the sea-horses, the very poisonous Stone fish and the rays, who slide up the glass and smile at you! And we always end the excursion with a stop at the shop for a souvenir of another delightful, educational day out.

Nice. We went to the Two Oceans Aquarium based on a recommendation from somebody we had been talking to. The fact there were penguins sold it to my friend. A nice little aquarium but the highlights were definitely the penguins and the sharks.Very family friendly.
One of the finest in the world. Okay been here more times than I can remember. Love it and my kids love it. One of the highest tech aquariums in the world. Just fabulous.
Two oceans Aquarium. The place to take the family for a great experience of sea world. The best time to visit is early in the day. Restaurant is quite ok for the basic menu.

Two Oceans Aquarium. We as a family visited the aquarium during the Festive Season. What a joy, especially for my young 11 year old son and the rest of us. Definite Landmark in Cape Town and a must see for all visitors.

Disappointing. I went here on my own as I wanted to see this attraction, very dissapointed by it, geared solely for children, some of the tanks are tiny, the frog show was terrible, mechanical puppets with some not even working! Would not be in a hurry back here, iv been to much better aquariums

Definitely a must do and see. Do not miss out on this fabulous venue.. Even on a rainy day you can enjoy the experience.Diving with Sharks and all types of fish is possible so we understand...Children and Adults will all be equally excited by the Beautiful Aquarium It's a must visit when in Cape Town.
Wonderful experience for the family. A wide variety of sea and fresh water fauna and flora to see and a new jungle section. Very clean and well looked after. Activities for children. A fun day out!

Always a firm favourite. My family loves the variety that the Aquarium has to offer. It is centrally located in the V&A Watefront and has plenty of fun exhibits, hands-on experiences for little people coupled with a children's area which is geared to educating kids about sea life conservation and responsibility.I would give yourself two hours to explore this attraction. There is a great deal of building work underway at present to add bigger and better exhibits in the coming months.The adjoining Shoreline Cafe is a great stopover point afterwards for a light snack.Always a popular family favourite - the only thing about the Aquarium I am not so fond of is the pricey entrance fees.

This Aquarium has something for all ages.. We stay in Cape Town We love visiting the Aquarium and have an Annual ticket. Our grandchildren from the UK were recently here aged 11months and 3years. So much interactive stuff for the children and NEMO of course is a big highlight at that age. The aquarium is being added to so later in the year there will be even more to see. Definitely worth a visit.

sea creatures and sharks. Visited the two oceans with my grandson who is 6 years old. It is definately a visit for all ages. The shark tank is awesome , one can watch divers feeding the sharks at specified times. My grandson loved the nemo tank and the penguins. Dont be in a hurry when you visit, there is so much to see.

Grandchildren Friendly. With my wife and I on Grandchildren duty, and mixed weather, we decided to spend the morning at the Aquarium, my oldest grandson had been taken a few times, but this was the youngest first visit.This is simply one of the best attractions in CapeTown, absolutely family friendly, extremely well laid out, and an education for all ages.The tour was rounded off with the essential milkshakes for the boys and a recharge for the grandparents, the restaurant was clean, offered a simple menu, good portions, priced to please and excellent service.Highly recommended for any visitor to Cape Town.
Great!. Really awesome place to visit. Well spaced and accessible with a wide variety of attractions. Went many years ago and enjoyed it aswell. Good to see the standards are still high
Excellent experience. As a regular visitor to Cape Town, it is surprising that this was my first visit - it won't be the last. Work is underway to make the experience even better.

fantastic aquarium. It is a must place to visit at the waterfront.There is a huge variety of sea creatures and also some penguins.we found people feeding some creatures which did not look like living beings.view of marine life is spectacular and educational.

Dive in the aquarium. Our great white shark dive got cancelled due to weather all week so instead we dove in the aquarium with their ragged tooth sharks, turtle, sting rays and various fish. It was fun, well organized and worth the money. The employees are very friendly and if you're not a diver then try the intro course that they offer. I can't think of a better place to try an introductory dive.
Meh. Nothing groundbreaking to see here. Average aquarium with not a great deal of range to see. Good if you're bringing kids but I'd say anyone over the age of 8 would be bored
Tired, needs an upgrade. the rest of the world has moved on, it time the aquarium upgraded its displays. nevertheless, some great exhibits

Shark diving. I think this is the same aquarium I did a shark dive in with the ragged tooth sharks. Great experience at an affordable price. Professionally looked after with a detailed brief of what to do and not to do whilst diving with the sharks. I would thoroughly recommend this as part of your holiday. You will need a valid diving cert though.
Great with Kids. Still great! I wouldnt go on my own, but was special and really fun going with my little cousins aged 5 and 7!
Wonderful. Absolutely worth a visit, very large aquarium with most amazing exhibits. If you can go at feeding time, the giant turtles and rays are superb. Truly wonderful place for kids too.

Good but like a kids playground.. Have done many aquariums and this one is fairly average. We went on a Saturday so maybe that's why it was full of screaming children. It doesn't take long to walk around.

average. i was expecting much more. it must be said that the panels are very informative and this is awesome but it lacks the wow effect I was kinda expecting. Then the staff in not expert on their subjects I asked some questions snd I good really poor answers in term of biology knowledge. .. got the impression that I was being answered by the cleaners.I hope the new shark tunnel now being constructed will add some more thrill

Nice but disappointing. The aquarium is well run and well kept, but it is really very small... I guess it is ok for those who do not normally visit aquariums... I personally always do when I have a chance and this specific exhibit is nothing even remotely close to US and major European aquariums... There is potential, but they need to expand the displays area consistently if they want to get anywhere close to be an Aquarium to remember...

A very good experience. The best aquarium I have ever been to. A vast verity of see creatures from the two oceans, interesting guides that walk you through the process of exploring the place, and an explanation in writing all over the place. I highly recommend

Really?! This is it?!. Disappointment. A big one. I regretted I went there. Comparing to the one in Bangkok or Chicago, it is Two Buckets, not Two Oceans. I am spoiled. If it is your first time, maybe...

Good thing. Small package.. We went on a reasonably quiet day (we assumed), as there weren't that many other people in the aquarium. R125 each saw us through the barriers, and the first exciting thing was getting my hand stamped but seeing nothing appear. I pointed out that the ink had run out, and was then informed by the man that it was invisible ink! My girlfriend also told me that most of the clubs in SA stamp your hand with invisible ink as well. But anyway, the aquarium...!First up we saw some children standing up inside a vertical tank full of 'Nemo' fish, next to another tank with a couple of massive eels. Further through, highlights included touching starfish and anenomes, seeing the penguins, the kelp tank, the carnivorous fish tank (including two sharks and a bunch of some of the ugliest fish around, a pitch black angler fish, giant spider crabs, and some beautiful drawings and posters about whales.At one point we turned a corner, fully expecting to be half way through the adventure, but instead coming across the little shop at the end. We saw that they're building a new tunnel so that will give people a bit extra to do, but it felt very small and we were expecting a bit more. However, what was there was very good, and the posters and information on the walls added to the experience.

A great all weather dive. Having booked and had to cancel a dive package the alternative of diving in the aquarium and having close encounters with sharks, stingrays and a leatherback turtle was an offer not to refuse. For 700 rand you don't have to risk visibility or stormy seas and are guaranteed the encounter with sharks - a first for me. The kit is excellent, the briefing clear and you get 30 minutes with a whole range of fish. There's also discounted entry to your family, who can film an unforgettable experience.

Great for half day. Bought combo with boat tour of bay. Aquarium has usual interest but I thought the tanks were really clean and the fish heathy. Great selection of fish and some I hadn't seen before. I thought the tunnels which gave kids a chance to see inside the tank from a bit in the middle were really good. Also had penguins. We were the only people on the boat trip which was really good for us. Nice Catamaran. Saw Penguins in the bay some seals.

FUN FUN FUN. My friend and I spent hours here. It's brilliant! So many different things to see, you can take selfies with stingrays and watch the penguins getting fed. Great location next to a beautiful market with handmade candles and good gifts!
Excitement for kids. It is not a very big aquarium but it is perfect for kids. Very informative and interesting. Must see the various kind of sharks
great aquarium. fantastic aquarium. have been several times and happy to go back each time. great for a rainy day or if you are sick of the beach or just love aquariums

Lovely. My kids loved it. Must go during feeding times as its so informative and quite spectacular to see the turtles and stingrays to be feed. Also the guides and staff there are so well informed and really make an effort to educate. My kids also really enjoyed the play area and they had bead making which was great fun too.

Great day out - for all ages. The layout and space to view the tanks is brilliant - lots to look at and plenty of information to read if you want to. Great interactive features - touch pool and microscope presentation. Huge variety to keep all ages amused. Predator display is awesome.

Have seen much better. My sense is that this is a good entertainment hub for families with kids.Not for a solo adult like myself. For others travelling through the country, the Aquarium in Durban is muc,much better.

World Class.... When my daughter was very small, we bought a season ticket and I was interested to see that they're still exceptional value.We hadn't been to the aquarium for years however, and it was the arrival of an overseas visitor that was the trigger for us to make the effort this time.The overall layout hasn't changed much, but the smaller exhibits have. The octopus tank is still there, as are the giant crabs, but there was plenty that I hadn't seen before. There's quite an emphasis on welcoming children, but there's an enormous amount for adults to enjoy too. Although it was busy, we didn't feel that it was over-crowded.I'm proud that this world class facility is here in Cape Town!
Ok. Not very interesting for the price that you pay. The penguins are cute but I didn't find a good enough reason for 125 rands

Brilliant. My wife and I visited in January,2015 it is a wonderful experience. We were entertained as much by the children appearing inside the 'Nemo' display to be photographed. The main round tank area was marvellous to watch, indeed we even enjoyed the penguins and later the feeding of the sealsGreat value and entertainment for all ages.

Way more interesting than I had expected it to be. I went to the Two Oceans Aquarium with my wife only because we had a bit of time on hand, and were in that area. In the end, we enjoyed it so much that we ended up spending about 4 hours there.It really is a world class aquarium with a wide variety of fish and plant species. It was a highly educational experience, along with a lot of fun, especially in the penguins section.We stayed to see the staff feeding the penguins at 14:30 and virtually visited every exhibit twice. It is a brilliantly maintained aquarium and a visit there brings out the child in you!

NOT MUCH TO SEE. Visted with my wife and two sons,January 2015.There is not much to see,i spent half an hour.The only thing i enjoyed was the big round tank .the aquarium is not so big and not muck to do.

What a memorable experience diving with Sharks and the fabulous IaIn. One of the highlights of the holiday for the kids was the day they spent in two oceans aquarium. They learnt to dive that morning thanks to the lovely Iain and then dived that afternoon in the Shark tank. We watched as they swam with the Sharks turtles yellow tails and many others and as they hunted for shark teeth which had fallen into the basin of the tank. They all came home with wonderful memories of their experience and a shark tooth each. We photoed and videod it from the viewing area. A must do for kids when in Capetown.

A wonderful place!. The Two Oceans Aquarium is one of Cape Town's "must see" attractions. The aquarium displays a wide variety of marine species from both the Atlantic and Indian Oceans. The aquarium is also homed to 23 African penguins, as well as 9 Rockhopper penguins, who are housed in a beach like exhibit on the upper level of the aquarium. Daily penguin-feed presentations happen at 11.45am and 2.30pm, these are filled with information about the species on exhibit and fun to watch! (attached a photo) The aquarium's I&J Predator exhibit is the largest exhibit and the most popular. Here you can find ragged toothed sharks, a variety of rays, a large school of yellowtail as well as a loggerhead turtle named Yoshi. Other large scale exhibit areas include the Ocean Basket Kelp forest, Indian Ocean Gallery and Atalntic Ocean gallery. Feeding times for the Predator tank is 3pm daily (with sharks being fed only on Sundays at 3pm).If you get hungry and feel like a quick bite! Pop-in to the Shoreline Cafe' located near the entrance of the aquarium. Their Menu caters for all, from adults to kids... and much more! The service is excellent and the prices rational! On a whole my family and I were blown away by the overall cleanliness of the aquarium, friendliness and helpfulness of the staff and fine detail of each exhibit space! Although some find the aquarium small compared to the likes of Ushaka Marine World and other Marine "Parks", The Two Oceans Aquarium is a unique experience on its own!Coming Soon! - The aquarium is also currently expanding its exhibit space and building a brand-new Predator Exhibit which should open in March this year! The new exhibit will have a 180degree-viewing tunnel and will display a larger variety of sharks, rays and fish found off the coast of Southern Africa!!

Huge tanks of kelp and predators were entrancing. We spent hours here -- fascinating tanks and information. The huge kelp forest and predator tanks were outstanding -- we sat and watched the fish glide by for a long time. Excellent exhibits, too, about overfishing, pollution and how to behave in an environmentally responsible way towards the oceans and fresh waters.

Great for the children. This is a great way to spend a few hours of fun with the kids. My grandson has a great fascination with sharks and even though there are not many here he enjoyed his time looking at the large Raggy Tooths. the Nemo tank was also great fun and once in it was not easy to get him out. The penguin feeding was also a highlight and amazed how each penguin could be identified by the spots on their chest so even us "older" folk learnt a few new things. There is also a fun exhibit, where students teach the younger generation about the sea and the marine creatures in it. There is also a good amphibian section.
Great Aquarium. Definately a world class Aquarium! We went there on a rainy day, and so glad we did. Even our teenagers loved it :-) Worth a visit for sure
unique. very nice, alot of sea creatures, very big fish tanks, dont miss this experience. penguin feeding is a waste of time/

Nice !. Perfect to spend an hour or two. The 'NEMO' tank is an experience and when we were there we had students explaining and showing through a microscope different creatures that live in the ocean.
Disappointing. A real waste of money. Did not live up to our expectations especially if you been to aquarium at Ushaka Durban. It was like a visit to a poor relative.

Decent aquarium but nothing more. We were a little disappointed by Two Oceans as it failed to live up to the advertising. We have two little boys who are obsessed with sharks, so we were keen to take them there but all we saw where two ragged-tooth sharks. No other shark types. If you are travelling elsewhere in South Africa, I would highly recommend the aquarium at uShaka in Durban over Two Oceans.

If you have any love for fish or animals STAY AWAY . I instantly felt sad the moment I entered this maximum security jail for innocent animals. The size of the tanks are disgusting and everything contained in them seem to be dateless AND LIFELESS. If your thinking of taking your children there you are sending the wrong the message and not educating them in how these animals live at all. I FEEL SICK I GAVE THEM MY MONEY TO ALLOW THEM TO KEEP THEM IN THIS ENVIRONMENT. Close this place down ASAP.

Appalling. All of the tanks and exhibits were absolutely tiny. The penguin enclosures consist of one tiny stream. I'm no nature scientist but I know for a fact that the exhibit was not suitable for the animals and they all stood looking miserable. The heat in there was absolutely rediculous too. Another is the shark tank. The tank was like a roundabout and the Sharks barely swam around, more like they floated as if they were doped. I don't think anyone should go there and invest in there terrible business.
Fish. My other half is a fish freak and he absolutely loved it... The corals were pretty and the giant fish were fascinating... a really good few hours!

Stunning. Just amazing. As a traveler and you like the underwater scenery go and visit it. If you are a keen diver and you like the thrill of diving with a shark or 2, they do it upon requests which is amazing.
Great for kids. Nice displays, and interactive activities for kids. The penguins were great. The frog puppet show was weird though. they should close or update that.

Loved it. When there on a Sunday afternoon. Love every minute of it could stand there for hours looking at all the animals. Really enjoyed seeing the predators tank. The staff was friendly and helpful

Sea life at its best. Dont go during peak season because you will stand in a que for more than an hour waiting to purchase the tickects and also inside its not easy to move around or take pictures due to the over crowding but the place is so beautiful and the kids loved it

Great family outing. When at the V&A Waterfront ,visiting the aquarium is a great way to relax, spend time with your kids (kept them entertained for close to 2 hours) and educate yourself at the same time. The staff were knowledgeable, friendly and passionate.I would have liked to see other shark species than ragged tooth sharks but it was still worth while.
Paradise for the kids. The sharks are impressive. The Penguin court was a bit warm and smelly. All in all a fantastic visit.

Very relaxing and educational experience. When in the vicinity of the V&A Waterfront visiting the aquarium is a great way to relax and learn something at the same time. The staff were very knowledgeable and friendly, and never hesitated to answer our questions.

Still the best acquarium I have ever been too. I love acquariums, but this one has got to be the best. I confess I have never eaten there, but the diversity of sea life just makes it the best for me. Try to catch one of the feeds if possible. The whole family loved it, and even though it was very busy, we did not feel rushed or harrased.

World-class attraction. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Two Oceans Aquarium where we could easily have spent the whole day exploring the many informative displays and well maintained tanks. Although traveling with my wife, this attraction is perfect for families and young children. The penguin exhibit was our highlight.
A must see. Spacious displays of the most colorful and unusual fish and sea creatures. Definitely worth a visit.
Entertaining. Very informative, loved the "Nemo's" exhibit amongst other things. Staff generally helpful. Will visit again.

Wow!. Great aquarium with play areas for kids and touch and feel stations. Penguins were a highlight. As were the clownfish and the giant eel. Beautiful big viewing areas and easy to navigate. Kids loved it!!

Very educational, but limited in size. They are in the process of expanding the aquarium which is somewhat on the small side at the moment. However, what is there is done extremely well and is very effectively targeted at the youngsters - it was absolutely packed with them when we went. The educational component (a big focus on plastic waste and how it affects the oceans) was really first class. Nice gift shop and restaurant.
Overpriced. Expensive compared to other local museums/attractions, and we managed to go around in less than 90 minutes. It will be good once they install the new tunnel.

Great for the Family!!. The Two oceans aquarium has a variety of marine life. The staff are knowledgeable and there's great awareness about protecting our oceans and the marine life that occupy it. This is a great venue for kids as there's also puppet shows and feeding exhibits.

Great For the Family. Two Oceans Aquarium is a family friendly attraction with plenty of interactive exhibits. The aquarium focuses on the diverse local marine life. Being in the V & A Waterfront the aquarium is easily accessible with plenty of bars, restaurants, and other attractions in the area. On our visit we saw patrons of all ages having a great time.

World Class.. This is a rare example inn South Africa of "museum" management at its professional best. It has set a strategy to provide serious scientific information AND to attract families with young children by ensuring that there are things for them to do. I learned much about minuscule sea life from an interactive station asking for guesses on what was in pots which were then put under a telescope and projected on a screen. Several tanks allow children to crawl underneath and rise in a central bubble making them appear as underwater swimmers. There is a staffed children's play area. Regular animal and fish feeding sessions are another attraction. The sharks and sea turtle are fed only on certain days but the penguins daily.Entrance is not cheap for South Africa but the ticket is a day pass allowing entry and exit as one chooses. There is constant updating of displays and one gets the impression that there is excellent management of the total environment. The cafe has terrace tables on the harbour front or interior seating. Kids are well catered for with a reasonable ice cream and slush drink selection.People say its great for a rainy day but I think it is equally as good when its too hot outside!
Loved it. Great place to find out a bit more about the aquatic species - really enjoyed it - great for kids.........

Excellent - Better Than Most Cities. I have been to aquariums all over the world and this one is probably one of the best. Its a place you can visit on a gloomy day and have a great experience. The tanks are great and there is always something that you will find of interest.

Great outing with the family.. We visited the Aquarium on Sunday 4th January 2015 as a family outing. Beautiful experience. My grand child loved it enormously. We adults enjoyed it as well. Lots to see and learn. I visited it last when the Sun fish was displayed in the shark tank - way back. Loved the Sea Horses.

Astonishing. This was an amazing experience. I have never seen an aquarium of this volume. I would go again and again and recommend it to anyone visiting Capetown. The sheer size of the place amazed me and the volume of creatures contained within. Everything was pristine and healthy. My children loved every moment and I'll admit that I did too. Since our visit my husband has been back with a work colleague who had not previously visited Capetown. They had a fabulous time and his friend was totally wowed.Well worth a visit for anyone of any age.
If its raining a great place to go. This is a rework from my kid:Fun for all the family. Keeps kids interested and excited as there is so much there for them.

Brilliant family outing. Brilliant thing to do with the family (and also on one of those rainy days). Good displays with lots of information. We hit luck as they were doing feeding on the day we went although due to feeding lots of school groups there causing overcrowding. Perhaps would be nice if they kept school groups separate. Other than that good experience, large variety of species and fun all round for the family.

scuba dive with the sharks!. We visited the aquarium and noticed you can dive with the sharks. If you buy the year membership a shark dive is about 50 USD, which is cheaper than diving many places in the world. It is a really fun experience to have sharks a few feet from you. Petting the aquarium turtle is also a good time. It is a totally different experience to dive in a fish tank than in the ocean, definitely worth a shot.Other than that the aquarium is OK. It is great for kids and families. We actually found the information on the fish and plants to be lacking, but there was lots to see and touch. Check the feeding times ahead of time and try to come and see penguin, shark, or other feedings. The penguin exhibit is good fun as well. Lots of spots for great photos with the kids so bring a camera.

Great day out. This is a large aquarium with a wide range of species, and really caters well for children. Impressive design, including the large shark tank. A good programme of events including talks, feedings. A fantastic part of the V&A Waterfront.
Rainbow Ocean. Colourful and exciting visual experiences for our family. Relax and enjoy an ocean of rainbow colours. Beautiful presentations and wonderful sights. We will return.
Good rainy/windy day activity. There were some odd exhibits with creatures we have never seen which made it worth while. However, it is not very big, and doesn't take long to see everything.

Excellent choice for those misty mornings. Two oceans aquarium is located right at the waterfront and is a very family friendly experience. Very nice demonstrations and aquariums. You can easily spend 2 -3 hours here and because of it's central location you might want to consider combining it with other waterfront activities.

Think Nemo. I loved this aqaurium. My favorite was the Nemo tank where kids could have their photos taken inside the tank and the penquins. But there was so much more. I love that the aquarium had so many lessons about the environmental dangers to our oceans and lessons on how humans should think about their impact on the environment.

Overpriced. Having been to a number of aquarium's i found this place to be small and overpriced. The quality and variety on display were not as diverse as some other aquariums we visited. The entire place can be toured in under an hour.
Best aquarium. Kids loved the aquarium and must say one of the best. First time in capetown and the best time for the whole family

eco marine boat trip. I had great expectations as the boat trip was described as a marine game trip. It didn't come cheap at R250 pp. The vessel was comfortable and clean and the staff friendly and welcoming. There wasn't much sea life about so that was disappointing. Overall, it was a relaxing trip though.
Worth a visit for families. We spent 2 hours in the morning and liked the experience. Good mix of good explanations, exploring smaller fishes and seeing bigger ones in the end
Pleasant two hours. Number of different areas with different fish etc. Fish, penguins etc all appear to be well cared for and in good condition. Feeding times interesting.

Dive with sharks. We started out in the cafe and it just got better,we paid to go diving with the Sharks what a great experience instructor was great,after diving we went around aquarium which was excellent seeing all the different fish including my favourite lion fish,then a visit to the shop great morning out,
Wow. One of the nicest places I have been!! Very child friendly and the exhibits were amazing...loved looking at the penguins and at the sharks!!!

Aquarium . It has what is to be expected in a good aquarium except that we felt there could be a little bit more added to it. We had to walk out into the cafe to see the seal even though we didn't know that there was a seal there. It is a good aquarium nonetheless.

For young and old. The two oceans aquarium is a place that I can suggest for both young and old. Might not be the best aquarium you get in the world, but has lots of interesting areas to offer. From live fish, to skeletons and history of animals.

Good viewing but sad for animals.. I visited the Two oceans aquarium during the Christmas period. It was not packed like other resorts around Cape Town.They have a wide variety of animals. What disturbed the most was to see great white sharks about 3 that I counted and many other big fish types all enclosed in a small area just swimming in circles aimlessly. It just struck me that these majestic creatures in the wild travel from the Cape peninsula to Australia... how sad.This is not to suggest that I did not enjoy the aquarium. I definitely enjoyed the diversity of ocean marine.

Perfect for a non-beach day. Two Oceans Aquarium is a great aquarium. The layout is good, exhibits are interesting and varied and the large tanks are spectacular. There is a good range of things for kids to do and enjoy, as well as the opportunity for them to learn about the two oceans that converge nearby.The Aquarium is well suited with ample parking, and good for a wet weather day, or to amuse the kids while some shopping gets done in the nearby Waterfront. Combine with a lunch at the Aquarium restaurant or an array of options nearby, plus a wander through the harbour area. Its a really good spot.
Great for Kids. We have taken the kids to this aquarium whenever they are visiting Cape Town. Very high quality aquarium thoroughly enjoyed by the kids.

Don't forget to check out the clown fish bowl!. Every time I go to Cape Town I visit the 2 Oceans Aquarium!It's great to see the big fish swimming so effortlessly through the clear water. A very educational place that's fun too!

If you only have a few days in Cape Town, don't spend valuable time here. Compared to other aquariums around the world, the one in Cape Town really is quite uneventful. It is small and quickly seen. We waited an hour for the 'shark feeding', but we did not see any of the sharks actually eat anything. For very small children it might be OK though.
Unusual fish. I must mention that this aquaruim is home to so many new species everytime I visit it is like a new discovery waiting to happen

Good first time Aquarium only. Bit underwhelming. If you have been to any other aquariums chances are there's not much new for you too see here. It is laid out well and looked after. Plenty stuff to do for kids. Took me and my partner 40 mins to see everything so don't plan it as a daytrip :(

Absolute fun!. My wife and I took our two nieces to this aquarium just before Christmas. Quite frankly I thought I'd be bored as I am not an aquarium person. It was an absolute fun thing to do. Lots of children having fun and discovering new things. The penquin pen was a highlight for me. They are are such cute little fellows those. The aquarium focuses on educating children and adults on conserving our environments and fish and animal habitats and on sustainable fishing. Activities, especially the Frog display area is very child friendly and interactive. There are also loads of photo opportunities within the aquarium areas.A must visit if you find yourself in Cape Town.

A lot to see. So much to see! Maybe too much! They managed to cram so much in. It's almost confusing?They offer no maps... encouraged to just keep following the signs. With small kids that is easier said than done. We ended up back & forth so many times we probably saw everything twice.But a good experience.
Enjoyable. Great educational place. Lots to see. You can easily spend a few hours here. It's amazing to see the different depths od,the sea and what goes on in them.

Escape under the sea. There's something soothing to the soul about visiting here, taking in the relaxing energy of the kelp forest and various aquariums, and the penguins are cute! Check the feeding times of the sharks, quite interesting to see!

Very Good and seems like it will get better. Our kids loved it so much we went around twice, they are building a new big tank with tunnel and flat wall so this will make things twice as good, they had a microscope section for seeing the small stuff and a touch tank, quite a weird experience being stung by anemone. Your hand gets stamped at the entrance so you can have reentry during the day. Graet value for money.

Awe inspiring Aquarium. What a brilliant aquarium snd so much more!The most smazing interactive exhibits where you csn get in the middle for a picture surrounded by fish.I found the whole experiece a delight.I loved sitting in a gallery watching a gigantic window and watching the white tipped sharks and a dozen other species casually pass by.This place is a must whatever age you are but next year it will be an extended visit with the grandchildren!

A first visit with my 2 year old granddaughter. My son daughter in law and 2 year old grandaughter visited the Aquarium for the first time and were really impressed found the whole visit worthwhile, informative and our grandaughter enjoyed the outing and was very excited to see all the different species of sea life

One of the best. I have been here many times and it is well worth the visit. All the fish and animals are displayed beautifully. It is large and spacious, and the variety is excellent. The big glass tanks where you have a passageway underneath is my favourite. They have done an outstanding job here!

If you like underwater things, you should visit. We visited the Aquarium, which is in the heart of the Waterfront, during a three day stay in Cape Town. We saw creatures there that I have never seen before. There is a huge variety of marine life although the signage is not always accurate. Some of the exhibits stress the importance of how we need to change if we are to save the planet. We spent a very enjoyable 3 hours there

Fantastic! . We visited the aquarium with our two toddlers, aged 4 & 6. What a fantastic experience. We arrived early as to avoid the holiday rush. The aquarium is really littered with interesting displays. The large tanks are really spectacular. Sharks so close i could start counting teeth! Although not cheap, I honestly believe it is value for money. The yearly tickets also seem to be a steal, and had I lived in Cape Town, I would definitely invest in them. The kiddies area is also entertaining with puppet shows and other activities on offer. You cannot fault this place.

Kids birthday party at Two Oceans Aquarium. If you are ever bored in Cape Town , take a trip to the aquarium. We took our kids ah headed off to a birthday party hosted there which we didnt know you could do. From start to finish our kids enjoyed themselves immensely and were not bored at all. We then all went to the restuarant where a real treat was waiting for the kids. They had lots of fun and were completely exhausted by the time we went home. From the waitresses to the manager were superb in handeling the little ones.
Not what I expected. The aquarium is cool for kids or for a rainy day, but that's it. If you visited a sea aquarium before, you won't get surprised by what you see.

The kids loved it, surprisingly educational. Our visit on a Sunday afternoon coincided with the feeding of the penguins and we found the experience educational and the kids enjoyed it. We also witnessed the feeding of the sharks in the predator exhibition, this was a spectacle watched by a full house at the auditorium as it quite a popular attraction with the rugged tooth sharks, a turtle plus other predator fish species. There are colourful and interesting smaller species of marine life, some that one can never imagine ever existed, which were a revelation to us. The kids also loved the educational frogs puppet show. All in all it is a fun and mind stimulating environment. Awesome space every kid will love (it awakens the kid in everyone of us)
fantastic fish. I always pay a visit to the aquarium when I visit Cape Town. It is a great place to spend a few hours.

Well worth the visit. I had a very enjoyable hour here - could have stayed much longer as there was so much to read and see but my brain cannot absorb all that much! Good explanations of the two oceans. Good shop too for souvenirs / presents

Very interesting with boat trip as an added value. If you have anough time, I advise everybody to book a boat trip! The aquarium has special sections for kids that can make their experience unforgetable.

Nice aquarium. We had high expectations for the place based on the reviews and aquarium was nicely designed, has a lot of different features, exhibitions, displays. Loved the penguins, large sharks and tuna in the huge tank! Each review is subjective.. if you are there in the V&A waterfront should not miss it but if you have been to the Monterrey, Sydney or Auckland aquariums.. this will not knock your socks off!

Nice and large aquarium at the waterfront. Visited the aquarium and really had a great time. Fondly and nicely designed with lots of fish to see. Lots of basins to explore. Very nice penguin exhibition with changing tides and real waves. Brilliant explanation of the whales around South Africa. Very good also for children. They are still rebuilding and expanding. A very good aquarium for a bad weather day or when visiting the Waterfront.

Great Educational activity for students. I took my students to the V&A Two Oceans Aquarium for their lesson on what the seas off Cape Town have to offer. The Volunteer staff were fantastic. They had worksheets for the older students to do. As it was raining that day, we were given a large room to sit and have our tea break and eat our packed lunches. The exhibits are fantastic and they were in awe when listening to the professionals tell them all about the exhibits and witness the feeds. It's a recommendation to visit the Aquarium as they differ around the world, although our Two Oceans will guarantee a special experience!

Excellent aquarium - diving in Shark tank a must!. Fantastic exhibitions and the dive just made it - I would highly recommend booking a dive into the shark tank a couple of days in advance (must be qualified) as you then get free entry to the rest of the aquarium.

the best ever. I have been to many aquiriums around the world, Tghis one is one of the tops I haveever been to. The exhibits are 1st class, well done, the penguin are very healthy looking and the staff is well trained, Bill New World Expeditions

A quality experience. If you're spending time at the V&A waterfront, don't miss the opportunity to spend time at the Two Oceans Aquarium. Staff are friendly, the displays are all very well done and informative, and there are many opportunities to learn something new about marine life. And there's an open pool that includes penguins and oystercatchers. The largest tank, which includes shark and other large fish, is mesmerizing. It is worth setting aside some extra time just to quietly watch the light and movement.

Fantastic sea aquarium but too pricey. Very educational, as opposed to many other aquariums in the world where the focus is on show and sensational, you walk out of Two Oceans Aquarium actually having learned something, but the cost of entering this relatively small aquarium is a bit steep.

Fun for everyone!. Spent a wonderful morning looking at the most amazing sea creatures. The interactive exhibits are well organized and informative. The staff are super pleasant and answer questions .Very reasonably priced fun for all .

Nice experience. The aquarium is really well done and entertaining for all members of the family - especially our three year old son! I loved the little touches that made it child-friendly - ledges next to the tanks for him to be able to see into the tanks himself, bathroom basin lowered at the end for children, play area halfway through to take a break and get a snack. We started the visit with lunch on the outside deck and it had a nice menu and beautiful view.Good place to visit with kids!
Great Fish but not to eat. A really nice aquarium right on the waters edge. Stay away from the shark baiting. It is making them dangerous - go here rather and see the sharks up close and personal
Small and huge. Centrally located at the Waterfront, Cape Town. Many species of fishes, corals and even sharks swimming with other smaller fishes. The penguins are also present.

Remove Indoor Penguin Display. I would give it 5 stars BUT i feel very sick to my stomach when i think about those poor penguins in the penguin display that never get sunshine on their skin!!!!!!! And they don't have much room to move around! It is so cramped! When the aquarium remove the indoor penguin display i will give it 5 stars but until the it only gets 1 star!

Inside the Aquarium. Excellent attraction with all the marine life all around you and Sharks also visible in front of you. Putting yourself in the middle of the display was unique experience, i.e., you among the fishes.
Great fun for the kids. A lovely spot to take the kids, particularly on a rainy day. Lots to see and a lovely play area for the kids. Restaurant also had a nice play area.

Morning outing with my family. This is almost the perfect place to spend a few hours on a weekend morning alone or with friends and family. I have bought an annual family pass, which pays for itself after the first visit. Plus I receive a good discount from the restaurant and some good opportunities to attend some awesome events at the aquarium.Puppet shows for the kids, penguin feeding, shark feeding and and an array of sea creatures makes coming back her different every time.While it may not be as big as some of the international aquariums, it definitely represents South African coastal and sea life as well as various sea life conservation projects.The shark tank is one of the highlights and even having been to the aquarium many times, I always spend a bit of time here mesmerized by these beautiful creatures.Don't forget to get some gelato on the way out.

Great family outing. We had a great time at the aquarium. The kids stayed entertained for a good few hours. Be sure a catch the penguin feeding times. I definitely recommend a visit to the aquarium as part of a trip to the V&A waterfront for all visitors to Cape Town.

Healing and Fun. This year I bought an annual membership for myself and my two kids! The aquarium is every parents dream location to just unwind whilst the little ones are thoroughly entertained. Whenever we are running short of ideas, the Aquarium is the place we pick to undo the boredom we may experience. The puppet shows and touching pools are always a treat. At the end of every visit, we always end our stay at the craft tables, where we paint whatever canvasses are available. Parents are allowed to paint too! Winters in Cape Town are always a treat at the Aquarium. We like that they are constantly upgrading too. The annual membership also allows us discounted rates to really fun activities organised by the establishment like Halloween parties and breakfast picnics, etc. Definately value for money. For adults, the experience is awesome too. There is nothing like HUGE, majestic sea creatures to keep one in awe of life.

Meet the creatures. I enjoyed my visit, taking a look through the aquarium. We watched them feed the penguins, turtles and manta rays. There's a lot to see but i was a bit disappointed that the predator tank was pretty small
Two Ocean Aquarium. Fantastic place to visit during Summer and Winter. Spectacular view of the many fish and lots of activities for the kids. My favourite part is the Sunday feeding of the Sharks
Great for kids!. Always fun taking my god child to see the fish, there is lots of space to move prams around. The fish are well looked after and a play section for the kids to have fun in.

amazing experience for kids and adults. beautifully set up and presented, the Aquarium offers a few hours experience for the all family, with unique fish and sea-life of both the Indian and the Atlantic oceans.

Children's paradise. My daughter is a member at the aquarium, and we take her there at least every two weeks. They have a dynamic program which changes every two weeks, focusing on a different aspect of the ocean every time. The kelp forest is a timeless favorite.

Time worthwhile spent. If looking for a worthy experience, you will not go wrong visiting the aquarium. The attention to detail and variety of the display is quite amazing. It is a really humbling experience and much can be learnt from taking in the visual experience that only the peace and serenity of a well run, well laid out top notch aquarium like this can offer.

Super afternoon out for the family. Really enjoyed it, lots to see, my daughters loved the puppet show and then we had break in the cafe, there's a play area in the aquarium and a play area in the cafe so they were very happy!

Travel to another world. I haven't been to the Aquarium in some years but it was a good little trip.We went as family and enjoyed it, there is something for every one in the family to enjoy.
