The big tanks and tunnel/half tunnel was my favorite with the penguins and educational tanks more for the kids.The staff was very friendly and helpful and we spent a few hours just staring at the creatures of the deep up and close. Its on the pick-up point for the red bus tour ( V and A Waterfront) , close to all the shops and restaurants and not expensive so definitely drop in if you are in the area.

Wonderful staff. My girlfriend and I visited this wonderful place and it was all brilliant - but what struck me the most was how god damn friendly and helpful every single staff member was. All of them, that I interacted with, were highly knowledgeable and never once talked down to us. My only discomfort was the heat in there, but I can imagine it'd be ruddy expensive to aircon every part of the aquarium.

A aquarium that presents the fauna of both the Atlantic and Indian oceans.. No really big but interesting aquarium in the V&A waterfront of Cape Town. Nicely presented with small and very big aquariums. It is even possible to dive there with sharks!
nice place. its a nice place to go with family or kids...lots to see and a nice shop there to buy gifts.the sharks are cute

Must see place for visitors. A fabulous place for young and old. Sit and relax at the kelp forest and feel your troubles melt away. Or watch the sharks or the penguins being fed. The smaller tanks are full of exquisite species. Great place for kids. Sadly it is very expensive, so the majority of Cape Town's citizens will never see it.

Great ocean display. Not as good as Usharka in Durban, but worth a visit if you are near the V&A waterfront. They have some great displays and you can see some unique scenes of the ocean life in the Cape Area.

Awesome place to visit in CT. We loved the Aquarium, lots of aquatic life, great for kids, a lot of educational info. Amazing hall to sit down and watch the sharks, tuna, tortoises and the rest. Entertaining program for kids. Overall we had a great time.

Interesting visit. The Two Oceans Aquarium is well known to be one of Cape Town's top attractions and is a stone’s throw away from the V&A Waterfront. The exhibits were informative and there were a few interactive stations such as the microscope station and the tactile tank. At both of these, there were knowledgeable volunteers who added a different dimension to the exhibits. The children loved them! The Penguin area was also very cute, and at feeding time some is available to answer questions and also share interesting penguin facts. The predator tank is also impressive. The Aquarium seemed to be a hit with families and young children. Worth a visit for sure!
Good. Good range of Aquarian life. Interesting info supplied with each exhibit. Got round the place too quickly though. Ideal for children

Nice place to visit.. My wife and I made reservations several months in advance to 'dive with the sharks' and had a good time. the staff was very friendly and eager to help us with any problems we had. it was cool to see the creatures from 'the other side of the glass' and have a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Before and after our dive we had an enjoyable time visiting the entire aquarium and exhibits. there is a small restaurant on-site that served average food that fit the bill. I have been here twice and would visit again.
Educational and fun. We loved the aquarium and thought it was one of the best we had visited. There was a lot of information, the tanks were well cared for and the exhibits were stunning.

Very good aquarium to visit. Comparing to other aquariums I've visited this one is an average one. It is not very large and not very reach collection of species. The truth is that I've seen some for the first time. They have some educational programs for children here which is good. The best thing is the penguins area - they are absolutely free at 2m distance of you! Amazing!

Lots to see. This is a very well stocked aquarium with interesting exhibits and some family friendly presentations. The main tanks are very large and visible from many angles. I always feel a bit uncomfortable in places where animals are confined for entertainment (Zoos, circuses Etc). I would love to dive and visit these creatures at home, but that will not be happening. The organisation does a lot of conservation and research, so I can justify it and it does provide somewhere pleasnat to go.

Nice place to visit. The Two Oceans Aquarium was good, but I think those with children would get more out of this as they have lots of interactive experiences. The entry ticket allows you to go in and out all day. There are feeding sessions that can be observed at different times throughout the day. We were fortunate to be there when the diver entered the Kelt tank and the penguin's were being fed.
Beautiful. If you are a nature lover this will give you your "fishy-fix" Great diversity of species, good sized for all the family. Clean.

Perfect for a morning with the kids!. This aquarium had all the stuff you would expect - excluding large whales/dolphins or others that really shouldn't be in captivity - and was very well laid out. My toddler loved it! Lots of informative signs, lots of variety. We particularly liked the frog and penguins. Definitely worth a few hours if you are in Capetown on a rainy day!

Small and pleasantly-formed. This is a small but informative and nicely set-out aquarium - ideal for a couple of hours' respite on a warm, spring day! Our children loved the touchy-feely area where an enthusiastic assistant told them all about the local marine life.
Fish-watching. An extensive collection showcasing the fish of the South African waters. The smaller tanks are well- lighted and the large tanks have a wonderful diversity of fish.

Lovely. Wonderful for kids and adults, especially if the weather is bad. Easy to spend to 2 hours there. Massive tanks well designed, makes you feel part of the sea. Take a camera. Go for coffee, organic juice and wonderful eats in the market (shed) about 50m towards the waterfront.

Attraction for young and oldest kids. i recommand the visit of this aquarium whatever your age, it's educationnal, funny ( kids will enjoy the clownfish tank when they can "go inside"). The weather was rainy and it was the perfect visit( 2 Hours needed). You've got a large artcrafts market next to the aquarium.

Fantastic aquarium with Sharks dive. It was really nice for us to see the different aquariums but mostly the big one with the sharks.If you have the opportunity book a Shark Dive; it was an amazing experience though a little bit chilled towards the end; make sure you wear a long sleeve lycra underneath the neoprene if you are used to tropical waters and of course have someone on the other side who can take pictures of you with all the sharks/turtle/stingray around or bring your underwater camera with you during the dive.

Informative. I enjoyed going alone for a change without children rushing me on to the next exhibit. Being able to take my time and read the information about each exhibit was great! This is a great educational activity and it was amazing seeing these creatures up close.

One of the best aquariums. Very good aquarium, well laid out with information for all. Plenty to do for goods, good environmental links, cafeteria on site but for good cheap food visit the food market nearby.
fun. The Aquarium is good fun, lots of different species of fish. Feeding of the penguins was especially fun. Walking under the swimming sharks. Spend 2 hours here.

Nicely done. We spent a couple of hours here while wandering around Cape Town. A nice variety of exhibits including a nice large tank full of large fish. The penguin exhibit upstairs was a hit with kids (and me). Several interactive exhibits were a plus for the younger set. Not quite as nice as the Shed in Chicago or the aquarium in Atlanta but well worth your time.

Fishy Fun In The Sun. This is our seventh visit to Cape Town, but first with our 2yr old daughter, we visited the Aquarium as something to do for her in the Waterfront and what a treat! The touch pool, penguins and turtle blew her mind and we all had a great day!

Ocean attractions. The two Oceans aquarium was well set out and the variety of sea creatures was interesting. We found the aquarium clean and the staff helpful. The shark feeding was a highlight for us and the divers had a hard time keeping the rays and other fish species at bay while they fed the sharks. It was comforting to see the efforts being made to make the public aware of the endangered species of fish.

Well worth the visit.... The displays are fantastic, far better than many in Europe. The place was clean and tidy and apart from a noisy school group a pleasant place to visit. Staff are attentive and were able to support our visit in a professional manner. The diversity of colours and sealife on display is amazing. The restaurant could however, be greatly improved in terms of service. We stopped in for a coffee and sandwich at around 1500 and left without having either after 20 minutes of waiting to be attended to despite the place being almost empty (now know why).
A great collection in an intimate space. The diversity of creatures was broad and we learned a lot about the local seas and what lives below the waves

Something to have pride in.... The two Oceans aquarium is one of a few places we can still be proud of. The entrance fee compared to similar places in Europe and America is low, and it is clear that most of the fees collected goes to the upkeep and maintenance of the aquarium. The kelp gardens is a place to sit and relax for a few minutes because it has such a calming and tranquil efect. I would highly recommend a visit and also revisited to anyone visiting Cape Town.

A Photographer's Dream. We visited the Aquarium during a romantic trip to the winelands in the Autumn of 2014. It's been there for ages and each time I visit it there's something new. The place is designed to let you stroll around, beneath and into the displays of colourful creatures. I especially enjoyed the orange shrimp in the blue tank, the Nemo's you can pop your head into and the sharks in the whirlpool aquarium. A great extention to your visit would be to catch a sail boat from the Harbour and see South Africa's marine life from another unique angle.
Amazing. Very interesting for the whole family! In the centre of Capetown, nearby the Citybus Hop-on hop-off and also very nice and also cheap for 2 days!

Aquatic Fun for all. Had a trip with a group of children on a Saturday morning and had a better that expected experience - the kids loved it and I can recommend it to any visitor, well worth the visit, spend some time just relaxing at the large Auditorium and view the passing parade of aquatic life. very enjoyable morning and the kids and adults enjoyed it equally.

Well presented. Had heard good reports about the aquarium so on a wet Monday it seemed like a good option. The tanks and presentation of the fish and other sea animals (coral/urchins sea fans etc.)was very good with the big tank at the centre extremely good comprising tuna,rays and a couple of sharks to name just a few. Possibly the route through could be slightly clearer but this is the only thing you could comment on. Lovely attention to detail with the descriptions of the contents of the tanks. Very enjoyable and would be an excellent place to visit if you had children.
Good place for kids. Beautiful and relaxing to watch. Kids enjoy the feeding times and just sitting and watching the fishes.

Magical place in great location. Happened to be passing by this place whilst in Cape Town & decided to go in & have a look around. The place was truly magical, so many different types of aquatic life to see & touch, a great experience for kids & grownups alike. Only part that scared me senseless was the shark tank, you see it from afar before getting too close, however to get past it you have to walk under a glass tunnel where they're all swimming by. Thankfully someone held my hand whilst i ran under it with my eyes closed (not a fan of sharks)Price was good for the amount you get to see & not far from the water & lots of good restaurants, certainly worth a visit. Only complaint was that a few of the 'Nemo' fish were dead at the top of the tank, which upset a few kids (poor things)

Fabulous Fish. The aquarium is amazing. Especially on rainy days with kids. Lots of crazy fish to see. Trippy kelp forest. Sharks. Penguins. Activities. Puppet show. Arts and crafts. Go early to avoid the crowds. It opens at 9:30. It's not particularly cheap as a tourist but as a local you get an annual membership and it is totally worth it if you go a few times. Kids love this place and adults won't be bored.

More than just an aquarium. I already positively reviewed this aquarium and I recently went back.This time I like to mention that the souvenir shop has a very nice collection of items. They let you into the shop even if you didn't buy a ticket to see the aquarium.Of course there are the usual things with the fixed price tags attached to it valid all over South Africa, but it has other nice things too. You will definitely find something nice to bring home.What people forget that this aquarium has very nice restaurant attached to it. If you sit outside, you have a wonderful view over the harbor. The prices are very low too for a tourist place like my double espresso for only about R20. Great view, great prices, don't miss it.

This was OK.. If you've not been to an Oceanarium before then this is worth a visit. It is very good, but not unique to Cape Town, I think there are other attractions that take priority over this. However that said this would be great if you had children.

Fascinating. The Two Oceans Aquarium has a hefty price tag (well, for South Africans, anyway), but it's well worth visiting. There are many different displays, static and live, and the layout invites curiosity!If you have any interest at all in the life in our oceans, you'd definitely appreciate this aquarium. And children will almost certainly love it!

Feeding the sharks. The Aquarium is always a good outing and even better if your timing includes feeding the sharks. That was the highlight of the trip. We also experience the feeding of the penguin...what a noise they make but what a joy to see them enjoying their lunch. There are so much to see inside and every time you will see something new. There is just no end to the wonders of the sea. If you are looking for quiet time then there is no better place as a front row seat in front of one of the many big windows where you can see all kinds of fish, other sea animals and plants moving with the current of the sea.

Exceptional Wonders of the Deep. This is very well worth a visit. Wonderful tanks very well presented with loads of species. Good for children as they are well catered for. Don't miss this when in Cape Town.

Amazing fish. The tanks are huge and the variety is awesome I took the most amazing picture's of the sharks and of other fish that I have not seen in any other aquarium. The gift store has great souvenirs to take home and overall I had a great day at the aquarium and was well worth a visit.

Great for the kids. If you have kids and looking for entertainment, this is the place to be. We have the annual pass and I think its definitely worth it as we go quite often especially in the rainy weather.

A real treat for the whole family. This is one of our favourite places to visit in Cape Town! The fish and other animals are very well looked after and the displays are breathtakingly beautiful. We enjoy the shark feeding, penguin feeding and touch displays the most. We visit often and can recommend this site. The restaurant provides good food which is well received after all the excitement.Would recommend this experience for young and old!
Great for kids. Great play area & activities for kids. They also enjoy popping their heads up in the middle of the clown fish so it looks like they are swimming with Nemo & friends.

Great selection of fish. I've been to many aquariums, but this is one of my favorites. They had a station where I was able to pet a starfish and an urchin. They also had an entire "nemo" tank which was amazing. The aquarium was well laid out and all the staff were very friendly.

Super indoor outing. We go at least once every two months, Cant wait for the new section to open. Nothing much to dislike. The aquarium has a calming effect away from the everyday stress (even though one is always running around after the little ones as they want to see everything)

One of the best.. I travel a lot and have been to a large number of aquaria around the world. For it's size and diversity, this one has to be one of the best I've ever been to. The tanks and variety of creatures on display is awesome.It will take you a good few hours to really look around so do allow plenty of time. There is an associated trip on a boat available but I didn't take this.Enjoy:)

Great place to take the kids. If you have kids who love to be entertained, no better place than the aquarium. Its beautiful and has lots of things to see, so you wont regret it. It is a bit pricy though but good fun none the less.

Fun attraction at the V&A. We were staying at the V&A waterfront so this aquarium was walking distance from our apartment, so I can't speak as to the parking situation. I believe the fee to get in was about 10-12 USD. It is a very nice aquarium, but ranges on the small side. It is something you can do in just an hour or two. I really enjoyed the penguin and shark exhibits. Our group had a lot of fun with the cameras that are near the touch tanks that will upload your photos, so don't miss that. The aquarium is located in a great area with a lot of great shopping and restaurants on the waterfront nearby.

Kids love it. We live in Cape Town so we have been here many times. Its a fab aquarium - but its a bit repetative now ! The penguin area smells awful so we always rush through that section. The shark tank is cool.

Not worth the hype. I spent two weeks in Cape Town with my boyfriend, and visiting the aquarium was on our list of things to do.The price per person was R250 and it was a waste of time and money! We spent less than 2hours at the aquarium, there's not much to see or too do either. The touch pools were okay, we watched the divers feed the Sharks and that's about it, waste of money to be honest.
Good. Good.My 6 year old son loved it. We parked our car in Victoria Wharf mall and had to walk quite a bit to get there.One tip : Please park your cars at Alfred mall.

Sea extravaganza. Brilliant is not the word.Died a thousand deaths video shooting my family swimming with the sharks in the predators tank.The rest of the sea creatures paled strongly against this nightmarish feat.Great world class dive master though!!

fun place. This was a good aquarium showcasing the 2 oceans that border South Africa. The price was good. There were several neat exhibits with a flare for the creative. This aquarium is on the smaller size so it is fairly quick to take in.

Worth a visit. This is definitely worth a visit, although coming from Durban the Ushaka Marine World is better. The one area that Two Oceans trumps is the interactive section where you can touch and feel certain seas creatures and plants - a good hit with the kids.

Nice aquarium. I had been before but it was still worth another visit to come back and look around again, there is a wide range of fish to see of all sizes from water horses to sharks. I generally come in the last 1-2 hours of the day and it is usually pretty quiet at that time.

Lovely. Beautiful aquarium across from our hotel lovely souvenirs. This place is currently being made bigger so should be brilliant in 6 months or so.The café attached served some lovely dishes I think we ate there 3 times, sometimes for convenience but if it wasn't nice we wouldn't have gone back
enjoyable aquarium. We very much enjoyed this aquarium--beautiful marine life, well-organized displays. An enjoyable aspect of a trip to the Cape Town waterfront!

Peaceful and informative. We spent 4 hours here, mostly sitting in front of the predators tank. A lot of information given and the atmosphere is one of peace and harmony. Although it is a small aquarium, it has a huge heart.

does not live up to the good reviews, feel sorry for the sealife in there. I expected more after reading the good reviews. Whilst there are interesting fish and other sealife to see, most of them are in tanks that are way to small and often overcrowded. Most fish have nowhere to hide and nothing interesting at all for them in their tanks, I felt sorry for them. The turtle was showing clear signs of stress, and so did other fish. Anyone who cares about sealife will feel sad after visiting.

Felt Young Again. From African Penguins to Predator Fish and Coral Reefs, I felt like I was young again. Be prepared also to enjoy watching the fish going through the algae in masses. Also be prepared to at least sign up a petition to either support or condemn whailing

Love the penguins. Better than the average aquarium by far and the staff really believe in what they are doing. Conservation and education is the driving force. Feeding the African and Rockhopper Penguins is a must, especially as you are within a few feet of it all.
A Must See!. We thoroughly enjoyed the aquarium. Ideally situated at V&A Waterfront, there are over 3000 species of marine life. You find yourself immersed in this sea world. Unbelievable!!!!
Entertaining experience. Great way to be entertained and interact with some sea life. Good fun for kids and pretty reasonable.

Awesome. its been 4 years ago , but when I hear the name of two oceans aquarium, I still can imagine those bright colors, fishes and the most important my emotions of that day ;)) enjoy , it's really cool
Amazing array of marine life. We got a discount as we had been on the Bus tour. Loads of fish and I even tried to get my head under the Nemo Tank (which is really for kids!!)

A Great hands on Aquarium. This is only a relatively small aquarium by the Waterfront in Cape Town but it is really nice for children especially, though we enjoyed it too. It had a wonderful variety of fish and the staff had hands-on areas where you could touch and feel the fish which made it so much more interesting for the children. The cafe overlooked the marina area too.

Fabulous displays. As you might expect there are many tanks and fish, but some of the large tanks which display the environment as well as the fish which live there took my breath away. Well worth a visit.
Good for a rainy day.. A great aquarium with plenty of marine life and situated on the Waterfront. The place was very clean and everything was well laid out.

Amazing. There was a good variety of sea species available to view. The children was very exited to see a lot of "Nemo" fish swimming around and i had to answer a lot of questions, lol. They also enjoyed seeing the big sharks and turtles and that will probably be the closest i will ever get to a shark.

the world of ocean life. a must visit if u in cape town, they have almost all ocean life and the building laid out well, while inside u feel like u walking under the ocean and even shacks shim close to u, for adrenaline junkies, u can dive in the tank full of shacks

great attraction. A must visit place while in Cape Town. Lots of varied fish & sea creatures in a well laid out building. They have a small but good penguin enclosure with informative lesson feeding time. They also have things for kids to do like coming up in a middle of a fish tank and it looks like the kids are with the fish. There is also a curio shop & one can swim with the sharks.

Nice Aquarium. This is a nice little aquarium which is still expanding. The staff were all pleasant and there are some nice exhibits. We did the Penguin Encounter which we thoroughly enjoyed and found very interesting. Just watch out for the hoards of school children on their trips!
Ushaka Marine world is SO much better. Was bitterly disappointed with our visit here. Not worth the time or money. The exhibits were so few, it makes u wonder why they even bothered...

Nice aquarium. This was a nice experience. It was a bit small to earn more than a 3, but it has an amazingly huge central tank with sharks, turtles and many other fish, which is very interesting to sit and watch.

pretty good aquarium. my wife and i visited on 09/22/14 while staying at the cape grace hotel (nearby). this was a very nice aquarium. it took about an hour and a half to walk through. my only complaint was there was tons of little kids running around (school visits), but i suppose that can be expected. certified scuba divers can go into the shark tank. i would recommend this place as somewhere to see in the harbor area.

Wonderfull. It is very rewarded to sign up for a guide. We book a guide beforehand. It was excellent to get all the info. I visit the place a few years ago . It was good , but this time the guide give me so much info!! A must to visit!

Under renovation but still very good. It will be even better.. I had the day to myself on the V&A Waterfront, so I went in as it was a bit miserable and rainy for the morning. I knew it was in process of renovation and extension so expected displays to be a bit lacking. In practice, I ended up spending a wonderful three and a half hours inside. There's much to entertain youngsters, including a Finding Nemo tank with a glass dome in the centre where they can put their heads up and be right among the clown fish. There's also a smashing little automated puppet show on the subject of protecting the habitat of frogs. For adults, much to see; much to photograph. My one disappointment was that the seahorses were missing due to the extension works. A good reason to return when next I visit Cape Town.The Aquarium is also the easiest place to pick up the Tourist hop on-off bus from the waterfront, or there's a car park across the road.

Single visit to two oceans. We visited this aquarium during our Cape Town holiday. Plenty to see and do here even for children though we didn't have any in our party. Staff once you got in were very friendly though on the reception / entrance I would say their customer service skills could be improved. Our visit from the UK was worthwhile and as we visited the Aquarium in the Dubai Mall on our stopover going home the Two Oceans was certainly just as good and members of our party thought even better.
Take the kids. If you have younger Kids this is a must as you will have a ball. a few great touch and feel areas too and some real cool fish to see and come close to.
Keep the kids enchanted!. The aquarium was a super outing, our young kids had a ball. It is a good place to visit if the weather is miserable as everything is under cover.

A must see in Cape Town. Great entertainment for old and young alikeConsider an annual membership. (Great idea for gifts)Excellent visit to get out of the midday sun. In the early afternoon there are feeding times for penguins etc
Fun and well designed. I thought the aquariums were really beautiful. They do a good job with posted information.The penguins were so cute. The sharks are intimidating!

Two Oceans One location. Well organised, with interesting displays about the difference between the two oceans (Atlantic and Indian - warm and cold). Plenty to see and although it was midweek with school groups visiting they did not distract from the experiance

best aquarium I have ever visited. I have been to several highly rated aquariums in the US, but found the Two Oceans Aquarium very special indeed. One of my first observations was that their reefs and sea plants in the displays were real, not artificial. Offering displays from both the Indian (warm) Ocean and the Atlantic (cold) Ocean makes this aquarium unique. Another strength is their child-friendly facility and services. There is a playspace built into the tour, as well as a children's classroom/party space. Very educational and beautiful!
awesome experiance. nothing I disliked about it! Young and old, we had an awesome time at the aquarium....we were so lucky to see feeding of the sharks

Great visit for the whole family. The two oceans aquarium is a very nice attraction near the waterfront of Cape Town... regardless of the weather. We especially enjoyed the penguins and the 2 big aquariums, one of which contains sharks, turtles and other very big fish.-> must see when in Cape Town.
Aquarium. large place and its nice to go when the weather is raining the entrance price are good but its a normal aquarium nothing special I wish if there was a Dolphin show or a whale .

Beautifully arranged. Given that the waters are often rough and cold off Cape Town, instead of diving, we went to the aquarium. Small and nicely displayed, differentiating Atlantic and Indian oceanic under water life. Also a small penguin exhibit. Confortable settings to sit and just watch the fish for a leisurely visit. I would advise a weekday or when school is in session because kids flood this venue.
Penguins <3. The penguins were really cute and close to the visitors! And the feeding was great and interesting.I think going on sundays to see the shark feeding can be also amazing.
Interesting. Easy to get round and some novel displays. Get in the tank (wet) with Sharks - get in the tank and stay dry - with hundreds of nemos.

Good aquarium, shows local animals. This impressive aquarium has a very good display of local fish, seafood, plants, and other under water creatures. It places the animals in its tanks in environments that are similar to the ones they would find if in the wild. There is a large tank that is similar to the ones in San Francisco and Monterey, Ca. The display says there are only 3 like it in the world. Good sized collection. Does good job of education about the local eco system.

Oldish and intimate. Was wanting to while away 45mins and stepped into this aquarium. Overall you can see the age of this place and they are working on sprucing up several exhibits Their main tanks with the giant fish and sharks are small by comparison with other better known aquariums around the worldThey do have a penguin exhibit which was a nice and uncommon touchOverall ok for 45 mins and didn't wow

This was our first stop from the airport. This was our first stop straight from the airport. My daughter was veery excited to finally visit the aqwarium for the first time. We had lunch at the restaurant and enjoyed the harbor scenery and the seal platform where a big seal bull was basking in the sun. At the aquarium there was lots to see, explore and learn. There is even a new section that was being build during the time we were visiting.All in all a great experience for families with young children and although pricey worth every cent as we love the sea and sea creatures.
Nice small aquarium. Loved the penguins and the big tank of Nemo fish! It is not a large aquarium, but very nicely arranged and easy to get to.
Pretty good aquarium. Spend 2 hours here on a rainy day. Some really cool sea creatures worth having a look at. Gift shop is quite pricey.

Aquarium Visit. We decided to spend an hour or so at the Aquarium and loved it, the exhibits were just amazing and the Penguins were so cute!! We had allot of fun in the photo booth, and the touching pool where kids can touch some of the sea life and learn about them. I would recommend this for families with children or just couples who want to know more about the sea, and what lives in it.
Beautiful ocean creatures. Great family activity or outing. Kids loved it and parents enjoyed it alike. Loved seeing the sharks being fed! That was awesome

Fun for everyone. We loved the penguin feeding and the kelp forest exhibit. The aquarium is doing a lot for conservation and is well looked after. It is interesting for everyone, not just children. Lots of fun as well as educational.

UNDERWATER Wonder. The sea life shown is amazing.The fishes,sharks plants, fauna, penguins are worth looking at.All the exhibits are so well set out and explained that it is really worth a visit especially if with children

My daughter loved it!. It is a well packaged aquarium. The highlights for us was the penguins with the children's play area right next to it. It also had excellent photo opportunities, the clownfish tank was another favorite for my daughter. We totally loved it.
Good for the kids. Ok experience. Not as good as the ones in Dubai or Singapore. The cafes good with a nice play area for kids. They sometimes have puppet shows for kids too. The kids will enjoy

Nice stop while in Cape Town.. We have been to a number of very nice aquariums in the US. One of my favorite is the Aquarium in downtown Dallas. This facility is on par with the Dallas Aquarium and is worth the cost of admission.
A lot of money for seeing a few fish. I must say, I have been to better aquarium. It might be interesting for little kids, but not for young people or adults.
Large variety. Awesome layout with massive variety however it would've been nice if they could have people doing brief chats on some of the animals and just being available to answer questions.

For The Kids. Although Ive been here many times I still feel it is a nice trip especially for the Kids. Most cities across the world have Aquariums so I think if you want to give this one a skip you will have an extra 2 hours to see other sites that you might not have at home.

African Penguins. We liked the african penguins. You could get really close up to them. We also liked the fish from the Indian ocean. We liked the hundreds of clown fish, too. It was a very good aquarium. Worth the money.

There isn't much to see. There isn't much to see. The price is too much for what is on offer. Definitely for kids I think. Was a bit expensive and disappointing if you consired the much larger Durban Aquarium.

Fun for the whole family!. As a nanny in Cape Town I visit the aquarium once or twice a week with the little ones I look after! There's so much to see and a lovely kids area downstairs! The food at Shoreline cafe is also excellent! If you're a local get a year membership! Totally worth it! Kids under 4 are free!

A wonderful way to spend 2-3 hours with young children at the Waterfront. Being from the Monterey Bay Area in California with one of the world's best aquariums, it isn't as grandiose as ours, but for the price of admission, its displays are so very "kid friendly", with so many opportunities for children ages 2-14 to get up close to all the denizens of the deep. Well done! One of it's best features is a "cafeteria/coffee shop/playground" on the lower level, where tired parents can sit with a cup of coffee while their little children can play in the sand, relax and recharge!
Nice. This was a nice Aquarium for children but a wee bit small but well worth a visit. The penguins are worth a look.

2 Oceans aquarium. Fabulous exhibits , my grandchildren and I love coming here for an educational fun filled day.Always something to see that you might have missed last time around. love it. We have annual membership so no need to queue and a lot cheaper overall.

FANTASTIC. Just loved exploring this gem in #LoveCapeTown and combined this tour with a Catamaran experience into the beautiful Atlantic Coast to view dolphins! You can combine this tour or not but both is a must when in #LoveCapeTown
Be amazed!. If you have never dived, this is something to see! Don't miss the feeding of the fish in the Ocean Basket tank, as well as the penguins.
Lovely!. I Love aquariums! And this one is beautiful. There's a big variety of sea animals and the penguins are so cute. Lovely experience, I would love to go again.
Day out with the kids. What a lovely time I had with the school kids. Beautiful, well taken care of animals, clean place, and friendly staff.

Under the sea. Exhibitions are stunning. As you enter there's Nemo and Dory waiting to be photographed with you inside their tank (a funnel you pop your head into which makes it look like you are right in there with them - very cool). The predator tank feeding every day at 15:00, sharks are fed on a Sunday - love watching feeding time. The kelp forest is so peaceful you may just be hypnotized by the ocean sway. I love the touchy feely tank where you can hold a starfish, feel an anemone's prickles, see crabs up close and personal all under supervision to keep the animals safe. The microscopic display is fascinating and always gets my attention. The kiddy play area down by the seal tank has all sorts of art and craft activities and puppet shows at different times of the year. When my children were young we went every holiday and never got tired of it. If you become a member you get to have sleep overs in the aquarium with treasure hunts, and all sorts of fun activities. Sleeping by the kelp forest was a highlight for our whole family. Very educational and entertaining. The restaurant's food is nice but I feel strange eating fish after admiring them alive, so I stick to the sandwiches and salads when I eat there.

Enjoy the Sea from a different perspective. The V&A Aquarium staff are very helpful. Taking a group of children to the Aquarium got me a discount and an activity for the children to do while exploring the different sections of the Aquarium. Make sure you are there for the feeding of the fish, turtles or shark. They are on different days and times. This is a very informative experience. If you want to dive with the fish then that can sure be arranged. Not a bad place to visit on a rainy day.

Average. I Have seen a lot of good aquarium around (Melbourne,Singapore ect) and this is far behind...not bad if you want to know the sea life around but there's nothing outstanding to see..except may be the penguins...

Splish Splash. A well maintained aquarium with a diversity of fish frogs reptiles and penguins. Its air-conditioned so a good escape from those hot Cape Town days. They have a canteen type restaurant : ( not great but fine for ice-cream and sodas

Lovely aquarium. Not many aquariums have this quantity and quality of displays. The penguins are entertaining, but you'll probably spend most of your time in the shark tank - something like the 3rd biggest in the world and an extremely pleasant way to waste a few hours.

Sacred Oceans. Remarkable aquarium with Noel Ashton created them of the sacredness of the oceans and the diversity of life within them. Rival's the Monterey Bay Aquarium in California and Trumps the one in Monte Carlo. One of the world's best. If you're at the waterfront in Cape Town, don't miss it.

Interesting and Manageable Aquarium. I am a big fan of salt water fish- and this aquarium covered not only the fish species but the plant life and sea anemone - Its a nice way to spend an hour or so.....and is in a great area to walk around and shop and eat

Penguin Encounter a Must!. The aquarium itself is of a fair size, and has exhibits (for the most part) not that different from a typical aquarium. The thing that sets it apart is the penguins. They have the normal exhibit, which is nice, but if you're really lucky and there is still space, you should book the Penguin Encounter. They take you to the roof of the aquarium above the penguin exhibit and then they give you time to hold, pet and play with the penguins! It was quite a lot of fun for our family.

Rainy day attraction. We went to the aquarium on a rainy day. Lovely attraction to go to, when the weather is not good. Overall the experience is pleasant and very informative. Can be a little frustrating with noisy school groups. Our 5 year old loved the "feeding of the penguins". Great environmental awareness initiatives were also explained and or advertised. Lovely way to teach our children to look after our natural resources.

Great, but it could be better.. It was a very interesting place and the staff is absolutely amazingly friendly and helpful.I had a great time here, i felt like a child again. Considering the fact tough, that Cape Town is a capital on the shore of Atlantic ocean, i was expecting to a much bigger aquarium, with more fishes/ animals to see. Maybe in the future.As an experience, it was great.

Small aquarium worth a visit. We came here on a rainy day in Cape Town and I must admit is was a lot of fun. Many different varieties of fish! Quite small but they were busy with construction, adding another part to the aquarium.

Want to go over and over again. It is absolutely fantastic. What a great day when the weather is playing up outside. You can spend the whole day there. There is so much to see the times just flies by.

Time to relax. It is always interesting to see the weird and wonderful creatures of the sea. It is also a nice way to relax if you are stressed. Just a few minutes sitting, watching the Kelp Forrest and you are completely relaxed.

Very good aquarium!. We are used to good aquariums coming from California, and the Two Oceans Aquarium was no disappointment. It is obviously run by people committed to preserving our most vital resources. Fun and educational for kids and adults alike!

Good, but small. This aquarium is well layed out, but it is kind of small. Do not expect to kill a lot of time here. The penquins are definitely a highlight of the location. Helpful hint - if you can get the penquin experience, book it. It was amazing.

Educational. What stands out for me at this aquarium is that it is very focused on combining the educational aspect with the visual. So instead of just walking around admiring the aquatic displays, you will frequently encounter areas to interact with staff manning a display with something really interesting to share. Whether it is looking into a microscope at plankton or touch and feel of sea cucumbers or watching the feeding of penguins or predators. Take note of feeding times and puppet shows when you enter and make an effort to attend ... you will enjoy.
More for kids. Although the variety of sea life is good, but kids would definitely enjoy it more than adults. The penguin watching was quite exciting though :)

Fun! Do not miss if with kids in Cape Town. Loved it all - so many things to do and see. Puppet shows on weekends, art and craft area on lower floor with sand pit and play area. Kids can touch and feel sea weed and other cool sea animals...

Nemo & Jaws. A stunning facility to view the deep blue oceans creatures & fishes. Beautiful "Nemo" tanks where they swim around your head. The predator tank is amazing - especially if you are lucky enough to experience feeding time. My girls fell in love with the penguins. Very nice gift/curio shop and reasonably priced too. A very fun activity to do - young & old.

A little educational gem!!. Mum didnt want to leave!! A great place to see different species and well laid out. Best exhibit for both of us was the Kelp exhibit. We went on a day when it was raining and spent a good 6hours. Great idea to have your hand stamped and you can go back again on same day.Fair price and lots to see for both young and old!

Small but interesting - Penguin Experience is Amazing. The aquarium itself is small but nicely laid out. If you are familiar with the Boston or Baltimore Aquariums, this one is maybe a third of the size. However, they have many fish that we haven't seen before so that was neat. For general viewing it took about an hour.The amazing thing was the penguin experience. 3 times a week, 2 people can spend about an hour with the rock hopper penguins - all for $35 (including Aquarium admission)! We booked this and loved it. My sons went to the roof, sat on the edge of the tank , covered in towels while the penguins jumped on their laps and demanded to be petted. The volunteers that were our guides (Tallia and Kristin) were informative, kind, and enthusiastic. We learned about the penguins while having a once in a life time experience. If you can this it completely worth it!
amazing!. in December 2014 it will become even bigger! kids will enjoy it! you can see mermaid-shark eggs! take a guided tour it is worth it
Fish from two oceans. We enjoyed the aquarium as it had fish we had not seen in aquariums in the United States. There were exhibits that appealed to children as well as adults.

Fun little aquarium!. The Two Oceans Aquarium is a small but extremely well curated aquarium -- an excellent introduction to the fish, birds, and marine mammals of South Africa.We saw the penguin feeding and the marine animal show--good fun. Our favorite exhibit was the huge aquarium with many types of beautiful fish...and swimming penguins.
Fun for all ages. Beautiful displays, big fish and sharks. the aquarium is good for about 2 hours but could be done in one hour is you are short on time.
Aquarium Junkie - Two Thumbs Up. Small but well designed aquarium. We enjoyed the exhibits and the staff were well informed and pleasant. We would recommended if in the V&A area.

Sealife. This was easy to find on the waterfront & well worth the money. It is well planned out & there were a couple of places where the children can crawl into a bubble that looks like they are in with the fish!!! There are plenty of different fish to see that we dont get in England & the sharks especially are BIG!!!!unlike the ones we see here.The best Aquarium we"ve been too, in fact this was our 2nd visit.
Great way to spend an afternoon. Small enough to spend a couple of hrs between other tours and dinner. Try to see the penguin feeding - you will learn a lot about them
OK. Somewhat rundown. Atlanta is better. I wouldn't waste my time. There are better things to do and see in Cape Town.

Dive in their Predator Exhibit!. A nice alternative to shark cage diving can be found here at Two Oceans Aquarium. Dive in their Predator Exhibit amongst ragged tooth sharks, rays and turtles. The water is warmer than that of the coast, and the sharks are friendlier!
Great Fun. My husband and daughter dived with the raggy toothed sharks and there are beautiful fish. While away some time and the cafe is good too with a view of the harbour (and seals).
Weather beaten. Parts under construction. It is winter but we so enjoyed it. Tranquil and fish are so calming. The staff were so helpful.

Great experience. This is particluarly the place to go to see sea life. It was a holiday period so packed with children - but the best thing was the extra shows and touch pool experiences that could be had because of this
Super . Had a wonderful time here on a rainy day.Just got off the red bus route popped in for 2 hours and then popped back on bus. A great aquarium. I thought the price was fair. Enjoyed myself

Interesting and Educational. Avoid going over weekends and in school holidays to get most out of the experience. I do wish there were more staff around to whom we could address questions we had about various animals that were not answered by the little info slate.

Decent but other aquariums are better. This aquarium features primarily local sea animals, frogs, and penguins. What it has is nice but it does not compare to the aquariums in Osaka, Lisbon and other cities.
amazing. we took a group of students to the aquarium and it was wonderful watching their faces light up when they saw all of the creatures that are living in their waters!

Awesome. Very relaxing and enjoyable. Large variety of species with friendly staff. Looking forward to their huge new predator exhibit opening end of 2014. Do try to go during the week and avoid school holidays as there may be unsupervised kids running around. The kelp forest is particularly relaxing (sans the kids).
Terrific Aquarium. Excellent visit - penguins were being fed while we were there and the displays are all well done. Good value.
Best Aquarium I have ever been too. I really liked the variety of animals here. You see animals that you do not normally see. They animals are also quite large. It is very affordable.

Interesting, but expensive. Great exhibits, we'll managed, large variety, suitable for all ages. Quite a number of the exhibits were empty however, the number of which seems to be increasing, according to us. It is an ideal option when the weather in the Cape is foul. Having said all the good things I have to mention that it is a very expensive option to go with the family, which is what most locals and visitors do. The restaurant offers reasonable value and is airy and clean.
Great for Kids. I took my one year old son. He loved the place. Adults also like the place as well. It is very entertaining for kids.
Awesome day out!. What a great attraction in Cape Town. We had an absolute great time. The staff were super friendly, informative and helpful. I would definitely visit next time I am in Cape Town.

Great day out with the kids. What a great way do enjoy a rainy day in Cape Town. A very informative aquarium. Make sure that you see the penguin feeding session. It seems that the african penguins go out of their way to pose for photos :)

A must do attraction. Easy access, fantastic exhibits and the staff are brilliant, always willing to take the time to talk to the kids and share their knowledge, the "touch talk" is always a highlight, as is the penguin walk and the seals.

Good rainy day activity. Overall, this is a small acquarium. They do specialize in native flora and fauna that you may not see on other aquariums. They also have a mammoth reed display, one of three in the world.
Here fishy fishy.... Impressive .... Love the shark tank. Make an effort to visit during feeding time. If you are from overseas...ensure that you ask the staff to point out the snoek!

Fun for families. I went last winter because the cable car was closed due to the weather conditions. It was really nice going back there after 10 years to see the sea life. Its very educational when up you take along kids. Unfortunatley I dont have any. The Pengiuns are the cutest!

Rainy day activity. We ended up heading to the Aquarium after our Robben Island tour was cancelled. It was very interesting. I liked the interactive posts, the funny photos areas and the Penguin feedings.I reckon it would be a great kids activity too. Spent about 1.5 hours there
Impressive and Educational. World class and fun for families with kids and adults alike. Although pricy for locals, the aquarium is a must see at least once.

Not what I expected. The Indian Ocean area of the aquarium was extremely tiny. You could easily go through the entire aquarium in an hour. There were some interesting things to see, but overall, I was not very impressed with the place. Good on a rainy day, but not nearly as exciting as I'd hoped.

Aquarium - two Oceans in Cape Town's permanent exhibition. I visited the aquarium with a friend of mine's little boy, as this was time to kill before Mom emerged from local hairdresser looking all relaxed and glam.The aquarium is a good way to while away time with the youngsters and the adults can learn into the bargain ! a wonderful introduction to the sea which inhabits more than 80 percent of the earth's surfaces. Lively fun atmosphere, a lot of comparisons and "'did you sees ?" .... children simply got on with being children and the learning educative side aided by the helpful staff, was great. Also a lively puppet show, with entertainment value.Great variety of species endemic to the Cape's colder waters and our more temperate ones too. Then there were those for poisonous value and those simply kalaeidoscopeic colours, the weird, the odd, the beautiful. plenty of choice.I would say that penguins star of the shows, but quite a number of the colourful fish and starfish interesting ... suggest bring a camera and comfortable walking shoes. Allow 2 hours for the visit.Certain degree of nostalgia ... when I grew up a 74, no not the year 1974, but the fish species a 74 was around. sadly no longer, and more to go. Currently there is a myriad of fish, sharks, reptiles, penguins ... 1000's to keep us entranced.On a related note, the aquarium included a wonderful live exhibit including the dire educational elements - weapons of mass destruction - lethal plastic bags, nets, hooks, wires, bottles, to name but a few and the painful death /destruction our selfish behaviour inflicts.... And a salient lesson in keeping your rubbish to yourself. it is our world but for the next generation or two.

Wonderful. The aquarium is a wonderful place to take young children. There is ample to see and explore. Thankfully there is an eatery and a play area for those young ones who would rather play in the sand.

Dive with the sharks. You can book a dive in the "Predator Tank" or kelp tank. 30 minutes and a fun thing to do. Need to be open water diver. Good briefing before hand if you haven't dived with sharks. Aquarium ok overall.

Underwater delights for all ages. Despite the crowds (bad weather brought in hoards of visitors), it was quite a treat. There are many extraordinary displays to intrigue and delight. The thoughtful presentation, especially for kids being able to "climb in to tanks" and behind them for fabulous photo opportunities, made this a very worthwhile outing for our family. The penguin exhibit is beautiful, but a bit disturbing to watch a couple of penguins trying to get through a barrier to another area. The added frog tanks were interesting. The only low point for me, as an adult, was the puppet show. However, it must be said that my six year old sat quietly through the whole thing, enchanted. And the touch pool needs work - they can certainly take some leads from uShaka on that one for a far more interactive and satisfying experience. It would also be great to have more staff on hand to attend to queries and offer guidance.

Don't miss diving with the sharks!. We came across the aquarium while enjoying the Red Bus tour. It is one of the stops for the Red Bus and is easy to find. While on the bus we heard an advert offering dives in the Aquariums Predator Tank. It sounded like fun so we gave it a shot.What a wonderful attraction! From the people running the gate to the lovely folks who signed us into the dive to the dive masters all were exceptional! We had such a good time we came back and did the dive again! For a ridiculously inexpensive price you can spend 30 minutes diving in the Aquariums center piece, the Predator Tank. There many snaggletooth sharks, 2 turtles and a plethora of other aquatic wildlife. All gear is provided for the dive and the dive guides are very knowledgeable. Be warned though, the water is cold! If you find yourself here and have your dive card don't miss this! Entry into the Aquarium after the dive is included!Enjoy!
Captivating. Wow, this was great , you feel like you are in the ocean. We enjoyed every bit of it. Watching the sea animals

Highlight is shark and penguin feeding. I was very fortunate to visit on a day and at a time when the penguins and sharks were being fed. This does not occur everyday. The sharks I understand are fed once per week. Great viewing areas. While you are at the beautiful waterfront I recommend taking in the Two Oceans!

Geared Towards Kids but Penguin Experience was WONDERFUL. The aquarium is small and is pretty much geared towards kids, but my friend and I did the Penguin Experience and got to go into the exhibits with Rock Hopper Penguins and helped out with feeding time for both the Rock Hoppers & the African Penguins. This was pretty awesome to be able to spend some time with these animals. The Rock Hoppers were friendly and came over and sat on our laps and let us pet them! Don't wear good clothes if you do the Penguin Experience since they might make a mess on you!

Loved the penguins and clown fish. The penguin feeding was a lot of fun to watch. But the clown fish exhibit is not to be missed. You can climb into a tube in the tank and be surrounded by clown fish - fun. The exhibits of sharks and large fish are impressive
Kids day out. Lots of interesting fish and underwater life. Photo opportunities are plentiful and there are cute mascots roaming around which delighted the kids

Very interesting aquarium - especially interesting predator tank dive. Well done and modern small to medium sized aquarium. Displays are modern, clean and colorful. Good variety of sea life. Good value for money. Did the dive in the shark tank with my scuba certified daughter and it really was a great experience. The dive is well organized with good equipment and the dive master was great. It was very reasonably priced and a great experience.

An aquarium to rival any other.. On our recent holiday in Cape Town, one of the things on our list to do was a visit to this world class aquarium and we weren't disappointed.Make sure you set a minimum time of 2-3 hours aside to be able to appreciate all that is on offer. There is so much to see from the big sharks, the little tiddlers, the giant spider crabs, the beautiful turtle with a panache for being the centre of attraction (a real poser) who's name eludes me at the moment, to the seals and the penguins.We went there with an open mind and came away rating this as possibly the highlight of our holiday. We could keep on waxing lyrical about this great attraction, but rather if you are in Cape Town put it on your list to see, you won't be disappointed.

Very overrated. I was very surprised at the high ratings for this aquarium. We finished in less than a 1/2 hour. Penguin section and weird fish at beginning were nice but I was really disappointed in this place. Very small for the money. I would rank it behind most aquariums in the u.s.a.

Unique aquatic life. Loved the variety in this aquarium and the kelp forest was unbelievable. Very well presented and kids would definitely be well entertained (at the very least by the huge number of "Nemo" clown fish greeting them at the entrance)

nice place but more suitable for children. You can see many south africa marine animals right here, it is nice and interesting place to visited, but the place and many aquarium tanks are small. When we visited, many school children also took a trip to aquarium by chance. That really make the space crowding. Maybe the better day to visit will be more lovely.

The best aquarium ever seen. I went there a little by accident, but it turn out to become one of the most interesting experiences i've lived in Cape Town.Here you can find the most impressive shark, along with several other species from both oceans.

Big sea creatures. I went to see Two Oceans Aquarium with n=my son and two grand daughters. What an experience to be able to see things I had only seen on television. Plenty of room to push a pushchair around places to sit and watch. I was fascinated as were the girls. Huge stingray and sharks all sorts and colours of fish. Truly a wonderful place to take children plus granny. We all loved it and would go again as I know my grand daughters have been again.

It is a beautiful place. The aquarium, is beautiful. Not that big if you compared with gerogia's aquarium. But you can see many species of animals, including amazing sharks, turtles, fish from Adriatic Sea, etc. the souvenirs store is really cool.

Great Aquarium. My wife and I had some free time during the afternoon and decided to check out the aquarium. It was really great. There was a solid diversity of fish and other aquatic life. The large kelp & fish exhibit was excellent. It was really interesting to learn about the species that are native to southern Africa and the Cape area, as we're from the U.S. so many of them were unfamiliar to us. They also have opportunities to dive with Great White Sharks, though we didn't try it.
Plenty to see . Well laid out venue. Educational for young kids and interesting for adults. Reasonably priced and a great way to pass a few hours.
TWO OCEANS AQUARIUM. Visited with grandchildren. All liked it a lot. Plenty to see and not at all hurried. A very pleasant way to spend a couple of hours

A great aquarium.. Coming to Cape Town, I expected more sea life than the average aquarium. I loved the visit, but if you are traveling to this city, there are so many other things to see if you have access to an aquarium at home. It's still a phenomenal visit for kids and families.

A good insight into the marine life found around South Africa!. Fantastic place. A little old, but the mature systems in the tanks reflects a healthy ecosystem.Location is great as well as it is a mere 5 mins walk to the waterfront. More fun to be had there too!

A great experience. Lots of varieties of fish and information. Almost on overload. The large aquarium was amazing as it is so big with a skin diver also swimming with the sharks! Nice to have more seating for the older visitors to stop and stare! Although the penguin section did.

Lots to take in - and very very busy.... Spent a few hours in here and it was enough - not because we had seen everything, because we hadn't - but we were a bit fed up of the crowds and noise...The education programmes and conservation projects are to be commended, it is very important work that they are doing - and hence you are going to get crowds of school kids on visits..the noise, the screeching, shouting, running up and down the glass was relentless - and sometimes in aquariums, you just want to sit in the peace and quiet watching another world under the sea where you can forget about your stresses for a while - but there was no 'quiet' area and each section was one big hectic whirlwind..,The shark section was pretty amazing - and even my thirteen year old was impressed - however, we found it a bit odd - and wrong somehow, that these magnificent creatures were swimming by, then around the corner at sea bed level came a couple of divers - these were not tank cleaners, or conservationists - they were peolpe who had paid a lot of money to get into a tank with the sharks! Just looked wrong and personally I think this should happen when the place is closed to the public...The chocolate cake at the cafe afterwards was very well received also!

Great exhibitions and education program. Really nice aquarium with great quality, it doesn't have all the "big" exhibitions like other aquariums but what they show is worth it. Also the information panels are awesome

Fanmtastic place to vsisit. As we were staying in Cape Town for a week decided to visit the two oceans aquarium. We weren't disappointed.We also timed it right and we were able to get a seat for the feeding of the sharks and turtle. Worth waiting for but you do need to get there early to get a seat.There is pleanty to see and some amazing fish and lovely colours. Do need to spend at least an hour to get the benefit but now that I've done it I don't think I would go back again as there are more places to go and see.

Worth a visit. Went one day as raining and wanted something to do, worth going to. Totally enjoyed the visit. Small in comparison to some aquariums been to, but the sharks and rays are lovely to see as well as the tank with clown fish in.
Colorful. A visit full of colors of different sea species. It was an awesome experience. You cant ignore this place if you are in central capetown.

Fantastic way to spend a morning in Cape Town. Really didn't expect to enjoy myself this much, but was most pleasantly surprised. From watching the feeding of the turtles to the cute penguins as well as all the different exhibits, we had a fantastic morning.

Wonderful exhibit. It is set up well and in a great location at the waterfront in Cape Town. They had different kinds of fish and included penguins which I haven't seen in other Aquariums. Visiting the Aquarium was a substitute for the Gardens as it was raining heavily our last day in Cape Town. Sorry to miss one but at least we got to the Two Oceans Aquarium.

Gala Dinner. We had out gala dinner at Two Oceans and it was a great experience. Dining in front of the big tank where sharks, turtles swim by. The host was also friendly and we had a great time drumming. Plenty of photos taken of course.

Two Oceans. The great thing about this aquarium is it shows you differences in specifies of the Indian and Atlantic Oceans. It is a very nice exhibit, but we are spoiled in the USA like facilities in Monterrey Bay, CA. There are other things to do in the vicinity. The large mall is nearby where there are numerous eating places.

no surprises. we had a couple of hours to kill before our flight out of cape town, so we stopped in the 2 oceans aquarium which was right by our hotel. it was nothing special, very typical of some of the smaller aquariums in the u.s. the admission price is very reasonable, however, and it is small enough that it would be great for small children without being too overwhelming. definitely a good "extra" in cape town for those of us who love sea life

Awesome exhibits. What a wonderfull and relaxing environment. We visited here and saw the Sharks get fed. The Penguins was a lovely expierience, Diving with the Sharks in the PREDATOR eXHIBIT SEEMS LIKE A HIGHLIGHT ON VACATION GOERS...
Shame........ Rather sad to see those beautiful sea creature spend day in and day out with screaming kids and small tanks. Make the damn shark tank BIGGER!!!

Reasonable admission and fantastic activity!. Absolutely Kids like aquarium, some teens have boring experience in aquarium, adults again like aquarium. This attracts even teens. Various spices with great curating. Also lovely souvenir shop and restaurant is good.

Nicely looked after aquarium. Great time walking round and seeing the different species. Not a very big aquarium but still worth a visit and they are currently expanding for more sharks. Worth going when the feeding times are on
An enjoyable experience. A nice easy going, relaxed experience.The feeding of the predator tank is an interesting feature and very informative.Great for the kids too.

Fun day with the kids. We like the easy way to walk about by ourselves, but did want a few questions answered and really struggled to find someone that works there. but all in all it was worth every cent. A bit expensive for a family of 4.

Diversity, Education, and Entertainment. I absolutely love the Two Oceans Aquarium, so much so that I did a course to become a volunteer. Sadly I couldn't volunteer as I left the country shortly afterwards, but it remains one of my favourite places in Cape Town. The aquarium may be relatively small, but it showcases a stunning variety of sea life from both coasts (West Coast and East Coast, each of which have very different sea life) and, as the name suggests, two different oceans (Atlantic and Indian). The aquarium is very interactive, with a touch pool and microscopes available for guests to explore marine life first-hand. I'd highly recommend buying tickets online in advance,as the lines can get very long in peak season. Check the feeding times if you'd like to see the creatures in action - the penguin feedings and shark feedings are the most popular. The Two Oceans aquarium is very child-friendly, with lots of activities for little ones. The staff are friendly and informative, and there is plenty of information about each exhibit. A great outing for the whole family, couples, or friends. It's also a great indoor visit for rainy/cloudy days!

recommended for a rainy day!. we were at v and a waterfront ,it started raining and we decided to visit the aquarium but didnt have high exceptations but i was pleasantly surprised.the staff was very good, a lady was showing through microscope..sorry have forgotten her name was very nice, the girls at touch and feel were nice too we could touch a snake .the gift shop was lovely.reccomended

Excellent seafood, bothersome baboons. We stopped here for lunch on our 'round Cape tour. It is conveniently located at the base of the funicular which goes to the top of the Cape of Good Hope lighthouse. The food was surprisingly good for an area with lots of tourists. It would have been nice to eat outside and enjoy the view, but the other eaters were being chased inside by bothersome baboons, so we ate in a large, pleasant dining room.

Quaint but very nice. The aquarium is not very large, but it offers tons of value and entertainment. The penguin habitat and the predator tank are the can't miss exhibits. It's a good idea to shop/eat at the V&A Mall next door once you have explored the aquarium.

Favorite Attraction to Visit with my young Daughter. I have been going to the Aquarium for years now. My daughter, now 6 years old, is spellbound whenever we go there. We enter into this subterranean world and re-visit each tank to say hello our fishy friends. The staff are great with her and take time to explain new things. Of-course funding is an issue and the facility remains fairly "static" but there are new tanks from time to time. My daughter does not mind one little bit and regularly asks to return! Overall - it is well looked after and judging but the number of cameras clicking away, a big hit for first timers.

Very nice aquarium with interactive options. The aquarium was fun for my 8 year old and I. We went midday and it was quite empty, which made our time there feel like a private event. We enjoyed reading and learning about the animals and my daughter really enjoyed the interactive table in addition to her conversation with the volunteer working the microscope lab. I think the negative reviews need to take into account the size and point of the aquarium. It is rather small, but it also serves a great purpose to educate kids about animals and the environment. South Africa is a special place and the more humans respect their environment the better. So yes, this aquarium is worth a visit. Have an open mind and learn about the local waters and animals!

Modern aquarium. One of the nice modern aquariums in the world. Lots of different fishes, some jellyfish, penguins. The fishes on display is very colourfull. The price of entrance is high, but its the same as most modern aquariums. I like zoos and aquarium and this is one of the best.

Not a CT highlight, but fun experience. I decided to check the aquarium out on a day when the weather did not permit trips to Table Mountain or Robben Island. I went on a Sunday afternoon. FYI: Sharks are fed at 3pm on Sundays. Good way to spend a couple hours. The shark exhibit is definitely the main attraction. Large circular tank with 4 nurse sharks, a large turtle, and a number of other large fish. Two staff members in scuba gear hand-fed the sharks and turtle for about 20-30 minutes. Very entertaining staff narration. I would recommend arriving early so as to get a decent view of the feeding.

Very disappointing. I had high expectations from the Aquarium, especially with so many good reviews. However I was totally disappointed, as it offers nothing different when compared to the underwater world you find in Singapore, Malaysia and many other countries. While it was good to see the penguins, and the sharks, but there was no WOW factor. On top of it, the entrance is also expensive. Certainly not a must do on a visit to Cape Town. My kids liked the aquarium as one more place where you see underwater animals.....again no WOW factor.

Well worth revisiting, even if you're local. Though I'm local, this is one of the attractions in Cape Town that I love revisiting time and again. Also, see about getting the package deal through CT tourism that allows you a trip on the open-top bus, as well as a trip up the Cable Way all for one price. You won't regret it. Allow yourself at least three to four hours in the aquarium, however. And the touch pool for the littlies is always a big hit. I particularly also loved the "hollow" tank with all the clownfish. Good for the young of heart, and the young. ;-)

Wow factor supreme.. I've had the pleasure of seeing many aquariums and the Two oceans stands head and shoulders above the rest. Being in the V&A waterfront and on the marina with ample safe but expensive parking it is ideally located for the first time adventure explores doing Cape Town. Both times our visit revolved around our families, I can remember that we were experiencing bad weather at the time. The huge tank with the big sharking many other species was my personal high light.
Never fails to impress. About our tenth visit to the aquarium and it never fails to amaze, definitely with a visit. Only downfall is the cost of entrance maybe look at an entrance fee for SA citizens

Good idea for a rainy day. Cape Town is beautiful, but not much to do on rainy Days with little toddlers. The Aquarium kept us very busy for hours. My kids loved every second. The basins are huge, and lots of space to just sit down and enjoy the show, especially with divers in the shark tank. A great place.

WOW. What an aquarium! fact filled with a wealth of information. Friendly helpful staff , well kept and beautifully laid out displays with tanks that looked plenty large enough for the inhabitants within them.
insight into mother nature's bounty. the plethora of the ocean bottom's bounty has been well collected, well maintained and well displayed. it is very innovative and informative too.

Nice place to visit, well priced but only takes and hour- good for a rainy day. Well done, this aquarium is surprisingly good, but really only takes an hour or so. It is well positioned on the waterfront, staff are friendly and helpful. Lots of school parties, but they were well behaved and not too noisy

We went SCUBA diving right in the predator tank!. This was a peak experience. As certified SCUBA divers, my two sons and I were able to dive for a half hour right in the predator tank at the aquarium. A giant sea turtle joined us the entire time, which was fun until s/he almost bit off one of my fingers, thinking it was food. The divemaster, Ian, was terrific and very helpful, and the equipment was fine. One of my favorite all-time experiences! The picture was taken by my daughter-in-law who was watching from outside the tank.

Spent time here during the rain. We were at the V&A waterfront and got caught in the rain. This wasn't the cheapest thing to do, but it's not too bad and it's entertaining. We were there during the penguin feeding and then the predator feeding which is cool to watch.

4 stars for the aquarium but 5 stars for the swim with sharks experience. The swimming with shark's experience was amazing. Me and my partner thoroughly enjoyed it, Iain was very helpful and reassuring and helped made this, my joint top favourite experience of Capetown, and something I would like to repeat.

Under the sea!. A bit of a wet and cloudy day during my stay in Cape Town led me to the Two Oceans Aquarium, and I was not disappointed. This aquarium showcases everything you can find in and near the waters surrounding the Cape.As soon as you enter, you are greeted with a tank of beautiful coloured fish, and a large eel at the bottom !!!! A small turtle seemed to follow me around the tank, and made for some great pictures (see below). Moving on further inside, there are loads of tanks with information placards alongside with information. A nice touch for kids (and big kids!!) is the tank full of clown fish (Nemo’s!!!) where you can crawl under and stick your head up into a “bubble” at the bottom and be surrounded by the fish :-)Luckily, I was there for the penguin feeding (done daily - check times) and talk - very interesting to hear about the penguins from people who work with them on a daily basis, and be able to have a Q+A session during the feeding. Further on and you are confronted with a HUGE glass tank (over 2 storeys high) featuring bigger fish, an awesome turtle (see pics) and sharks!!! Very cool and again, an interesting talk from one of the staff at the aquarium. There is a nice walkway around the massive tank and you can really get up close to view everything - watch out for the porthole windows, as the sharks seem to suddenly appear eye-to eye with you !!!!All in all a very informative trip and I got some great pictures to add to my album :-)Keep up the good work!!!

Excellent experience. This is a wonderful aquarium - they have done a great job of making the experience fun, interesting, and interactive. The volunteers who worked the microscope and touch tanks were terrific and provided a lot of educational information about the creatures they were supervising.

Great experience at Cape Town. If you are at this lovely city, you can't miss the Aquarium, with a very nice collection of sea life, extremely well organized and instructive. Spend at least half-day enjoying the different sea environments exposed, with very friendly and skilled people working, always ready to answer your questions. A very nice program !
Fish lovers paradise. I love shark, octopus, sea horse and all other fishes. I got a chance to see all these creatures at Two Oceans Aquarium. It has a nice cafeteria and shop.

Worth a visit. I have been to a few aquariums and this might be the better one. It is not super big, took us about an hour the get through it. They have a nice penguin exhibition and a big tank with some sharks. Went on a Sunday and it wasn't too busy and the price is reasonable, R125 for an adult.
Fantastic experience. A Great treat to visit the acquarium in CT. Very well looked after and displays very nicely presented. I enjoy time here with my children who absolutely loves to visit.

Aquatic Heaven. I took the kids last week and they loved it. A great way for them to see all that lies under the ocean up close. It was also very informative and I learnt a few things too. We were lucky enough to watch a real time feeding session where divers drop into the colossal tank and hand feed the mantas and the large turtle, I believe the sharks are fed on Sundays so shame we missed that. There is always plenty to do down at the waterfront but I'd recommend anyone with kids to go to the aquarium, photo opportunities are plentiful and just videoing what's in the the large tank will make for great viewing for years to come. The staff are friendly and welcoming so I'd say it's a given that any family visiting the waterfront should stop by the aquarium for a couple of hours.

Quite Nice!. We went on a rainy Sunday and there were loads of kids but it was no problem. Lots of displays, well done with steps so kids could see. Nice penguin display. When Grandson gets older they offer feeding the penguins. We ate at the restaurant and played at their playground. Great Vegan quinoa salad for me! We also played in the sandbox downstairs and watched a puppet show. Lots of fun!

good, but not great. As a local, I've been there a few times over the years. The most recent visit being a week ago. The exhibitions are interesting and informative, but I think they cater almost only for small children these days. I'm now 24 and enjoy it, but a lot of the tanks are very small or have minimal sea life inside. There are large kiddies entertaining areas, but nothing that caters to those who want to know more than the basic details. The exit goes through a gift shop, which is obviously good for sales, but makes the experience feel a bit cheap. As it is located at the Waterfront area, I expected a bit more. Nice to do on a rainy day, but nothing special.
A must see for the family. My kids loved the interaction with the seals and trainers. professional display areas - definitely kids friendly

Amazing and fun time had by all.. There is so much to look at and learn here, it's very hard to know where to start and where to finish.
