It's a beautiful aquarium and there is pretty much every fish known to man here, I am sure of it...but a must visit if you are anywhere near the V&A Waterfront.You will spend hours and hours here. I'm sure of it.
Great for kids. Great to see the different aquatic life in South Africa need 1/2 day to explore. Worth the visit if you have the time.

Worth a visit.. We visited the aquarium while killing time in Cape Town and we enjoyed the visit. It is well laid out and had plenty of information about the exhibits. I particularly enjoyed watching the penguins swimming. One doesn't normally see them underwater. We ate in the cafe and the food was very good and the tea and coffee hot and tasty.

Must for kids. A great place to spend 2-3 hours with family. My 3 year old loved every bit of it. The place and the staff keep you well engaged. There's even a puppet show for kids in a wonderful kids play area. Kids can do all sorts of creative stuff here with the staff. My daughter was thrilled when she made her own flower in the arts and craft activity. A lovely restaurant also attached to the place.

One of the worlds best aquariums.. This must count as one of the best aquariums in the world. It is not by any means the largest. But what you see there is absolutely what it looks like when you dive in Cape Town. The kelp tank is home to most of the common large fish species in the Cape waters.The shark tank has the added attraction the you can scuba dive between the sharks an other large fish accompanied by an instructor, to keep you safe.The food at the local restaurant is also good and inexpensive.A great place to spend a few hours.

Times flies when you're intrigued. Located in the V&A Waterfront, the aquarium is a must see for all visitors, specially with children Over the years I have visited the Aquarium, it has never failed to capture my imagination. There is always something new and interesting, as well as the old favourites. The penguins in the outdoor pool pressing themselves up against the glass are amusing and very cute. The sharks gliding around the main tank are awe inspiring, specially when you are in the 'glass' tunnel. There is a shop at the end with some great souvenirs, as well as a restaurant on the sea side. Go along, and have some fun...you'll even learn something new

Educational entertainment for eveyone. One of the most interesting places in Cape town what i visited. My visit to aquarium was unforgettable. I was running from one display to another like a little child and even twice around all displays, because it was so interesting for me.Staff of Aquarium is very friendly and educated. Staff is used to deal with foreign costumers and willing to assist not speaking English tourist. Aquarium is place what every tourist and local must visit in Cape town, I believe.

Two Oceans Aquarium Not Worth The Money. The Two Oceans Aquarium is nice but very small in size.It costs a bundle to get in and just as you warm up to the experience you are on your way out.The little shop and cafe inside is also for tourists as the prices are sky high.
Aquarium. Fantastic place to relax as well as enjoy the sights and facilities the Two Oceans Aquarium has to offer

Awesome place to visit. What a wonderful experience. The colours were amazing ,great for adults and children alike and for any age. A perfect outing ,especially during the cold Cape Winters.We saw fish that we never new existed and everthing is so well presented and documented.Everthing in the Aquarium is so clean and tidy and the staff so patient and well trained.

Fantastic Shark Tank!. Having been to a few other aquariums in both Kuala Lumpur and Singapore, I can honestly say that us locals in Cape Town have one of the best shark displays by far!We signed up for the yearly membership which is a big cost saver if you plan on visiting every so often to see the wonderful aquatic displays. I must admit though that on our 2nd visit, very little had changed so they might need to change things up a bit more often, but still definitely worth the visit.

Cape Town Aquarium. The Two Oceans Aquarium situated in the heart of the famous Waterfront is definitely a must-see on the Cape Town visit bucket list both for locals and tourists. While the entry fee may seem a bit pricey, the rewards for seeing huge marine predators and deep ocean crustaceans is well worth it! There is ample parking in the parking lots adjacent to the aquarium and the access and facilities are family friendly. You can arrange a scuba dive with the sharks on location, generally needing to provide 24hr notice to secure a booking. You can slot in the aquarium visit during your walk around the waterfront with many other local attractions and shopping malls in close proximity. Very educational experience. Don't forget to take a short boat trip around the harbour to see some of the marine life you saw in the aquarium!

Spectacular. The aquarium was amazing. Great place for both children and adults. Very informative about the sea life present in the Atlantic ocean - amazing to see all the fish and different species living under water. Penguin exhibition was great and the penguins were funny in their own way. Was great to see the sharks and we also happened to see the divers feeding the fish in the big tank - great learning experience for the whole family. Definitely worth a visit.

Definitely worth a visit. My personal favourite exhibit is the kelp forest, but they all rank highly... knysna seahorses, ragged tooth sharks, luminous jellyfish, nemo-style clownfish, massive spider crabs, even Cape penguins... they're all there to see and experience. The aquarium is very professionally run and maintained. For the brave/adventurous, you can arrange to dive with the raggies on display.Surely a great spot to take your kids, but will be equally enjoyable and interesting for people of all ages. Have been here several times, and would go again.

Best Aquarium I have been to. I nearly didn't go as I have found that Aquariums are normally very expensive and not very satisfying attractions. But this one is very different it is reasonably priced very well laid out and has layout that not only makes the best of the pretty extensive collection of very well kept Fish (and Penguins) but is Educational with out being Earnest it does a have a sort of environmental theme but not excessively so and the light touch might even course people to alter some of their behaviour for the better rather then feel the have just been lectured. It is also I think it child friendly as there are interactive exhibits place at just about the right distance from each other to prevent boredom setting in as they walk round

Visit here if you're too sunburnt for another beach day. It's an easy well laid out aquarium, busy during December/January tourist season. One can dive with sharks and turtles during feeding times- I did not. I've heard that it's wonderful
Nice time at the two Oceans Aquirium. Lovely.... Especially the naughty Penguins...And the Nimo fish were cool!!!My daughters really wanted to see the SHARKS, and they loved them
must seee place. wonderfull fish and sea creatures wonderfull sharks rays turtles all the fish you can imagine and so cheap..you can spend hours looking at the wonderfull things in the ocean

Two Oceans Aquarium, Cape Town. I have been there several times now with different people and thoroughly enjoyed each visit as each time it's different but also nice to see some ,old friends, still resident. Make sure you allow plenty of time to look at all the exhibits and tanks and watch them for a while. Not a cheap (nothing on the Waterfront is) attraction but good value if you take sufficient time to enjoy it all.
Great for the kids. Well laid out and interesting exhibits. Very child frendly and my grandson loved the puppet show. Well worth spending half a day enjoying a casual walk round.

Must visit!. Probably the best aquarium in the world. Great fun and a great day out. We went here on our last morning in Cape Town and really left feeling we left the best for last. There were loads of kids there at the time we went as it was a school holiday, but this didn't affect our experience. A lot of tanks are made so that kids can interact with them in one way or another and offers a lot of fun for kids to play around in and look at the stunning fish that are kept here. It's nice to see an aquarium where they have animals that 'belong' in that country. Most animals are either from one of the oceans or are stranded there by accident, like the penguins that they have there. Truly an amazing aquarium, they even have a huge tank with turtles, galjoen and sharks, where you can swim in. We spent well over 2 hours walking there and enjoying the tanks.

well worth a visit. The Two Oceans Aquarium is a very interesting and enjoyable experience for adults and children. It is a fantastic educational outing for groups of school children. I CAN HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT. There is a large underwater section, where one walks in between two huge glass tanks, with large fish and sharks swimming around constantly. It is quite fascinating to see these magnificent sea creatures so up close and personal!
Amazing collection of sea creature!. Wow! never seen so many varieties and so many interesting sea creatures in any other aquarium (including San Diego!)

Still a great show!. One of the best aquariums I've visited. Largest too! Great displays with the Sea playing a real time part in the show! Sad that the Penguins had been moved to the smaller area only, sure they prefer the larger section to play around in!
Nice rainy day activity for the children.. Lovely activity for a rainy day. Go early so that it is not too busy.The aquarium could do with some dolphins ( like the one in Durban)
Fun visit. One of the more impressive aquariums I've visited in life. Well designed for a fun as well as an educational experience. There's of course an impressive variety of sea life there, too.

Exciting for young children. We took our daughters (4 years old & 2 years old) to this Aquarium, actually this time is second time for my first daughter, both of were very excited, lots of marine life to see, they even could touch some of them, they really amazed when they saw the sharks, nice display, informative, and has lovely restaurant with great view to the harbor.
Diverse display of marine life. Extremely pleasant visit to two oceans aquarium. Wide variety of marine life on display. Extremely informative and well lay out.
Half day of fun for family. We took our toddler (2) to the Two Oceans Aquarium. She loved it. Especially the Turtles and Nemo exhibit. Great way to spend half a day with the family.
Great for kids. Our children (10 and 6) loved it and so did we. Lots of space to move around, things to touch and experience and of course sharks. What more do you need?

A good half day out. Nicely done with lots to see all easily accessible. Get there early as it gets very busy. Probably about 2 hrs worth of fun but, like just about everything in Cape Town, good value.
Must do this. Very good start with the penguins. Interesting even for adults.We could find good stuff at the gift shop for our granddaughter.

Under the sea. This is a world class aquarium as good as any, and better than many. It includes cute penguins and a few birds as well as the usual aquatic life. There are sharks of course, and all-in-all well worth a visit. Conveniently located in the V&A waterfront and on the “hop-on-hop-off” bus routes (next to the terminal in fact).
An excellent visit. A very good museum with lots to see. Terrific exhibits with lots of live exhibits from both oceans. Superb for children too

Very Fishy !!. Oh what an aquarium. Fabulous . Where ever we go my wife must visit an aquarium should there be one close by. This is one of the best we've ever been to. Great tanks of all kinds of sea life , fish and crustaceans .Wonderful hands on experiences for both young and old. A young botanist with very powerful microscopes projecting images onto overhead head screens , showing and explaining about eggs smaller than a grain of sand ! Most helpful and friendly staff, and under going an expansion , so it will be even bigger and better. Don't let the building works put you off , it doesn't spoil the pleasure of the visit.

great activity , not only for children. We found the Aquarium fascinating. We loved all the different fish they had, and the penguins and the sharks and the octupus and "nemo" and even a petting area which was great. I was there with my 18 year old son and we both loved it.
The story of Maxine the Shark is moving!. The visit starts off as quite low key, but develops into quite an impactful experience as you make your way through the aquarium.
Great fun. Very good aquarium, friendly staff with lots of interactive opportunity children could have stayed all day

Great for kids. Very interesting good for kids. Easy to get tickets and lots to see. The main aquarium tank is huge with lots of scary sharks and giant turtles. Its in a great location near the V&A waterfront.

Great experience. Very good and educational. Great variety of fish and sea life. The feeding shows for the sharks, manta rays and turtle is a great experience. Can get a bit too crowded over the holidays and weekends, especially when the weather is cooler and people cannot go to beaches.

Great to visit with children. I recently visited with 3 young kids (ranging from 2 to 8 years old) and each was enthralled, as were the adults - there is truly something for everyone. Make sure you get there for the feeding (in the afternoons around 3pm as I recall) which is captivating.
beautiful. a nice combination of beautiful fish in a lovely location. we had a nice afternoon out, the guides were very helpful.
Simply Wonderful. A great experience and vast selection, but we found it to be expensive and not for regular visits. The restaurant offered modern ambiance with good quality at affordable prices

Better than expected. I was a little skeptical about this venue being decent given the amount of space they have and new construction going on. From the outside, it was hard to imagine that they have massive fish tanks with substantial height to them. Very impressed with the types and varieties of exhibits. Everyone loves to watch the penguin feeding. Worth scheduling your visit to suit the feed times.Quite equal when compared to other well known US aquariums except here they focus is on their own indigenous creatures. Well done!

An option for rainy days. This is a nice aquarium but much much smaller than I expected. In my opinion, you can spend your time sightseeing outdoor rather than visiting an aquarium. You may consider this place as an option for rainy days. Just make sure you check the feeding hours before planning your trip. You may witness a shark feeding maybe.
Interesting and well presented. Well presented and interesting for all age groups, I was impressed by the Penguin display.In walking distance from the waterfront.

Diving in the Predator Exhibit. We went to the Aquarium for the sole purpose to dive in their predator exhibit since our blue & mako shark dive was cancelled due to weather. It was extremely inexpensive relative to the same experience opportunity in the States. You could use your own gear or you could rent their gear, which was very clean and well maintained. They had hot shower change rooms to use once you got out. The dive was too short, ~30minutes, as it was fun being so close to the creatures. Surprisingly I found it quite entertaining to wave at the kids and people looking into the aquarium from the outside. Was able to find and keep a few shark teeth from the bottom floor. Got to pet the resident turtle on her shell and back legs. The rays swam right to me and would swim above me right at the last second, making for very good video footage. Swimming with the ragged tooth sharks was pretty cool, but they stayed well above you so I never got a close encounter or even a head on picture of video. Was definitely something to do once in your lifetime if you are a diver. Not sure I'd do it again but glad I did it. I felt very safe and was never worried about anything. We toured the Aquarium after the dive and was very pleased. They had some very exotic critters that I had never seen anywhere before. The penguin exhibit was a bit small, the frog exhibit was a bit misleading as I could only see that they had 2 toads on display, but the variety and health of the underwater critters was good.
Penguins!. The easiest way to see penguins without renting a car. You can pay $35 and have one on one sessions with them too!
Good touch areas. Went with 2 year old granddaughter who loved all the tanks of different fish and helpful staff give information in the touch pool about the different plant and animal life.

One of the best aquariums we have ever been to. We have been to Cape Town with our young daughter 3 times now and have taken her to the Two Oceans Aquarium twice and as she gets older she enjoys it more and more. She is now nearly 5 and asked really intelligent questions and was really interested in the different fish and creatures that she saw in the amazing tanks. It is very child friendly with a petting area, clown fish tank that they can 'step inside' and we were even there for a puppet show in the childrens area. She enjoyed some of the craft activities in this area too. Unlike some aquariums it is never too busy and you can always get a good view of the tanks.

What a wonderful surprise - excellent place to take children. I actually won two tickets and went along not knowing what to expect. We started off with the restaurant and sat outside with a great view of some marvellous yachts in Cape Town. I had grilled hake and chips for R69.00 which was absolutely delicious. The service was excellent and the staff are well trained and cannot do enough to ensure satisfaction.The aquarium itself is well organised and has some wonderful effects. You can crawl into a tank and find yourself sitting in the middle (protected) of some cute Nimo fish and have a photograph taken by your family. Another interesting fact is viewing various subterranean life forms under a microscope which is projected on a screen and discussed by a very competent instructor. You can have your picture taken with family free and also watch a puppet show. You can watch the penguins being fed and feel and touch seaweed. You can also dive into the tanks with diving gear and swim around with the larger fish. It is a great delight and you can even hold a private event in the aquarium if you like! All in all an excellent venue !and most enjoyable!

A good place to take children. I have often taken my two grandchildren here who are now seven and five and they always enjoy it. Being expensive it is not too crowded and plenty of things the young and older will be fascinated by. I have learnt a lot about underwater life that I never knew before. There is penguin feeding time and also a play room where kids can paint and draw and are given free materials as well as a large sandpit for the younger ones. Everything here is well supervised. Another more daring room has a steep twisty slide which boys will love and also many toys and leggo type things to model with. An excellent shop and snack bar mean you need not go hungry and the ticket is for the whole day so you can return later perhaps after lunch somewhere else at the waterfront for more viewing.
good experience. Well worth a visit, especially on a sunny day. With or without children its a good learning experience. Recommended
Great outing for the kids. Fabulous Aquarium and one can easily spend a few hours there with young children who find it fascinating.

A "must see". Between the shark and penguin feeds as well as some spellbinding displays, you are constantly entertained. My favorite exhibit is the large round aquarium at the very beginning. The only thing that is a bit of a bummer, is the entrance fee for locals...

Well worth a visit. Beautiful facility, with amazing collection of colourful fish, both large and small. I find it very peaceful to be there with these amazing creatures that remind you of how incredible creation really is. The staff are great, and the facility is well run.

Up Close And Personal. The Two Oceans Aquarium is a once in a lifetime experience that you always go back to.If you have a divers license why not dive with fish and Ragged-Tooth sharks and a turtle in the I&J Predator Exhibit.There are also different feeds that happen in the aquarium at different times on different days

Fish, Penguins and Boat Rides. We went on a Sunday afternoon. The sharks, rays and turtles are fed at 3 PM. Go early to get a good seat in the area. Besides fish, they have two types of penguins in enclosures. The also offer boat rides in the bay with a duel ticket. We enjoyed our afternoon there.

Loved it!. Totally different from Ushaka in Kzn and so much fun! They have gone to a lot of trouble to make it interesting, interactive and to cater to children. The two favorites were the 'Nemo' tank where the kids could climb into a glass cavity in the tank and where one can interact through touch and feel with star fish and similar sea creatures while staff are happy to tell you all about them. I'm so glad we went!
Shark feeding.... Happens on Sundays at 3pm, make sure you're in the room at least 15mins before as it gets crowded. Rest of the aquarium is really well laid out and never felt overcrowded.

"Wonderful creatures under the sea". Had an absolutely fantastic time at the Two Oceans Aquarium. So many different sea creatures to see with a varierty ranging from sharks, fish, frogs, octapus to penguins. Kids would especially love seeing the penguins, they're so adorable and there are also shows for the kids. Located close to the main attractions and restaurants at the V & A Waterfront if you'd like to grab a bite after. There is also a lovely gift shop on the premises if you'd like to purchase a souvenir.

Definitely worth a visit. Had some extra time at V&A and decided to heed some reviews and check out the aquarium. Glad we did. Surprisingly impressed. Much larger than expected. Huge tanks, good diversity. Educational and fun.Only downside: introduction to penguin feeding got a bit lengthy. The passion for conservation is very honourable but risks loosing the attention of the patrons (mostly kids) who really just came to see the adorable penguins enjoy a meal. For sure, use the opportunity to get the conservation message out but short and sweet with a little repetiotion may get more traction.Good value for money. Definitely worth a visit. Enjoyed seeing kids and adults having fun. Be sure to check out the tank you can crawl into. Great photo-op.

Well run, pretty good place. Lots of different fish here. It's not a huge place but it's not too small either. People working here are friendly and nice. I don't see this as a "must to" attraction but "nice to do". Good for kids for sure!
Very nice Aquarium. 5pm they feed the animals and the penguins walk from one floor to the other. My children loved to follow them.
great place to visit.excellent display. This has got to be the best aquarium we have ever seen.we bought our tickets on line and got a discount.the displays are out of this world.highly recommended.
fun fun. I very much enjoyed seeing the aquarium. Free face painting for kids in school holidays. Play rooms and puppet shows. Can take your ice cream in to watch the sharks.. very cool.

Interesting- one of the best aquariums I've visited.. Interesting- clean- informative and nice displays. Familyfriendly, both adults and children in our family really enjoyed the visit here. Many exotic fishes and large sharks. We also enjoyed the penguines.

Great place to visit!. Two Oceans Aquarium is one of the best places to visit while in Cape Town.You get to see the differences between the fauna and flora of the Atlantic and Indian oceans and as a bonus you can dive with sharks (if you have the proper trainning).The big fishes are amazing and the feeding time is very interesting!

What a surprise. Normally steering clear of any kind of theme park attraction I was persuaded to go & see the Two Oceans Aquarium. Well I certainly had to eat my words! It was extremely well laid out, very informative & we had a really enjoyable few hours there.The penguins upstairs were a lovely addition & much easier to see than at Boulders Bay! Weel worth a visit.

Worth A Visit. We only had a couple of hours to kill while most of those in our party of 38 on a tour of South Africa rested at the hotel. My wife and myself opted to check out the aquarium instead. We are glad we did.While not large, this is a nice little aquarium, highlighting the species of Southern African oceans. Included is a nice shark display (we made it to the feeding) and a good penguin display. Especially nice for kids, we adults till enjoyed.

Worth visiting. Worth a visit if you're in the area of the V and A. Unfortunately there were a lot of school children there at the same time so we couldn't get close to some of the exhibits. The penguins were great

Uncrowded and pleasant. We went in because it was cold and raining on the waterfront, but once inside had a great time. We took our pictures in the penguin exhibit and while it is not a massive and impressive display it was a very nice couple of hours.

Very exiting visit. This is the only aquarium I know which allows recreational scuba divers in the exhibits.I have visited aquariums in Boston, Maui, Seattle, Singapore, Monetary, Long Beach,and others.I had a wonderful dive with rugged tooth sharks, sea turtles, rays and many other fish in their predator exhibitThe exhibits are well organized to show the creatures form the two oceans.

Must see at V&A. Some very large fish and fishtanks ! Great for all ages is this wellkept aqarium including two types of penguins. Just the right size and ambience. Well worth its 118 Rand per adult. Close to the food marked and shopping mall.

A bit disappointing. Expected more exhibits, I have seen much better aquariums than this. Does not take long to see it all. There is a good cafe and shop attached which prolongs the experience but at extra cost!
Nice. We enjoyed the aquarium. the tanks appear well kept and maintained. The penguins are so cute. Like the fact that there are enough places to sit, relax and watch the fish.

Get into fish !. A really involving aquarium. Beautiful tanks of tropical fish, enchanting 'Nemos' , Fun penguins. Scary sharks. A great venue for all ages. - And there is a serious educational aspect too if you want this.

Lots of sharks. The aquarium is great, you can dive with sharks here - not that I did. Lots of fish, some great penguins, interesting exhibits, and a demonstration area where you can learn a lot about the oceans, and their inhabitants. It's a take your time place where you can relax and enjoy.

World class. Often take the grand children here, though I probably enjoy it as much as they do. Superbly set out. there is plenty for all ages to wonder at. The penguin feeding is always entertaining, and the swimming with sharks, on Sunday mornings, is a great spectacle.

Something Different. Were expecting this aquarium to be similar to others we've been to but were pleasantly surprised. It included many sea creatures endemic to the region that we've never seen before. It also had a creative way of educating us on how mankind is endangering sea life and ways we can all help to change this.

Loved the penguins. We had some time to kill as another attraction let us down. There is quite a bit to see. We watched the fish being fed in the big tank and watched a diver rearranging plants in another. There was a pool where you could touch starfish and sea anemone and my favourite was the penguin area. Slightly smaller than I expected but enjoyable and I'm sure our kids would have enjoyed it too!
A must!. This place was fantastic with something for everyone. The penguins where very cute whilst if you are brave enough you can swim with the sharks!!
I have been to better.. They best thing about this is the lady with the Microscopes and Rock Pools. Talk to her she will show you many fascinating things.
Stand in awe and wonder. A place you can visit on countless occasions, always to find something new, always to stand in awe of God's creation. There is enough to young and old busy for hours
Two Oceans Aquarium. We really enjoyed the aquariumAll staff really helpful and friendly.The penguins a must see and the gift shop stocked with lovely goods

Two Oceans Aquarium a family favourite. World-class in every way. Highly recommended. Stay all day or take a walk to the V&A Waterfront and come back in for another visit. You can take the open bus tour from here and see Cape Town before another visit to the aquarium.
Best place to take kids. Very entertaining for kids. They also have shows that educate the kids about penguins. My children had a blast

Penguins, Sharks, and More. This is a great aquarium, although the claim to being the world's largest is certainly false, having visited two extremely large aquariums in Chatanooga and Atlanta, both of them being at least double the size. You get to see penguins from a very close distance, and they've got great viewing of sharks in a very large tank.

Good meal with a good view. I ordered green curry which was pleasant but ordinary compared to the view. No special add-ons or garnishing. Just curry and plain rice. Good thing the view was amazing enough to compensate for the average meal.

A lovely outing in Cape Town. We were there in 2012 and just back in Cape Town in February and visited the aquarium again, we'll probably visit every time we go. It's just nice to see all the exhibits, and certainly a great family excursion right there by the waterfront.

Fun and love the penguins. A must visit for every family and even without kids great fun. if you have the time, book the penguin encounter. We did and it was such fun, interacting with the rock hopper penguins, done with great care for the animals and informative for us. And fun, we will not forget petting a penguin and having one on our lap.
Amazing!. We liked very much the way it is presented; the variety of animals,the information and the central glassed tank is impressive!!! you feel you are there with the sharks!!! Don t miss it!

Brilliant. Took our young daughter there and she loved it. Lots of fantastic exhibits and she loved them all. There was also a puppet show on downstairs that was fantastic. Great experience and a definite must do for those with kids!

A day well spent. commentsI visited the aquarium on sunday 23.feb.2014 with my family.I am a south African staying in UK.Two oceans aquarium is absolutely amazing,i have visited other aquariums but i would say is still the best though a bit small.the displays are so fabulous.i enjoyed the shark feeding too.it was a great experience i'll never forget.it was a wonderful holiday experience.my fiancee who is not a S.African felt jealousy of our marine life.I should also really give our appreciation to Steven who was at the microscope.he was so lovely to speak to,very knowledgable.He was indeed adorable,the best for what is doing.Such a fantastic experience!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!W.Gill

Well worth a visit. Very nice attraction well set out and informative, try and visit at feeding time as they have a curator explaining all about the fish and sharks in the main aquarium, i have 3 children aged between 7 and 18 years of age and we all enjoyed it,The entrance fee for all five of us was less than £40 so it was good value as well.The aquirium itself is located in the v&a waterfront area of capetown so its well worth a visit you can also see the seals in the harbour and also there are some great shops in the mall.
Wonderful. I mad an amazing day there so much to see I could have stopped in there hours looking at all the wonderful fish and sea creatures

Predator Exhibit Scuba Dive. I have been to the Two Oceans aquarium about 6 years ago, and although it is smaller than some of the more famous ones around the world, I thought it was a nice day out. This time I decided to do the scuba dive in the shark exhibit (I know you can go Great White cage diving from Cape Town, but I personally don't agree with that environmentally, so decided this would be a good laugh). I am a very experienced diver, but I still found this a very nice experience. Ian the Divemaster made the whole dive easy and fun, and it was great being so close to the Ragged Tooth Sharks, the massive Turtle, and variety of large fish. At times I actually forgot I was in a tank - until you see all the excited school children looking in with amazed grins on their faces!The experience only cost 655 rand, and that also included entry to the other exhibits. I thought this was a great experience (I even found a couple of sharks teeth on the bottom) and well worth a try if you are a certified diver visiting Cape Town.
A welcome addition to a day at the V&A Waterfront. A welcome addition to a day at tge Waterfront. Especially Nemo fans will surely appreciate it. Great overview on maritime life.
Small but good. A fairly small aquarium but kept our 16 month old son amused (lots of wows). He enjoyed the penguins and the touch poolJust wish it was a little bigger

Totally amazing!. A wonderworld of marine life. You are transported to a whole different world. The aquarium is large - I understand the largest on the continent, and they are expanding even more. I would recommend, especially if going with a family thatyuo visit twice, different days.
exaggerated expectations. As announced as the largest sea aquarium of the world our expectations were high, the disappointment was similar.

Must see. Amazing place for both children and adults. It has a lot of great things to see. I wouldn't have minded to stay there for the whole day. It is organized very well. Great learning experience with a volunteer who was eager to provide interesting facts about ocean dwellers.

Go under water!. We were first skeptical to see another aquarium , but the arrangement in this two ocean set up was really good, with interesting stories connected to a very nice selection och fishes and other inhabitants in the two oceans.

Wonderful experience!. The little NEMOS are the best! Thank you for keeping the Aquarium full of interesting fish & tales! Wish there is more snakes to see, a Puff adder & Cobra, perhaps a Boomslang! Anel from African Wonder Tours

Two Oceans Aquarium, Cape Town.. As someone who spent a lot of time diving in Cape waters when I was at UCT I found the Two Oceans Aquarium had excellent exhibits and could have spent a lot more time there. When in Cape Town again it will be on my places to visit list.

nice afternoon. lovely to see the fish, penguins, jellies and more. there was a stand with someone who let you look at specimens and gave you some information, which was interesting. Here you can also dive with the sharks in the aquarium.

Fantastic for kids and adults. So much diversity. Well maintained and very knowledgable staff. Kids love it! Especially the touch and feel ponds. You need a few hours to enjoy this. Good for a windy or rainy day outing.

Nice place to visit. Very interesting place to visit, specially if you have kids. You can have a great time there and the price is not expensive. They have a gift shop at the entrance in case you want to buy gifts for family and friends.

Worth a visit. I have visited many aquariums around the world and feel that this one is well worth a visit. It's on the V&A Waterfront so can be part of a day here along with maybe Robben Island or just shopping and eating.

I was impressed. I was leaving Cape Town to go back home on a Sunday evening, so Sunday morning I went down to the V&A waterfront to do a few last things. After hearing from a colleague that the aquarium was worth seeing, I bought a ticket to enter.I was very impressed! Many of the exhibits are well-laid out so that you can see the animals from different angles, and the collection is quite interesting. E.g., they have the famous mantis shrimp.The penguin feeding is worth seeing, and one benefit to visiting on Sunday is that you see the shark feeding (it takes place only once a week since the sharks have slow metabolisms).If I recall, the price was about 6 or 8 USD, and it was just as good as aquariums in the US for which you might pay 25 or 30 USD.

Excellent. I was not really keen on going but my husband wanted to go so I went and honestly really enjoyed the aquarium. It is in a great location, you can shope, eat and visit the aquarium. The set up, information, the flow, the visuals, the variety of fish, reptiles, amphibians, birds, the sharks, kelp forest exhibit, etc. made for a very interesting fun visit. They display in regards to plastic in our oceans was informative, the touch pools, just everything was amazing. All the kids I saw were having the BEST time ever as was this adult therefore this reluctant visitor is giving it a most excellent!

Wonderful attraction but a bit small for the fee charged.. We enjoyed our visit to the aquarium greatly, both being marine enthusiasts. The displays are well set up and designed and there are some awe-inspiring exhibits like the 3 floor high kelp forest tank. It is also great to see how the aquarium is contributing to the environment by reducing carbon footprint, pollution awareness programs and reliance on natural energy sources. Staff were very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful and the restaurant and gift shop were well stocked and not horribly overpriced. Our only complaints with the aquarium were that for the price charged (R108, average national museum fee is R30-60) it was a bit small, we got through it in an hour. Also the layout of the museum itself was a bit counter intuitive for getting around. All in all this should definitely be a place to visit if you are in the cape.

Certainly worth the money and the time. It is not the biggest aquarium of the world but being so close to the waterfront and all the shops in this area it pays to take a break and enjoy this aquarium.The inside is pretty well laid out, lots of fish, jellyfish and loads of good and well presented information aboutthe inhabitants with one big main tank in which people who wish to do so can have a dive with the big fish in there (turtles and sharks will be very curious once you are in).Do in no case miss the penguin feeding. Of course it is a small number of birds compared to Stony Point or Boulders but it is very entertaining. Especially on a hot day a very nice place to wind down and entertain you and your kids.

aquarium for environmental dimension.. Very nicely built and led Aquarium Two Oceans visiting at each visit Cape Town. In addition to the visual experience is a great educational and environmental dimension, which warns of hazards and teaches consumer behavior.

Experiential learning at its best. The acquarium was fantastic for young and old. You get to analyse sea life under a microscope and touch the sea life. It was quite a hands on experience which was fantastic for the kids. We (the parents) also found it all quite fascinating.

Nice. This is a nice aquarium, not huge, but they have some good exhibits. You can watch them feed penguins and get a lesson on penguin behavior. There is also a large tank which contains sharks, a sea turtle, and a lot of fish. They do lectures there about the different creatures and there is sometimes divers inside the tank. I believe you can pay to dive in the tank and get educated that way as well.
It's impressive for sure. The Two Oceans is a well laid out aquarium with some truly stunning exhibitions. All the fish look healthy and there is plenty here to keep young or old stimulated
great with kids. fantastic outing with great exhibits and great things for the kids to interact with for real education
Wet day out. We visited two oceans on a wet afternoon when our trip to robin Island was cancelled. It was an interesting afternoon out with much to see.
Always great. We have been there many times with our young daughter. She loves seeing 'nemo'. Sunday afternoons you can see the sharks being fed. It can get very crowded, so find a spot early.

excellent Aquarium. One of the best aquariums I have ever been to. The layout is fantastic. I loved the fact that one could interact with the penguins! They are so damn cute! Don't miss the giant crabs! They look as if they come out of a space movie! lol
Always fun. No matter how old you are the aquarium is a fun outing! The excitement of looking into each tank never falters.
FISH!. Not the best aquariam in the world, and in such a big tourist area i would expect more. Worth one trip only, if that!
a must see!. The best aquarium I have ever visited, the penguins re an absolute delight!The staff are very knowledgeable and friendly and will always stop to answer any questions!!

Wonderful Aquarium - book a private experience!. Our family loved the Two Oceans Aquarium. We were there on Christmas Day and it will be a Christmas Day to remember.We are usually traveling on Christmas Day and I try and do something memorable for my kids (ages 12, 17) to remember where they were. The Two Oceans Aquarium had a number of activities that you can book and I organized it in advance of our trip. The one thing I noticed was the great emphasis on what is in the best interest of the animals. For both of the activities that I booked, there was in depth discussion as to whether it was better for us to go in as a family of four, or whether we should be broken down into two groups of two. At all times the staff were thinking of what was best for the animals. Which is the way that it should be!We began with a diving experience in the Predator's Tank. You need to be scuba certified to do this. It was especially fascinating as you go up to the roof of the Aquarium to enter the tank, thus allowing you a peek at the "behind the scenes" world of the Aquarium. The dive itself was great with the sharks and turtles. Our dive master gave us extensive briefing on how to conduct ourselves and we felt safe at all times. Afterwards we were given a towel and time to shower.After that we had booked a private session with the rockhopper penguins. Again, there had been extensive communication via email about how many people could be by the penguins, what they would feel comfortable with, etc. I was so impressed with the passion that the Aquarium staff feel towards their charges. The penguin experience was sooo amazing. I smile just thinking about it. The lovely lady who was their trainer was so impassioned about her job and she was excellent at it. She really loved each of those penguins, and so did I after the first 2 minutes. My kids were grinning ear to ear. We had a solid 30 minutes with the penguins and then it was time for the feeding of the other penguin exhibit so we were taken upstairs to view that first hand.While with the rockhoppers, we learnt so much information about the breed and how each penguin had come to be at the Aquarium. We got to touch a couple of the ones who were receptive to contact and were inches away as they got fed.After both our our private tours we took an hour to view the rest of the Aquarium and were very impressed. It is not a large Aquarium but is really well done. The staff are excellent at their jobs and very knowledgable. If I am back in Cape Town I will definitely visit it again - and dive and see the penguins!

Fun for the little one. Awesome time at the Aquarium with lots to do for the little ones. Be sure to be there when it is feeding time. Great experience. You also get the opportunity to dive with the sharks. There are live plays available at certain times for the kids. we stayed for an hour just looking at the sharks go by and by. My son even had a chance to touch some of the fish in the touch pool.What an awesome experience. pity it was so crowded inside. But, we Will definitely be back

A bit on the expensive side, but worth it!. Having lived many years in California, one is somewhat spoiled with great aquariums. Two Oceans Aquarium does, however, stand up quite nicely. The displays are beautiful. It provides ample opportunity for learning and is a great aquarium to bring kids to. You need to reserve an hour at least, but not much more. It is quite concentrated and compact.

Good for familys. Went 14/04/2014. Good interactive features ,helpful staff ideal for children. Smaller than my home town Aquarium but with some features better than here . If you get any inclement weather in Cape Town when with children I can think of no better place to spend your time.

Excellent! Worth the money.. We took the kids, 6 years old, to the aquarium. What a day! We had to walk through the aquarium three times. They truly enjoyed it. Money well spend and highly recommended.
Very good. The aquarium is a nice size and is a good afternoon out. There is a good selection of fish and well worth it.

Dive with the sharks. A great experience for newly qualified and experienced scuba divers. Operation run by a very knowledgeable and experience scuba diving instructor, Iain Robertson. Whether its looking for shark teeth or being flattened by the rays, every minute is exhilarating.

Fascinating. So much to see here - marine life so colourful. You can even watch divers swimming with the sharks. Great for families - lots of interactive activities for children. Tourist bus stop right outside.

fishies!. i enjoyed holding a star fish in my hand though i think it might have been dead?! the fish and presentations were awesome, the sharks were lame, they didn't have a big variety of sharks, and the ones they had were tame, and boring. The penguins were kept in a small smelly area, which was slightly upsetting to see.However all in all, the aquarium is a great place totake your kids for the day:) It is too expensive though..

Beautiful experience of the ocean. I have been going to the two oceans aquarium for years with my children. They just love it and I have seen it now from top to bottom! It truly is beautiful, and it is what is says, an aquarium of two oceans, which is so unique. The kelp beds are especially beautiful to behold, because unless you are a diver, you will never understand the beauty of a swaying kelp bed. And remember there are only a few places in the world where you get these massive kelp beds. It's a great spot for children, they will be kept busy for hours and there is a great entertainment area for them too in the aquarium, where they do wonderful craft activities with the kids, and the restaurant also has a nice play area for children so you can eat your lunch in peace!

Fun for the whole family. The Two Oceans Aquarium is well worth a visit. They have a wide range of marine animals and fish to look at, and the penguins and sharks are a particular highlight. The exhibits change too, so if you go more than once you will see different things. The staff are really helpful, and the touchpool and playcentre for kids are wonderful ways to keep the kids entertained, especially when the weather is windy or rainy outside and unpleasant for sightseeing. There are queues for tickets when it's busy and the tickets can be pricey, but they offer family and seniors discounts, and the queues move quite quickly. Well worth a visit.
Two Oceans Aquarium. Fish big & small; sharks; turtles; stingrays; penguins....this stunning world class Aquarium has it all. child & disabled friendly; good coffee shop; well priced......

Great place for kids and adults. The sharks in the main aquarium are just amazing. Took my kid there for his birthday and he really loved it. Lots of fish and interesting creatures to see in the aquarium.

Great place to take all the family. A great aquarium with something interesting for everyone.
This is one of our "must do's" on every trip to Cape Town. Large and well maintained. Right balance between interesting and educational. All of our family absolutely love it. Lots of hands on stuff to learn about/with. Really one of the best anywhere

Amazing Sea Life. As it was the school holidays there were lots of families, children, babies and buggies which did make it difficult to get close to some of the aquariums. Lost of patience required at times like this.There was a queue to buy the tickets, but it went quickly. Entry cost 118 rand per adult. there are toilet and restaurant facilities.Some amazing fish, and sea life, some never seen before. No leaflets were handed out with the tickets so am sure we missed some things and it wasn't clearly signed posted inside to guide you on a route.
One of my favourite aquariums in South Africa. Amazing to see so many sea species up close and personal. I have been many times and always enjoy my visit.
Very poor. No value for money at all. It is very poor. It took me just half an hour to see all of it. The only point of interest is the three small sharks they had. (obviusly not the white ones!).

Pleasantly surprised by the variety and abundance of fish on display. I went in thinking, oh dear here we go again, but much to my amazement I was more excited than the kids. The variety and species on display was fantastic and getting a discounted bot trip into the bargain was an added bonus.
one of the best aquariums. i thi k that just the sidney one is better, otherwise an amazing visit,not to be missed.we have been back several times, given the opportunity , and keep liking it !!!

Get there Early. The Two Oceans is one of the best aquarium experiences we have had. The quality and attention to educational detail is superb.If you do not like hordes of kids around you at such venues - get there early and avoid the crowds! If you have kids - nothing better to educate them in respect of preservation of the oceans.
Fun and Informative. We had a fun day with our 2 kids. The tanks are great, displaying a wide variety of fish. We also enjoyed the microscope showing us some sea-life close up.

Compared to other aquariums, this one is less impressive. As a family we visit all aquariums when we are traveling. It does mean that we have visited quite a few and my children were quite disappointed with this aquarium. The displays were excellent, but they could not find any turtles other than on advertising banners.The educational aspects of the displays were good, but the time spent in the aquarium is not worth the fee charged.

Great and educating!. Visited the Two ocean aquarium with my 1year old and he actually had fun. Its quite educating, the lightening gives it a real feel. There are lots of aquatic animals, jelly fishes and rare species. Lovely location close to the V&A waterfront. Loved our visit!

Small for a aquarium at the sea. This is a great outing with kids, it is surprisingly small for a aquarium at the ocean , there are no dolphins or open water viewing areas or even seals? It seams the aquarium is the same size as the one at the Pretoria Zoo in the middle of town. There is so much more that can be done and shown to visitors with there direct access to the ocean. For the price per person you would think the aquarium is much bigger and would have more displays

A treat for sea-life lovers. We spent a morning at this Aquarium and really enjoyed it. It has a good variety of Southern Hemisphere sea-life, including sharks. There is a really interesting exhibit - a tank full of Nemos.We did not have any children with us but it would be a great place for children. The displays and the lighting are really good and create a soothing atmosphere. A good feature of this aquarium is that you can make multiple visits on the same day. We thought the aquarium is a good size as we spent nearly three hours there.

Good for the Children. There are lots of interesting things to see. My daughter enjoyed it..What was disappointing was the 3 PM feeding in the predator tank. We were there for a good 30-45 min waiting for them to feed the sharks and they only seem to feed the fishes and sea turtles. The Nemos exhibit was fun but due to the Christmastime, the lines were long each time we checked back so we didn't get in for a picture. There is a good playground outside the aquarium the children can burn off some energy after.

good displays, conservation a strong point. We went diving at the aquarium, in both their predator and reef tanks. These are both slow moving dives. In the predator tank, the sharks tend to just circle the top and ignore you although occasionally they pass close by. (You swim along the bottom.) In the reef tank you can feed the fish which is fun. Both were reasonable value for a dive.Aside from that, you can also do a penguin enccounter which looked good. (Booking essential for all the above.)In general, the aquarium has great displays, including a touch pool for kids and a nemo display were you can pop up "inside" the tank for a different view. The cafe on the waterfront had good views and nice lunch too.

Small aquarium with large content. The aquarium is not large by U.S. Standards, but it offered quite an assortment of southern hemisphere/African oceaniac inhabitants. Easily toured in 2 hours and next door to the One and Only Hotel. Loved the exhibit full of Nemos (clown fish).
Very good for children. I have visited aquariums all over the world and this is good, but not good enough. It's a bit small and the tunnel is not really spectacular.

A wonderful day out!. I have been to many aquariums in my time and I must say that the Two Oceans aquarium is by far one of the best I have ever seen. The displays and exhibits are very well presented and the entire design is well thought out. Many of the exhibits are presented like a picture gallery, except the artwork are glass tanks filled with exotic sea creatures. Many of the exhibits are tailored for children, so it's a must for the kids! If you plan and book ahead, there are close encounters available with the rockhopper penguins. They are very friendly and have loads of personality. The aquarium takes you on a journey through different marine habitats and exhibits an impressive diversity of marine life. As an added bonus, if you have lunch in the cafe outside the aquarium that backs on the harbour's docks, you may be lucky enough to see (an hear) the wild sea lions. The aquarium has built a floating pontoon for the sea lions and often they will bask in the sun and play on it. Me and my partner spend a good hour enjoying fish and chips and watching and listening to the sea lions... got some great pictures too!

Good Place to see what's in the sea!. Tickets to Robbins Island were sold out so we decided to take in the Aquarium. Great idea, it was a wonderful place to spend a few hours. Be sure to purchase a ticket that includes the boat ride, it was well worth the price. We spent time viewing amazing fish and undersea urchins , watching the divers in the shark tank and touching spiny critters. Then had a lovely time on the water viewing the city, Table Mountain, Robbins Island and the beaches, from a catamaran with free soda and beer.What could be better .
Underwater Spectacular. Amazing place - the wildlife at this aquarium is brilliant. To be up close to the underwater animals etc is an eyeopener. Worth another visit again.

Fun for Whole Family. Family Fun for all ages,from Face Painting to Coloring to Fish Feeds to Spectacular Exibits a World Class Venue.For Certified Dives you can Dive with the Sharks and Large Fish to Kelp Dive with Feeding to me Best Dive in Cape Town.

Well worth a visit. The aquarium is definitely worth a look if you have a few hours spare in cape town. It's a great attraction for kids but is equally interesting for adults, with plenty of information on hand to explain the exhibits.Everything is well laid out and the wide variety of creatures they have on show are all clearly well cared for. The sharks, sea turtle and some of the larger fish in the main tank are a great sight to see.
Amazing. It was really beautiful, with a lot of fish, sea creatures, and penguins!!!. It was really interesting, . I loved it
Brilliant. Excellent attraction for anyone. We thoroughly enjoyed the wide variety of fish. Lots and lots to see and extremely interesting. All that at a reasonable price too.
Amazing creatures. Great pass-time - especially when it's raining. You will need around 1-2 hrs. It's nicely showing the animals first in the Indian the in the Atlantic Ocean.
Interesting Aquarium. From the tiny krill to the huge sharks, this aquarium has many interesting creatures on display. Very easy to find since it is a block away from the V & A Waterfront.
This is a Brilliant Aquarium. This is a must if you visit the V&A harbour - loads to see and the massive aquarium in the middle is a must

Decent aquarium at decent price. A decent variety of fish, sharks and other aqua life, although not much interaction (I.e. Touching pools). Younger children would enjoy but not really for everyone. Would see more/interesting species with a visit to Boulders Bay for penguins or Gaansbai for shark diving/viewing.

The Two Oceans Aquarium. This is a nice place to take your children too. But also very relaxing and entertaining if you just want to see animals. The sharks were my favourite viewing to see how large they are upfront. There are a variety of sea creatures to see some which one is not famillar with and therefore this visit is very educational but fun at the same time.
avarage. small Aquarium located in the waterfront ( red and blue bus tour start from this place),may be good for the someone who have never seen an aquarium.

Not only for children. I took my granddaughter to the Aquarium when she was here last week from L.A. She is 2 years old and thoroughly enjoyed it as did her grandma. Lots of fun things for children of all ages. Nice to be in time to watch the penguins being fed as well. Kids absolutely love it.

a fun filled educational trip. the aquarium may not be big but we have a great time, thanks to the friendly staff who generously spend much time to share with us in depth some interesting facts and stories about the sea animals, It is an ideal place to spend a hot afternoon in Cape Town.
Peaceful and calming effect. The ocean is one of the biggest mysteries! Viewing it via this angle is so educating and beautiful at the same time. Kids are in awe!
Checking out the sea life. Amazing exhibit! Well worth the money and a very good representation of sea life in both the Atlantic and Indian oceans. We spent several hours there and took many photos.

A great morning out, especially for young ones. Friendly staff and lovely displays make the aquarium a firm favourite, especially on those rainy wintry days when the little ones need space to run and explore - which there's plenty of at Two Oceans. There's a free craft in the basement where you can see the penguins swimming around through the glass. The Nemo's are great and the Kelp forest is a good place to stop for a breather and to enjoy the view and calm music. Worth getting a season ticket if you stay close enough to visit more that 3 times a year.

Lots of Fish and Marine Life. Really interesting place to visit for adults and children. There are lots of opportunities to have practical experiences with the marine exhibits. Its amazing to see all the different fish big and small and all different colours. Lovely attraction to visit
Great fun for Kids and Adults alike. Have your photo taken with Nemo! See Rays and Sharks amongst many other species of fish and mammals.

Worth a visit with the kids. The aquarium is worth a visit to familiarise your children about the sea life that surrounds Cape Town. The aquarium is not very large, which surprised me but there are lots of things to see for children. You even get to touch the different types of kelp that can be found off the coast, which sounds pretty dull but is worth a feel! The aquarium is a stop on the hop-on hop-off bus, which makes an investment in a bus ticket worthwhile. You exit, as always, through the gift shop into the cafeteria, which has good coffee. You can watch the odd seal sunning itself from the outside tables while you enjoy a 'caffeine-fix'.

Perfect for a rainy day. With our guest from the USA facing a full day's rain, we went off to the aquarium and had a great time. I loved the very interesting and well documented small displays - the tiny creatures that we always miss have such amazing stories - and the kelp forests with large fish were fascinating. All the tanks were in excellent condition and we particularly liked the way the facts were presented to make everyone more environmentally aware.

Great Atlantic animals experience. It was my first visit to an aquarium, so I really enjoyed seeing sharks, turtles, penguins and many other fish or plants in an environment that resembled very well their natural habitat.

Dry Diving. The underwater, walk-around 'tanks' were hypnotic. Fish were captivating whether clownish or sinister and one can't help but sway while watching the creatures float through filtered sunlight and seaweed. Simply beautiful. And, the smaller exhibits were well documented, educational and accessible for mobility challenged. Loved standing at eye level with swimming penguins. The entire experience was uplifting.

Good Place for a Rainy Day. We had planned that we would go to the aquarium if it rained and so myself and my daughter did and let mum go and get a massage etc. Its a good aquarium with some big tanks and good exhibits. Its not as good as the one at Monterey in California, which takes some beating, but was very good. The best bit I thought was when we spent about 20 - 30 minutes with a lady in the middle of the aquarium, explaining all things about small sea creatures such as some specific sea slugs, anenomes, krill / plankton / sea monkeys etc and also learning about baleen whales and the baleen they use to filter the small sealife for feeding. We spent between 1-2 hours there and that was enough.

Nice Daytime activity. We wandered in here while visiting the waterfront. We just hit on the time they were feeding so this was very interesting. Good tour guide talking about the creatures and their personal attributes. Well worth a visit

SeaWorld. A nice small aquarium which was thoroughly enjoyable - a large variety of fish and the glass walled area to see sting ray, sharks a turtles and other fish was good especially if you had kids

wonderful aquarium, especially for kids. this aquarium is great for all, but especially for kids. Amazing displays of fish and explanations of the fish and their environment. You can learn a lot about the sea life of Africa and the Cape Town area. Kids had a display where they could touch the fish, pop up into a display of fish, draw, climb, etc. Easy walk form the V & A Waterfront Hotel. For adults, nice option to dive with the sharks, must be arranged in advance and you need diver certification.

swim fishy swim. This knocks the British sea worlds into the proverbial cocked hat. a fantastic trip round looking at all manner of fish and sea life they cater well for kids too in fact the whole family will enjoy this attraction

Great place!. This is a must see in Cape Town and is home to one of only three live kelp exhibits in the world. The aquariums is very earth conscience and right outside you will find a seal platform where you may see some sleepy seals resting peacefully. The cafe at the aquarium is also very good with a large menu!
interesting and informative. The displays were imaginative and the information clear. I could see that it was good for capturing childrens imagination, and the close up view of the sharks was awesome

Awesome Aquarium. We visited here during our visit to Cape Town in 2012 and loved it. Such a great array of underwater creatures and much more impressive than any of the aquariums we have visited in the UK.

A very pleasant visit. My daughter was thrilled to be able to dive with the sharks - it was an amazing experience she will never forget, and I wasn't even scared or worried whilst watching her through the glass, even though it was the sharks' weekly feeding time just after the dive!The variety of marine life on display was superb, with full and interesting information. I particularly liked the innovative idea of the glass bubble so you can pose in amongst the clown fish.

Two Oceans Aquarium scuba diving is INCREDIBLE !!. I had the privilege of diving in the Two Oceans Aquarium Predator Tank over the weekend – what an AMAZING blessing !!! It was so different seeing it from the perspective of the fish. The Two Oceans Aquarium allow up to 3 certified divers per time slot (they have 3 slots in a day – 09h00, 11h00 and 13h00) to dive in either the Predator Tank or the Kelp Forest Tank, and the dive itself lasts around 30 minutes. You can use your own diving kit or rent from the Dive School. You can do your bookings and payments through the Two Oceans Aquarium website.I have visited the Aquarium many times over the years and have always enjoyed the visits; but this is by far the high-point of those trips for me. We had a Loggerhead Turtle who seemed to take a liking to our fins and was very persistent – much to my delight and the amusement of the visitors watching us. The Ragged Tooth Sharks kept a wary eye on us the entire time – it was only afterwards that I found out that it was Shark feeding time a few minutes after we finished our dive, so I was somewhat relieved that they saved their appetites for their regular food !! The Rays were very inquisitive and the shoals of other fish were amazing to experience “close-at-hand”. This is DEFINITELY an experience that I would encourage any certified divers to do.

not so big but worth a visit. this aquarium is not one of the biggest i've visited, not even medium size, but still worth a visit, good variety of sea creatures, well designed and well displayed. it is located in the waterfront so better combine it with a visit to other places in the area. one unique item are the penguins. price is cheaper than in japan or the u.s., but as mentioned not as impressive .

Small but nice aquarium. The Two Oceans Aquarium was a pleasant visit on a rainy / cloudy afternoon. The Aquarium is nice but not that big or spectacular, still what we saw we liked. Although some animals looked bored (Pinguins) or not that healthy (the fish in the Nemo tank). We liked the extra info we got at the touch area. We saw most of it in about 1.5 hours. The place has friendly prices compared to aquariums in Europe.

Highly informative and well designed. The aquarium is well worth a visit. I was there for about two hours. My time was well spent. The information provided for each exhibit was excellent, and many of the “creatures” on display were fascinating to observe. There were two kinds of penguins as well as many fish and crustaceans.

A "must see". The Two Oceans Aquarium is a must see. We went in the morning (very crowded) and saw the penguins being fed. We returned in the late afternoon (it closes at 6 PM) when it was practically empty.

Nice experience. The place is located at a very convenient location. It is just opposite the parking and very near to the sea and the mall. The variety of sea animals is good. You can easily spend an hour or two in this place. There are many nice attractions such as the shark tank , the nemos tank and the touching fishes area. I would recommend it to anyone who is in Cape Town.

Magical afternoon. My husband and daughter passed the better part of the day here in bliss. The displays were state of the art, the variety of animals were impressive and the information provided digestable and memorable.

Still can be amazed. Thought we had seen all the creatures that the oceans have to offer, but were amazed at some of the creatures that we had not seen before. Definitely worth spending some time in this small aquarium.

Great place for children of all ages!. We were certainly surprised with the aquarium here in Cape Town! Took a great picture of my husband in the middle of many "Nimo's"! Will bring back happy memories of our visit to this aquarium.

Nice enough. The aquarium was interesting as far as providing more information about the local marine life. I enjoyed the kelp tank and large aquarium. Since taking up scuba diving I feel less impressed by the big fish tanks so I think a non diver may have enjoyed this more

Very good and conveniently situated. Well worth a visit especially if you have children. Easily found on the waterfront, an extensive array of fish and sea creatures imaginatively and informatively displayed.

Surprising fun. Went with some friends and found it surprising enjoyable. The entrance fee seems a bit pricey at the beginning, but when you see the truly lovely facilities the animals have it makes it worth it. Many of the tanks have cleverly designed displays to show off their residents and some of the tanks are truly spectacular in size as well as in their function. Just the variety of species also impresses for sure. Well worth the visit whether with the family or with some 30 something's on holiday.

So peaceful. We went to the Aquarium on 11 February 2013 and what an awesome visit... We had such a great time. We loved the Clown Fish bowl that you can climb into. And the Jelly Fish. The employees were very friendly and helpful... The restaurant's food was terrific. Keep it up Two Oceans Aquarium. We will definitely see you again in the future
Well worth a visit. If you have time you really should go, I was very impressed with the wall of fish and the sea horses that they have are so beautiful. The feeding of the penguins is very amusing.

Interesting, educational and hipnotizing. I have visited on a rainy day but would have been there on any other day: I loved it! It was one of the best places I have been in Cape Town. I have never thought I would see plankton or so many varieties of jellyfish! The aquariums are well kept and in some areas there are people explaining about the behavior of some very interesting creatures like microorganisms and sea anemones. You can feed them and touch them! I also really enjoyed the "Nemo" aquarium, where you are surrounded by fishes, the different crustaceous and the predator tank with sharks and stingrays. I will definitely go back!

worth a visit. The aquarium is right at the waterfront, at the city sight-seeing bus departure point which is very handy. Lots of tanks full of amazing fish etc to look at, lots of great info too. There is a touching pool where you can hold/touch starfish etc. A great place to spend 2 hours, finishing off with a relaxing sit in front of a HUGE tank of mixed fish/shark/tortoise etc.
Fascinating. Loved it. The exhibitions are beautifully staged, my children and i had a great time watching the fish, shark and also penguins swimming and feeding.
Loved the Nemo Fish!. There are variates of fishs and sea life. Just thought it would be bigger but it didnt lost its charm. A place to come back.

Small but worth a visit. We visited this place with three adults. The building is well shaped and there are unexpected animals to be seen. When the penguins go to there night stay they walk among the guests wich is nice and rather funny to see. They don't seem to be borthered by humans. The museum is not that big but okay to visit for a few hours.

An aquarium worth visiting. If you like sea life there is a lot to like about this aquarium. Some very good and unusual exhibits. They could use a better ventilation system for the penguin exhibit though. The smell is pretty overpowering in there.

Aquarium. Fabulous not the largest aquarium I have visited but very well designed. Lots of interesting exhibits. The Nemo tank that you can put your head up into is amazing. Watching a baby penguin being fed was wonderful. Lovely gift shop and cafe on site.

I found NEMO!. My boyfriend and I visited this place after our shark dive got rescheduled. Its a really nice place for friends, couples and families to visit. Theres lot's to see inside with lots of information. We even managed to see the fish being fed. It's nice to see if you enjoy marine life :)

moreSAplease. A beautiful combination of entertainment and education, with loads of exhibits and good interactive displays. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable and you can usually see everything, even the showboating penguins. A great couple of hours for not much money.

Nature at its best!!!!. Great exhibition. Sea species are so wonderful.I have been to uShaka Marine in Durban. I was expecting more than what I already know . However it was nice observing those cute penguins, and one of them really liked the spot light. It kept on doing its moves as if it was show - casing and it was a wow!!

Feed the penguins!. Great to visit the aquarium on a rainy day! This place is great to see the many types of sealife, which are located in this part of the world. My favorite has to be feeding time for the penguins. The penguins are hand fed by the employees and is a sight to see. This is a great place for families.

Nice little gen. Having just visited the Vancouver Aquarium, I didn't have high expectations - i only went to see the shark exhibit. The aquarium is smaller than many, but each exhibit is excellent and has something for all ages. The price is very reasonable. The touch pond is a little small, but will keep little ones busy. Best exhibits were the kelp forest and the shark tank. But some of the smaller ones were gems like the shark egg cases and the "finding nemo" tank.

Sushi on the "hoof". Awesome! And I have been to many aquariums around the world and this one is the best. Atlanta had caged otters and trained belugas - so sad...Galway and Port Elizabeth today - keep your money for beer rather!
A great visit. I took my children to the aquarium & besides them thoroughly enjoying the visit, I did so too. It is definitely worth a visit.

Worth a Visit - and Breakfast!. We visited the Aquarium during a wet morning in August, mainly to keep dry, but also because we've made a habit of visiting similar sites all over the world, from New Zealand to the US. A large number of the displays were familiar from those other visits, but there were some notable exceptions. The exhibit with literally hundreds of clown fish springs to mind, as does the penguin site. However, the major point I'd make is one that has been raised by other contributors - the staff. Every single member of the staff that we met, from the ticket kiosk to the touch pool, was clearly enthusiastic about the centre. Probably our most interesting fifteen minutes was spent in conversation with a charming lady at the micro marine life stand, where she showed us amazing items that were all but invisible to the naked eye. Her enthusiasm was a joy to see.The final point I'd make concerns the attached café. We were staying in the Waterfront Apartments and breakfasted extremely well each morning in the Aquarium's café, eating our fill at very good prices, far cheaper than any other establishments close at hand - and, again, with charming staff, who were eager to please. Thoroughly recommended.

Two Oceans Aquarium Five Stars. Well worth every penny. Truly world class attraction. Plus one of the best views from a restaurant there is. Excellent value also, with several kids play areas. A must.

Wonderful experience for young and old.. This is a great place to observe and experience sea life, which is indigenous to South African shores. It is also within walking distance to other places of interest and great restaurants, in the Cape Town Waterfront. There is a gift shop and a small restaurant, as well.

magic. the kids (and us) had fantastic time at the aquarium!
it has so many sorts of species, activities, and attractions for the kids,
we've been there for 3 hours and could easily stayed longer.

Excellent value, truly amazing experience.. Being used to the sealift centres etc in the UK we weren't expecting too much. We were pleasantly surprised. This is a real experience, wonderful for children. There's so many exhibits, tank after tank of sea life and plenty of information. It is all so well presented and maintained. There's also areas where staff will talk to you and give information.Very impressed. A well stocked shop and pleasant cafe.
wonderful aquarium. I have been to many aquariums around the world and this one was quite nice and worth the visit.Some unique fish and a nice penguin display

Entertaining and informative. Really good attraction to go to when it's raining outside. Very informative, well stocked and clean. The one guide was brilliant in telling people about what you can see under the microscope and involved the people listening to him.

Serene & Wonderful. After having spent 9days in Cape town, i headed off to the Aquarium and i wasn't disappointed with what i saw there, i like the fact that environment is well arranged and the staff members i interacted with were very friendly. the high point of the visit for me was the feeding time. i bought a one year pass which gives me access to the aquarium all year long as against paying 4 just one day. will be back on Sunday to see them feed the sharks.NB feeding time is 15.00hr local time.
A good way to spend an hour or two. Not the biggest or smallest aquarium, well presented, with an interesting variety of sea life to see.

Wonderful experience. This is a great place to visit with many interesting and informative exhibits. The staff are friendly and helpful whilst the exhibits appear well kept and the creatures generally happy and healthy. The only negative for a local is the somewhat high entry fee - otherwise a great place to spend an afternoon.

This was fun. Located in the very convenient V&A waterfront, Two Oceans Aquarium was a nice visit. The aquariums is open 365 days a year. It cost about 10 USD to visit and a visit takes about an hour (as it's a relatively small aquarium). The highlights for us: the predator exhibit (note: sharks are fed on Sundays at 3pm); the Rockhopper penguins (very unusual and great fun to watch); and the "Nemo tank", where you can scoot under the tank and take a picture with about a hundred small Nemo's. Very cute. If you get lucky and catch a trainer as we did, they are very friendly and informative. They clearly love their jobs!There's a café at the Aquarium entrance - we had burgers and fries that were pretty good.

Great place to take the kids. This aquarium has loads of fish and different types of sea creatures for everyone to look at and appreciate. it also teaches people about ocean conservation and which fish are okay to eat. Smaller kids will love going to the aquarium, where there is a kiddies play room and a place to touch a few sea animals.

Really enjoyable visit. We had a good time wandering around the aquarium and just watching the fish especially in the big tanks. They have made the visit very interactive and the kids loved being able to put their heads in the middle of the circular tanks and see some amazing sea creatures. Well worth the cost and the time.

Great for all ages. The aquarium in Cape Town is a great place to visit, especially if the weather is a bit wet! Located right by the booking office of the sightseeing bus tours and just round the corner is a platform with seals on. The aquarium is a great learning place, the penguin feeding is recommended and you get to learn loads.
