great visit. the 2 Oceans aquarium while not as big as Ushaka Marine World in durban was no less impresssive, the touching pool for kida and those of us young at heart was great , the staff who was there was very knowledgeable and quite helpful. enjoyed our time there

Better than expected. We chose this as something to do when the weather was slightly less than appealing. We both enjoyed it much more than we thought we would.There's a crazy range of sea life here, and if you time it right you can see a bunch of them being fed too. I also enjoyed being able to touch some starfish, gawk in amazement at jellyfish, and being able to stick my head inside a tank of Nemos aka clownfish.I imagine it'd be a great afternoon for some kids- we saw a load who seemed to be having a blast. But good fun for us grown ups too.

It was ok. Went to other aquariums in other countries and that one didn't really had the wow factor! They do have lots of animals including penguins (you can feed them if you pay extra and book before)

Finding Nemo. The Aquarium is always a favorite spot - especially for those with kids. The hit for us was the tank with clown fish (aka "Nemo") with an entrance allowing kids (of all ages) to climb inside to see the fish up close. And to allow Mom and Dad (or colleagues in our case) to snap a picture. Great fun!I have been at the Aquarium only for conference events, and unfortunately, never explored more - but the exclamations of "Wow! Come look at this!" were numerous and made me want to go back and explore more.

A good overview of the Cape's main attractions. I had a little trouble figuring out the best way to approach the exhibits, but we enjoyed what we did see, particularly the feedings and the "microscopic sea life" docent presentation. They should put some more emphasis into the Indian Ocean life, since it does advertise itself as "Two Oceans."
Good aquarium, worth a visit. Not the largest or biggest but has good display of kelp. A good activity for a rainy day, won't take very long to go through it.

nice aquarium, affordable price. The aquarium is nice, not something really special, but a good choice to spend 2-3 hours in Cape Town at a more-than-affordable price. Probably, the main attractions are a tank with sharks and an area with penguins. I feel to recommend this aquarium to families with children, more than to adults.
Great Aquarium. Great spot on the waterfront. Allows you to see exhibits from both the Indian and Atlantic Oceans. We enjoyed spending a day here. Great for kids too.

A Lovely Place To Visit. Great place to visit with kids, it's bigger than it appears from the outside. We spent ages wandering around looking at all the fish and the lovely penguins. I treated my husband and daughter to a meet and greet with their rescue Rockhoppers which was just brilliant value for money.If it's a wet day then it does get rather busy, but if you take your time you can see everything. The staff we came across were all delightful and the café is also surprisingly good, and well priced.
Interesting. Has plenty to see, but expensive to enter. To go, you need to take your time and see all that you can and wait for the feeding of the penguins

Look into the eye of a shark. There are plenty of sea creatures to view, admire and read about. The talks and puppet show for the wee ones were very good and every body in our group, from grandma to grand daughter, had fun.
The best aquarium we have visited!. Huge tanks, great talks from various staff members, penguins, sharks, clown fish - what's not to like! Also great ice cream in the cafe!!
Always a pleasure. Every time I visit it seems to we improved. That being said, it seemed smaller than before. Good value for money.
Smaller but excellent. So glad we visited, particularly enjoyed the penguin feeding for the informative talk by the keeper. Lots of Eco information especially for children, a well worth well visit.

Wonderful activity for the kids (and Adults). Very enjoyable morning activity and right next to the Waterfront. A must if you have kids with a couple of hours to spare. We loved the clown fish exhibit (Nemo rules!!)

One of the best in the world. Whether you have children or not-find a time to go! We loved learning about the area's marine life.The main tank is massive and filled with some very weird local fish. I liked the penguin enclosure. I met them in the wild the next day-so I felt prepared!Pretty great and informative

Micro display very interesting!. A visit to the Two Oceans Aquarium is always worthwhile, but what interested me recently was the new micro-species display, which at first glance didn't seem to be very much more than a table with a microscope and a few jars. All manner of micro-creatures were found by the assistant, whose enthusiasm was infectious, and the initial reason that we stopped by. With amazing precision, she zoomed the microscope in on tiny crustaceans, the smallest of which were reconstituted shrimp (amazing!) used to feed smaller species of fish, and barely visible starfish which were my top pick - no bigger than a match head but so perfectly intricate! What initially seemed a side display became the event of the day!

A real favourite for the whole family. I've been to a few aquariums in my time and this was one of my favourites. There was loads to do for the kids and the fish were beautiful. We'd done whale watching the day before so all of the stuff on the whales was both fascinating and informative. I'd thoroughly recommend it.
Under the sea. Experince the sea life live, literally, beautiful, and you can come in and out teh entire day on the one ticket.

The Best Aquarium I have ever visited. Thank you to all the Staff you were all so welcoming and helpful and knowledgeable about your areas.My last visit was back in July 2008. I was on holiday (3 weeks) to the home land. (live on the Isle of Man now)I would love to get back there and see all the great staff and attractions again (my home country)This is a must visit from family's to couples and even singles (like me)(was there 5 times in that period) that love the ocean and there creatures.I have even been following them on FB and Twitter but only started to use Trip advisor recently.Hope to see you all soonedps: the date visited is July 2008 and Not 2013

Best of two oceans. The aquarium is quite an extraordinary place, but on a crowded day, you really don't get to appreciate it much. There are just too may people pushing and shoving and not nearly enough seats to enjoy the tanks that have "arena seats". Still, it is an absolutely beautiful aquarium and definitely world class.
Value for money. Good aquarium with lots to see. My 21 year old son loved it. We found the price very reasonable, around $12 NZD
<3. I make a point of visiting a zoo and aquarium in every country I visit. This aquarium was wonderful, and very informative. Beautiful fish! Great for a rainy Cape Town day. :)
Fishy!!. Very entertaining. This aquarium shows the local species both big and small. Be sure to taste 'kingklip' and chips....delicious...

Cape Town's Aquarium. Relatively new in Cape Town +- 10 years viz-a-viz the more renown aquarium in Durban (South Africa) Has all the ribbons and bows, lots to see and marvel at. Especial favourite with the kids. Worth a visit

The Guggenheim of Aquariums. A small but beautifully laid out aquarium with lots to see, a range of interactive elements, a hypnotic Kelp Forest Exhibit and attentive staff. It gets a tad busy on rainy days and shark feeds on Sundays are a hit but space is limited but worth the hassle. Love the Moving Sushi art works and the newly renovated Penguin playarea adjacent to the Children's centre.

great for kids of all ages. This is an informative and fun way to spend a rainy afternoon in cape town. There's a lot to see and it's arranged in a good order building up to the sharks and the giant turtle at the end.

love a good aquarium. My friend and I really like aquariums an always visit them when we're on vacation. This one was great, had a lot of fish I'd never seen before, a cool clownfish exhibit and a great predator exhibit. Definitely worth a trip if you're interested in fish! If you know you're going, buy the tickets online, it's a dollar or two cheaper than buying at the aquarium.

Worth a visit. We were able to enjoy a Sunday afternoon in this colourful place at the waterfront. They have a good collection of various aquatic animals including sharks, turtles, sea horses and penguins.We were fortunately able to be in time for the penguin feeding and shark feeding session. It’s better to reach a little early to get a good spot for these. The sessions last around 30 minutes and are quite informative without being boring.

Superb and very clean. Most aquariums look and feel the same but, I found the two oceans aquarium very clean and most enjoyable. Great lighting made the displays really interesting, well worth time to visit.
Wish it was bigger. A fun hour spent wondering. Around here, good displays, the kids and us enjoyed it, just wish that it was bigger.

Waterfront Day. For a family of 5 it was quite expensive to experience this. Its informative, but honestly would have preferred to have taken kids to Robben Island - unfortunately it was fully booked for days.

Must see for your kids. My kids loved this! The main tanks are huge, it like becoming part of the underwater world, without getting wet! The shark swimming overhead had the boys thrilled. This attraction works, no matter what the weather. Pricey for a family on a budget or bigger families.
excellent in all ways. nice aquaruim its for those people who are intrested in watching fish and etc.i did not like it any ways it was near to my hotel and v&a water front i visited it
Small but nice. Small aquarium, but nice and shopping around. The tanks with the sharks were awesome! I would recommend it to families

Worth a few hours. I really enjoyed our visit to the aquarium. The fish are really interesting to look at but I don't think I'd go again. Definitely worth one visit but couldn't imagine that I would want to buy a yearly pass

Great experience for Kids and Adults. I am not usually a fan of caged environments but I believe its important to nurture a love of all things wild and wonderful about our natural habitats... Two Oceans does a fantastic job of engaging with the youth, educating and inspiring them...

Entertaining marine experience. I enjoyed the Two Oceans Aquarium quite a lot, but one leaves afterwards with a feeling that the entrance might be a bit steep for the experience, especially when compared to the world-class facility such as uShaka Marine World in Durban, Kwa-Zulu Natal, South Africa.There are nice and educational activities for children, keeping them busy and entertained for hours. Not bad at all, but could offer a bit more.
Great time. Plenty to see and if you have kids they will be entertained. Food and drink is available inside as well as the usual gift shop.

Very educational. Very interesting place to visit. It was good yesterday spending time with kids learning about marine life. I liked the lab/ microscope viewing, penguin, and frog areas!This is a must visit!!

Kelp forest and penguins. I took my children here while my husband went to Robben Island. They had a lovely time, seeing the penguins and sharks being fed, getting inside the Nemo tank, looking at sea horses and other brightly coloured fish. There were also some good microscope and touching displays, with informed staff. The cafe and shop are also good, and there are plenty of toilets (it's one of the things you notice when travelling with children!)
Fun. Its really nice but not as fun as Shaka Marine in Durban :-) but its walking distance for the residents at V & A so that is lovely

Nice attraction when travelling with kids. Visiting the Aquarium is a good option when travelling with children. Entrance fees are comparably low and you will be able to see exotic sea fauna (and flora) from close distance. Being there at the right time will allow for watching the feeding of sharks.
best aquarium ive been too. Divers feeding wild fish,,,including sharks,,, barracuttas,,, .....huge array of fish species and penguin colonies.....awesome time,, a must see...

A surprising find. We'd been told the aquarium was good, but we weren't planning on visiting. We found ourselves with some extra time and we went it and we were so glad we did, we stayed about 2 hours and could have stayed longer. They have done a great job of presentation and education. It made it more interesting when we went to see the actual oceans and saw some of the creatures in their own habitat.

This is a truly world class aquarium. This aquarium is magnificent.Compared with the Sydney aquarium it stands in a league of its own.You really need quite a few hours to get through the various exhibits and even your kids will be entertained for ages.I've been to this aquarium a number of times and still thoroughly enjoy it.Located at the V&A Watwrfront, it's surrounded by great restaurants and shopping too, so make a day of it.

Penguin Encounter. I sought out Two Oceans aquarium specifically for the encounter with the resident rockhopper penguins that is available as a surprise for my husband. (He loves penguins) The aquarium seems very geared towards children so we didn't really visit many exhibits other than those we passed on the way to the penguins. It looked nice and well maintained with a lot of variety from what we could tell. I highly recommend booking the encounter and it includes admission to the aquarium. . We spent about 30 minutes inside the penguin enclosure and got to hold penguins and help them build their nests by handing them nesting materials. The keeper was with us and was very nice and informative. We had a great time and it was certainly a unique experience! It probably wouldn't be a good idea for young children as the penguins can nip/bite (it doesn't hurt). It is set up so that some family members could watch and others could go in the enclosure. I would say that older children and adults would enjoy this a lot!

Not as big as I thought. At R120 to enter the aquarium you would think it would take longer than 30mins to stroll around. The tanks and exhibits are stunningly beautiful and well presented. It's just a shame there is not more of it.
If you are at the waterfront it's worth visiting to fill in some time and see some rare species.

Awesome experience. Visiting the Aquarium was such an amazing and worthwhile experience especially if you have kids. The costs are very reasonable we also visited at the right time as we were able to see the feeding of penguins and the sharks, this was the climax of Aquarium visit. I would definitely recommend it.

Once In A Lifetime Aquarium Dive. It's not every day that you get to dive in a huge aquarium. Luckily, the Two Oceans Aquarium in Capetown offers you that very opportunity! So me and my brother-in-law (both certified divers) jumped at the opportunity. You need to book the dive in advance, so make sure to call ahead or stop by reception in order to book your dive. The dive guide will also be checking your certification card so make sure to bring it on the day of your dive.Our dive at the aquarium began with us signing the usual liability waivers at the front desk. Our dive guide met us at reception and took us on a quick tour of the aquarium. He brought us to the huge tank we would be diving in and talked about the different creatures housed in the aquarium itself. After that, we were off to the staff-only zone! After changing into our bathing suits and gearing up, the dive guide brought us to the top of the aquarium where we would be carefully entering the water. After making sure all of our equipment was working, we entered the water one at a time and made our way to the bottom of the aquarium.The dive itself was about half an hour, but in that time we got the chance to circle the aquarium twice. We were instructed not to touch any of the animals, for obvious reasons, but we were allowed to wave at the other guests staring at us through the glass panes. It was a neat way of experiencing the Two Oceans Aquarium - as part of the exhibit!If you are a certified diver and are in Capetown, I really recommend that you consider diving the aquarium at Two Oceans. You'll get to see many interesting creatures up close and just the experience of looking at people from the other side of the aquarium is a joy on its own! The whole dive was conducted in a very safe and controlled manner so at no time did we ever feel threatened by the sharks or other animals swimming around the tank.This was one of my most memorable dives and I hope this review inspires you to give it a try if you ever get the chance!P.S. The cost of the dive also includes access to the rest of the aquarium after you've completed your dive.

Very Enjoyable. I am not particularly interested in sea life but I enjoyed this. The range of sea life is wonderful and varied and you just had to marvel at a lot of it. It was pretty reasonably priced as well and located perfectly on the waterfront. Highly recommended.

Worthwhile if time is limited. The price is reasonably cheap. Not a huge place, but interesting especially if you have kids. Highlight was feeding in the large aquarium, not an everyday event. Good variety and kids enjoyed a tank full of clown fish. Walking distance from V &A Waterfront.

Nice, but much better for kids. The aquarium is nice and displays a lot of different sea life from the two oceans. They have a lot of activities for kids, thus if you have kids you should definite make a turn.
Wonderful aquarium, watch the sharks being handfed!. This aquarium rocks. Love that you can watch the sharks being handfed. Really good if you have kids, thoroughly entertaining.
Don't miss this attraction. This aquarium is large and is great for families. It had a magnificent array of species. Don't miss the penguins!

Enjoyed it.. I came here with my boyfriend but didnt expect to enjoy it cause ive been to so many aquariumsa in other countries and its all been pretty much the same. Im happy to report that a visit to this place is well worth it. So much to see but a little pricey.

Great attraction, good value. Family of 3 (1 8yr old) really enjoyed the experience here. Good exhibits, very large space, and a good location. Very helpful, knowledgeable and professional staff. Makes other cities equivalents (London, NY) look expensive and poor in comparison. If you like sea-life, this place is worth a look.
A fab time with the fish. A super chance to see many wonders of the South African sea. A lovely experience and a place we always love visiting.
Best!. Its just so hard to maintain such a large variety of sea life... the way it is organized and maintained is just spectacular... Kids and adults are equally exited to watch it!

Same old!!. Having been to the one in Berlin, Paris and Barcelona a word of advice is necessary!! Yes it is ok and the size of the tanks are reasonable. But it is too pricey!! Many of the tanks were dirty and the staff, when pointed out to them said, it never was their duty or the guy who has to do this is on leave at the moment!! The boards are however in great shape and give a lot of information on habits and habitats! If you want to teach your children something, go to the TOA and afterwards show them David Attenborough's The Blue Planet...

Aquarium at the Waterfront. Its a nice and informative aquarium, especially feeding times are interesting. But it is not something I would recommend when you have limited time to spare in Cape Town - in comparison with other aquariums we have visited it was pricy and quite small.The convenient location might be a big bonus for many tourists and kids will always love it!

A nice day out. I spent a few hours at the aquarium and enjoyed it, they have a few spectacular large exhibits and a live kelp forest tank which is hypnotic! It's not huge but it's well laid out and there's a lot there considering the size. Only thing I would have wanted was a marine mammal exhibit, but it was still great without. It would be fantastic for kids.

Lovely little aquarium. We enjoyed walking around and seeing the difference between the two oceans that surround South Africa. It is not a huge aquarium, but it is very well done, and has many little nooks and crannies with great things to see. We especially enjoyed the shark feeding at he predators exhibit.

Ideal outing if you have kids. The aquarium caters to all ages. My kids love going there and we can easily take them a few times a year. We have an annual pass and it has been worth every cent. We always finish off with lunch in the restaurant that has a lovely play area with a child minder.

Two Oceans come together at the Aquarium. Located in the heart of Cape Town, near V&A Waterfront, it is a nice Aquarium and place to visit while in the area. Some of my favorites were the Starfish, Sea Horse, Turtles, lots of Jelly Fish and oh may be aware of the Sharks. It is called Two Oceans because it is framed by Atlantic and Indian Ocean. Children, and of course Adults alike, even get a chance to touch a few "friendly" marine creatures... such as Start Fish.

A good way to spend a winter morning. When we first arrived, school groups surrounded us and were very loud. These kids moved on quickly and then we were able to see the exhibits easily. We enjoyed all the quotes on water attached to the tanks. My kids liked this aquarium.

World Class establishment. What a great experience, all the displays are very well planned and put together. A feast for the senses - to make this review short and sweet: a highly recommended must see!

Typical Aquarium. This is your usual aquarium. We were there for the stingray feeding time and that was something neat to see. One good thing about the aquarium is that you can go in and out as you please. Make sure you get your hand stamped and if you pay in the morning, you can go back later in the afternoon.
Ocean experience. Well worth a visit. Nice layout and friendly personal. Big tank with nice variety of fish. Layout of such that kids can enjoy as well.
Great exhibition of local sea life. You can really get a good feel for what lies beneath. A huge tank with sharks & rays to a clown fish display.
Same Aquarium, Different City. Very nice aquarium but similar to other ones I've been to in Europe. Pleasant experience and loved the penguins (!!) but not an absolute necessity while in Cape Town

My son loved it ..... I on the other hand found it limited, you seem to be in and out so quickly I was disappointed, I really expected more from the bigger tanks. It wouldn't be my first stop thats for sure. Merely somehting to do with the kids.
great aquarium. For North Americans, it is interesting to see the local aquatic life here. This is one of the top aquariums I have seen. Restaurant is good, but ordering food can be confusing.
Under the sea!:). One of the best aquariums...see from both oceans sea life ...from penguins to sharks ....jelly fish to mermaids purse :) wonderful experience !:)
Fantastic aquarium!. Excellent and interesting aquarium! Quite small, but very well maintained and interesting. Plenty to do for children as well as others. Very knowledgeable and dedicated staff.

Amazing. A must do as just amazing!
Just to sit there and watch all the fish in the sea! Fantastic!
Great to take the kids as well but adults will timeout when visiting the Aquarium.

Amazing. A must do as just amazing!
Just to sit there and watch all the fish in the sea! Fantastic!
Great to take the kids as well but adults will timeout when visiting the Aquarium.

Beautiful, but expected more!. The aquarium is very nice, but before we knew it we saw the exit. I was hoping for some animal encounters (touching) but this was not the case. I think this is a great activity when you have kids!

Expensive...!. It is a great trip to go and see the Two Oceans Aquarium, but when it comes to buying anything, it is very expensive. Even the tickets to get inside were very pricey. Other than the price, we enjoyed the trip to the aquarium.

Great Experience. Do not miss the Two Oceans Aquarium on your visit to Cape Town. You will be able to observe sea life from the Atlantic and Indian Oceans. One of the best aquariums you will ever visit and admission was reasonably priced.

Baeutiful and Informative. Great family fun with a wide variety of tanks with a diverse range of fish, crustaceans, amphibians etc. Both Oceans are well represented and each tank has detailed information on the various fish within.

Great for African fish culture. They do a neat job with their displays. I don't have kids, but it could be great for kids, families. Really interesting to see what they have in Africa ( so different from what we have in the USA) in terms of sealife. Cute to see penguin feelings
Very interesting. Very interesting place, very beautiful. Try to go there at feeding times...............................

The best Aquarium ever!. Have been going here for five years now and we are members. It provides so much for the younger child including a puppet show and arts and crafts section. Well laid out and detailed information is provided. The cafe is good for kids also.

Great for a rainy day in Cape Town. This aquarium is great fun and it is laid out so that if you follow the path you won't miss anything. The predator tank and kelp forest are mesmerizing! If you want to see the sharks being fed, make sure you check what time you need to be there.There are also special events, details on their website. There is a cafeteria, but it looked rather basic and did not strike me as worth a visit as there are much nicer looking eating places nearby at the Waterfront.

Ok for a city Aqaurium. Having been to a lot of aquariums in different parts of the world, this was ok. Nothing really outstanding. The displays were good and there was a great variety of sea life. But nothing compared to Ushaka Marine world in Durban. This is a small aquarium. its ok to keep the little ones occupied for a little while.

Not just for kids. A rainy day meant a change in plans, so we opted for the aquarium. Lots of mums n strollers, but there is something for everyone. The variety of thriving sea life in big, easy to see display areas was a pleasant surprise. The tank of Nemos was hilarious. Giant Spider Crabs, lots of Jellies, huge moray eel, abundant corals and sharks were a hit with our teens. Educational too. This is a good option if you need a filler for a couple of hours.

Great presentation; fun learning experience for whole family. Liked: Large variety of fish and sea life; interactive demonstrations; 'Finding Nemo' photo opportunity for youngsters.
Disliked: NIL

fun fun. Good fun. Maybe a bit similar to all other aquariums I've visited but what do you expect! There were penguins as well so that was a bonus :) Spent the majority of the time in the penguin enclosure. There are a few interactive bits and bobs all the way around so great for the kids.

A fun day out for young and old. My husband and I spent a Saturday morning at the Two Oceans Aquarium and it was really great! From beginning to end we were entertained and educated. The displays are masterfully put together and some are truly astonishing ... those huge crabs ...The only thing that was a bit annoying was all the push prams. Of course it's to be expected that a place like this will be FULL of little children (be warned, if this is a problem for you!), but the prams take up a lot of space and sometimes you've got to squeeze through to a display area. Nothing aggressive though. Just a bit cramped, but again, to be expected on a Saturday morning. If you've got little children, this is THE place to take them. Many of the displays are geared toward children - they've even got a play/craft area and a puppet show, which was very cute. All in all, a fabulous, fascinating, entertaining morning - we got AMAZING photos here.

Nothing fishy about this place. Although the aquarium looks quite small from the outside, they do have lots of things to see and do inside. The "predator" tank is especially mesmerizing. You'll find that you can sit and watch the fish, sharks, rays and turtle swimming past for a long time before getting bored.Check out the frogs, the penguins and several other informative and well-organized display areas, too.There's something here for the children in us all - Enjoy it.Plus, as it is situated in the waterfront area, there are also plenty of places nearby to eat, shop or generally browse away your time.

A choice for rainy days. It's an okay tour to do, but Cape Town offers so many beautiful natural scenaries, that I would only chose to go to the aquarium if it were rainning or with kids. The place is packed with kids, they seemed to enjoy it a lot. The place is nice, clean, entertaining and a good value.
An Educational Treasure. A wonderful facility especially for children. The play centre is great and the educational opportunities are wonderful.
Nemo as a Sushi. Not that big as Dubai's but very nice.The only know aquarium to have hundreds of clown fishes in the same tank : a big sushi orange plate and alive!Very nice40 minutes visite
Superb Aquarium!. We went to the Aquarium on our 1st day in Cape TOwn and were well impressed. Loads of different fish and animals to see and were well presented. Best aquarium we have ever visited!
Riveting. The best aquarium I have been to. This is a trip to another world, which is so very beautiful, an extra ordinary range of species, very educational at the same time. Wonderful outing.
Interesting. Well even though we were 2 adults, we had a great time here and its open and spacious....saw beautiful creatures and so glad we made the time to visit.

Very informative. Great place to spend a wet afternoon. Loved that the displays related to local S African marine life. Enjoyed the penguin and preditor feeding sessions. Penguin enclosure is fragrant but worth sticking it out as you get used to it and it is worth it to get a good look at the penguins and learn about them

World class aquarium.. An absolute must do if you are in Cape Town. We had not visited the aquarium for about 15 years and my son was keen to go back as he had good memories of going there with his grandpa. We spent a morning there in absolute delight. The spooky Giant Crabs and the secretive seahorses were interesting. We watched the penguins being fed and sat in absolute wonder watching a massive turtle cruising the Kelp forest. The photogenic Ray's made us laugh and we peered through a microscope at anemones and more. Try and avoid going at the same time as the school tours, but other than that it's just all good!
Worth a visit, but expensive. We enjoyed our walk around but aside from the spectacular kelp garden we didn't think there was anything to set this apart from other aquariums we've visited.
Nicely done!. Great place and right on the waterfront. My favorite was the sign when you entered that said that fishing was forbidden!

Awesome and informative. I had 2 hours to spare so decided to have a look. Well value for money the staff are outstanding and very knowledgeable. It was an absolutely relaxing 2 hours. Any one visiting Cape Town must put this on there list of "Too Do's" It is extremely user friendly in every sense of the word.

Fun for all ages. Incredible aquarium with so much to offer. Large tanks and huge variety of creatures. Lots of space so even when it is busy it does not feel crowded. Touch pools for the kids to explore with their hands. Downstairs is a small play area for children with a craft area and a small snack bar. Well worth a visit! Don't bother eating at the cafe though - slow service and poor food, just walk over to V & A waterfront for lunch instead!
Excellent, accessible. Very fine display areas, well lit, with good signage. Several "live" features including a large shark tank. Knowledgeable attendants. Full of interest and good value for money.

Very good aquarium; worth the visit. The displays and animals in this aquarium were very interesting. The clownfish tank where they all swim right at the bottom of the viewing portal is very cool. The big tanks are nice with many sharks, rays, and one turtle. Try to see the shark feeding; educational and entertaining. You can actually scuba dive into the shark display tank (if you so desire). The layout is a little difficult to find all the different displays, but get a map and follow the big ramp toward the 'frog' display and it opens up into the other areas. PS: when in Cape Town; watch our for pick pockets.
Good aquarium overall. Not bad at all although we saw better aquariums. Nice place to spend 1-2 hours. Convenient access from V&A waterfront.

The Other World!. When I close my eyes, I can still see peaceful, wavy kelp moving gently and hundreds of amazing fish swimming between those huge, few-meters long "branches". Incredible, magical, moving underwater world, definitely and strongly not to be missed on your trip to Cape Town. When going solo, it can be a perfect place for quiet meditation of nature's beauty and of power of life. When going with family or friends, a fantastic and attractive (plus highly educational for kids) Sunday outing. My definite and big YES!
disappointing. we have been to ALOT of aquariums and this one is not on our list to return. it is small and crowded and gloomy. i felt sorry for the inhabitants especially the penquins
Worth a visit. Visited on a very wet day else may not have gone. That said a very enjoyable visit that would suit all ages. Nicely laid out and good value.

good, esp for kids. my sister insisted on going here (worth pointing out she's 22 year old), I was hesitant but it was a nice aquarium. a good alternative if it is raining out (which it did a lot of). an excellent place to take kids.

Really representing two Oceans. As I am a SCUBA diver I am normally very critical about visiting aquariums, however, we have visited this amazing aquarium on a number of occasions and every time I am stunned but the diversity that this particular aquarium contains.The warm Indian ocean is represented by the colorful reef fish and the cold Atlantic by the kelp forests. Very well done, I spent some underwater time in the real kelp forests off the Cape coast and this is a true reflection of what one will see.Another amazing part is the predator and penguin sections - not to be missed.While everybody is shopping at the W&A Waterfront shops, spare some time for a visit to this amazing Aquarium

Must visit for the family. This is one of the better aquariums I have visited, well located and incredibly well staffed. There is more than enough to keep the kids entertained for hours on end, well recommended.
A must do for kids. Even my teenaged boys loved it. They took about an hour to see the whole aquarium. It has besides so many varieties, sea horses and some kinds of sharks!!

Exotic marine life I had never seen before!. The aquarium, conveniently located at the V&A Waterfront was recommended by my cousin. She was right! It was worth the visit. It may not be the largest in the world, but the variety of exotic marine life surprised me. I have been an avid scuba diver and snorkeler, having dived many times in the Caribbean and the French Polynesia so I thought I had seen almost all. Wrong! In my opinion, they have succeeded in presenting some of the most representative of marine life from the two oceans that bathe South Africa: the Atlantic & the Indian oceans. The huge circular tank in the center of the Aquarium is full of large white sharks, rays,big yellow fin tuna and some othernlarge fish.Kids and adults that we saw that day where having fun! They have a kids interactive zone that reminded me of the Monterey Bay Sea Aquarium in California. Also an African Penguin habitat that is great for the kids, especially those not too familiar with them. Some of the other areas didn't impress me much.The visit will only take a couple of hours. Don't miss it!

Well worth a stop.. Great place to spend a few hours. Wide selection of marine life from around the globe. Amazing Predator Tank and Kelp Forrest Tank. Animals seem to be well fed and looked after. Highly recommended on a rainy Cape Town Day. If you plan visiting more than twice, a annual pass will make it worth your money.

Eating Sea food on top of the Sea. a wide selectionof sea food. They ust need a warning to indicate which foods are endangred species. The staf are marvellous and the walking distanecthe the waterfront shores makes it a very conveniene location after a days trip. Security is always present.

Solemates Member. I have bought an annual pass to the Aquarium and have been there 5 times this year. I can spend hours watching the different types of species available. They could use more attractions or shows wih the animals as they aqaurium has been the same for as long as I can remember with my first visit in 2008.

A good couple hours' diversion. Two Oceans Aquarium has a variety of different and fascinating species, in clean conditions and appear to be well-looked after. The information on the animals is clearly posted and you can easily spend 2 or 2 and a half hours in this aquarium admiring the sea life. The large central tank with sharks, tuna and a sea turtle is mesmerizing and can be viewed from all sides. Afterward, you can go shopping nearby - plenty of options from the nearby mall to a large crafts center next door.
Fascinating. Fascinating and educationally sight. Well worth a visit particularly when it is raining outside. The cafe also serves excellent coffee

Wonderful outing for kids and adults alike. So much to see and do, this is a great outing for a rainy day. A lovely kids area with puppet shows, and enough interesting things to see and learn about for adults. Very clean and well organised. Highly recommended.

Great little aquarium. A great aquarium well worth seeing. It's relatively cheap to see the fish here and you get a good few hours there. We went first thing on a Monday and there were lots of kids from a local school but other than that can imagine its normally quite quiet at that time. The exhibits aren't massive in the first section but give you some good looks at different fish. Nice penguin exhibits too
Hour Detour. The Two Oceans is a great way to spend 1 to 2 hours in Cape Town. The aquarium is well stocked and is situated just next to the V&A Waterfront. Definitely great for the whole family
Best Aquarium I have been to. This was incredible with so many displays of amazing fish. staff on hand to educate and tell you about the fish and right next to the citysightseeing bus terminus

Best attraction in V and A waterfront. This place was a real surprise!! The sharks and Jelly fishes are the best! The kids who came along just loved this place! There is so much to learn from this sea creatures!Loved the Penguins! They are so much fun to watch!!Must visit at V and A!
Not bad, but have been to better.. Worth a visit if wou want to kill an hour or so, but was no diferent to any other aquarium that can be found in most cities.

Wonderful. What a place to go. The amount of time spent can never be enough to see and really enjoy all the fish and shows available. Also the wonderful puppet show and the penguin shows for the children. Great value for money but plan it for the whole day. Restaurants are also on offer as well as curios shops.
Well designed - cool experience.. Very nice design and layout. Makes for some really gorgeous pics. Beware of the cute penguins... that bite :-)
A must see for children. I took my grandchildren aged 7 and 4 there last year. They were fascinated by all the various tanks - 'nemo' was a favourite but I think, the sharks really impressed them.

Very nice aquarium. The title says it all :-)The 2 Oceans aquarium is a great place for families on rainy days, but I - on a sunny day, travelling alone - also enjoyed it a lot. The atmosphere is very nice, and some of the displays are really cool. I really enjoyed the big free standing tank just when you enter the aquarium, the jelly fish tanks with the cool lights, the clown fish tank where kids can "go into the middle of it", the penguins etc. etc.

Well laid out. This was a nice aquarium however nothing really outstanding from other aquariums I have visited. It did however, have African penguins on display with regular feeding times and also a touch and learn centre for the children. The displays were informative and well signed guiding you which way to go. There was a good variety of marine life on show and worth a visit if you have never been to an acquarium.

By far the bestestest. This is hands down the best aqua exhibition in the world, and we've seen some pretty awesome places, both in the US and the Middle East. You get lost here, and we spent three hours that went by so quickly we wanted to do it again. Much better than the time we wasted at Robben Island (we won't even write a review for that!).

Family must. Kids will love it. It will easily fill a whole morning for the whole family. It's always great for kids to gain conscience of what cares with must have with the planet. Loving animals always changes a child's perspective. Beautiful item for your itinerary.

for adults and kids. this is well worth a trip to. my wife and i went there while on honeymoon. it was great. it was only €8 each approx. it is very interesting inside and lots of marine life to see. very enjoyable

Just the right size for 2 hours trip. It is small but very rich! great way to learn about the differences between the two oceans and be aware of the great amount of life they hold together.Kids really enjoy the area and the feeding times must be attend!
Excellent Aquarium.. one of the best Aquariums in the world! Definitely worth a visit on a rainy day or any other day! Nice to take kids along. Well laid out, and a huge variety of fish.

Ichthyology experience for children and families. Up there with the best Aquariums in the world. A huge display of fish and things aquatic. Wonderful experience for children in the wet zone where they can be part of the sea

Keeps all ages wanting more!. As a family we never get bored of visiting the Aquarium, with the restuarant now on site, you can see everything and then finish afternoon off with a relaxing lunch. Puts a smile on our dials everytime :)
Great place. It may bot be as spectacular as uShaka, but the displays are informative and beautiful. Monday mornings are quiet and give you plenty space to walk around. Worth the visit!

Great way to spend a relaxing couple of hours. Having been to a few Aquariums I was not to keen to visit this one, however I am glad I did. It is a really good size, not too big for you to get to the stage of 'oh, there is another fish tank' and not too small to make you think you are not getting your moneys worth.The tanks are lovely and clean and their inhabitants wonderful. Try to time your visit for feeding times. We were lucky enough to see eels, penguins and the turtle & rays being fed in the predator tank. Great for kids, educational and fun.

Great way to kill a few hours and learn a little!. Me and my Girlfriend dropped into the very well located Two Oceans Aquarium before our Red Bus Tour of the city. It's reasonably priced and you can learn alot. Would be a very good place for kids. Somehow we managed to miss the turtles but everything else was well planned out.

Very visitor friendly. The aquarium at Cape Town may not be so fantastic as others in South Africa, such as Durban which boasts dolphin shows etc, but it is beautiful all the same. The displays are very well presented with ample information for those that want to read every tank. Hands on displays and penguin feeding time made it all the more interesting. Don't miss your photo opportunity inside the Nemo tank...that goes for kids of all sizes. Also look out for the main tank feeding drop which is very well explained by the aquarium director.
nice place to spend some time. Lots of children and family. Convenient, as V&A Waterfront is full of shops. The penguins there are cute. Suitable for children as there is a corner for them.

Really enjoyable and interesting. We spent a couple of hours here and both adults and kids enjoyed it. Lots of different bits to it and, this being Africa, things are BIG! We had our PADI cards in case the opportunity to dive in the shark enclosure came up but it didn't work time wise.

Always on our list when in CT. We just love going to 2 Oceans - also get amazing pictures (one where our son is right amongst the fish, thanks to a large space made available in the tank. Kids definitely love this and for adults it is a great way to de-stress - just watching fish.

One of the best on the planet!. Not only is Two Oceans one of the best designed aquariums on the planet - it is hugely conservation orientated. The I & J Predator tank is just spell-binding, I could seriously sit and watch that exhibit all day, and the kelp exhibit just behind. Great staff and nice outreach. Highly recommend!

Excellent. This aquarium is a must-see for everyone, but if you have kids, do not miss it. This is a great place for kids to wander and see the creatures-from-the-deep. The exhibits are excellent, and the quantity of sea life on display is impressive.

Great family outing!. This took me by surprise as I didn't expect to be so thrilled by an aquarium. I mean I love fish and all but how truly amazing could it really be, especially being 30 years old with no kids with me to enjoy it. And yet it amazed me completely!!! I went there with my best friend and we had fun, took loads if pics and found it so interesting! Great display, hugely entertaining and great souvenir shop. We easily spent a good two hours in there! We had fun like little kids!

Smaller than I expected, but still nice.. I made a last minute decision to still visit even though i only had an hour until closing, and so was surprised when i had zipped through through all the main areas with time to spare. I expected the place to be bigger, but still was not disappointed, and was able to back-track through the aquarium again to spend more time at the exhibits i enjoyed. I was particularly impressed with the predator exhibit, as well as the penguin floor, since there's no glass between you and the penguins. Some benefits of being at the aquarium so late was that I almost had the place to myself, which was great for taking photos.If you have kids, definitely allot more time here, but if you're alone, i'd say a minimum of 1.5 hrs would be sufficient.

Great for kids and tourists to Cape Town. The Cape Town Aquarium is great for families with children - the displays are well done with plenty of educational information.The restaurant has lovely views over the V&A Waterfront - great for a tasty snack or drink whilst relaxing either before or after visiting the aquarium.Aquariums vary in size thoughout the world and we have found that it's is the quality of the various displays and the number of different species displayed that grab a visitors' interest.Our 1 yr old grand-son absolutely loves the "Wave Pool" and is mesmorized by all the colourful smaller species.If you love the oceans around the world, this becomes a must see for those visiting Cape Town and a wonderful outing for parents,grandparents and children.For the brave - try a dive in the Shark Tank!

Great for a family. We took 2 adults and 2 kids (11 years and 8 years old) to visit. We've been to a lot of aquariums and this rates as one of the largest and best. We particularly liked the friendly staff doing the talks.

Have a fun-filled and educational day.. I LOVE the aquarium. I'm an aupair for 3 girls of different ages and they are always wanting to go there again and again. I have also participated in a sleepover there with a school, and it was amazing. Great activities throughout the day and extremely informative. This is the 1st place I go to during the school holidays.
excellent food. The Food is out of the world. Limited menu but ever dish is delicious. we were 5 and ate here thrice. A must visit for all travelers.

Two Oceans Aquarium Visit. This aquarium is in a good location and visible from the street. This place is neat with a nice breeze of air. As a Durbanite and knowing uShaka marine world I thought this would be far bigger that uShaka Marine World but I was dissappointed when I reached the end while still amazed by it's exhilerating fish tanks and views.I liked taking pictures as if I was inside the fish tank. I also enjoyes watching small penguins swimming in a stream, wow that was wonderfull.Although this attraction is good but I still prefer Durban's uShaka Marine with it's spectacular views.

Two Oceans Aquarium. Fabulous Aquarium and ideal for visitors of all ages. There were lots of interesting sections to this aquarium and great opportunities for photographs with various dressed up characters and tanks that you could climb under and get in the middle of! As a penguin fan, I loved their range of penguin exhibits that allowed you to get up close (almost touching) them! There is an opportunity to have a penguin encounter for 350 rand but unfortunately this was not available on the day I visited (Mondays). Otherwise, just book the day before.If you love underwater exploration then this is an absolute must!

very enjoyable place. The aquarium was just perfect for the rainy day i had in Cape Town ... I spend a couple of hours admiring the beauty of the many species they have in it! The place is very clean and it wasnt crowded at all (I visited it in low season I presume it is a little bit small for the high season) ... I really enjoyed the penguin show, when you are walking all the way with them! Nice stop to avoid the rain! entrance fee for adults is around R$100

Enjoyable. Smaller than ushaka aquarium, but realize that the exhibits are species from local waters so you won't see the same type of fish. Penguins were great. We stayed for the reptile show which was fun. Brace yourself for hoards of misbehaving children.
fish and stuff. good for a look around, its pretty cheap and if you do the hop on hop off bus you get a bit of a discount.

Nice Aquarium. Well maintained aquarium with good displays. Enjoyed the large shark tank. Good value for admission. Cue seemed to get longer later in the day. We had no wait in the morning. Might have been more impressed if I had not already seen several aquariums near home.

Great for kids!. I have been tnhere a few times and always enjoy it but it is def a great place for childern mainly to learn and to observe! it is also very well kept and entertaining! i always enjoy it and it is worth going if you have time! a must see if you have children; they will love it!

A fishy treat. The Aquarium is a brilliant experience. Educational, interactive, highly entertaining. There is everything from Clown fish to hammerhead sharks on offer here, with penguins and an array of colorful birds here too!
You can get up close to huge spider crabs, deadly box jellyfish and much more.

World class Aquarium at V&A Waterfront - diving with sharks no cage!!. Two Oceans Aquarium offers diving with sharks and you may even complete your Open Water diving course here (PADI). They also offer Discover Scuba for beginners. Check out www.aquarium.co.za for more details. Really worth while!!!

Great way to spend a rainy day!. When it's nice out, you'll most likely want to be outside enjoying the beautiful day but when you want to escape ugly weather, duck inside here for a few hours to see penguins, sharks, turtles, rays and lots fish and other creatures!

Great aquarium. This is a world class aquarium which has both native and non-native specimen on show. There is a sea lion display where they show off to visitors both above and below the water with their acrobatics. I've been there about 6 times now and I could go again and again. Makes me feel like a kid again!

Awesome time. All other reviews will tell you how great this place is. I totally agree with them.
Remember to take your picture in the booth with the nemo fish. Classic shot.
Great Attraction. Well worth a visit I had my nephews with me and there plenty to see and do. Would recommend it for anyone.

Although very educational- not appropriate for the species!. The nemo attraction with many "Nemos" in the beginning might be very catchy, but it is not how those fish usually live. The need anemones to hide and thus I think that they cannot be exceptionally happy. Also in many cases the fish tanks seem far too small for the animals. The visitors give a crap about the signs to not touch the rays. Yet, I really liked the information about preservation and also what fish we " can or should eat". Setting sharks free again is a nice gesture and I think other aquaria should consider this. I also found it morbid that ocean basket is sponsor of one of the fish tanks.

Just the right size. Spent a nice couple of hours really taking our time. Great that only focuses on sea life of the Western Cape so just the right size for a morning visit especially as it was raining. You can dive in one of the aquariums and the sharks are amazing.
Cape town Aquarium. Never seen anything like it, really interesting and fun! Great to do with friends and pretty cheap...

Great city aquarium. Worth a visit. Our boys aged 13 and 9 spent a happy 2 hours wandering, reading and touching.
As with all things in Cape Town the staff are so friendly
Having done many city aquariums over the years and this one ranks highly.
Also would be great for younger children as very interactive

Just OK. . Maybe I've been to one Aquarium too many, but nothing about this one struck us as anything special. The place is well maintained and very friendly - and the eel tank quite interesting - but that was all, really. With all the other amazing things Cape Town has to offer, I would skip this one.
Look down a shark's throat. Take yer time in the cool and enjoy the bot where you can see the huge sharks swiming all around you. Great cool spot for kids fed up with shops at V and A

must visit. if you're in Capetown, you have to visit the Two Ocean Aquarium in V&A.
great access, beautiful aquatic life with lots of options to view them, one included even diving with a rugged teeth shark (been there, done that !)
awesome shark aquarium.
worth every minute!

For rainy days. The Two Oceans Aquarium is fine. Not something to rave about but is worth a visit on a rainy day if you are at The V & A Waterfront. Adults cost R118 (£8.50) while 14 to 17 year olds cost R92 (£6.60) and 13 to 4 year olds cost R58 (£4.15). The queue moves fairly quickly.

Love it!. I love visiting this aquarium every time we come to Cape Town. This year my 14 month old loved it too. It was about the right size and kept her attention all the way around! She even enjoyed the touch pools.
The cafe was also great and had plenty if high chairs.
Can't wait to go bavk

A good rainy day activity. It's always fun to visit an aquarium and this was one was also worth the visit. It is not as grand and impressive as others I have seen ex: Monterey California. But reasonably priced and worth a visit, especially on a rainy day.
fun place. my kids like to go here and see the different sea aminals.. very informative educational tour is being run for schools. my kids can wander around for hours
One of the Best. Great family fun! The Aquarium is beautiful, clean, organized, and has a great atmosphere for kids and adults alike. If you love nature, this is a must in Cape Town!

World class. So much fish to see wow it's as good as Atlanta - lovely shop, friendly staff and great experience. The price oyu pay is worth it. There are rooms for kids and exciting sharks and other species to see

World class brilliant experience. Second time we have gone and brilliant every time. Son loves every second of it and it is clean, well run and all the animals to my untrained eye look very healthy. Lovely puppet shows, interactive exhibits, friendly staff and volunteers. What more can I say, we will be back again and again.
What a joy. What a joy this was - the children loved it, and all the staff were knowledgeable and friendly, and the exhibits great. Highly recommended.

Perfect for a rainy day or to escape the sun. Amazing exhibits of a variety of fish, sharks, penguins & more that are superbly displayed. We particularly liked the rock hoper penguins as you could see them both on land and underwater.It's worth looking up the feeding times of some of the animals in advance as this adds even more to your visit. Also outside the cafe area is a platform for seals to use instead of the jetties, good to take a few pics!

Beautiful Aquarium Exciting for kids. I took my son and brother to the aquarium during the holidays. They absolutely loved it. Well kept, friendly helpful staff. Lots of sea life to see. Conveniently play area with scheduled puppet shows for the littles, which my 3 year old son enjoyed. Free for kids under 4

Impressive array of fish and other interests. Close up to the enormous Ragged Teeth Sharks was an experience to remember, with the underwater "tunnel" providing the most memorable moments of the visit. At first thought that it would just be a quick visit, but soon they were calling closing time, and we had spent three hours wandering around the various tanks. Unusual item was the lady using a microscope to show us the miniature water world which you would otherwise never appreciate.
Family outing. My hubby and I took our 4 & 7 yr old kids there and what a lovely time we had. The kids obviously wants to go there every weekend, as my daughter said, "it's not far mommy"
Great Sharks. All ages will enjoy this experience. about 2 hours or more to observe the most amazing different fish etc.Even penguins!!

A Great Day to Spend a Rainy Day in Cape Town. The aquarium is spectacular! The variety of animals is incredible. It is really well laid out and you learn a lot from the little blurbs at each exhibit. The penguins were really entertaining!

Shark Feeding and Penguin Feeding - Dont miss !. I made it a point to visit the Aquarium on a Sunday and timed it to see both the attractions - 2.30 pm for the Penguin Feeding ; and 3.00 pm for the Shark Feeding as part of the Predators Feeding. These two only will make it a memorable experience even though you have lots more to feast on - Nemo, lobsters, jelly fish, turtles, cray fish, octopus, etc.

Year passes available for locals. Worth checking out times when they feed the sharks/penguins as would be worth seeing, but then probably busier than other times - interesting facts on what fish you should aim to eat and what you shouldn't (if your concerned to the effect of certain types of fishing etc).
Tastefully done. Great way to spend a rainy morning / afternoon. Quality exhibits for children and adults alike with interactive areas hosted by experts.

Two Oceans Aquarium. Just alongside the famous Waterfront shopping center in Cape Town lies a this wonderful aquarium. Finish your shopping and take a walk through the craft market and you'll end up at the entrance of the Aquarium. Fun and educational for the whole family. Kids will love this place.You will need about 2 hours to fully complete this visit but can be done much quicker. Worth a visit. Be sure to check the website for feeding times of the different creatures.

Nice day with a child. We spent an afternoon here while visiting Cape Town. It is easy to get to in the V&A Waterfront area. It is on par with many med to large city aquariums in what they have on display. They do have many interactive exhibits/talks which is very nice. All the personnel were very well informed and obliging to answer many questions in a friendly and unhurried way. We strolled around for a few hours looking at all the tanks and just happened to stumble upon the ramp up to the PENGUINS! They were awesome, but the signage should be better. Wonder if the people who thought this was small and not so great got up there. We spent a long time looking, then broke away for a lunch in their restaurant. The food was very fresh, a lot of variety for a place like this. Unexpected and great. My daughter and I sat on the outdoor patio at the waterside enjoying our great meal,then re-entered (you get a hand stamp for the whole day) and looked again at our favorites as well as getting to see a couple of their feeding times. All in all a very nice place to be able to spend an afternoon.

A great escape!. We went to Two Oceans on a rainy day, spent 4 hours, one hour spent scuba diving in the predator tank. It was such a fantastic experience start to finish. The tanks and variety of animals are numerous! Jaw dropping creatures around every corner. If you love animals and aquatic life it's a must! The staff are all very friendly, and prices are very reasonable.

Not as exciting. My family loves aquarium and sea creatures. It's quite not what I was expecting. The place is small. And there wasn't too much action. It's ok if you want to see something and maybe go on the waterfront. But that's about it. With all the great reviews I thought it would be better. But the price to get in is inexpensive.

Nice aquarium, a bit small by modern standards. Spent a pleasant 2 hours there recently, it was quite nice, especially the large tank w sharks and the penguins. Not too much else to recommend it, sorry!

Very well laid out, very child-friendly.. The whole aquarium is laid out in a spacious and interesting way. For us the very large central tank was amazing - one forgets how large so many fish could be if only left to grow! We loved the penguins. Go!
Pleasantly surprised. This visit was well worth the money. At first I thought it expensive, but once I saw what they offered I think it is money well spent. What a wonderful experience.

A pretty common aquarium. The main highlights are the Penguins, Nemos and the giant Turtle n Sharks. Rest you will mostly find in most of similar sized aquariums. Ones in Singapore are much better from an experience point of view

Best chance to see big sharks in a tank!. If you like the ocean and all the amazing and weird animals of it, that's your place! Great for kids, but also for adults, I just loved that! They have such an awesome collection of penguins, nemos, jelly fishes and etc. Sharks are the best... they are giant, and you can see them swimming really really close! Take your ticket right now! :)

A haven for my niece. I spent my first real 'aunt-niece-date' here with Skyla and we loved it. So much for her to see, touch and listen to. I thoroughly enjoyed the conveniences they have: accessible toilets, plenty beverage and snack options, lots of light, change of scenery, exciting exhibitions and well timed schedules. Loved it.

A must see in Cape Town.... It was the start of my son in-laws bachelors party! He loves to dive so we kidnapped him first thing in the morning to go scuba diving in the preditor tank, he was made to hold up a poster underwater saying HELP getting married! It was a great experience enjoyed by the divers and the groomsmen.

Terrific Aquarium. We exited the Red Tour Bus and had a few daylight hours to spare so we went to the aquarium. It was a great experience and would recommend a visit. The displays were terrific and we especially enjoyed the large tanks. There is one huge tank with sharks and large fish that is viewable from amphitheater seating with soothing music playing. My husband and I probably spent 30 minutes relaxing and enjoying the peacefulness. Definately a good value.

Small. If you have reach the waterfront early, and its hot in the afternoon, you can step into the aquarium to catch a glimpse of some exotic fish. The feeding of the shark takes place on Sunday at 3pm and other fish during the week at 3pm. If you are spending approximately R100 to see fish, might as well be there during the feeding time!
Stay there and go ahead. Up to me the nicest in the world. (Sydney is also to compete)Can be upgraded bcs all potential is here...

good way to cool down. if you are feeling very hot walking around cape town especially with a 2 year old, then i would defiantly recommend a visit to the aquarium, it is lovely and air conditioned inside and a nice walk around excites your eyes to some beautiful fish and sea life.

Great Aquarium. Great place to spend an hour when down at the waterfront area. It's just behind the main shopping centre.Interesting collection of species from the Indian and Atlantic Oceans with penguins, sting ray and great white shark being he main attractions.

Two Oceans Aquarium Cape Town - Where's Nemo ?. -A very nice little aquarium, a stop on the Red bus route, and right next to the entrance to the V & A Waterfront complex.-A great attraction for young children, some very nice displays geared for the young at heart, and some interesting displays for unusual fish.-There is a finding Nemo display, containing a HUGE school of Nemo looking fish, that swarm around and around inside the tank...AND...there is a bubble inside the tank, from the bottom, where you can sneak down under the tank, stick your head up inside the tank, and from the outside, it looks like you are swimming with the school of Nemo fish...-There is also an animated puppet display/theatre for children, and an up/close and personal area for kids to touch/feel some sea life.-Understand it is a smaller aquarium, very clean, very friendly personnel, easy to get to, and a very nice little gift shop with ice cream and what they advertise as Gelato....trust me...we have been to Gelato heaven in Italy....and this ain't no Gelato...but...it was cold...and it tasted OK...so yes, I will quit whining now...you remember what our cousin in Da UP says...."just put your big boy underwear on, and deal with it"....-We give it a two Yooper thumbs up, it has more fish than the Ford river when it slows down to a trickle at the end of summer, so really..?..How bad could it be..?? Just do it..it is a nice break in your tourist day...-Mahalo

Excellent day out when the weather is poor. If you travel to Cape Town on holiday and have poor weather, children and the thought of being stuck in a small hotel room makes you want to whimper then head down to the Cape Town Waterfront and visit the Two Oceans Aquarium. The aquarium has both cold and warm water ocean tanks which are fascinating as all other aquariums I have visited only had warm water tropical tanks. There is also a penguin area which the children enjoyed thoroughly.

So good, we visited twice!. I was really keen to visit the aquarium because they are generally quite rubbish in the UK!
I had heard about the huge exhibits and particularly liked the kelp forest exhibit. It's mesmerising!
Lots of interactive exhibits and I love the way they presented smaller exhibits like the jelly fish and clown fish. So beautiful!

A great for kids and adults alike, and shark diving. Arranged to go shark diving here at the aquarium, unfortunately I lost the courage and didn't go through with it. It's aquarium is fascinating with plenty to see and a huge fish tank with all fish species in. It's this tank that you get the chance to dive with sharks. Enquire and perhaps you will have more courage than we did !
Two Oceans. Fantastic acquarium giving a view of sea life from both Oceans. Fun and well laid out, the kids will love it. A real must if you are caught on a rainy day!

Love the aquarium!. I have been going to this aquarium for years and they have yet to disappoint me! Feeding time is the best time to go although the seating area gets full very quickly, so you've got to get there early to get a good seat.My son loves it and he is 6 years old. They have the touchy-feely pool that you can actually touch and feel small critters. This is educational but also so much fun as the attendant gives the kids more details on what they are actually feeling.
Not worth the time or money. This is probably the worst aquarium in all of South Africa. Not worth the time or the insane entrance fee they charge!
Aquarium visit. This was an amazing experience.... so much to see.... definitely worth the visit! There are lots of interactive activities and photo possibilities.
Very nice aquarium. Is one of the best Aquarium I have ever seen. You can see when the guardians are feeding sharks and pinguings. Nice sourrinding.
Nice visit. Very nice aquarium and a must if you are travelling with kids. Well organised and a fun place. Interesting show with the penguins.

Sharks and turtles. For children it was a very educational. We had visited the Atlanta Aquarium which is the largest in the world so this was a little small in comparison. We did see the sharks, sting ray and turtles fed which was very interesting.
World Class. I love visiting the Aquarium. The penguins are amazing as well as all the variety of aquatic life they have.

Aquarium. It is certainly one of the better aquariums – spacious, light and airy with a friendly atmosphere. I have a deep seated love of aquatic life and have visited many Aquariums. The Cape Town Aquarium can compete with the best - the Capetonians can be very proud of their aquarium and the diversity of their sea-life.

NIce trip. My teenaged sons actually enjoyed the visit. It can be a challenge keeping the attention of kids raised on overdoses of video games. But they found the aquarium's offerings to be engaging and informative. Definitely worth a family visit.

Two Oceans Aquarium- very interesting. My Mum, Dad, Carer and I visited the above. It consists of a cafe, disabled toilets, and good wheelchair access. This was particularly important, as my Mum used my wheelchair, and I used my electric scooter, whilst Dad and my carer walked!One floor consists entirely of fish (tropical) in tanks, and I spent a lot of time with my camera, There is also one attraction where you can climb up into the fish tank (and stay dry) so that one's head is in the centre of a fish tank!The staff are very knowledgeable and there is another section where one can use microscopes to look in detail at coral, seaside items, tiny planktons, rocks etc. it was obvious the staff really knew their job, and were perfectly willing to answer all sorts of questions.We then went down a ramp to the bottom, where we saw divers go into the tank to feed the various fish, which included Great Whites, tuna, snook, and various other types of fish. One of the divers told us that they feed certain fish on certain days. The fish didn't seem to bother about humans in the pool- they were more interested in the food!Later on, we went up to the penguin pool to watch the Rockhopper Penguins being fed Raw Fish by a female assistant. There were also some black oystercatchers, who live with the penguins quite happily! It is open every day of the year.Lastly, we went to a large trough where an assistant invited tourists to put their hands in water, and take out samples such as seaweed, coral, barnacles etc. She did this herself, and put items into our hands. She then told us about them, and again it was obvious she knew what she was talking about, and was willing to answer questions.One slight grumble, is that although the shop is well stocked, the prices were a bit on the high side, with 400 ZARs being asked for a book, and 140 ZAR's being asked for a set of postcards!However, we enjoyed the morning, and after we had been round the Aquarium, we had our sandwiches outside in the shade!
was expecting a lot. really was expecting a lot, as every one told us that it is a must place to visit, but honestly it didnt impress me much

My first visit to Cape Town. This place was fantastic. Lots of different specie of fish to look at. And the shark experience is brilliant. The kids will love this place, and its great for adults too. Definitely worth a few hours out of your day.

If you have been to Durban's Ushaka, you will be disappointed. I took some Johannesburg colleagues to the aquarium thinking it would be similar to Durban. My concern was the very tiny containers they kept the fish/Crustacea- and their lack of appearance. To me they seemed neglected. As for the sharks they are much smaller than the ones at Usharka and not as menacing. Everything seemed sponsored- like the I and j shark tank. I really likes the work the the aquarium is doing regarding work with community involvement and upliftment, but I really do not see enough negative to convince kids of the harms of plastic killing dolphins, seals and shark. I liked the touch pool for the kids and the anemones that was well done and a good educational tool. I also liked the tongueless toad and the little frog house and show, doesn't have much to do with the sea. Being western cape we should focus on our galjoen ( stunning display) , seals, and sharks and the difference between Raggies and great whites. I am passionate about the sea and was disappointed. I expected more.

What a great place.. Two Oceans Aquarium can easily fill your day. Children will love it and I was tickled with the idea of having all those little clown fish swimming around my head. There is so much to see and do. Thank you for a great time, I will look forward to returning.

It's not worth the time. There is so much to see in and around cape town. I think it's too bad about the time you stay there to visit the aquarium. The aquarium was a disappointment for us because it's quite small and it's quite expensive (particularly for south african circumstances). The topic of two oceans is quite interesting, but if you go pay attention you don't miss the line between the different animals and oceans.

Best Aquarium Ever!. We've been to so many aquariums - but Two Oceans was by far the best one yet! There were so many animals we've never seen prior to this aquarium! My kids enjoyed it so much! Even the junior scientists teaching my kids about some marine life was awesome!

well laid out. I guess one Aquarium can become pretty much like the others but on a bakingly hot day we were glad to dive for the cover and two pleasant hours spent viewing and learning about sea life.
Well laid out aquarium.. There are a good many fascinating exhibits in the aquarium, all well presented, with plenty of accompanying facts. Children well catered for with interactive exhibits.
Interesting. Not a huge facility but an interesting way to spend a couple of hours. The tanks had some good information on the species in he area.

Very interesting aquarium.. I did find this one of the best aquariums I've been in. I got the impression they do actually care about the inmates.
The tanks seem to be big enough for the inhabitants. All clean and well kept with a lot of good conservation information.

A must for the kids when in Cape Town. The aquarium is one of the biggest in SA, and boasts a massive tank with great white sharks (3), giant manta rays, ragga tooth sharks, turtles and lots of other fish. There is also a large seaweed garden and quite a few 'touch and learn' exhibits for the children. The penguin enclosure is always fun as well, and they always make me laugh. Definitely a must see attraction!

Reasonable attraction. I'm not a grat fan of aquariums as a rule, as I believe that large animals such as Sharks etc should really be in their own environment, however, what is interesting is seeing the different species of jelly fish, anenome and sea horse - okay but not my favourite place.

Lots of fish. the large crabs and fish of all sorts were great. It's a nice aquarium with plenty of fish. Our little girl was disappointed as she thought she would be able to touch the sharks :) maybe in a few years, she will get to do the cage!

Interesting, small, good food. The aquarium was a little smaller than we thought, but still interesting. We spent less time there than we had planned, but it was a good time. One real benefit of the aquarium is the cafe. we had a terrific lunch there, sitting outside and watching the seals. The open sandwiches served on breadboards (not the pre-made take and go) were very fresh and it was nice to see vegetables in a land of meat. The gelato counter was also welcome on a hot day.

Something fishy???. Very good exhibit with great variety of fish and marine life. Cape marine life is well displayed. Penguin area seemed to be a hit with little kids. The touch area was just ok. Predator tank was great. Good way to spend a couple of hours with kids.

Two Oceans Aquarium. It was hectic, lots of children everywhere. Good Penquin exhibition and good interaction with the children through the displays. Gift shop was busy. I asked what percentage of sales goes towards the upkeep of the Aquarium, but no-one could tell me.

Average Aquarium by world stadards. killing time in cape Town and decided to visit the aquarium. somewhat disappointing and below par when compared to others we visited. highlight was the Penguins, otherwise it was pretty ho hum.

so much fun. looking out for special stops in cape town for my guests, i do recommend to see the 2 ocean aquarium on windy days.it is greatly done with a vast number of species - so the number of aquariums, floors, paths and little gorges is high, there is a kids corner, a possibility to sign up to feed the fat sharks (you dive in the big aquarium, yes you are inside!), benches to rest , on the upper floor an area featuring nature with stranded penguins birds, fish, and so on... there is an outside pool for the seals :-) the curio shop is fine but extremely expensive, well the cafe, if you are not too thirsty , choose another spot...

Good attraction. This aquarium is modern and well appointed, with lots of great exhibits, including both the big ticket items like the predator tank, and and the more understated displays of smaller sea creatures. It's not the biggest of aquariums so only an hour or two to go round, and but we'll worth it, and especially if you are already in the V&A area.

Worth a visit. I visited the aquarium with my wife on the 3rd of January this year and we both thoroughly enjoyed our time there.The aquarium itself is decently sized, has basic on site catering/toilet facilities and caters well for both child & disabled visitors.For an extra fee you can arrange to swim with the sharks and take very up close and personal photos, also you can spend time with the hopper penguins and their keeper in a very personal encounter and get to participate in the feeding session.Part of our group did the shark experience and my wife and I did the penguin encounter, both are highly recommended by us!Overall, in terms of value for money you can’t really go wrong with the two oceans aquarium.

Only if you're in the area. Possibly since it features in many top things to do in Cape Town lists, alongside cable car to Table Mountain, Kirstenbosch Gardens and other unique experiences, that I was I found myself disappointed with the aquarium. The kelp forest was fascinating, but otherwise it was quite unremarkable. I found the food market next door much more entertaining. I'd only recommend visiting if you're at the waterfront on a rainy day with little else to do.
nice aquarium. This aquarium isn't huge but it is nicely done. Worth a visit if you are traveling with kids and need a good afternoon activity. Nice for adults too

Give it a Miss. Perhaps because all that we had experienced thus far in Cape Town was simply mind blowing - the Aquarium was really the low light of our trip.
