They had a puppet show trying to educate people on the life of the frog and the need to be mindful of our environment but everyone walked out within 5 minutes. If you can give this a skip - not even the diving with the sharks were interesting

Bit Dissipointing. After all the hype I had heard about the Two Oceans Aquarium I was disappointed with what I got.. It is small and didn't have as many exhibit tanks as I thought it would. The most interesting displays were the penguin enclosures and the Amphibian area. The touch pools looked sad. Honestly I would rather go to Ushaka Aquarium!

Mesmerizing. It is well laid out and the variety of species that you an see is great. Well signposted and the feeding times are well communicated and advertised. Love that you can buy tickets online. Just a great customer experience and a well run operation.

Informative and entertaining. Very nice, good position and informative. Even though it was busy, we never felt crowded. Place are well maintained and from there one can continue to explore the V&A Waterfront. I would advise them to possibly add more seats, it would have been nice to sit and watch the sealife, but seats is only available in some areas.

Rock hopper penguins. I didn't realise how big this aquarium is. It was very informative and well worth the money. What topped the whole experience off was seeing rock hopper penguins for the very first time. I have seen all types of penguins apart from one and I got to see them here. Made me so happy!!!

worthwhile. very good place for children and parents alike to interact and spend quality time here. its Small unlike the big Oceanariums in the East, yet i apprciate the way it was presented. if you have seen may around the world you may skip it unless you are travelling with childre then i suggest dont miss it.

Fantastic. A lovely experience, worth every cent. The lady talking about penguins was very engaging and interesting. The prices at the store were not too bad and so we were able to buy gifts for family as well. The staff were very friendly. Although the toilets were a little dirty

My kids loved it here!. This is a pretty good aquarium and worth about 2 hours of entertainment! There is a decent variety of fish and sea animals in clean surroundings. The shark exhibit is great. There is also an inside kids play area and art/craft area where the kids can make something to take home. We had a snack at the restaurant afterwards which was good also. Overall worthwhile kids activity if you are in Cape Town.

Good for families, right by V&A Waterfront. The aquarium is right by the waterfront, so you can visit both in the same morning or afternoon. It's not huge or fancy, but it is well done and there are plenty of species of fish to see. Super for kids and a low-stress environment for parents. Not expensive (from R40-112 pp) depending on age. Only went once but would go again because it was nice.

Get lost here!. When you travel as much as I do, you get jaded. Here however was the perfect break from the V&A Mall. I can't rate this place highly enough. And all the nice rooms to walk to and fro. I loved the big tank,walking through the whale skeleton and using the magnifying glass to view little creatures of the sea. Well done South Africa. If you have to go the waterfront with your parter but hate shopping, leave her be and walk, no, run over here. You'll love it!

Good for something different. I like that fact that the sea life is represented from both the Indian and Atlantic Oceans. We enjoyed watching the divers dive with the sharks in the shark tanks. I have been several times to the aquarium over the past 8 years and there hasn't been much change. If you are a visitor to CT I highly recommend this place. If you are a local and have been once it is a case of been there, done that!

Under the sea. A great outing for the family. See all the local marine life in well designed viewing areas. Make sure to visit around feeding time to fully enjoy the day. Those feeling brave can dive he shark tank.

Nice And informative, but thought it would be bigger. Nice and child friendly. The staff is very friendly and the can teach a lot of interesting fact and even go out if their way to show you other things. Great staff and nice small children area.

Great for the family. I was on holiday with 2 very young children (3 and 1) but they loved it here. Great selection of marine life on view - some of which is startling to adults, nevermind children. Wholly recommend this venue.
loved the sharks!!. i loved the sharks it was a great experience the nemos the tuna the rays the jelly fish everything! we also got really nice souvenirs

A good way to be more informed, learn and spend a nice time.. I visited the Aquarium over my holidays and found that the experience is good. I was not impressed by it but I did liked it. There are several fish-tanks with all kinds of species from different oceans, the information on each one of them was quite complete and if you read the learning is guaranteed. The aquarium is well set up, the animals look well taking care of and there are staff members around so in the case you need something you can always ask. There are some fish-tanks that are really big, they definitely leave you impressed and the animals are beautiful.For kids this is a very good experience, I was traveling with friends but there were many kids having fun. The aquarium gets some efforts done in the conservation and ecological area which is something that I rarely saw during my time in SA... very good!Not many negative pointers to be honest, maybe they are just missing some seat spots near the 360 fish-tank but honestly there are not many things I can say I din´t like.

one of the three. We have seen many special fish, very surprising. We were there just in time to see the pinguins been fed as well as the big sharks and other big species. The staff was very friendly and gave us a lot of information... We payed 105 rand pp, not so much. There are three aquariums like this in the world of which we already visited two of them : cape Town and Monterey (Caifornia)

Great Fun for kids and adults. It was great fun and an awesome experience. Definitely a must do especially if you have kids. They enjoyed putting their heads in the middle of the tank so that they could get a 360 degree view of one of the tanks.
A lovely place for children. I love taking my grandchildren here - there is always something new for them to see - and the joy on their faces is lovely to see.

Beautiful escape!. Really enjoyed all the species and genuine smart exibit... Was very busy when we went but we got to see it all... helpful staff and acceptable prices for snacks... Do make it a stop on your travel plans!

A interesting place to visit. I visited the aquarium during December after an absence of many years and were pleasantly surprised at the amount of improvements done. This is a very special treat for young and old and a must visit when in Cape Town

Wow. The kids absolutely had a great time here, looking at all the fish on display. It was done so nicely. The premises was very looked after and well managed. You could see time and effort went into everything. Well done for a great place!!!

Feeding frenzy. Two Oceans Aquarium is an amazing place. My boyfriend and I went to the aquarium for our anniversary. I enjoyed watching the divers feeding the sharks and huge turtle. The petting pools are also wonderful for young children. Truly a special place!!!

enjoyable. We spent about 2 fascinating hours here. There were a large variety of interesting exhibits and lots of fun for all. Touching the various kelps, star fish and sea anemones, watching them feeding the huge conga eel, feeding time for the penguins with a very interesting talk and then the huge tank with the sharks and rays. Not just a children's outing. We two pensioners enjoyed it very much
Average but good. Wasn't what I quite expected. There wasn't that many shark tanks etc - not like Ushaka Marine World, but still good nonetheless.

Nice place for kids. The aquarium is well maintained and is not so big. There are two big tanks, one for kelp forests and another with big predators. There are smaller tanks with reef fish as well. It is worth a visit.
Fun. My son loved this place. So many different things to see and also enjoyed the little interactive parts

Have you seen Aquariuns before? If yes, no need to go.... Have you seen Aquariuns before? If yes, no need to go... Comparing to others I have see, this one one is medium-rare. If you are with small children, go.

A good morning out.... We have annual cards for the Aquarium and it is a great morning out. The displays are interesting and there are a couple of interactive things for the kids to do. Love the restaurant with a nice play area which is supervised and the puppet shows are also great. I think for older kids it might be a bit boring. Also, I think they should update their displays a bit more and add different interesting things to make return trips more interesting. Overall it's a great morning out, but I think in some ways it could be made more interesting.

Best none-Cape sea life!. If you are brave enough to scuba dive in the cold Cape Town waters, you should get 10 points. But you can save yourself the cold and low viz challenges by popping into the the Two Oceans Aqaurium in Cape Town. Not only will you see the local sea life (without freezing), but also showcased many of the fish species from the tropical regions. After visiting many aquariums across the world, I can say that this one is just as specatular. Although there is no whale sharks (like in Atlanta), you can come up close and personal with the fantastic raggies (or ragged tooth sharks) in the big sea tank (my personal favourite). The interactive section for the children is my son's favourite. So if you are really desperate to scuba, book a dive in the sea tank. I did this many years ago and still remember it as one of my highlight dives. Checking out people from under the water!!!! There is also a fab little restaurant outside - for hot chocolate after the dive!!!
Best bar nine. Brilliant place, this was by far the best aquarium I have ever visited, great for children & adults, loved the penguins
No sea mammals. But as interesting as every Aquarium can be!Great for kids of course.The giant crabs are most impressive!!

Majestic sharks!!!. Oh my was i blown away!!!!this is the best aquarium ive ever been to hands down!!!the diversity, variety are just amazing! its not too expensive and you definitely et value fr your money!the sharks are what got me! wow so majestic, slick and yet so dangerous!!!defintely not something you get bored of!!!loved it!!

Not worth it if you have been to Aquariums elsewhere.. It's not that the Aquarium is bad, but you you can easily see all of it in thirty minutes, so the price is not worth it unless you love penguins or are able to see the feedings. If you have been in other similar Aquariums in other countries, I'd skip this one and focus on Cape Town's natural attractions.

Close-up with the sharks. The predators basin the the aquarium's main attraction. You can come eye-to-eye with impressive sharks and other creatures. But you also have the chance to have close looks at creatures which you normally find on your plate, like lobsters and king crab. Also recommendable are the penguins and the kelp forest.

Excellent. We had to go back later the day as my daughter wanted to see more.
Very good and well worth the visit

Extreamly bad. #1. There no air in that oven type aquarium
#2. There's no slush in the cafe "Thats crap"
#3. The Ice Cream you buy there, melts as soon as they give it to you. And prices and prices are terrible
4#. The ride by the enterance cost R10!
Otherwise, the fish look good
Colour. Overdue visit did not dissappoint me. A great selection of sea life and was in time for the feeding.

A lovely venue to visit. On visiting the Waterfront in Cape Town we came upon the Aquarium by chance. At the time of our arrival a talk was just starting telling all about the aquarium and how they rescued the sharks. Most of these sharks had been caught and injured in Nets and then brought to the Aquarium. After a number of years they are tagged and released back into the Ocean. The talk was also about preservation of fish stocks in the ocean and to look for the label on tins of fish(tuna) to say that this is not endangered.There was a good variety of different types of fish and turtles and it makes for a well worth while visit. It taught me things I did not know and will bare them in mind when I do buy tins of fish. The ocean and fish need to be preserved.

So expensive for practically nothing. On arrival we saw how much this trip was going to cost us but thought it will be worth while. We passed through the whole aquarium quickly and went to watch the sting rays being fed. I would have hoped to see more signage regarding feeding times as this would make the trip more worth the price.

Interesting for children. We love exhibits of wild and aquatic life. The aquarium is fun, well presented for children but could only hold our interest for an hour and a half. Good cafe for human feeding and enjoyable feeding times of penguins and sharks which were fun and well presented by keepers.

The importance of the environment. The most appreciated part of my tour to the aquarium was seeing the emphasis placed on the damage caused to the environment and it served as a reminder not to destroy nature. The marine life was absolutely stunning as well. There were seating areas as well, for one to sit and enjoy watching the fish swim around.
great for the kids. Was great for the kids especially the big window were all the fish (and sharks!) swim leisurely by. Still inside the Waterfront so parking nearby
Kids loved it. We had a great visit to the aquarium. My 8 and 9 year olds loved it. We watched the penguins being fed which was neat to watch. Some great displays. Spend about an hour and a half.
A must see. A starting point for all tourists, Visit this place when the weather isnt at its best. Kids of all ages will love this museum.

Too fast. We were expecting more but unfortunately it wasn't a big . There were too many people on the day that we went there so we ended-up moving from one exhibit to the next very fast. We were able to take a little break once we all got into the shark area. Cool place to visit on an off-season days.

Spectacular! Make time if you can. Enjoyed a damp afternoon here and were not disappointed. The giant tank was wonderful and I could have stayed for longer. Good value. Do go if you are even slightly interested, it is well laid out and modern.

Quick.. Loads of species but it is rather small. Expected it to be a massive thing but we were in and out within an hour!
But still worth a visit!

Not quite as good as Sydney. The aquarium was very good, with a wide range of fish and aquatic life. But after visiting Sydney Aquarium I felt it didn't quite compare. At Sydney you get to walk through a shark 'tunnel' with sharks and rays above you - here the experience was much more in front of you. Having said that some of the giant crabs, jellyfish and seahorses were truly wonderful!

Amazing Ocean Life. A visit to the aquarium is always fascinating in that we are given first hand experience of how sea life looks. The variety of sea life on display is an educational as well as a pleasurable experience. The kids thoroughly enjoy this outing everytime we go.
Very little excitement if you are over 9. Great visit for kids. If your looking to see hundreds of Nemo fish visit Cape Town Aquarium. Entrance quite high for the experience.

Great for the Kids. When my boys were little, we were Two Oceans Aquarium club members. We went there frequently to play in the splash pool, and watch the feeding of the sharks. The kids really enjoyed these trips, but as they got older, nothing changed or enticed them to go. My advice to the Two Oceans Aquarium is to keep the momentum going for the older kids by arranging more activities for the older age categories, or you will keep having to entice new families with young children. This also then makes life much easier for families with very small kids and tweens/ teens to still be part of the Two Oceans family.

Not impressed. We travelled to Cape Town with two children aged 12 and 13 at the time. After visiting the Durban and PE aquariums we expected to be even more impressed and we were bitterly disappointed. There was not much to see, nothing really impressed either my husband or the kids! A waste of money!
Our little boy loved it. A really impressive collection of fish and other nautical treats. Great for an afternoon if the weather isn't great outside

AS ABOVE. Very good aquarium with large number of fish of all types, too many to list. Look out for the huge massive Moray eel right at the begining. The Kelp forrest and the sharks etc is th highlight spectacular in the enormous aquarium. Moderately price worth a visit.

Great for rainy or hot days. The mix of aquariums is quite unique. Really enjoyed by my daughter.
Suddenly a group of penguins appear to be marching around the place.
The story of the sharks is quite interesting and will convince hopefully that this are not awful animals. We humans are worst.

For kids. Real effort made to make the Aquarium exciting for young kids.
The penguins are the star of the show, make sure you are there at feedin time around 11H00 daily.
Needed more time. Visited the aquarium in the afternoon after a city tour and didn't want to leave at the 4pm closing time. Outstanding displays on multiple levels, very helpful staff.

a place to relax. kidds will love it. If you are not a diver this is the closest you will get to experiencing the cape underwater world. Great activities for all ages. If you are a capetonian become a member and save money on recuring visits

Smaller than I had hoped. Maybe I'm just spoiled when it comes to Aquariums, but it was smaller than I had hoped. Also, unless you are an aquarium aficionado (which I am not) or have not been to an aquarium before, it is probably not worth going to, as it just feels like being in another aquarium...lots of people all trying to take pictures of fish in tanks. There are other more unique things to do in Capetown, such as Kirkenbosh Gardens and Cape Point.

Does it need an upgrade?. We wanted to visit because of the two oceans angle, the Atlantic and Indian for a sense of contrast. In the event perhaps we missed it but this aspect was not emphasised, there were plenty of tanks and variety of species but somehow I was not enthralled. It is a must for children to see the extraordinary range, size and colour of the fish on display. The penguins are funny but I somehow felt sorry for them in their captivity while on a short distance from their natural habitat.I would have liked to see a clearly posted recommended route to follow so as not to miss anything and perhaps events; feeding times etc marked up at the entrance. Enjoyed it but I've seen plenty of others around the world which can compete with it when this one has so many natural advantages.

I am never disappointed. I have visited this on and off for many years and recommend it to anyone! I love being a child and marvelling at the marine life that abounds! I can sit at the shark tank and observe the sharks, fish and human creatures for hours!
Take Your Kids. This was a nice experience but I think that it really great for kids. Definitely take your kids but dont stay too long if you dont have kids

Small but Interesting. The Aquarium is right on the Waterfront, a stop on the Hop-On, Hop-Off bus and certainly worth a visit. Some of the exhibits are awesome, in particular the jellyfish, starfish and a HUGE eel. Be sure to see the frogs and penguins on the upper level. There's a gift shop with items a step up from the usual tourist souvenirs.

Great For Kids AND Adults. We went to the Aquarium not knowing what to expect and we LOVED it! They have some great marine life and it was a very fun experience. If you have children, it is definitely worth going. They have a lot of interactive areas and information that's great for kids.

Underwater Uniqueness. This is a great place to visit in the hour or two before a great waterfront dinner. The price is reasonable and the attractions are pretty cool if you are coming from other parts of the world. The penguin exhibits and shark tank are pretty exciting and the kelp forest amazing. Lots of visuals for kids and families (a crawl-in clown fish tank, touching starfish and seaweed, a play place, etc.).

Great place but shark tanks too small. This is a great day out for families and couples. I went with my boyfriend for our anniversary and had an awesome time. It is very expensive though.We were unimpressed however at the size of one of the shark tanks. Sharks are used to the open ocean and as a marine biologist, I was shocked to see just how small it was :(

Interesting. Although it's expensive, it's worth a trip here, if just once in your life. All the creatures are fascinating. They also do kids shows which sound like lots of fun, gauging from the laughter!
Great way to spend a rainy day. It rains in Cape Town. Quite often in fact. The Aquarium is an excellent outing you can do when the weather is not wonderful. Lots of interactive displays too.
Surprisingly enjoyable. Worth a visit, most aquariums disappoint, but this one is worth visiting, even for adults without children.
Loved it!!!. our favourites are the big sharks (and the group of yellow tails following them), and the small sea turtle in the round tank right at the entrance. we had a great time there.

A true piece of awe. I have visited the aquarium on a few occasions, and it is really very nice. There is a lot to see, and every time you go, you find something new. It is a bit overpriced, and the food and curio totally ridiculous.
Family outing. Beautiful, good layout. Caters for young and old. Curio shops available. Card and cash payments accepted. Amenities are clean, and well kept.

This is a must go. The service and friendliness of the staff is amazing! Such a professional institution. It is so well kept and the variety of sea creatures are overwhelming. I just love the section where you actually can be so close to the penguins.

good food after a walking tour.. i did a walking tour with cape walk and talk tours in the mother city which was vefy informing and visited the aquarium fantastic and unforgetibleexpearians.all the diferint speesis of ocean creatures unbeleavibleand the staff was very helpfull and friendly i can say a mast to do when in cape town.thanks Edgar

Definitely worth a visit. We had a great time with our 2 little girls, but even adults without kids should give it a try! They also have nice little presentations for kids during busier holiday times and try to see some feedings too.

Thankes God it is in the Waterfront area. This aquarium is a peaceful place, where you can forget the hours inside it. Children and adults stay perplex in front of that big glass wall where you can see the men working, feeding the fishes and cleaning inside, between sharks and big fishes.
educational. Two oceans shows the various fishes in their different surroundings,: deep dark, clear water, riffs etc.
Kids will love it!. If you have kids and want a certain program to negotiate with them this is an excellent option. Save at least 1h and enjoy a very large number of fishes found in SA.
Fun for the family. Well designed & thought provoking. The kids also had great fun with the magnetic wall map of African countries (challenged the parent's too!)

Very Impressive. The aquarium will take you by surprise. Our daughter was facinated at every turn we made, from the penguins, to the sharks, and even the enormous crabs! Her favorite had to be the ability to look through the clownfish (Nemo) tanks!
a must visit. situated in V&A waterfront. Brillant displays of fish, the predator tank is amazing, a must visit for young and old
Awesome. Took my godchild for a visit. He loved it and I must say I enjoyed it too. It's been many years since I was at an aquarium. A sit down place to have a meal inside would be a plus.

best I've ever seen. this is an absolutely fabulous experience for adults and children alike. We have been to many aquariums around the world including Singapore and Bangkok but this is by far the best in layout, specimens and general educational information. Whatever you do, don'y be in a hurry when you visit as you can easily spend several hours here and not get bored if this is your thing.

Interesting. The visit started off with a bit of a shock to the wallet at the entrance gate, but thereafter it was most enjoyable. The exhibits are supplied with enough info and pictures to identify and gain a bit more knowledge about the creatures on the other side of the glass. The two big tanks is definitely a highlight, but there were several other "highlights" as well. It was a very enjoyable, entertaining and educational visit.

World Class. My Grandson just cannot get enough of the Aquarium since he watched Nemo, fantastic setting and so educational for both adults and kids. The Waterfront must rate as one of the best places to visit world wide, and we are seasoned world travellers.

Nice Aquarium. Not large by any means, this aquarium had a lot of interesting facts about the animals. We ate dinner there outside the large tank watching the sharks, turtles, rays, and other fish swimming around. Great for kids.

Only to be enjoyed!. I've visited a number of aquariums around the world and of course they vary a lot. Whilst not huge Two Oceans Aquarium certainly has plenty to see. For me it was designed really nicely for adults and children alike, with a nice educational edge.If it is your want you can feed the penguins or go shark diving! There is plenty to do.

Certainly worth a visit. Our kids kind of like aquariums, and this was a good one. There are lots of touch opportunities and excellent explanations of the local aquatic environment. Our kids really liked the "Nemo Tank" (complete with a lonely Dory) as well as the walkway that went around the 2 story tank.

Two Oceans Aquarium- very good value for money. We visited the aquarium on our last day in Cape Town at the end of Oct and it was a perfect relaxing end to an amazing holiday. Prices were excellent at 112 Rand for an adult and if you got your hand stamped with 'invisible' ink you could enter and exit as many times as you like for the day. Even though some people may say it was a bit small, you might get round in an hour if you rushed it was still an excellent experience. There where lots of sea life and it was really well presented, the large predator tank is worth a look at.Also on you way round check put the touch pool is cool, as the name suggests you can touch and feel many types of sea things. I afraid I don't know his name but the staff member who told us about the pool was very friendly and knowledgeable.I was very impressed with the amount of life they had here and the size of some of the tanks is impressive. Overall we were pleased with this trip and would recommend it. If you have kids they would love it.
wow. It gave me a glimpse of what really lived under the water. What impressed me most, were the enormous deep sea crabs...they look loke Daddy-long-leg spiders! A very enjoyable experience.

Really cool when it's rainy outside. Went to the aquarium on a rainy day and it was great. Saw the biggest crayfish ever and got to see the feeding of the sharks... Lots of families and quite busy but worth a visit

Nice, but small. This aquarium was really nice! It was a great place to spend an hour, and it was educational in the sense that it had a lot of local marine life species that you probably haven't seen anywhere else. Unfortunately, it was rather small and didn't take very long to get through the entire exhibit.

Dining with the fishes.. The gala dinner to celebrate the last night of our international conference was held in the aquarium. Although the building was closed to the public, we were allowed to wander all through it whenever we wished. Dinner was in the large, three-level viewing area surrounding the huge ocean preditors tank. So, while we ate, we were watched by large sharks, manta rays, schools of tuna and two sea turtles. What a hoot!

Sea view. The aquarium has many creatures that you would expect to find in an aquarium but also has many that, I suspect, most people will never have seen before. All the exhibits are well presented and information is plentiful. I found it interesting and well worth a visit.

A nice Aquarium. This is a very nice aquarium especially as it displays sea life from two Oceans, the Atlantic and Indian. Nice displays and in very good order. The only negative was that many displays did not have much text on the habitat or life of the creatures we were viewing. That would make it perfect.
all over very nice and interesting. very interesting and beautiful species to see and discover. At some places we think the place is a little bit outdated.

I love this place. Ok I may be a bit old for this but you must do the aquarium, viewing of the large sea water and kelp tanks with huge shoals of immaculate very large sharks and fish is very I motive and thought provoking. Lots of colourful exhibits to enjoy also and of course "Penguin Feeding"After the visit go for a iced coffee in the cafe, very high quality and the outside deck has lovely views .Cheap and fascinating .

Great Business Venue. Believe it or not we had a client meeting after hours in their conference venue and it was unique in that our clients were able to amble around the venue which we had all to ourselves. The aquarium in itself is the best in Africa, in my opinion.

One of the Best. The Aquarium at the Waterfront is a joy to behold. Quite the best I have ever been to. All the exhibits are crystal clear and the marine life is obviously well cared for. What an enormous collection and all so very interesting. Was a bit concerned that flash photography was allowed - it hurt our eyes let alone the fish's. Definitely recommend and don't miss the feeding times - fascinating. It was recommended to us by our super Tour Guides Lisa and Louise at African Trax. Everything they arranged for us was superb and I can't recommend them too highly. They are a two woman band and they deliver a friendly personal service. On our pick up they even took my Grandaughter over the road from the Aquarium to forage for 'precious' stones before driving us to the hotel to pick up our bags and thence onto the airport. Nothing was too much trouble.

Great experience. The aquarium shows a large variety of fish and other sea creatures, as giant crabs and incredible anemones. Children and adults can learn a lot as also see wonderful sea animals. There is a show in which they feed big fish that is very informative. And they also feed penguins which is a very nice show for kids. And you can take nice pictures there.My only complain: people working there should be more kind to visitors. If you get there with the hip on-hip off bus, remember that you have a discount in your entrance ticket to the Aquarium.

"Nothing much to see". The aquarium was average and not nuch to see and do,i would say it was a waste of time and money.The gift shop was adorable,it had different types of extremly cute plush toys,good for people with children or young cuzins.
Modern aquarium. Very modern, but relatively expensive. Central, good all weather entertaining. Not very big, but done very well. Go and see if you have the funds.

a HUGE Thank you!. Although not massive (compared to the likes of Sydney for example), the acquarium is really well laid out and clean and informative. I was lucky enough to have a behind the scene tour of the acquarium with Msa, which was amazing. Again, friendly and informative. Withought his insight, I would have had no idea how much conservation work they do and also how much research they are involved with too. I also had a "penguin experience", which was a dream come true, and included a penguin sitting on my lap!!!! They weren't African Penguins, but Rockhoppers, and I got to sit in the enclosure with them for about half an hour. As this was a present I have no idea how much it cost, but however much it was, I would pay for it and do it again. A lovely place to visit. Thank you to the team.
It is awesome!. It is like being under the sea. It is huge. It is very well designed and very informative. You will definitely learn something.
feeding the rays. managed to get there for the weekly "predator feeding" on sunday afternoon. Packed, but worth it. Loved it.

Beautiful. We took our little 1 year old daughter to the aquarium last Saturday for our anniversary. I seem to remember that there was more going on at the aquarium on my last visit.... or did I miss the Sun Fish tank somehow? LOVE the jellyfish and Clown Fish tanks..the Giant Spider Crabs are also fantastic. The kelp forest and shark tanks are always a favorite!

Amazing experience. OK, it may not be seaworld but Two Oceans is definitely worth the visit especially on Sunday at shark feeding time... these are ragged tooth sharks, but they are great to see while they swim over you!!! The variety of sea life including the turtles is really a great experience

A nice Aquarium, but we have seen better ones. If you are limited in time on your trip, skip the Aquarium. It is great, but not compareable to to the large ones in this world like sea world. If you are though interested in local sea details, this Aquarium has a lot of details and I enjoyed the experience of some details, I guess I would have never got to know about.

You can skip it. If you've been to a nice Aquarium that you liked somewhere else in the world before (like in Singapore) then you'll be disappointed. Also it's quite pricy for that experience if you ask me (120 rand pp).
Special Place. If you go to Cape Town a visit to the aquarium is a must, the kids loved it, and I loved it, very clean, and you know the entrance fees go to helping conservation to some extent.
Small but Beautiful. A nice aquarium but not very big compared to aquariums in the States. Wide range of fish and other animals.
Nice. A nice Aquarium, really big. If you like aquariums or you try to find something to do if the weather is not so nice, this is a good recommendation
Worth a visit. A very good aquarium even by international standards. It features a unique live bamboo forest. Really enjoyed it. And it is in the V&A waterfront.
Two Oceans Cape Town 2012. Excellent, money worth spend!!! This is the most amazing place to see. My whole family enjoyed the outing and if we ever visit Cape Town again, we shall return.

An impressive aquarium. We took our 7 year old to the aquarium on a rainy morning in October. It was very busy as there seemed to be aa lot of school children visiting, but this didn't spoil the enjoyment .The aquarium is very clean, has a good selection of fish that look well cared for and the conservation information was well presented. A good place for a family day out.
Atlantic ocean fish V.S. Indian ocean fish. The aquarium curator at Two Ocean Aquarium did a good job. Fish is healthy, perfect aquarium to visit.

Kids will love it. Had a fun time with our 3 yeard old in the aquarium. Lots of varieties of fishes and well kept. Very informative . There is a play area for kids with penguins swimming which we loved it.

Excellent way to spend some time. This aquarium is the best one we have been to. I would recommend it for families as well as couples. It was educational, well laid out and easy to go round. You could come and go all day long once you had paid so if you wanted to go and do something else before you had finished seeing everything you could go out and come back as many times as you liked. They even had a mini boulders bay with the penquines.

Beauty behind glass. Wonderful for families with younger kids. Kids and parents can learn alot about marine life and some interesting rare fishes can be seen as well. Nice that there is a restaurant as well so if you are hungry you can indulge. Another must see when in Cape Town, especially parents with kids.
Great fun for the family. Very interesting and well laid aquarium. We were all pleasantly surprised. Predator exhibition feeding time worth the wait. Thoroughly recommend it
Really good. Great aquarium. Displays are well put together and the whole place is very well laid out. Interesting exhibits.

Very intresting for family. The place is a very fun place for kids.There will be nice restrants there too.Its got alto of rare fishes and more.If you have kids the touching area wil l be their best place to be at
Fantastic Aquarium. Great aquarium- I have been to a few and this one had a few different features to set it apart from others. Good way to fill in a few hours, and reasonable entrance fee.

NOT SEA WORLD BUT STILL GOOD. An interesting place, especially if you take children along. It is conveniently situated in the V&A Waterfont and is also next to the place where the HOP on Hop Off bus stops (the Topless bus).
Two Oceans Aquaruim. Displays and information are excellent, can spend at least 5 hours and schedule your walk about to include feeding times. Feedings times are display at the entrance.

this is a great family trip. If you visit the water front , you must take the kids to the aquarium. The facilities are excelent , well laid out and very educational. There are a lot for children to touch , smel and learn. Spens ome time just taking in the hypnosis of the bamboo forrest tank
Soooo beautiful!. The aquarium is really well laid out, and soooo beautiful!!! The aquarium is also very informant to get the know all the beauties of the sea!

Well done!. My 8-year old loved this...so did I. I learned SO much and saw things I have never seen before! It's downtown with lots of attractions and restaurants nearby. (Take the double-decker Red Tour bus to get there!!)
A regular. I have a season ticket for me and my daughter and not a month goes by without a visit. Our favourites are the jelly fish, octopus and petting pond!

Fun for the whole family. What a world class aquarium, with species of ...well, as the name implies, 2 oceans! The greatest specimens of sea life from the Indian and Atlantic Oceans. If I had to pick a favourite part of the aquarium, I'd say sitting in front of the shark tank! On your way out, many curios and cuddly stuffed sea creatures to purchase.

Favourite place for my girls. My kids love this place, get there before the puppet show and you can easily win away 4 hours here just entertaining the family. The attached restaurant is family oriented too, just not exceptional.

Finding Nemo.... The quarium is easily accessible and there is 1 disabled parking bay just outside, if that's full there are disabled parking bays in the undercover parking garage opposite (paid for parking though). The aquarium is easy to navigate and all areas are ok for a wheelchair user.

Worth a visit. As it was conveniently situated on the Waterfront where we were staying we dropped in. Particularly loved the large tank where an active penguin kept diving from top to bottom non-stop. Got a great pic.
Kids loved it. great experience when taking your kids over there. Plenty to see and never dull. As parent of 3 I really enjoyed myself as well!

Creatures from the sea which you have never seen before!. We were in cape town our first day of our trip and it was raining cats and dogs, we decided to go to the aqaurium to stay dry, this was a very good choice as this a a very nice place with a lot of animals I had never seen before, recommended even when there is no rain.

Family outing!. Perfectly catered to children, they can stand 'inside' the 'NEMO' aquarium, interact with the staff and play in the children's area. I've never seen an aquarium so in tune with needs of children of all ages.
Feeding time. Always a favourite place to take our visitors - check out the feeding times before deciding when to go, it adds that little bit more to the visit.
worth a visit. Spent a couple of hours walking around the aquarium which was really interesting, we were fortunate enough to be present just as a penguin laid an egg!
Interesting. ...but we're spoiled by the local attraction for us, The Monterrey Bay Aquarium in California. It was interesting to see species that we don't have available for us to see here.

Well worth a visit. Stopped by just before 3pm on Monday 3rd Sept just to pass some time, but ended up thoroughly enjoying ourselves. We were directed to the big tank fist as the turtle and ray feeding was about to start. Ideal for both young and old alike. The guide who was giving us a talk about what the divers were doing and explaining about the various fish was very interesting.

Wonderful Aquarium. This is a great little aquarium packed with all sorts of cool exhibits and exotic fish life. It is a perfect afternoon stop to relax and explore at the V&A Waterfront and will only take up about 1.5 hours of your day!

A great experience. Friendly staff, great facilities and all the marine life you'd ever want to see in one place! Plan to spend an afternoon there, as there is loads to see - the aquarium also offers a great little sit-down and take away restaurant with a great view of the Two Oceans dock. There are loads of families with small children about, so be prepared.

Great way to spend a few hours on the Waterfront. We went here on our last day in Cape Town because we had some time to kill before heading to the airport. Great museum and great way to spend those last few hours
Good option for a rainy day. We spent an afternoon here and the kids enjoyed it. Loved the kelp forest. Have been to many aquariums around the world and this was overall pretty good.

Very Nice. The visit to the Aquarium is very interesting indeed. Although it is not very big, yet there is a lot to see. Many different and strange types of sea creatures to see, also the penguins on the last section. It is a nice activity.

V&A Waterfront Attraction. With limited time to see Cape Town we wondered about the logic of visiting an Aquarium but were handsomely rewarded by an excellent array of displays that showcased local species. Being winter, there were some displays under upgrade (like many of Cape Town's attractions) but we enjoyed the couple hours on a rainy afternoon that we spent at the Two Oceans Aquarium. For locals, they offered great family multi-trip concessions which had I been local I would have signed up for as the displays were not just static but interactive and educational including conservational messages. A fabulous facility well worth the visit whether local or foreign visitor.

Typical Aquarium, but a nice rainy day spot. There were nice exhibits but it was quite expensive and they allowed photographs so everyone in there was taking pictures of every fish tank which was super annoying. The penguin exhibit was weird and they had arctic penguins but kept the temperatures a little warm even for me in the penguin room- cant imagine this is too good for the penguins. the St. Louis zoo penguin room with the same penguins is kept at a temperature cold enough that you need pants and a jacket. Jelly fish and other fish were great tho and is a nice activity.

its made for kids... its too small.. you take a spin and thats it .. like i was surprised i took a second spin to make sure that was the end.. i tried to explore even more there wasnt any thing .. so dont go!

One of the best. Worth a stop this is an impressive Aquarium on three levels with some really big and small fish, the shark tank is worth the price of admission alone. Its worth going at feeding time for the penguins which is at 11.30

First class aquarium. A first class aquarium which has some wonderfully colorful fish. There are special exhibits with penguins (native to South Africa) and the skeleton of a huge fish. The 4D movie was fun for the kids. It is smaller than some of the aquariums I have seen in the US, but has the giant shark tank and manta rays that we all love to watch.
fish fish and then some. firstly the expression on my grandsons face and the excitement of all the other children therethis is definately a must see when touring cape town young or old
Loved it. Since I love aquariums, I find this aquarium suitable for kids and adults. It also have a great gift shop.

What a great show of the sea life.. We were very impressed at the displays of the wide variety of all marine animals located in the area. We witnessed the feeding of the penguins and the feeding of the fish in the large tank.

Dissapointing. Was expecting much more but the staff did not seem that knowlegable ny 6 year old daughter kept asking them questions about sharks and they didnt have a clue she seemed to know more about sharks. which was a shame as they had so much more than the aquarium in New York and the Aquaruium in Plymouth in the United Kingdom but both of these venues were better as the staff knew what they were talking about.

Big white sharks. Not very big aquarium, but they have really big white sharks, definitly work to see. Nice view around, some interesting animals and fishes, also South Africa penguins, I could recommend.
Great Aquarium. Very nice Aquarium situated in the V&A Waterfront, it is a very nice 3-4 hour tour and it is very educational, also great for taking kids along.
Value for money. Beautifully laid out, with a stunning array of fish, and one of the best souvenier shops I've been in, well worth a visit in my opinion.

A great feeling below the Water Front harbour. This Aquarium carved out of a flooded quarry and positioned in the opulent yacht basin has plenty to view, maybe too much to take in all the detail and beauty, but the Water Front attraction surrounding it tends to draw you through it too quickly. Rather plan to spend a lot of time there to get your moneys worth and enjoy the educational components as well.

Wow really worth the visit. Brilliant is the word our son 10 years had great fun and thought it was nicer than Sharka Marine. A great kids party venue and there is so much to see and do like feeding the penguins and preditors. Well worth the entrance fee.

Meet The Denizens Of The Deep & Feel The Pull Of Ocean. Two Ocean Aquarium is large aquarium of varieties of Sea breeds. Do not miss Shark Feeding, Stink Ray & Tortoise feeding session where you will get more close to the creatures. Must visit for 2hrs when you are in cape Town.
World class. Definatley worth a visit when you are at the V & A. This is a world class venue and offers fabulous viewing. The kelp forest is the most spectacular I have ever seen.
Two Oceans. everything very interesting wonderful experience for the whole family This is one of the most fantastic places to view in Cape Town

Well worth a visit (and a dive if you are qualified). Had a great time visiting the aquarium today, plenty to see and informative. The highlite of our day was being able to arrange a shark dive for our daughter. She had a great time and us land lovers could watch at the same depth. Thanks to Candice for arranging it and to Iain for runnng the dive.

Great visit for young and old.. There are some great events for the kids to enjoy while the adults can enjoy the varied sea life on show, the highlight being the predator tank - home of a few raged tooth sharks. Why not book a dive in this tank if you are feeling adventurous!

Worth a visit. Cape town aquarium is a good aquarium with a variety of sealife including penguins and sharks. My favourites had to be the giant rays and turtle though. There is plenty to see and it is good if it is a rainy day. The preditor feeds are worth seeing but make sure you get there early as it gets so busy that you may not be able to see anything.

Nice fish. One of my favorite aquaria. The fish are well displayed, but some of the curved glass tends to provoke nausea. The day we visited, there were large groups of school children and this detracted from the tranquility of the place - I would call ahead to check when groups are booked.

Great place to take your children.... Really a great aquarium and one of the best we've been too. The children loved it and were entertained for hours. My favourite place was the sharks tank and spent much time there. enjoying the tranquility.
Closes relatively early. Went as a last minute thing and only spend about half an hour at the aquarium, but that was almost enough time since there was not an extensive collection of animals.

Magnificent. The Two Oceans Aquarium was fantastic. There was great range of fish and plenty of information about them was on display. I was lucky enough to chance upon the penguin feeding, which was a bit of fun. I would highly recommend that you look at the events and time your trip to coincide with them – a nice way to enhance a trip to the aquarium and some great shows! The events are listed on their homepage, around 2/3rds of the way down.  The large tank in the centre full of sharks, rays and the bigger fish (the predator exhibit!) was amazing, and very well designed with several viewing points around the tank, so you can look on the big fish from above, alongside and below. Another favourite was the Clown Fish tank where you could climb underneath and come up inside the tank.  The Two Oceans Aquarium was very well designed and a fun place to explore. There were plenty of interactive opportunities and a huge amount of fish and other aquatic animals. A must see in Cape Town!
Great time.. What I liked was that they had a lot of types of fish , sharks , some reptiles.Me and my family had a great time there.

Valentines Dinner at the Aquarium. Although I've lived in Cape Town for some time now, I'd never been to the aquarium (as a student I could never afford such luxuries) but I'd always wanted to go because I heard of how amazing it is. My boyfriend found out that on valentines day each year they have a sit down 3 course set menu dinner served to couples, with tables placed strategically around the aquarium. So, he booked a table for us (I think it was about R250 each), we got a lovely meal (had to buy drinks separately) as well as getting the opportunity to amble through the aquarium without the throngs of other tourists blocking our view. It was a lovely evening and much recommended way to get maximum value for money. <3

An Okay Aquarium. This is a nice aquarium on the V&A waterfront. It features sea life from the South Atlantic & Indian Oceans. It that sense it's special. However, if you live near a high quality urban aquarium (e.g., Boston or Melbourne) this one is average.

Loved the fish. It was very good. Enjoyed most of the exhibits. I particularly loved the jellyfish display as you walk in. Beautifully done. Wonderful way for the children to be educated with regard to our rich marine life.

Absolutely recommend this. I honestly am NOT an aquarium person. My husband wanted to go here and I reluctantly caved in as it was bad weather. I was truly astounded. This was the coolest aquarium I have ever been in. The displays were great. We saw loads of amazing sharks, rays, fish, penguins. . . It was definitely worth the visit. And if you have kids in Cape Town, I would say this is a must do!!

Wonderful.nature at its best.. The place itself is very well laid out and clean.One has the freedom to wander around and enjoy the various exhibits and catch a glimpse of the sealife underwater. I especially liked the exhibit where the tanks stretch over the ceiling which gives one a feeling of being part of it.

Suitable for children. This attraction might be great for children, but doesn't offer much for adults. I was a bit disappointed that the frog exhibit promoted outside did not actually have any frogs, only pictures, interactive boards and a puppet show.
Also the tickets were quite expensive when there was not that much to see.

A great aquarium. The aquarium at the Victoria and Alfred Waterfront has an excellent selection of marine life displayed in a very logical manner that the layout makes quite easy to follow. The aquarium also provides an excellent starting point for a visit to the shops and restaurants on the waterfront
Disappointing. We were expecting something pretty spectacular seeing as it was Cape Town but it's no better than any other sea life centre i've been to in the UK. Don't bother unless you've got kids.
A holiday favourite. We visit the aquarium every holiday and still enjoy every single moment after 10 years.

Beautiful aquariums and close up views of sharks. The fish are beautifully displayed. The predators tank allows you impressive views of the sharks and rays as they swim past. There is also a nice penguin habitat where you can have a look at these cute little creatures, although they smell pretty awful.
it was more aimed at kids and very busy!. it was ok, had no surprises and the enclosures where very small! we were waiting for robben island so killed some time
informative. houses animals from two oceans , Atlantic and Indian. very informative and nice exhibits.
excellent aquarium. we had a rainy day during our CT trip. We were within walking distance and decided to go to spend a few hours. A wonderfully pleasurable experience!

More than we Expected. The aquarium was a unexpected surprise. We were not thinking that a place in the tourist area would be as good as it was. The wildlife featured was from the area and things we had not seen anywhere else before. The tanks were clean, the speakers at the different exhibits were knowledgeable and interesting. As a side note, the food in the little snack bar was not to be missed. It was SOOO much better than I have ever had at place like this in the states.

Finding Nemo. This aquarium is such a joy to visit because of the vary wide variety of sea creatures they accommodate and the effort to keep the animals in such good condition by caring for them and treating them as so special for us to enjoy - a well equipped aquarium offering a very comfortable and enjoyable visit - awesome experience!
Go with the kids. Our kids love this place - we go at least once a year (not that it changes) and is a great outing - especially if it's raining. Good family fun.

Love the fish!. And no i'm not referring to a restaurant. The aquarium was beautiful and stunning to the eye. It was eye candy for both my partner and I. The best (and scariest part) were the King Crabs-so scary,so cool!

A fantastic place to take the children. Great aquarium (not cheap but worth the ticket price). Many fish and marine life I had never seen before and a great touch pool where we were able to touch and pick up starfish and anemones. Highlights of the trip were the predator feeding and the microscopic display section. A very knowledgable staff member showed us plankton hatching under the microscope and anemones eating the plankton close up. Really interesting!Plenty of learning opportunities but also a really fun experience for all the family.

Worth seeing the penguins being fed!. I visited the aquarium in early June and had to pay more attention to the school groups rushing through than to the fish. Experiencing the penguin feeding times is worth the visit, though. As each penguin comes out to the feeder/fish pail, it has to stand on it's own monogrammed mat. Hilarious, particularly since one of the penguins is named Alan.My amateur photos of the penguins and the brightly-colored tropical fish are a great souvenir. And for those of you who load up on South African handicrafts, their gift shop sells a roomy burlap bag with strong bamboo handles. It has a picture of penguins on it along with the words "Cape Town".

Escape!. If I feel like escaping to another world - I bundle my daughter into the car, and we go to the Aquarium. It's so peaceful and relaxing, and there's always new exciting exhibits or stimulating activities for the kids. I could just sit and watch the sharks and turtles and fish for hours.
Great Day Out. Great family day out. We took the kids with us and had just as much fun (if not more!) than they did!
so fishy. I took my botfriend from Australia there.We loved it.The penguins were the best!
Aquarium. I loved the penguins most, but also the layout of the aquarium and the size of the tanks, you almost feel like you can touch the sea creatures.

It's an Aquarium. I'm not much into Zoos and Aquariums as I love animals and I don't like to see them caged, but it was raining cats and dogs so we went in. It's interesting to see the differences between the Indic and Atlantic ocean ecosystems and the penguins are fun to watch. There is a tank full of clownfish that the kids just love. I appreciated the information displayed at various exhibits about vulnerable and menaced species due to fishing.Good for families with children, aquarium fans or occupying a rainy morning, but I've been in more impressive aquariums.
World class educational facility. On a par if not better than Atlanta. Experience the different biaspheres of the Atlantic and Indian Oceans in one place

A must see for Young and Old!. Exciting, educational exibits of marine fauna and flaura. Riviting microscopic detail of the wonderful inhabitants of the mighty ocean.
A soul enriching experience. Be sure to allow ample time to visit.

Two Oceans Aquarium - Explore South Africa's Oceans. If you have kids then the Aquarium at the V&A Waterfront is the place to visit. There is a variety of exhibits and some really amazing looking sea creatures! Children will love the touch pool and the section at the bottom of the building which consists of computer stations where kids can learn more about the sea and marine life. As an adult I must say I learnt a lot. I think this is one of the best places to take children and spend a good few hours. Be cautioned - kids love this place so you'll need your roller-skates to keep up!!

Good aquarium for the price. Good price if you a coming from the US. Cost about $11 after conversion. Most aquariums in the State run at $20 at the door. Not too big, but does make of use of limited space. Worth a visit, particularly if the weather isn't cooperating and you want to be inside.

Plenty to see. While the covercharge may be pricey if you're paying for a family the sheer quantity of fish on display is worth the money as you'll spend at least an hour and a half to two hours here if you spend a few minutes at each tank. The venue is well maintained and I never felt cramped with other visitors around. It can get a bit noisy if there are a lot of kids but not irritatingly so.
Afternoon out with kids. Loads to see and keep everyone entertained! Staff well informed and helpful.
pretty average aquarium. This was pretty basic compared to most aquariums, still a nice way of spending the afternoon, they even have a nice communal sitting area so you watch the sharks go round

Nice Museum. Coming from America, I have seen many museums of this quality or better. But for outside of America, this is a very nice museum. The jelly fish, crabs and lobsters truly stood out. Also, this museum caters well towards children.

Excellent by global standards. My wife and I are attracted to aquariums like fish to water! :) We've done all the major aquariums in Europe and Asia and Two Oceans, as it should being next to the see, is excellent. The quality of the displays, posters, interactive media and overall venue will make for a memorable experience. Try to go early morning or late afternoon before the school groups or tourist masses turn up.

Great afternoon material!. When you're in Cape Town i advise you to visit this aquarium. You can spend a full afernoon and see extraordinary things (all kind of fishes, pinguins...) As the name says it, it's mostly aquariums, but it's really worth it. We enjoyed it a lot. Also the kelp forest was impressive. The best aquarium i saw in my life!

My kind of aquarium. The Two Oceans aquarium isn't glitzy and glamourous but it's my favourite type of aquarium: one where education and conservation play a major role. I always love seeing the exhibits too and there is a lot to see here. There is an emphasis on the local marine area which is always a great thing. There is a kelp forest tank and other references to the Cape. Well worth a visit!

Great rainy day activity for kids. We took our kids to the aquarium on a rainy day, and it was enjoyed by all. The kids especially enjoy climbing in the Nemo tank (a circular tank with a place in the middle to stand and be surrounded by the clown fish), the Penguin show and the touch-pool where they could touch various things found in the sea. There is also a play area, cafeteria and shop.The aquarium doesn't stand out when compared to others around the world, but it's still worth a visit, particularly on a rainy day. It's proximity to the V&A Waterfront (and Sea Point) is very handy.
Educational and fun. The large predator enclosure was great - we were lucky to be there in time for a hand-feeding session of the rays and the turtles!
Must do!!!. A small aquarium however real value for money and experience. Kids will have a ball

perfect day out. whether you're a tourist or a local the aquarium is always worth a visit with constantly updated displays and a wealth of potential knowledge to gain.I au pair for children in Cape Town and they request the aquarium everytime!I once took a little boy four time in one week!there is a great interactive play area downstairs with marine story books to read, activities such as card making or necklaces to bead and even a puppet show- which is always a win!Amd the Shore Cafe restaurant has good food, you can sit outside overlooking the water whilst your child runs out their energy in the supervised play area attached to the restaurant.With giant crabs, a touch pool, shark feeding and penguin displays- there is always something to see at the Two Oceans aquarium.
Pretty good if you have some extra time. We enjoyed the aquarium but it's definitely not one of Cape Town's "must do's". We had a rainy afternoon free though so had a good time.
wouldnt waste my time. really busy, and the tanks seemed tiny for the animals in them. Not much to see and I just felt cruel being there and supporting them
Good. It felt a little pricey at the time, but I guess it is one of those things you have to experience at least once.

a good effort. The people in Cape Town seem very proud of the Aquarium. I have been to the Californi aqarium and the one in Vancouver, so I guess my frame of reference was a bit high. The "two ocean" theme didn't seem well played out. If your time is limited, so something else.
A must for adults and kids. World class and well presented, well worth the visit. The kids want to go there on every visit to Cape Town.

2 in one. One of my favouritre places to visit with exhibits from both oceans (Indian and Atlantic). A lovely place to visit on a gloomy day with the kids. Good hands-on stuff for them to get involved in.

great variety of sea life. I have visited a few times and always love it! There is always a new display or a new talk to attend. My personal favorite is the kelp forest and of course the shark tank! It's a well laid out aquarium, just wander around and you will see everything, it's a great experience to walk from one level to the next and rounding a corner to find a new exhibit. The penguins are very animated and put on a bit of a show, which is charming. I would definitely recommend it for a fun day out

Nice display of marine life. Aquarium shows a nice display of marine life and it's also very informative with feeding shows of penguins and sharks. Kid's love those. If you are more adventurous, you can also book a dive in the shark tank.
Amazing Marine life. Must do the aquarium especially if you have kids. It was a fun experience in comparison to other aquariums.

a must visit for the whole family. Two oceans aquarium is a exelent visit by families visiting Cape Town. The stuff is friendly and very knowledgeble, patience and allways very keen to show he kids and anwser the enquisite questions, A lovely day for the whole family.
Great for Children. A highly recommended morning out.....wonderful setting, children loved the interactive displays.
Very interesting. Wonderful display of fish, from the tiniest to some of the largest. Plus Coral jelly fish and penguins.

Fun place to send an hour. We spent a rainy afternoon here - fun way to be out and about without getting wet. Loads of live shows every hour and some fab aquatic animals like the sharks and the jelly fish. If you ave kids, definitely unmissable.

Great for kids and grownups. This is a terrific aquarium. We live in a town with a really good aquarium, but Two Oceans has penguins, and they are native to the area. Lots of sharks and other interesting exhibits, with lots of games and stuff for kids

A lot of fun and educational at the same time.. I took my family and all of us had a blast. There was so much to see and learn. Try get there for the penguin or shark feedings. The jelly fish and the micro labs are just simple but highly effective. Wow what a great day out.
Wonderful Adventure for Adults and Children. this is an exploration of fun for the children and still a learning opportunity for adults and kids alike
one of the Best. This is certainly one of the best Aquariums we have ever visited
Interesting. It is not big, but it has very nice aquariums, fishes, my son loved it.

Convenient Informative Beautiful displays. My favorite part of the aquarium was the kelp forest tank. So peaceful and serene. Touch tank was a bit of a disappointment, but aside from that I'd see it again.
A great place for little ones. My granddaughter thinks this is a magical place. Its a quite large exhibit but pricey.
Great Family Outing. Alot to see, thousands of species and a great outing for the family(both young and old)
Great Aquarium. Really nice aquarium and especially good for kids. Good penguin exhibit and shark feeding once a week on Sunday.
Had a blast with our 10 month old. We brought our little one to the aquarium and he had a blast. It was clean, well kept and very entertaining for all of us.
Not so great. We expected more of the Aquarium, but it is still worth going if you have young kids.
bland!. bland...after visiting Ushaka Marine World in KZN the two oceans had very little to surprise my little 3 year old girl!
Nice aquarium. It is not too big but very interesting! Worth to give a visit

Two Oceans Aquarium. Good place to go, located at the water front just near cape town red bus station.It operates from 9 AM to 6 PM, normal visit takes 1.5 hours and the ticket is around R100 as I recall.Try to call them to check when they feed sharks as we heard this is a great thing to watch but unfortunately we missed it.

Sharks at the Two Oceans Aquarium. Finally we got to visit the Aqaurium. It is in the Waterfront and we just loved it so much - they have a restaurant to the left as you enter which serves really delicious food.

A geat place to see the water world of Southern Africa. A great place for the children to see the various sea life of Southern Africa. Saw plenty of sharks, fish and other marine life. Being there over easter 2011 made it very busy and took us a while to get in the entrance. It was a bit corwded but you did get to see everything that was there. Well worth the visit. You get to see a lot and the usual photographers are ther for momento photos.

Fun for the kids. Nice aquarium in the heart of the V & A waterfront. More intended for children with a good variety of fish and sea life from the 2 oceans. Offers a number of hands-on activities with helpful staff. Would only recommend if you had extra time in Cape Town as there is so much more to do. Slightly cheaper to purchase tickets in advance on-line.
Great fun for all. The different attractions going on during the day at the aquarium makes it an any time of the day visit. Kids love it and it is a wonderful attraction for them.

Good family outing. A lovely place for a family outing or to just spend some quiet time in front of the kelp tank. Sunday afternoons are great for feeding of the penguins and sharks, but should be avoided for those alergic to the patter of tiny feet and happy shrieks.
Must See. Gorgeous!I'm not usually a fan of aquariums as I've never been wowed by any I've previously seen but this was well put together and overall an enjoyable experience.

Fun and interesting. Lovely aquarium that showcases the diversity of life in the 2 Oceans that surround the Cape Area. Also other wonderful animals from other parts of the world to be seen and discovered. Feeding time at the predator display was so cool!

Fabulous Aquarium. On my last day in Cape Town I spent a couple of hours in the Aquarium. It is a fascinating place, particularly the large predators tank. I also watched the feeding of the fish in the "kelp forest" tank. That was good fun! Very good value too! A nice shop and cafeteria attached.
an education. what a great concept to contrast the sea life of the two oceans, warm indian vs cold atlantic. loved it.

The best aquarium in Africa. The amount of effort put into making this one of, if not the best, aquarium in Africa can be seen in the quality of exhibits, the quantity of same and the overall condition of exhibits. My personal favourites The African penguins, the Tree Frogs and The Clown Fish. A restaurant on the premises ensures that nobody gets too hungry during your visit. My tip if you like going out as a family get a family / annual membership works out much less expensive. Even so it's still good value for money !!
Worth a visit. Kids had a great time. Very informative, wide variety of sea creatures and well maintained.
Very Good. This is a great aquarium, lots to see and some fantastic large tanks with huge fish to see, well worth a visit.

Really impressive!. Having been to several aquariums around the world, I must say that I was plesantly surprised by Two Oceans. The exhibits were really really great and the place was kept clean and ordely. All the staff we interacted with were very friendly; everyone was so interested about where we were visiting from.A must do!

Great exhibits, super family friendly. With limited time we were concerned about paying for a family of five but ended up covering the entire museum with time to spare, giving us a chance to sit and watch the predator exhibit in awe of the mighty shark.As it turned out, going at the end of the day was wonderful as the crowds were gone and we didn't feel rushed or crowded.The museum has well designed exhibits and easy to read displays. Creative touches, such as the opportunity to stand "inside" the clown fish aquarium and hands on exhibit areas made for great fun. Seeing the kelp forest (only two others in aquariums in the world) was amazing.Tanks ranged from tiny to huge and a variety of multimedia displays helped to hold the interest of our entire family (two adults and kids ages 14, 11 and 7)This is a great stop in Cape Town!

Small but perfectly formed!. It is worth visiting the Aquarium when visiting the Victoria and Alfred Waterfront. It is relatively small but there is lots to see, including penguins. There is a great cafe for snacks.

The Best Aquarium I've Found. I love aquariums and have been to many around the world. My favorite (four visits and counting!) is Two Oceans. It is not the biggest or the most diverse, but the layout is fantastic and the wildlife is extremely well cared for.There isn't much crowding at Two Oceans, but if you want more space just backtrack after the scheduled feedings. (They are worth it, by the way!) The aquarium is especially suitable for kids, with many exhibits at their level and steps for those that aren't.
Seen better. Having been to this type of attraction all over the world, this one is adverage. Cool to dive with the sharks though
A must see for kids.. Our baby is only 13 months and we was able to keep her attention for one and a half hours before she got bored.
Great way for spend a day. Aquarium was great, especially the section with the penguins in. Only down side is the now standard walk through the gift shop to get out

Nice but not spectacular. There was quite a long queue but the waiting time was shorter then expected. Inside there was nor a clear path to move through the aquarium, so you we came along the same places several times. Nice was the feel & touch area manly frequented by kids where qualified staff was explaningsome of the secrets of the sea in a destricptive way. The basin in the centre shows sharks, rays and other big sea dweller very closly.

Surely one of the bests. A very good aquarium. lots of things to see and especially the big tank with all the sharks and huge fishes...I loved the black musselcracker, such a strange fish, looks like an angry man with a big nose.
One of the better aquariums. Nicely done aquarium down by the V&A wharf. Great penguin and predator exhibit
Cape Town aquarium. close-up viewing of sea life, managed feeding times all good.
Say hello to Yoshi the Turtle. Not the best aquarium in the world when it comes to size but good enough to warrant 4 stars. Watch the sharks being fed and the penguins in their own enclosure as well

Worth a visit. It was fascinating to see the kelp forest since they abound around Cape Town and I was wondering what it would look like under the water. This would be a great stop for families with kids.
Very nice for the kids!. Especially if you come on sunday as you can see the sharks and turtles feading.
Top class. You can dive in the main tank, but booking essential. The diversity is great
Spectacular selection. of fish and the wonders of both Atlantic and Indian oceans! Magnificient, well tended tourist site
Fish,fish,frogs. Oh this was a great experience. the feeding session was "edutaining". My kids loved it!!
OK but there are better aquariums elsewhere. The best thing is to go at feeding times for the predator fish (around 15,00 hours), when the divers are in the tank with the predators.

New sights never seen before. Hesitated on oing to this aquarium but after reading reviews decided to go. Only need about an hour. The box jellies and giant spider crabs were very cool. Worth a visit since there were many sea creatures we had never seen at any other aquariums before.

No cage required here.... Whilest in Cape Town we visited this attraction primarily to Dive in the Shark Tank. My teenage son and I wanted to go and swim with the fishes, even the ones with teeth!! Ordinarily to do this you should book prior, however we did not, but the very friendly and helpful staff secured us a spot on the dive with no problems at all. The dive master was really helpful (I didn't know a Scotsman could scuba dive) and made the experience more memorable. We were actually allowed to touch the turtles in the tank and as we went around on the bottom, we fossicked for Sharks teeth and found one!! It was great to SCUBA in South Africa with sharks without fear of being lunch. I guess we get them in Australia as well! The only prerequisite for this is that you must have a SCUBA licence to dive. The rest of the aquarium is fantastic and worth the trip when visiting Cape Town. The location is convenient and is on the waterfront. Have anice lunch at the cafe and watch the fat Cape Fur Seals basking in the sun on the wharf.

Aquarium visit. I volunteer at the Georgia aquarium in Atlanta, GA, the worlds largest. Two Oceans is not as large but a great collection of sea life, most specific to the local oceans. Well worth a visit.

Exotic varieties of fish. The Aquarium is particularly good for kids, or adult children. There are an exotic array of fish. The shark room is scary and wonderful, and there is a section where you walk under an archway of glass windows with fish swimming all around. this is great for an afternoon with the family.

Living and working Aquarium. Great place to take the kids, the are keep busy the whole time.I enjoyed the displays and interactive parts of the Aqarium more than the kids.Must do if you are visting Cape Town

Still very special!. Love the Two Oceans Aquarium! My two teenage children begged to visit again, as they had loved it ten years ago! Still just as interesting and worth the repeat visits and the large shark tank is still a real highlight.
Fun !. One of my favourite places ~ so many fascinating things to see, and the staff are always ready to help with any weird or wonderful queries.

Well Worth Seeing. As we are quite familiar with the large aquariums in the USA, I was not sure this was going to capture our interest. We were quite delighted with our experience. There are fish seen within that are only seen off this coast. We happened to be there at feeding time and that was well worth the price of admission. The large crabs that can reach a height of a meter are amazing. The baby loggerhead turtle was a joy to watch being fed. The tanks are spotlessly clean and filled with interesting fish. It is certainly small by comparison to say a Monterey Bay Aquarium but seems to offer a lot of things to occupy small children and adults alike and we enjoyed it very much.

Don't visit the Waterfront and not go here. It's a great place to take kids and it's always entertaining, even if they have been before. It's well maintained and caters to all ages with a love of or interest in marine life.
Visit so that you see the feeding of the sharks. You can enjoy this for hours on end… maybe a great thing to do when the weather is fowl for sightseeing

A very cute Acquarium. The Two Oceans Aquarium is world to immerse yourself in all sorts of fantasies, find Nemo and Dory. See the lovely sharks and great giant turtles among all sorts of fish, endangered Kynsna Sea Horses and many more species. Easy to spend 2 hours or more ...
Really a wonderful experience for the whole family.. Now this is a great way to spend your time on those days when the weather is not great. Huge variety of fish and sea life.

amazing selection of wildlife. There was an amazing amount of sea life that I’ve not seen in US aquariums. My wife and I (in our twenties) had a great experience but felt that most of the exhibits were geared towards children.

nice attraction, kids will love it. Nice aquarium with a lot of interesting things to see. Was not very keen in the frog area, as it smelled a bit but the rest was amazing: nice sharks, colourful fishes, interesting facts on the side of each tank. I am usually not a big fan but I enjoyed visinting this aquarium. no white shark though....

Well worth a visit. It's a place that will enchant grown-ups and children - there are lots of things which will fascinate children and if you are interested in marine life you will love the wonderful presentation of fish and corals. It is not particularly big but each display area has been put together with so much imagination.There is an outdoor seating area with a cafe and if you are lucky you can watch the seals sunning themselves on the nearby pontoon

Fantastic aquatic disply. The 2 oceans aquarium is one of my favourite 'animal' places in Cape Town. The displays are beautiful and educational. The staff are friendly and helpful and the displays are constantly updated. There are also good facilities for children including a play area and a touch pool. It's also right next to the V & A waterfront, so very accessible.
