Some hits and a some misses.... I go to a lot of zoos and aquariums so I can see the pros and cons of this facility. Pros: extensive penguin exhibits both indoors and outdoors which provide ample opportunity for photography, good representation of south african species, cnidarians and exhibiting species which they have the facilities to properly care for. Cons: lack of information/eductation/edutainment for each exhibit, many of the exhibits poorly lit which made the reading of any provided materials difficult, many of the non south african species are a cliche, most disappoint there is a full section about frogs yet only two small frogs in the penguin section (I hope the frog exhibit is under construction!).Besides to photograph the penguins or some south african fish I wouldn't return.
EXCELLENT aquarium in Capetown. Easy access; diverse animals . Well designed. A fun way to spend time.
a good place to take the kids. fairly typical but a nice place to take the kids. the surrounding area is very nice and a pleasant place to spend the day
Got to love it. I loved our visit to the aquarium and think it is a very professional and well maintained one. The variety is great and one always leaves amazed!

Small but nice. I didn't know what to expect as I have been to good aquariums before (but this one is just as nice as the others!) There are sharks, pinguins and lots of exotic fish over there. Here's a little tip: if you have a student card, take it with you as they offer a discount. It's well located and all in all it's a good place to visit, especially when it's raining and one can't go to the beach!

Perfect for a rainy day. The perfect outing for a rainy day for the whole family, kids can have fun and be creative in the kids corner or just laugh at the different fish. Feeding time is always interesting!

Fish. An excellent morning out with the kids. They will love the shark tank and the touch and feel section. a world class aquarium right on the waterfront so easy to get to. Surrounded by restaurants and bars so lots of options afterwards.
Fantastic. Great Aquarium,a must visit , it's in the Waterfront. Great for kids and kiddies parties. Very popular place! Great fish too!
Nice aquarium. The aquarium is nice, but quite small. Nice sharks.
Great place. Cool place, we had fun here too. We took a lot of photographs here, it was worth the while, really.

Good Aquarium.. Very good aquarium, many kinds of fishies, but not extraordinary. By the way, if you have kids in your trip, you must go there! Don't miss the "Nemo's Aquarium", where the kids may take photos with "nemos" around....

Four Star fish!. Not the biggest Aquarium by world standards, but really well laid out and designed. Some wonderful fish swim here. Great for the kids, and a perfect thing to do if you get a cloudy/ rainy day during your stay in Cape Town.

Should Weather Limit Your Plans In Cape Town, Dive This. My sister and I found ourselves in Cape Town for three days of less than admirable weather. High winds kept us off Table Mountain and high seas kept us from getting on a shark cage boat tour. With no firm plans, the last few days of our South African holiday were looking like a bust until we happened across the hidden gem of the Two Oceans aquarium.The aquarium is a half-day well spent for anyone with kids, but it's fun for adults too and a great opportunity for divers who are PADI Open Water or PADI Advanced Open Water certified. They offer closed-water dives lasting about 30 minutes into their main tank for Open Water certified divers and into their kelp tidal tank for Advanced divers. Even if not everyone in your party is qualified, interacting through the 12 inch thick polycarbonate with your friends is pretty fun. If you're not diving, you'll just need a simple day pass. As the diver, you'll need to call ahead and book a time in advance. As a non-member (you, the traveler) who isn't on a SCUBA holiday with your equipment, you're looking at about R595 for the dive. A bit pricey for 30 minutes of fun, but being up close and personal with the sinister looking (but otherwise harmless) ragged tooth sharks as well as large rays and sea turtles is a real treat. They offer full gear, rooms to change in, and showers for after the fact. Just make sure you bring your certification card or dive log or you won't be able to go!Just outside of the Aquarium is a lovely waterfront area with plenty of shops and restaurants to explore once you've dried off. For the family travelers to the divers to those with a penchant for sea life, Two Oceans Aquarium will not disappoint.
World class. Have visited this aquarium a couple of times and love it every time. Its well kept, well put together and actually quite entertaining with some very special local "produce" added.
aquarim. not the biggest we have been to but ok was a bit dissapointed not many sharks on show but for a few hours out of the sun its worth a visit

Worth a trip. We enjoyed a couple of hours at the Aquarium this month. Fascinating exhibits in general although we thought the penguin area was too small for the penguins and perhaps not necessary given the large colonies elsewhere that can be visited
Loved it !. I loved it. Will try to visit the place evertime I go to Cape Town.
Need Rod and Hook. the best fresh fish in Cape Town - pity you can't eat them

Must see in Capetown waterfront. Amazing aquarium - especially the kelp tank. We visited 10 years ago and went back this time with our kids 9 and 5yrs. Lots of different attractions. Our kids enjoyed the touch pool, jellyfish, seahorses and of course the shark feeding (check for timings - they are not fed every day).Also a nice (but small) indoor play area for children where they could do painting and make bead necklaces etc. I agree the shop is big and quite expensive, but we have come to expect this from this type of family attraction.

Interesting. Not the biggest aquarium, but it is stil Africa. We made it for the penguin and predator feedings which really made our experience interesting. I liked the two oceans theme but the frog exhibit was definitely a bit weak.
Expensive and nothing special. Nice for kids but there are much better aquariums else where. Expensive for what it is really.
Nice aquarium. It is a nice place to go but don't expect too much from the sharks tank. The presentation is interesting.
Go during feeding times. Worth a visit but it's really interesting if you go around 3pm when they feed the animals.
Fishy. a really awesome aquarium. A good selection of sea life. Nice for kids.

great for the family. i enjoyed taking my nieces there and the staff was great and really well informed of all the fishes
have nothing bad to say really
Swim with Nemo... almost. Surround yourself with clown fish and stay dry. Play in the touch pool - this _will_ make your hand wet.
If you have kids, don't miss it!. We spent an amazing 1,5 hours packed with emotions with our kids. It is not very large, but definitely a worthwhile experience, well organized and neatly displayed.

Brilliant!. You won't tire of this one. Great exhibits. Don't miss the shark talk (well, you can't anyway, it's the climax of your wander) but there are other great things like the tidal pool and a touch tank where you can get feely with the starfish in the water.
Avoid the restaurant.
A bit lame if you've been to good aquariums before.. It's a nice experience for kids and people who have not been to great aquariums before, but a bit disappointing if you did.

Cape Town can be proud. We've visited many aquariums around the world. Yet, right here on our doorstep is one of the best and most pleasant - impressive to say the least. Very educational, enjoyable and scientifically sound. The education people at the aquarium should be congratulated.
Please take your children there!. A highly recommended outing for the family, and really enjoyable to see all the sea life under one roof. A must for those who did not see it already.

Entertaining. We have visited on a number of occassions - and have always found it to be insightful. Though you would find most of this i other aquariums, it is well run and maintained and you can be assurred that the family will love it.
A must. Don't miss visiting tris magnificent aquarium especially durino feeling time at the predators tank, full of white sharks and large fish.
A must see for family. A great collection of marine life and a good opportunity for kids to interact as well. Shark collection was great :)

Good enough. I had been looking forward to it so much that it couldnt help being a bit of a let down. Its far too busy and "catering for coach parties" to be a place to rave about. Still its a friendly place with a fanatstic location and the drive getting there is worth the bother just on its own.
kelp. something different for the kids , you get to see most of the cold water species of the cape that live amongst the kelp
Nice place. Its a nice place to go, though not as big as I thought it would be.

Aquarium. Really did not enjoy this place, I have been to lanazarote aquarium and found this a much better experience. I was disappointed.The feeding times were spent by staff chatting to each other not interacting with the kids and the shark display was rather overcrowded and boring. The sweet shop, cafe and shop took over the place instead of rare species.Take a wide berth if you have kids who are always wanting things as you will be poor by the time you leave.

a favourite outing for us locals. Beautiful, informative displays, good layout and interesting for the whole family. Adults love it, but kids really go crazy there. This aquarium has taken aspects of those in Sydney and Monterrey Bay in California and Africanised things by showcasing our local fish and underwater scenes where possible. Its really worth a visit.

Lovely exhibits; interesting aquatic displays. A world class aquarium featuring the marine life of the area. There are large numbers of tanks with dozens and dozens of interesting displays. It takes at least a half day and if you want to do it leisurely a full day. almost of the caliber of quality as the Montery Bay Aquarium in California
On par with La Rochelle. This aquarium is beautiful and offers a lot of diversity. Visit it you won't be disappointed.

Do you enjoy Aquariums if so this will rate # 1 on your list. This is by far the very best aquarium I have every visited. If you think Singapore's Waterworld or Ushaka World Durban are good then you must visit Cape Town and check out the Two Oceans Aquarium. We get Visitors from around the wrold from Australia to the UK and everyone says it is magnificient. Just dpon't set an hour or two aside for the visit. When you make a date do not plan anything else so that you will not have to rush or miss any of the exhibits or you will be disappointed. The lighting, set up and collection of displays are truly wonderful and a joy to all ages. I cannot praise it enough and return at every opportunity.
loved the shark tank. this is an awesome awuarium, my only regret is not going often enough

Very entertaining. We went to the aquarium to escape from the windy rain outside and we had so much fun!
They have something for everyone, including a feeding session of the predators they have and lots of activities for the kids
We even went back on a sunny day, it was so much fun!
Be mesmerized!. A must see when in Cape Town. This really is a wonderful place to spend some time.

Hold your breath. beutifully done, a wealth of information for the kids and adults aike, easy spend half a day (especially if the weaher is not good, head to the Aquarium) very calming and relaxing, great fish exhibits and we love the shark tank

Love it!!. Quite expensive but worth a visit. My son absolutely loved it, the tanks are well maintained and the shark feeds are great to see. My son enjoyed the puppet shows and afterwords you can relax at the restaurant while the kids play in a supervised play area with jungle gyms and various other activities. Absolutely great!
Big aquarium. Good sized aquarium which wasn't too busy and reasonably priced at 100 rand. You can swim with sharks if you have Padi qualifications.

Always something new. Although the Two Ocenas Aquarium is probably not the biggest or the best aquarium in the world, it is certainly one of the nicest that I have visited. The displays on the ground floor are constantly being changed so that frequent visitors get to see something new every time. They are also very "child-friendly" with low viewing windows for them. There is also a "touch pool" for those that are more daring - both young and old. The "kelp forest" tank is amazing with its variety and almost hypnotic with the huge swaying kelp plants. The predator tank also has a stunning viewing area where one can sit and watch the many varieties of fishes (and somethimes turtles or sunfish) circling the huge rock. All-in-all it is well worth a visit - both for entertainment as well as education.
Great Experience. Exhibits beautifully shown - very educational - frendly staff - and within very easy walking distance of waterfront
good for wet days. we went when it rained, brilliant aquarium, i've been to alot and i highly reccomend this one.!

An amazing Experience. Now if you like marine life you will love this Aquarium, it will keep you busy for at least an hour. It has many different things to see, but for me the main tank was magic, you stand in awe as large sharks and fish pass by you... a memory which will stay with you.

Great aquarium - especially the Kelp Forest. Really liked the Kelp forest exhibit. All the exhibits here are great actually - although the penguins could do with a little more work!
Good if you have little kids.
Disappointing. Was a little disappointed to be honest. Tanks very over packed and lots of dead or dying fish on the bottom. As a marine lover, left feeling quite sad.

Fun for everyone. My husband and I have been to Cape Town twice, and on both occasions we went to the aquarium. He had never been to an aquarium before and was totally mezmerized- there are giant aquariums inside where you can come face to face with sharks, turtles, even those fish from Finding Nemo. I brought my parents here, too, and we all enjoyed it- even after living in Boston for a number of years, which boasts an amazing aquarium itself. It's just a five minute walk from the Waterfront, where we were staying, and is especially ideal if you need a rainy-day activity, or anything with the family. And if you can't make it to Simon Town to see penguins, you can see them up close here!

Fun and Exciting. It was fun to see all the sea animals in environments that mimicked their natural habitat. We really enjoyed the Predator Exhibition and couldnt get enough of the Sharks and Turtle swimming by. really huge fishes. I didnt like that visitors had to pay extra to get a tour guide so we opted to just along by ourselves!!!! There are informative exhibits to read by each display anyway...
Fascinating Aquarium. Loved seeing a wide variety of fish including sharks in huge tanks and photos are allowed, well worth a visit

A Beautiful Aquarium - Must See. A high point for me was the Kelp Forest exhibit. It is hypnotic to sit and watch the long stalks sway and the fish swim by. There were so many wonderful things to see here, from the Nemo tank to the big jellyfish. There was even someone (a scientist?) explaining about some of the marine life. This is an excellent attraction that I would return to.
Diving. Try diving in the aquarium, its an experience that is a once in a life time. Very different from outdoor diving

One of the Better Aquariums. Was not over excited about visiting an Aquarium but with bad weather our Guide Mac ( from Cape Tours With Mac ) sugested we go. We ended up staying for 4 hours and only left to join other friends or could have spent another few hours. The Sharks are fab and some guys were diving with them ??
Not bad. It wasnt as big as I thought it would be, its your standard aquarium, nice penguin exhibit though.
Worths it.. One of the most appealing aquariums I've been, and trust me I've seen lots, is not huge but everything they have is more than worthy.

Great place to take the kids on a rainy day. I visited the Aquarium with my 6&3 year old children. They got an up close look at the penguins, in addition to viewing the shark feeding session. A wonderful experience. I can highly recommend a visit to both families and to grown-ups a like.

Unique Aquarium: Kids enjoyed it !. We took our children (aged 2 & 5 years) when we were on holiday in Cape Town. This is quite unique compared to other aquariums in major cities we have been. You will see species from both Indian & Atlantic ocean. It is conveniently located next to V&A Waterfront. There is a kids play area and sand pit inside the premises where kids can take a break in case they are bored. We had a great time. However, it is not so clean as Sydney Aquarium for comparison.
Sea Life. This is a nice aquarium, being not too big so you get to see everything and can still roam around the waterfront afterwards
Attractive place. We visited the Two Oceans Aquarium on our fist day.A must see if you have children.There are lovely penguins and ragged tooth sharks.Beautiful and calm atmosphere.
Top Three. We've been to many aquariums around the world and this one ranks way up there. Very well layed out and some very interesting presentations
Jaws under glass. Took the shark tank dive and had an absolute blast.

A rainy day option. It doesn't rain that much in Cape Town but when it does you know all about it. The aquarium is a good choice on such days. It may be small but it is well presented with particular appeal for children.

Very diverse aquarium. This is not a big aquarium, but it is a very diverse one, presenting the marine life from the two oceans, the bordering South Africa, the Atlantic and the Indian. You can see many colourful creatures, but also sharks and penguins. It's a good place to visit during a rainy day and a great attraction for kids, as there are many interactive activities.
Great Day out. The fish seemed to be kept well, very good tunnel and there were Penguins there too!

Beautiful sea life. My children especially enjoyed the aquarium, as they got to see "Nemo" and "Dori" in person and also got to watch the turtles and sting ray being fed.The staff at the Aquarium are all very friendly & patient and the overall experience was wonderful.
The best thing to do on a rainy day. It doesn"t rain often in Cape Town. But if then visit the Aquarium. It has so much to offer. it really is spectacular

Aquarium visit for young and old. Excellent displays and much to interest both young and old. The penguin area is excellent, especially the shoreline reproduction. Some amazing fish to see at close quarters.
Small but impressive. On the pricey side but excellent and we enjoyed the penguin feeding! Worth visiting.
For the kiddies. After Sydney and San Diego Aquariums, this feels like a children's pool. But decent fun on a rainy day. And the kids seem to love it.

Ocean Magic. World class exibits! A visit to the Preditor Tanks is a must. We were lucky enough to visit just in time for a feeding session.Staff at the Aquarium also shared information on the species in the aquarium and shared interessting facts about the tanks etc.Definitely a must when visiting the V&A Waterfront.
Interresting for children.. Beautiful aquarium, but nothing special. Requires little time to do a full tour.

Something new and unique to us. While smaller than some of the aquariums I have visited elsewhere, this houses some unique exhibits - the kelp forest is enthralling, the penguins adorable if pungent, and some of the fish and crustaceans were intriguing as they were new to us.
Nice place to kill some time. It's got a good collection of aquatic life although the place seemed a bit small. We covered everything within 1-1.5 hours. No complaints.

Best acquarium in the world, probably. Spent loads of time in the place as it was so interesting and very well presented. Watched the penguin, shark and turtle feeding which was very interesting. Never seen so many clown fish in one tank!
Great day out for the kids. This is a great place to take kids, it was worth the money but it isnt the best Aquarium i have been to. The predator tank made it for me as it has three very big sharks!!

Beautiful Aquarium. Definitely a one-of-its-kind aquarium as it houses marine creatures from 2 different oceans :-)
The Kelp Forest is my favourite feature, and the big old turtle is magical for me.
Nice but average. It is a nice aquarium, but I've seen others a lot nicer.
Beautiful. Wide variety of species set out in an excellently designed space. Also, the giant kelp forest and shark tank can't be missed!

Great place for children. We visited Two Oceans Aquarium three times and every visit is different, we can choose time for learning, relax, coffee etc. Our children like touch pool. Perfect place for half day trip, covered parking place is few steps away.

Great for the kids. I went to South Africa on a study abroad and one week of the study abroad was spent working at a camp with kids around 12 years old, at the end of the week we brought the kids to the aquarium. The kids loved it! most of them had never been to an aquarium so they had a lot of fun seeing all of the sea creatures up close and personal. There are large tanks that house sharks that the kids loved and a hands on area where they could touch some star fish. As a person in her early 20s I wouldn't have enjoyed this attraction on my own but it was fun with the kids.

must see on Waterfront. Having been to the Super Aquaria in London , Sentosa Singapore , Ocean Park Hong Kong , Tokyo , Osaka , Beijing , Shanghai , Atlantis Dubai etc , it was with a rather modest anticipation we entered this place . But this was very good . As good as any we have seen . Do not miss the gigantic Moray Eel , Arum Lily Frog and the Penguins .

You feel like you are off a magical shore. The Two Oceans Aquarium was our last place of visit on this most recent trip to Cape Town and an ad hoc decision while saying "goodbye" to the Waterfront area.My husband and I were so happy that we included this, as it is an excellent series of high quality viewing opportunities that truly make you feel as if you are swimming alongside a marvellous array of sea creatures from both the Atlantic and Indian Oceans. There are wonderful sections for children (of all ages!) and the "frog" area is a terrific interactive learning area. The penguins are wonderful, as usual, and it would be easy to imagine that they know their names and play for the crowd. That area is especially meaningful for those also visiting thenatural penguin colony at Boulders Beach, which is on most Cape tours. The signage is in English and I believe there are "audio tours" in several languages, but am not sure. The layout, lighting and information panels are well planned, and it is easy to get around on foot or by wheel chair. I'm sure we missed several aspects, and will be sure to visit again if we return to Cape Town. I can imagine sitting in the "shark" pool indoor amphitheatre and just "being" with the action among the many fish and others who share the large tank with easy viewing advantage from a number of angles.But we did not miss the wonderful selection of gelato in the cafe inside the entrance and enjoyed them with the view of the waterfront. Well worth the visit!

A good couple of hours. We visited with our 1 year old son earlier this month. We got there just before they opened and did the route backwards by accident, so we were alone for much of the time. Our son was mesmerized by the fish tanks and sat there staring and pointing at the fish. In the middle of the route they had a kids area with games, a refreshment stand, face painting, arts and crafts and a puppet show. The staff were also super nice and friendly.As a whole, the Aquarium was smaller than we thought it would be, but still great fun.

a fantastic aquarium. My travel buddy and i loved the Two oceans aquarium.very friendly staff at the front desk, who happily informed us of feeding times and things to see while in there.the set up of the aquarium is amazing, each room has something different, and are pleasing to the eye.I enjoyed reading all information they had on the walls around the tanks, and was very impressed by the shark tanks!We watched the penguin feeding which was very pleasant, the lady doing the feeding was very knowledgeable and easy to listen to.the Two Oceans aquarium is a great place to see, i would recommend this to all types of travelers.

Great for kids - especially when the weather is bad. There are no performing animals in this Aquarium (so don't expect Seaworld) - and it has a serious scientific and educational purpose. Leverages of the Cape's position at the boundary between the Atlantic and Indian oceans. Quite pricey at R100 per adult - but there are discounts for kids.Large predator tank, kelp forest tank, penguins, scheduled feeding times and special events - lots of interactive displays for kids. Would certainly recommend as an option when the south easter is blowing and the kids need entertaining.

Diving in the shark tank... incredible!. I paid to dive in the predator tank at the 2 oceans aquarium and it was an incredible experience and great value. The divemasters were very friendly and could not have been more helpful. The dive lasted about half an hour and you get up close and personal with ragged tooth sharks, rays, sea turtles and other beautiful fish. Nowhere else are you guaranteed an opportunity to do this, if you are in Cape Town I would strongly recommend thi experience!

Quite a nice attraction on the V&A Waterfront. We were pleasantly surprised with the 2 Ocean's Aquarium, the massive tanks with predatory fish and sharks is something we could sit and watch for hours. The Penguins were extra cute and we really enjoyed the many underwater displays of various sea life, overall this was very educational and a nice experience, especially if you are planing to do some shark diving on your trip to CPT. Cons: Its a bit pricey at 96 rand per adult. Thats about it! We highly recommend a trip here, particularly if its hot outside at the V&A Waterfront.

Very good aquarium. Whilst this is not the best aquarium I have ever been to, I thought it was very good. A reasonable selection of reef fish was complimented by a collection of exotic fish and some good panoramic fish tanks containing the bigger fish. I would rate this in my top three attractions in Cape Town (alongside Table Mountain and the botanic gardens)

It is a place strongly NOT recommended to visit.. I have read about lot of places to visit in Cape town, the 2 oceans aquarium was among them. I went there on 25 Mai 2010 and I was shocked cos there were nothing amazing according to what I was reading or expecting. there were some colored small fishes with one or two sharks and PHOTOS of all types of whales :-(

I spent *hours*. and enjoyed every minute. The displays were great, both oceans, and the river path were fun and educational. The special things going on were well announced, shark feeding, penguin feeding, and so on. Petting the rays was fun, and they seem to love it. There were other educational interactive things going on too. All-in-all, I found it very enjoyable (but then I love aquariums), interesting, educational, and a super way to spend quite a few hours. And I'll go again when I'm next in CT.I was there in the fall of 2007.

Educational and informative for young and old alike. This venue is very worthwhile and a fascinating perspective on a world many of us do not fully appreciate. In particular, the deep water tanks with a multitude of fish are quite amazing, especially yhe rays and sharks. I could easily have spent the entire day in the Aquarium, which is located just a short walk from all the restaurants and the main shopping mall on the V & A Waterfront. There is access-all-areas and there is a cafe/restaurant alongside for well-priced refreshments. There is a large public paying car park opposite and the open-top red tour bus calls there. Take comfortable shoes for walking, your camera or camcorder. Penguin feeding time was very entertaining and recommended!

Feeding Time is Fun. This is a very nice aquarium, although it's no Sea World. The collection of fishes, shellfish, and especially penguins and predator fish was extensive. Attending the feeding time activities is extremely educational, as the aquarium staff take a lot of time to explain about the various species in front of the audience, and about the process and purpose of the methods of feeding. The discussion of the shark feeding (I believe that takes place on Sunday afternoons) was fascinating.

Lacked any real wow factor.. Visited this aquarium located at the awesome V&A Waterfront last year, and was really dissappointed at what I saw. I've been to many great aquariums in Sydney, Hong Kong and Vancouver and a good one in Melbourne...and Cape Town's was no way up to the standard of the above four. It had no wow factor. For example Vancouver Aquarium had the amazing Baluga Whales, Hilarious Sea Otters, Gigantic Sea Lions etc etc...but Cape Town's 2 Oceans Aquarium I found quite small, un interesting and not something I'd reccommend doing unless you've never been to an aquarium before. It also lacked any exciting exhibits.Cape Town is the best city i've ever been to, but only go to the aquarium if you're unlucky enough to have a really terrible day weather wise and can't think of anything else to do.

Excellent aquarium. I visited the Aquarium in February 2006. The Two Oceans Aquarium contains marine life from the Indian ocean and the Atlantic ocean. It is based on the on the V&A Waterfront, Cape Town. It showcases the diverse of marine life found in these two oceans.There are over 3000 living sea animals, including sharks, fishes, seals, turtles and penguins in this underwater nature reserve. It is an impressive place. On the higher floor you will see penguins, although they are better in Boulder's bay. The various sharks are a must see.There are demonstration for children, an activity area for kids and note the Aquarium had active volunteers who impart knowledge and take part in demonstrations.A highlight is the kelp forest, one of the longest surviving kelp forest exhibits. There is only one other which is based in California. We liked the fish that seemed to resemble Mick Jagger!
